Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Columbia, MD

At Advanced Pain Management Services, we specialize in providing personalized pain control treatments for patients throughout Maryland. Our team of board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management at our state-of-the-art facility located at 10700 Charter Dr #100, Columbia, MD 21044.

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

We pride ourselves on creating individualized care plans that address the root cause of pain rather than just masking symptoms. For more information or to schedule a consultation, please call us at +1 888-600-7940 to begin your journey toward improved quality of life and effective pain relief.

column3:
At Georgetown Pain Management, we are a multi-disciplinary team of highly-trained pain medicine specialists committed to providing comprehensive care for all pain-related disorders.

Advanced Pain Solutions

Our practice delivers a variety of interventional therapies including cutting-edge minimally invasive treatments designed to address even the most challenging chronic pain conditions. We specialize in managing complex pain syndromes that are often intractable and difficult to treat, approaching each case with empathy and compassion. Our services include:

  • Comprehensive pain assessments and accurate diagnoses

  • Customized treatment plans for chronic pain management

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Multi-disciplinary approach to pain relief

We believe that effective pain management requires a holistic approach involving several medical disciplines working together. Located in Greenbelt, MD, we are confident that the care we provide at Georgetown Pain Management is among the very best available anywhere. Contact us at +1 301-718-1082 to schedule your consultation at our office: 7500 Greenway Center Dr #940, Greenbelt, MD 20770.
column11: Georgetown Pain Management is comprised of a multi-disciplinary team of highly-trained pain medicine specialists committed to providing an accurate assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of all pain-related disorders. We provide a variety of interventions and therapies including the latest cutting-edge minimally invasive treatments. Our practice is dedicated to the management of various chronic pain syndromes that are often intractable and difficult to treat, and we aim to treat such disorders with empathy and compassion. We believe that the best approach to pain management is a comprehensive one that involves several medical disciplines, and we are confident that the care our patients receive is among the very best available anywhere.

The pain management options offered by this practice are extremely limited. If you have a complex case, I recommend choosing another practice for your care.

Furthermore, the practice is poorly managed. The administrative staff is unhelpful and rude. Be prepared to wait multiple hours for your appointment (while being given the run around by the front desk) regardless of whether your consult is in office or virtual. Do not expect your time to be respected.|I have been under the care of Drs. Net and Kiefer. Both Specialist are amazing and go above and beyond to thoroughly examine and address the root cause of pain using very little medication & more on activity modification and interventions. Both physicians, Drs. Net/Kiefer advocate their patients, and that they derive immense pleasure from patients' wellbeing. Unequivocally yes, I will recommend Dr. Net's practice at Georgetown Pain Management. The office staff treats you just like a family member. More over, the facility is very well managed where you will get personable care. Thank you so much for everything so far. You guys are awesome. Blessings!
Very Respectfully,
Mobeen|If you're someone who has suffered from chronic pain and have felt dismissed by previous physicians, look no further than Dr. Kiefer

I saw Dr. Kiefer for a consult before he will perform a procedure. As someone who has had chronic pain for the last 10 years, I've seen A LOT of doctors over the years.

Dr. Kiefer stands out because:
1) HE TRULY LISTENS TO HIS PATIENTS AND CONCERNS! Also, he has great bedside manner overall

2) He is super knowledgeable and clearly continues research/learn about conditions to ensure that he can provide the best treatment to his patients. He clearly goes above and beyond by doing additional research on existing diseases/conditions as well as studying new conditions.

3) he doesn't rush his patients and makes sure to ask all of the pertinent questions to make sure you receive the best care possible

Also, the office staff is super responsive, organized, and helpful. When working with patients who are suffering from chronic pain, it takes extra patience and empathy. They carry themselves with passion and grace.

Excited to have found Dr. Kiefer and I wish I had sooner|Dr. Tesfayohannes is an excellent person.My experience with him has been great.  He is very attentive to my needs and has relieved me from the awful pain I experienced; on many occasions.
He is also a great surgeon as is Dr. Kiefer. The best doctors I have ever had.|Dr. Kiefer is genuinely a life changing doctor. I have a fairly rare disease and it's usually very difficult to find a doctor who understands my body and the way pain, and medications, affect me. But Dr. Kiefer is very knowledgeable about Ehlers Danlos Syndrome and has experience working with other patients with the disease, so he didn't have any issue in that regard. Above all else, possibly more importantly than his knowledge and experience, he is incredibly empathetic. He listens to me when I state my concerns, goals, and symptoms-- and we have an ongoing dialogue that makes me feel heard and respected. He has helped me immensely and thanks to him I no longer wake up every day in 8/10 pain.|I had a acute problem with sciatica.  I went to see Dr. Net and Kiefer and they were very professional and caring. column48: Does dr kiefer have offices closer to Columbia md?
column49: Thanks for your question! Georgetown Pain Management has offices in Washington, DC and Greenbelt, MD, which is about 25 minutes away from Columbia, MD. Dr. Kiefer and Dr. Net see patients at both locations. Please give us a call if we can be of any help to you or a loved one.

At Advanced Spine and Pain, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Halethorpe and surrounding Maryland communities. Our specialized team at Advanced Spine and Pain combines medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions effectively.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Our pain control clinic offers a wide range of treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs:

  • Personalized pain assessments with our experienced providers

  • Interventional pain procedures to target specific pain sources

  • Medication management for optimal pain control

  • Comprehensive treatment plans for long-term pain relief

Located at 3720 Washington Blvd #100 in Halethorpe, MD, our modern facility is designed with patient comfort in mind. We pride ourselves on our professional, attentive staff who work diligently to ensure each patient receives the highest quality care. For questions or to schedule an appointment, call us at (443) 267-2803. We're committed to helping you regain control of your life by effectively managing your pain.

column3:
Advanced Pain Management at Johns Hopkins Hospital

At the Blaustein Pain Treatment Center, we provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain through world-class treatment options delivered in a supportive, compassionate environment. Our specialized team of pain medicine experts treats thousands of patients annually on both an inpatient and outpatient basis at our Baltimore facility. We offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Innovative interventional procedures

  • Customized medication management

  • Specialized nerve blocks and injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

Our mission is to help patients regain independence, find relief from debilitating pain, and restore their quality of life. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans tailored to specific needs. Located at 601 N Caroline St #3062 in Baltimore, we're proud to be part of Johns Hopkins Medicine's renowned healthcare system. For appointments or more information, contact us at (410) 955-7246.
column11:
The Blaustein Pain Treatment Center at The Johns Hopkins Hospital offers a comprehensive range of services for patients suffering from acute or chronic pain.

The team of pain medicine specialists provides some of the world's most advanced treatment options in a supportive, compassionate environment. Our doctors care for thousands of patients on an inpatient and outpatient basis each year. They have helped patients return to independence and comfort, and have restored their quality of life.

column40:
The worst experience I've ever had with a doctor. Dr. Cohen has absolutely no empathy or concern for his patients. He tried to gaslight me by saying he had appealed my insurance denial and when confronted with the evidence he did not, he simply shrugged his shoulders. He also told me "I don't do MyChart and don't give out my phone number," when asked the best way to get him to communicate with me between appointments or when needing him to appeal using the peer to peer method with my insurance. He is condescending and uncaring. The nurse even told me to "run away. This is how he treats his patients." No one returns phone calls. Ever. I'm filing a formal complaint with the hospital, but needed to put this here too. Nursing staff is phenomenal. Front desk staff is a solid 3/10. And Cohen is reprehensible. Stay away.|It's Mighty Sad to see that what was once a very excellent inpatient Pain Management Treatment Program at Hopkins is no longer so highly regarded.  When  I was there  years ago, the emphasis was on Pain Management and  Severe Pain Reduction. Now  it's  possible that the program has been largely supplanted by , or hijacked by, Psychiatrists and psychiatric residents
which are no substitute for the particular expertise of  Physiatrists, Osteopathic Physicians and Anesthesiologists in.a clinical setting aiming to improve lives of pain sufferers.                   " Multidisciplinary " Medical teams sound and often are very impressive and helpful ; that is , if indeed they produce good outcomes. But if , for example  , an
" addiction " preoccupation overtakes a focus on Safe Lasting Relief in a program like this , patients will surely continue to Suffer.|Dr. Ooi and Dr. Limerick were both communicative and kind. I have found relief from the medication and nerve block I was given. They have been very empathetic and I'm glad to have doctors who care about my experience.|I've been suffering with chronic pain in my buttocks right hip and thigh for over 5 yrs. I found Dr. Sivanesan and Dr. Ooi who specializes in Arachnoiditis. Since seeing them I have been treated w more aggressive nerve medication, muscle relaxants and now after my trial w a Spinal Cord Stimulator which improved my symptoms a lot, I am going to have the SCS permanently installed. The whole team at this center is and has been very helpful at a desperate time.|Literally moved here from out of state and been trying to get a appointment to see a Dr and after months of back and forth about my records I still haven't heard from anybody just to see a Dr. Been on Pain Management for nearly all my life and this is the worst patient relations I have ever been through they simply do not care..I would definitely choose wisely next time don't bother with this department|I dont even want to give one start but that is the only option. I saw a pain doctor 2x. He was great by the way. Sat in the office for 2 hours ans waited for my appointment because they were running behind. He prescribed me meds and ordered a pain procedure for me. They told me someone would call to schedule. Nobody called and you can't get ahold of anyone from the office because there is no direct number. Left about 10 messages and no response. My medication is still sitting at the pharmacy because it requires a pre authorization. What a joke!|I feel this clinic and Dr. Schechter saved my life.  I fell down 18 stairs and severely broke my arm.   I had two surgeries was in the hospital 11 days.  I couldn't make progress in physical therapy because I was afraid to let anyone touch my arm; in fact I was afraid of many things after that fall.  Dr Schechter was so kind to me and made sure I had the serious pain meds I needed to get through a year of PT.   I can't say enough about this center.|Promotional materials for Johns Hopkins Pain Treatment Program (PTP) cheerily assert that "story matters!" This implies that the service user's story, their lived experience, matters to the clinicians and plays a significant role in treatment. However, I discovered the treatment plan is based on the psychiatrist's story about my story, which has virtually no similarity. Dr. Glenn Jordan Treisman's personal experience and psychiatric training reduced my story to one about broken brain chemicals disconnected from a living, breathing human being. Such dehumanization generates the contempt from which cruelty is made and abuse is perpetrated.

The Hopkins pain clinic provided me with an assessment that erased my life story and replaced it with items cherry-picked to support a preconceived conclusion so ill-fitting that my therapist said "Well, at least they got your name right." My psychologist noted the document is "blaming you in a sense for where you are, that you haven't done the right thing." Ironically, the document simultaneously says I've done so much of the right things for myself that Hopkins can't offer better.

Hopkins presents the clinic as cutting edge but it just pushes the same old stuff. It proposes to treat me through the same modality that deeply harmed me already, much more of it, for a longer period of time and more intensely.

The density of the contempt markers in the report confirms that to trust my care to anyone associated with the production of this document would be to knowingly put me in the very power dynamic that repeatedly caused me deep and lasting harm. The Hopkins pain clinic would be the very kind of closed system and power differential that allows and protects the type of obliteratingly heinous abuse to which I have been subjected repeatedly since birth, predominantly by those in charge of my welfare.

Fortunately, I have studied the neurobiology of trauma and recovery for over 9 years and was able to discern the truth about the Hopkins pain clinic: it's just another pathologizing, degrading, and reductionist psychiatric facility that often causes trauma survivors more harm. I chose to continue my neuroscience-based somatically-oriented dynamic healing framework, which has saved my life against a "healthcare" system so ignorant that it causes further trauma and even kills. #TraumaAwareAmerica

column48: Are you excepting new patients? And where is your location exactly?
column49: Yes, we are accepting new patients at the Blaustein Pain Treatment Center. Our center is located within the Johns Hopkins Outpatient Center at Johns Hopkins Hospital, 601 N. Caroline Street, Baltimore, MD 21287. We are on the third floor at the end of the hall. For more information or to schedule an appointment, please contact us directly.

At Maryland Pain Centers, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Baltimore area. Our team, led by Dr. Levin, combines medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions.

Personalized Pain Management Approach

We offer a wide range of treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs, including:

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Located at 7106 Ridge Rd, Suite 100 in Rosedale, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We accept multiple insurance plans, including Medicaid, making quality pain management accessible to more Maryland residents. For comprehensive pain relief solutions, visit our website or call us at +1 443-868-7149 to schedule your consultation.

column3:
At Interventional Spine & Pain Physicians Center, led by Dr. Puneet Sayal, MD, MPH, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Arlington, VA.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Our practice offers a wide range of interventional treatments to address chronic and acute pain conditions, including:

  • Targeted spinal injections and nerve blocks

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Personalized physical therapy programs

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

Dr. Sayal combines his expertise in both pain management and physiotherapy to deliver patient-centered care that focuses on finding the most effective treatment options for each individual. We take the time to listen carefully to our patients' concerns, explain all available options, and develop customized treatment plans. Our warm, compassionate approach ensures that patients feel understood and supported throughout their pain management journey. Visit our Interventional Spine & Pain Physicians Center website or call us at +1 703-546-9676 to schedule a consultation at our Arlington office located at 1635 N George Mason Dr STE 180.

Waiting to get my injection and I will update the reviews.
I use to go to another place which they weren't good and I saw reviews and came here.

The doctor was amazing.
I feel I'm in good hands. They understand how bad it is to have pain and really try to find best treatment for you.|Dr. Sayal took the time to carefully consider all of my symptoms  and provide me with an effective pain management option.  To top it off, the office staff was caring, considerate and efficient.  Having injured my back in my teens, I have been to a number of pain management clinics over the years.  This one went the extra mile to make sure I received the appropriate treatments as quickly as possible. I confidently give them my highest recommendation.|Dr. Sayal is the best pain management specialist!  He believes you when you tell him you're in pain.  He finds alternatives to help you be more comfortable no matter what it takes.  I think he's great!  And, the office staff is polite, kind, and extremely competent!|Phone visits with doctors are not very satisfying but my phone call with Dr Sayal was satisfactory.  As usual Dr Sayal showed a willingness to listen and has a positive outlook as to trying to solve the problem..

On my last person to person visit Dr Sayal was his usual patient listener and explained my options in proceeding with my care.|Dr. Sayal was able to assist me when my regular physician Dr. Desai was out of the office for a week.  Dr. Sayal was quick to understand my medical situation and needs.  He provided excellent medical care and was patient in assisting a senior like me overcome technological challenges.|I consider Dr. Sayal most patient most considerate the most caring doctor I have seen in a long time for him to be so young he's from the old-school I like that yes a good heart that makes a patient feels comfortable Secure and I think him for that|Today was my first time seeing Dr. Sayal. For starters the office staff is super friendly and patient with you, they take the time to break everything down to you and don't rush you away if you have questions. The nurse that took me to the room was so polite and invested in our conversation it was genuine I didn't feel like "just another patient " then the icing on the cake was when doctor Sayal came in the room with a brite smile and warm personality. We went over what I need and a game plan to getting me back healthy and as close to pain free as possible. He listened to me never rushed things and was super down to earth. If you are trying to find a doctor in this field of study DONT KEEP LOOKING AROUND! This is the place you need to be. Thank you to ALL at this office god bless you!|A virtual followup consult following a hip injection.  Sadly, I'm one of the ones for whom the injection did not work, BUT Dr. Sayal is SUPER!  Asks all the right questions, Listens carefully, knows his technology and is patient with a Patient who doesn't, informative of options.  In short "bed side manner" is superb!   So glad I "found" him!

At Nova Pain Center, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Faisal A. Sayeed, a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management physician.

Advanced Pain Relief Solutions

Our practice offers a wide range of interventional procedures and treatments to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We provide:

  • Joint injections (knee, hip, shoulder)

  • Spinal injections and nerve blocks

  • Customized pain management plans

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

Dr. Sayeed brings years of specialized training to each patient consultation, taking time to thoroughly examine and identify the source of pain before recommending appropriate treatments. Our professional team is committed to prompt, courteous service in our conveniently located Edgewood facility. For comprehensive pain management with a compassionate approach, visit Nova Pain Center or call us at +1 410-676-1463. We're located at 1952 Pulaski Hwy Suite B, Edgewood, MD 21040.

column40:
If Google offered zero stars I would have rated them that, because you get nothing from going to them! If you want to be treated like a human with pain, please do not go to this office! You have been warned! His staff will argue with you (Office Manager Linda) instead of fixing the issue as if it's totally your fault for the miscommunication. The doctors there will not even touch you if you're showing them where the pain is, they will offer recommendations but will never do a physical assessment.

I had a finger injection. Still can't move my finger!
I had a knee injection. Hurts worse today than before it was done!
I had back injections that never worked. At this point I believe they do thier injections with saline(salt water), because nothing works!

Waste of my time and money, I could have been found a better office to help with actual pain management or relief!

This is actually on the website an actual joke!
"A pain management specialist is a physician with advanced knowledge and training in diagnosing and treating pain. These doctors do not come from one particular discipline, but rather use their respective backgrounds to contribute a varied approach to the field of pain management. These specialists use their different skills and training in pain management to treat pain stemming from different causes - whether it's neuropathic pain or headache, or the result of injury, a surgical procedure, cancer or another illness. Pain management specialists are primarily trained as anesthesiologists, physiatrists, interventional radiologists, neurologists, osteopaths, or primary care physicians".|Dr sayeed truly cares about his patients. I love him to death. I get great care from him. His staff also is great. They do what they can to help you. I strongly recommend them to everyone.  I know when I arrive there feeling badly,  I will be leaving feeling so much better.|I really appreciate the care and service I receive at the clinic. When I first started going for appointments my pain was terrible, now it's manageable. They very friendly staff working to greet you. I had a problem with billing and they straightened it out right away by correcting the mistakes. Overall, I am very satisfied with my treatment.|The office personnel are fine, very polite and nice! The Doctor is great, I just wish they would booked the patients further apart,  It's Normal to wait over an hour. If they could fix this problem they would get 5 stars
Update:last 4 visits have been very quick. Big improvement!|The only problem that I have, the one lady in the front office (checking out patients),, jer voice when speaking to patients at check out is a little rude. She does not give you the chance to say what a good time would be for the next appointment. With that being said I love this office i have been coming to this office for years, would not change to another office.  Also, Mrs. Linda ia very sweet lady who goes above and Beyond to help you or to answer any questions that.|Dr Sayeed is very thorough. He examine and know exactly where your pain is. He's on point with medical pain relieving injections. I highly recommend Dr Sayeed and Nova Pain mgmt. Stephanie, Brooke and the staff are great too.
Thank you everyone for all you do!|Dr. Sayeed has been a pure blessing. Always professional and very thorough. He has made such a huge difference in my life. He was able to target my back, hip and neck areas that have been preventing me from living a normal life. He has been able to give me back my mobility. Im so greatful. His staff has been attentive, courteous, professional and always treats me with the utmost respect. They go above and beyond to make sure thier patients get the care they need. Ive never had billing issues or concerns and anytime ive had insurance road blocks they have jumped right in to get things resolved. I cant ask for a better doctor or better care from a physicians office.|I kept receiving denied authorizations from my insurance company for procedures the doctor was trying to bill for that I had never had done, had never discussed and wouldn't even be the correct treatment for my issues. I only found out how improper those treatment methods would have been for my issues after speaking with a Neurosurgeon and he recommended I find a competent doctor. There was no legitimate reason for him to be billing my insurance for services I did not receive. All you want to know about the quality of this doctor is easily shown by the location of his office. It sits between a Wendy's and another food place. Is in front of a trailer park and surrounded by two mostly abandoned shopping centers in a crime ridden neighborhood. Whatever money he makes through his creative billing practices is certainly not going into making his medical practice better.

column48: I would like to know how the injections have helped or have not helped. Need reviews!!
column49: I have had injections and they have def. helped Cervical results lasted longer for me than the lumbar. However I was able to get the Cervical injections soon after my accident. The lumbar was a while after the accident. I did get improvement from the lumbar but it didn't last as long as I would have liked. So if you're gonna get them, get them as early after the trauma as you can.

column3:
At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC), we are proud to be one of the nation's largest pain management practices, serving patients across seven states. Since our formation in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, we have rapidly expanded our network to include over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers throughout D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia, and West Virginia. Our Germantown location exemplifies our commitment to excellence in pain management.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of specialized treatments for chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Innovative non-surgical solutions

  • Personalized treatment plans

Our mission is to bring together the highest quality providers in pain management to create an extensive network that meets the needs of the growing population of patients living with chronic pain. Through our strategic partnerships, including our 2012 affiliations with Capitol Spine & Pain and New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), we have strengthened our ability to deliver exceptional care across multiple regions. Visit our Germantown location to experience our patient-centered approach to pain relief.

column38: DeeAnn|Ron Lee|Philip Adarkwa|Zain Rizvi|John Roberts|Jeff Toquinto|Mel Y|Rees Richardson
column40:
I have been a regular, compliant patient here since 2016. Care has gone from good in the beginning - I followed a PA from Rockville to Germantown. She was wonderful. She has since moved on. About a year ago, they merged all of the patients from Rockville into Germantown. They only had one PA to cover 100% of prescriptions. They couldn't see you every 4 weeks because there were too many patients. They either gave you a hard time and called in a bridge or you had to keep calling day after day and pray you could get in before your medication ran out. I expressed my disappointment earlier this month when I was told again my appointment would be 6 weeks out. They seemingly paid me back by intentionally not getting prior authorization for a medication I notified the office was required a month and a half ago. Bottom line: they left me hanging, medication ran out. I didn't receive it until it was a week past due! I tried to work with the office. They couldn't have been nastier. They refused to take down the information my insurance said was required. They wouldn't even take the number I had. I was discharged from the hospital in extreme pain and they made sure that I would suffer when I couldn't get my medication. Horrible place.|My wife is coming from a long distance to seek help from an ailing back and knee that gives her pain every day. Came to the place on time and had to wait for the workers to come to work. Not a good look when a patient with chronic back and knee pain has to wait for the workers to come to work.|I tried to call to alert the provider of the cvs pharmacy's several attempts to reach him to change my prescription without success. I tried several times before getting someone to answer the phone.
The lady receptionist who answered the call was exceptionally rude. She didn't even wanted to listen to what I was saying. Some of us have worked in hospitals before and we see such behaviors as very abhorrent.
Continuous staff training at this facility is absolutely needed.|Krupa shah has exceptional bedside manner. I had a gunshot wound with tons of shrapnel. It always hurts in many ways. Krupa understood it and helped me out the best she can. Krupa is a great practitioner. She is by the book but also very caring towards patients' needs. Thank you Krupa for being a great practitioner with compassion and empathy. Means the world when you're dealing with pain management. Thank you|We patients understand the seriousness in taking narcotic drugs and the political pressures that exist politically. After going over the handlebars of my bike in 2001, I've been in very bad pain (even on 60mg of morphine 2/day). Twice, two years ago, I was unable to locate my medication due to a national shortage. The pain was horrendous and I very seriously considered suicide. Happily, I was finally able to locate some locally. (But no one cares if a patient can't get it, only if he has too much. The amount of pain I have is not easily described to those who don't have it.
When I worked at NIH, I talked to the director of the Pain and Palliative Care Department. I asked him one day how people handled chronic pain in the frontier era (people fall off horses, etc.). He looked me square in the eye, and without saying a word, he extended the thumb and small finger of his right hand, tilted it and flipped it, as though drinking a bottle of booze. Then using the same hand, he turned it into a pistol, held it at the side of his head, his thumb as though cocked, and dropped it as if it were a hammer. He didn't need to say a word. Booze or suicide.|Spine center is a great patient experience. They care and ensure you are taken care of, understand everything that is discussed and let you know what things actually mean. I've been a patient since 2010 and love the Germantown office. Ayanna is the Best manager ever and Krupa is a joy! Dr. Sood is very caring and his procedures provide what relief I can get.|Emma was a great receptionist and the main reason I continued to go there. Now she's gone and some of the others are surly and one told me I couldn't combine a refill appointment with a procedure even though I had done it before because "they would lose money." Spine and Pain is part of a large organization and seem to be unable to make their own decisions. Example is that the FDA has said that video appointments for prescription refills are ok even for opioids but the company won't let the office here do that. My health insurance also says it's ok. On another note the PA's have been nice especially Shah.|Spine and Pain center does a wonderful job in dealing with my disk problem.  I feel comfortable and confident from the moment I arrive for a procedure or other appointment.  Dr. Sood and his team are absolutely fantastic.

column38: Ashely Mathes|Ileana Estevez|r buccheri|Brianna F|Christine Merchant|Tara Wolferman|Laura Andrws|Dollie Baldwin
column40:
Amy is the best provider there. She treats you with the up most respect and is very understanding to you pain issues. All three of the front desk ladies are amazing but Jessica is always my favorite person.|"I don't like making these kinds of comments, but what this center is doing to its patients is very unfair. I have gone multiple times, and each time they say I am self-pay, and I respond, NO, I have insurance and give them my card. They say, 'Sorry, the other person didn't update it.' Ok, I leave, and then they send me two bills for $2,929.50 and another of $300.00 I call, and they say they will resolve it because I have Medicaid, and that's not supposed to happen. I'm tired of calling and explaining to them. I call LabCorp olso, and they tell me that I'm reported as if I don't have insurance. Thank God I have all my tests... Please, do not go to this place, where aside from being inefficient, they are sending bills to insured patients and then threatening to send them to collections... And on top of all this, the doctor never gave me the prescription for my medications. Honestly, I don't understand how a pain management doctor can be so incompetent when it comes to prescribing medicine. It's a shame that places like this resort to such low behavior towards people who are just seeking help with a medical problem; this is taking advantage of people in need!"
Please pay attention to this places and the doctor and all his excuses to make you come back but without give you your prescription just to charge more money.|I have been going here for years and I love Amy smith , she has helped me tremendously, I would recommend National Spine & Pain Centers to you if your looking for a good Dr. Amy has spent a lot of time trying to find the right medicine to help me and everyone there has been wonderful|I have been going to National spine and pain for several years and started with Dr.Nicholson as my first pain specialist. I was so sad when he left I think I even cried.. lol but meeting Dr,Mosuro made me feel reassured that I would be taken care of. The office staff and himself are amazing. He has been so attentive as well as caring for my condition. He has gone above and beyond. I would recommend NSPC and Dr,Mosuro anyday.|Going to this facility has been a nightmare. My Dr., Dr. Mosuro was unkind, emotionless and barely looked at me. Made me do a $2800 drug test as soon as I got into the door, which was ridiculous. He wouldn't make eye contact, barely listened to me and rushed my appt even though I waited over an hour to be seen. Then after all that, their accounting department submitted my insurance claim wrong and I've had to call them about a dozen times, speaking with disrespectful staff who kept assuring me that they would resubmit the claim, and they didn't. I can't get them to simply do their job! I basically begged, speaker to a supervisor and everything and it still hasn't been done. They're trying to stick me with this $740 bill that my insurance would cover if they could just submit a proper claim. It has been such a stressful situation over a terrible appointment where I got barely any help for my debilitating back pain. This office is terrible, and I highly recommend you take your business elsewhere. They're taking advantage of poor people in desperate need for pain management. I can't speak for the other doctors at the office, but avoid Dr. Mosuro please. And just know that dealing with the accounting department for this office is very stressful. They are incompetent and seem to be purposefully causing stress to their clients and not helping with a very simple matter. I hate to write bad reviews, but this place has caused me so much stress. I want to prevent anyone else from dealing with this situation.

Update: I spoke with the manager of this facility and she was very apologetic, and addressed each of my concerns which I appreciated. The billing issue finally got resolved after I spoke to her. I just hope they make some changes with the billing department and that Dr. Mosuro changes the way he acts towards his patients in the future. Best of luck to this facility and thank you to the manager (can't remember her name unfortunately).|I had my first visit a couple of days ago and I was happy with the experience. The wait isn't long and they like to keep things moving so definitely arrive early to fill out your paperwork. Everyone was nice and friendly. Dr. Nicholson is very knowledgeable and I like that he is going to retrieve all of my medical records and scans before making any decisions. I am scheduled for a block which I expected and the wait for that is very short as well. Appointment times and availability are great which help me out because I need afternoon appointments. Overall so far I have been happy with my experience and would recommend. I'll review again after a few more visits. Thanks for reading!|I was with another pain center who were charging my insurance two times a week for physical therapy while taking $70 a week for co pays. I started in June and couldn't get a sit down appointment with the doctor because he didnt take my HMO for his time nor the shots. Today I had an appointment Dr.
Nicholson. He told me exactly what my gut was and saying, which was, I need surgery! He is
Fresh , crisp and clean. He came to the table and he was right on. My second opinion was the right one! Thanks Doc.|This may sound weird, but, I truly enjoy going to pain management! Why? Because the Doctors, and staff are always kind, respectful, caring, and take time to listen to things of concern. They even laugh with me , show compassion when I am having a downer day!
Sometimes, patients don't want to wear their masks, and they begin to fuss when asked to put on their masks, but, the receptionist is "very courteous", she nods hers head with understanding, and allows the patients to vent, and when they have calmed down, they put their masks on, still fussing, but they put it on!
I don't have any concerns that needs to be addressed, at this time! I enjoy my healthcare with National Spine and Pain Center...White Marsh Office!

column38: barbi barbie|Teeandra Jones|Maxine|Shirley Naylor|Kimberly Lange|Linda Beattie|Tiffany G|Lannette Harris
column40:
This place do not recommend , they have clearly gone down hill. They can no longer keep anyone who is coherent enough and knowledgeable in answering basic questions. Front desk is too busy on the phone to notice you , Once you get to the back by the techs/nurse be ready to be judged and get answers that they don't know or unsure . The doctor is great he knows what he is doing was able to diagnose me and give me a proper treatment plan to avoid surgery and was able to have some injections to help my sciatica pain but his staff is horrible now they don't know anything and are too busy gossiping about others . The only smile and help was Rhonda who has been there for years and Katie who is a great listener , his former PA is no longer there and that was a blow as she knew immediately my needs and care, these new people are so uninterested in the health care , why bother being there to help those in pain if you do not like what you do. Work some where else where you go for a paycheck . the new nurse she is ok but seems to not know what is going on or what procedure is needed next or anything for my transition of care . Only reason to come back is for Dr. Coleman who can fix your back and not have you get surgery he is a life saver 35 years in pain he fixed with needles and didn't shove me off like some other docs with pills and no solution.  otherwise find care elsewhere|This is the worst experience I have ever had and I will not be back. If I could give them 0 I truly would. The lack of customer service, the lack of treatment and the lack of making sure patients don't get the run around is absurd. I recommended people but kindly took the recommendation back. For a person that works in healthcare, this was truly unacceptable.|I will not return because I honestly feel that I was treated unfairly. When a person is really feeling bad and sick, they shouldn't be wrongly judged.|About 2 years ago, I started going there.  At first, I left a positive review, but I changed it, and I want to explain why.  The doctor when I
saw him doing my intake visit really showed concern, after my first visit I was transferred to another staff member.  All of the receptionists were always polite and professional.  The problem that I had was with one of the staff members in the back.   I was prescribed a pain medication that due to the harsh side effects I didn't want to take. The side effect that really concerned me was the possible loss of teeth, even if no dental issues were already present.  Me and that staff member got into a disagreement about me not wanting to take it more than once, which should have been my choice.  She was very disrespectful, and I refused to be treated that way.  The next thing I knew, she accused me of having a dirty drug test, which, when I asked to see my results, I wasn't allowed to.   Yet, on my last day there, she discussed my medical record in front of me with a staff member who was at the front desk as if I wasn't there.  I feel that I was treated unfairly, and I do know that sometimes the test results can be wrong, having a false reading.  They should know that as well.  They actually refused to keep me as a patient due to this.|I've been visiting this exact location for over 10 Yrs and Dr Coleman has always been such an incredible Dr with outstanding bedside manner and if I didn't understand a medical terminology he was always thrilled to explain it so I'd understand. On the months I don't see him I'm happy to say that I see Mrs Justyna Myra and she is such an incredible human being an understanding of all concerns and I'm so impressed by her and how she remembers her patients and the conversations held with her she even recalls several months later and this is the type of relationship I'd like with all of my Drs. Everyone here is so amazing and makes my visit enjoyable|Dr Coleman is the best. Also Justyna Mira is the person I see every month for pain management. She's really good at her job and shows concern for her patients. Rhonda, at the front desk is AWESOME! She recognizes me right away and treats everyone with kindness and respect and compassion. I'm grateful for this entire staff.|This is going to be kind of long, but this needs to be said...

Wait times are atrocious. You're supposed to arrive 15 minutes early or you're considered late and you need to reschedule. Then you're waiting a minimum of an hour past your appt. time to be seen. Can be up to 3 and a half hours. Don't understand how it gets backed up when your only in the actual appt. for up to 1 minute.  Don't know why you're even asked about the state of your health and what you think the treatment regimen is doing for it because you're not listened to. For example, the past year I have voiced my concern that the meds I'm on slightly help, but I feel like maybe a stronger dose or frequency would give me more relief and better quality of life (considering I don't have a good quality of life at all) and their answer is to reduce or completely take away an entire medication. Which then puts me in the hospital for a week due to immense pain from a chronic condition. Then there was a period of time where meds were not being sent to the pharmacy for days after an appt. The most recent appt I had, I had new insurance information. It was never actually put into their system. So the pharmacy kept telling me they were waiting on prior auth. After calling the Dr office multiple times over the course of a week. Someone finally told me that their system showed I had no insurance and I was "self pay". I was like no I gave you guys the new info a week ago. After being put on hold 3 times, I was told the front desk does not deal with that. I need to talk to their insurance person. Honestly, what does the front desk even do at this point other than gossip and eat and text on their phones. I will say that the one receptionist, Rhonda, is always very very sweet and nice. She remembers pretty much every patient that walks in. The only positive out of this was the insurance person was very nice and took care of updating my info right away while I was on the phone with her. But even after that, the pharmacy still updated me saying they had yet to get prior auth from the Dr. At that point I was done. I asked the pharmacy if I could just pay for the meds out of pocket. The pharmacy was very helpful and understanding and used good rx to help me gets my meds. I am absolutely going to be looking for another office to start going to. I am so over this office's bs|Went to a previous Dr. and was in pain a little over a year. I went to Dr. Coleman and received 3 injections and it's been two months and NO PAIN! Dr. Coleman is amazing and the nurse that prep you for the procedure is amazing. She made me feel comfortable and was very nice and polite. (She was excellent in giving the IV)

6/152021
Dr. Coleman and his staff are AMAZING!  The first injection I received was 1 1/2 year ago.  NO PAIN. Just received another injection and Dr. Coleman and his staff was just as nice as they were from day one.  They make you feel comfortable and safe. Thank you Dr. Coleman and Staff.

column40: I went here seeking pain relief  and answers as to why I'm unable to walk. It was my first time there but the staff I came were warm friendly and caring. And compassionate. I hope they will be able to help me. I will update you as my journey continues.|I had the worst experience in my life I have been with National Spine for several years but now it's a new Doctor at the National Harbor office . I had a knee injection and I couldn't even move my knee or leg I couldn't walk they didn't have a crutch or wheel chair to assist me out the office!!!! I almost had to crawl back to my car. The doctor just set in his office while one of the nurse struggled to get me back to front area.|Staff & Dr's / CRNP are nasty. After months of agonizing pain and not having my pain taken seriously that the Office Manager made fun of me on the phone when I said lack of proper care has caused a dip in my quality of life. I have none, I am in incredible pain everyday and have been since becoming a patient in Jan/Feb 2024. I specifically choose this practice and even asked if they handled pregnant patients was told they did and scheduled with one of their doctors. I underwent IVF in Apr 2024 which I made my Dr well aware at my initial appt. Even he commented on how we should wait til the end of the pregnancy to install a medical device to get my endometriosis pain under control. I was the switched to CRNP Greene who for 4 months blew off my increased pain. Then told me last month the only way he would adjust my regiment was to get a letter from my OB. I did and had to play phone tag between Pain and OB since July 18th. Only to go in for my appt this week and be told that the practice was not going to make any adjustments to my pain regiment. I gave them my new OB's card and was told it was pointless for them to connect at all after telling me 6 weeks prior that was the only way my pain regime would change. Then was finally told that I am their ONLY Pregnant patient and they don't deal with pregnant patients at all. So I could continue to see them for inadequate care that has me using a walker and no safe ability to drive or I could take me somewhere else for care. I also failed my depression screening test in office and the Nurse just had me sign a form saying they asked me the questions. Then the CRNP came in and made not one mention of the depression screening at all which I failed because of part of their inadequate management of my care and pushing off me repeatedly saying the pain is worse. Last I noticed if a patient fails a depression screening then the practice is supposed to provide them with resources for mental health help. Nope just let me walk out despite being in visible pain every appt. Still in agonizing chronic pain which is leading to the depression and they haven't tried to refer me once until admitting this week that I am their only pregnant patient (I am 5 months pregnant) they knew from Feb I was planning on getting pregnant and then I confirmed in May that I was pregnant with twins. Not once did anyone refer me to a doctor that specifically deals with pregnant patients at all. And this last visit they told me find my own damn pain specialist that focuses on that. And don't add in the front desk receptionist trying to add his two cents to mix. Or how the Cigna Nurse Advocate told me that the Pain Office would change my regiment only for that to be a lie when I got there. Most days, I am in so much pain I can't talk and can barely breathe. But yea thanks for giving me the damn run around, not helping me and then making fun of me. All these interactions were with the male staff aside from the nurse last check in.|The entire staff has been courteous , professional, and truly caring and helpful. I would happily recommend them to  my  family and friends.|Not Veteran friendly. I was referred from Veterans Affairs and have been charged for every visit. They wrongly charge my insurance and have sent me to debt collectors three times. I feel used and taken advantage of.|I've had serious back pain since I was a little kid. This is the ONLY place that has found a solution. I cried when after my appointment I have no back pain. I really did not see it coming. I'm extremely grateful to the doctors and support staff that helped me. Everyone is extremely kind and professional. I highly recommend this location and won't trust anyone else with my back going forward. It really feels like a little family. Even the front desk staff remembers your name and asks how you are feeling. You won't regret coming here.|First off I would like to say that Dr. Mangal and his team and the nurses and office staff were awesome! The rest of the experience was horrible. I know as patients it is up to us to do our due diligence when it comes to making sure that everything is properly handled when dealing with medical issues, and I try to stay on top of that but you can only do so much with the information that you are provided. I was not properly informed and as a result of this I now have a huge bill to pay. Dealing with the billing department has been challenging because you can never get direct answers to your questions and if you are lucky to get someone you will be put on hold several times., you can't talk to or email anyone directly regarding claims. It was a hard lesson to learn but I got it and never again.|I must say, that though once in the office everyone is great. National Spine and Pain needs to do something with their call system. The fact that you can't get past the call center to speak to anyone in the office is insane. Not even a hospital ER doctor or a Hospice Nurse can get anyone to assist them with a patient of theirs or get anyone to return any calls. I have had to actually go to the Oxon hill location to get the information that Doctors needed back in July while my family member was in the hospital and they refused to return any of the hospital doctors phone calls. Now here I am facing the same issue, with messages being left to the staff from the Hospice nurse and her affiliates, with no return call and still not being able to obtain the information needed to properly care for my family member while under hospice care. This is insane and absolute cruel to the patients and family members. As if dealing with a family member on hospice isn't enough, now to have to deal with the fact that my family members comfort is being delayed because National Spine and pain won't return any calls or even care enough to provide the information needed!!!

column2: Newbridge Spine & Pain Center - Prince Frederick, MD
column3:
At Newbridge Spine & Pain Center, we are dedicated interventional pain management specialists providing comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our Prince Frederick location offers advanced treatment options designed to deliver long-lasting relief without excessive reliance on medication.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We specialize in treating all pain conditions from the neck to the knee, including:

  • Spinal Conditions: Degenerative Disc, Herniated or Slipped Disc, Spinal Stenosis

  • Musculoskeletal Pain: Back & Neck Pain, Shoulder, Leg & Arm Pain, Hip, SI Joint & Knee Pain

  • Neuropathic Pain & Cancer Pain

  • Injury-Related Pain: Sports & Fitness Injuries, Auto and Work Injuries, Spinal Cord Injuries

  • Post-Surgical Pain including Failed Back Surgery Pain

Our team of board-certified physicians combines clinical expertise with compassionate care to develop personalized treatment plans for each patient. We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we're committed to helping you regain functionality and improve your quality of life. Visit Newbridge Spine & Pain Center or call us at (410) 414-9229 to schedule your consultation at our convenient Prince Frederick location at 80 Sherry Ln #101.

column11:
Interventional Pain Management Specialists providing long-lasting relief from acute and chronic pain conditions.

We treat all pain conditions from the neck to the knee. Including:

Amber's great anytime that I take my family member to see her. She's always taking the time to hear about what's going on and answers any questions that you may have and she also will ask follow-up questions about what you were discussing at the time always kind polite with smile on her face taking care of my family member. I feel like it's a family member taking care of family and not a medical provider. I highly recommend Amber. The second you walk in the door, you feel comfortable and well taken care of by every person in that building. To find that level and kind of care nowadays so happy we found Newbridge spine and pain. I just want to say thank you so much for taking care of my family. We love each and everyone of you just like you were family|Very caring staff after my first visit.  Did not like having to wait 45 minutes for my appointment in pain. After the 45 minutes, was told that they had only one working computer to use with patients. I should have been given the option to reschedule. I walked out.|Care was good. I was charged over $500.
00 for 2 procedures that where not clearly explained by Dr. Gonchigar in my first appointment with him. The bills came as a surprise. Was not happy with that.|I love the fact that when I stop by or call the office I am always welcomed with a beautiful smile. I can be a pest at times. I have memory issues. They are very understanding and sincere all the time. I was going to move out of state at one point but it isn't an option for me to do that. I recommend anyone and everyone to come to New Bridge and Spine.|First nerve ablation on both sides worked wonderfully. This last one done 1 1/2 years later did nothing. Spoke to your staff. She stated it may take longer than first time. Still have lots of pain again. Don't know what to do next.|I was in so much pain for two months because of bilateral SI Joint Dysfunction. I finally called Newbridge in Prince Frederick and the staff was so kind. Thankfully, they were able to get me in right away to be seen. A couple of days later I had my injections at the Waldorf office by Dr. Jay. The staff here was also very kind too. Dr. Jay and those who were with him during the procedure made me feel very comfortable. I'm finally starting to feel some relief now. Thank you all so much for helping me get myself feeling back to normal again. I will definitely continue to see Dr. Jay for this issue when and if it continues to return.

Follow up: Unfortunately the four different injections that I had here never completely worked for me and were a lot of money each time. I finally went two hours up the road to another doctor and his injection worked the very next day and still is working two weeks later. I'm confused about why theirs didn't work and my new doctor's did but I'm just glad I figured it out.|Highly recommend this place, wonderful and kind people. It's always clean and barely ever have to wait. Dr. Spradlin is knowledgeable and makes sure your questions are answered.|Everyone at NB takes such excellent care of me!  After 5 years of struggling with pain and no end in sight I started seeing the amazing staff at NB.  My pain is now manageable and they have given me back my life!

column3:
At Metro Spine PC, we specialize in non-surgical pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our dedicated team, led by Dr. George H. Drakes, MD, understands how debilitating and overwhelming living with pain can be. We work closely with each patient to accurately diagnose and effectively treat a wide range of conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We provide specialized treatment for:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Hip and knee conditions

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

  • Plantar fasciitis

  • Sports-related injuries

Our approach combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to address the root cause of your pain. We're committed to improving your quality of life through effective pain management strategies that minimize reliance on medication when possible. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 301-856-5860 to schedule an appointment at our Oxon Hill location.
column9: Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Sports medicine physician
column11: As non-surgical pain experts, the Metro Spine PC team recognizes how distressing and overwhelming it can be living with pain. They work closely with patients to accurately diagnose and effectively treat neck, back, hip, and knee conditions and other causes of pain. They have considerable skill in helping people with disorders like complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) and plantar fasciitis.

column40: Yesterday, I had an appointment at 10:45am.  I didn't get out of there until 12:48pm.  I had been waiting for a long time to be seen by the doctor.  While waiting I was already suffering from flu like symptoms. I vomited 3 times while waiting to be seen. I had another appointment to go see my primary doctor for my symptoms and missed that appointment because I had wait there so long.  When patients are late for their appointment, usually they make you come another time but when they take forever to see you, you just have to deal with it.  The saddest part is that no apology is given when they take forever to see you.  I feel like my time is just as important as theirs.  I understand that sometimes things can get behind time, but again, apologizing would have been most appreciated.|Dr. Drakes has not only shown compassion to keep me out of pain without having to use pain medication, he shows true concern for my overall well-being. I'm truly grateful that he is a part of my care team. I couldn't be in better hands.|Dr. Drake is the best pain management doctor there is. I was in pain for 3 years no one would help me they couldn't find the problem with in 15 minutes Dr. Drake found the problem and been helping me to this day . He cares about his patients and is very wise. Thank you Dr. Drake you are the best.|My appointments with Metro Spine, both in Oxon Hill and in Clinton, have always been beneficial and most pleasant.  The staff is very professional and caring from the front desk administration to the care and pain management from the attending physician, particularly Dr. Drake and Dr. Boykins whom I have had the pleasure to converse with above and beyond physical pain management.  And, there is never a long wait time.|I really appreciate Dr. Drake he took time to explain everything to me about my condition. I had several things going on with my body and KNOW one help me understand exactly what was going on. Everyone was very pleasant and patient.  I thought by going to certain places to receive care I will have a better treatment that was not true .I can't thank Dr. Drake enough for what he's doing.  S. Hickman thanks for referring me.|Dr.  Drakes is great what he does.  He's an amazing and knowledgeable  doctor.  His  team is awesome and helpful. At National Spine & Pain Centers of Bel Air, led by Dr. Michael Burchell, MD, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's needs. Our practice combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Located at 510 Upper Chesapeake Dr in Bel Air, Maryland, our center offers a team-based approach to pain management that addresses the root causes of discomfort rather than just treating symptoms.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We provide a wide range of interventional pain management treatments including:

  • Spinal epidural injections for back and neck pain

  • Personalized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions

  • Comprehensive pain assessments and diagnostics

  • Non-surgical pain management solutions

Dr. Burchell and our entire team take the time to listen to each patient's concerns, creating effective treatment strategies that address their unique pain challenges. We believe in building lasting relationships with our patients, providing them with the expert care and support they deserve. For more information or to schedule an appointment, please visit our official website or call us at +1 443-270-7246.

column2: National Spine & Pain Centers - Glen Burnie
column3:
At National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) in Glen Burnie, we are proud to be part of one of the nation's largest pain management practices. Since our formation in 2011 through the rebranding of The Spine Center, we have rapidly expanded our network to better serve patients suffering from chronic pain.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our growth continued in 2012 when we partnered with Capitol Spine & Pain and later welcomed New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians) to our family. Today, we maintain an extensive network of over 60 centers with nearly 100 providers across seven states including:

  • Maryland (including our Glen Burnie location)

  • Virginia

  • Washington D.C.

  • New Jersey

  • North Carolina

  • New York

  • West Virginia

We strive to bring together the highest quality providers in pain management to address the growing needs of patients seeking relief from chronic pain. Our Glen Burnie facility, located at 1600 Crain Hwy S #301, offers specialized care in a professional setting. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, visit our website or call us at (410) 787-8315.
column11: National Spine & Pain Centers (NSPC) is one of the nation's largest pain management practices in the United States. Formed in 2011 with a re-brand of The Spine Center - NSPC quickly expanded, partnering with Capitol Spine & Pain in 2012. We strive to bring high quality providers in the specialty of pain management together to offer an extensive network to meet the needs of an ever growing population of patients living in chronic pain. In late 2012 our affiliations grew with the addition of New York Pain Physicians (now New York Spine & Pain Physicians), bringing our number of centers to over 60 with close to 100 providers in D.C., Maryland, New Jersey, North Carolina, New York, Virginia and West Virginia.

column40:
The surgery center at National Spine and Pain Management in Glen Burnie Maryland did 2 epidural shots in my upper back due to surgery and they were supposed to sedate me. The first appointment they said they did not have the anesthesiologist was not there and gave me an excuse. They offered Lidocaine to do it. I did this and it was VERY painful. I came in for my second set of shots 4 weeks later and AGAIN no anesthesiologist, more excuses and had no choice but to get lidocaine and get the shots and have extreme pain during and after the procedure. I needed to get relief for my pain and felt I had no choice. I set up the third appointment and no anesthesiologist with another excuse and I refused the third shot due to how painful the injections were. My surgeon ordered epidural shots in my neck due to extreme pain due to recovering from surgery. I set up the appointment for 8/6/24 and confirmed the injections with total sedation which my pain management doctor also ordered sedation in my chart, so it was in my chart twice. I arrived with my son (have to have a driver) and they said my appointment was cancelled and did not know why and apologized. They said sedation is only on Wednesday's and that the doctor was out the following week and scheduled me 2 weeks out on 8/28/24 and confirmed the injections ordered and  complete sedation. They called me at midday to confirm my injections and full sedation which I confirmed by phone. On my way to the appointment the office called again and asked me to come earlier and again confirmed full sedation with my neck injections. I arrived and checked in and paid for the services. A man came to the lobby and said management did not tell him I was getting full sedation. 20 minutes later they brought me back and put in an IV and then offered light sedation stating the anesthesiologist was no longer at the office. I was not happy but agreed to do the light sedation even though I questioned the dangers of light sedation and not being fully under to not have a medical mistake made with my injections. The manager then came back and said the doctor would NOT do the procedure because I needed full sedation to do the procedure and wanted to re-schedule me for a third time. I do not trust this surgery center and they are grossly incompetent. I missed 3 hours of work for both appointments, costing me and my son's valuable time and money. I told the office to void the transactions (2) and they only voided 1. I called to get the second payment voided and got the run around so now I have to go through my credit card and challenge the charge causing more time and effort on my part. I also experienced being off my pain medications because they had no appointments over the summer two times because providers were on vacation and no appointments were available. They said they would call them in without a visit and then refused to call them in and was off medications for 5 days one time and 7 days the second time. When pharmacies ran out of my prescribed pain medicine it took them 3 days to call in an alternate pain medication. I received good treatment 70% of the time with my pain management doctor and tried to overlook things and be patient. It is alarming to me the complete disregard for my health and healing from surgery to get necessary treatments and having to stop pain medications from a serious neck surgery and could not work or function during these gaps in service for my medication. The surgery center is "dangerous" to patient care, and I will be filing a medical complaint for the surgery center doctors for my procedures and lack of procedures due to complete incompetence. It is absolutely baffling to me.|Not only have i been coming here for longer than some of the practitioners, im not receiving management for my pain...after my recent back surgery it turns out that its my hip, I'm bone on bone and 6 weeks out from surgery, and 2 1/2 weeks out from my appt, I'm told we can look into it at my next appt....why are these ppl in pain management if they're not going to control the pain?!?!?!  And don't get me started on that lying arse front desk....this place is going down hill and fast.|Terrible.  Dr forgot to send my meds in, it's been days, I went in for my appt at 830am days ago and they still not calling them in and they said they would.  I'm so upset and I'm in so much pain. Wasted $17 on Uber to be mistreated and still not cared for by their Dr.  What a waste of time, shouldn't have to beg and call multiple times to remind the Dr to do her job. Smh.|I bring my mom here every month....everytime there is an issue with the pharmacy receiving her meds or preauthorization....no one can be reached ...I literally called on the 12/31/24 about an issue with her meds...it took 4 times to call and finally got thru, the lady said she will send the doctor a message....here it is 13 days later the pharmacy still has yet to receive the medication...this time it took me 6 times to get someone on the phone...I explained the situation ..she say okay hold on a sec...1 hour later I hung up......do better|I've been coming here for 8 years and the service with the front staff has deteriorated. Two months ago I show up for my appointment that someone forgot to schedule because I had my form with my injection appointment. I couldn't have the procedure done because insurance needs to give consent. Then today, I find out I don't have an appointment because the provider no longer works there. I feel like the receptionist was stating like it was my fault but I showed my text stating I had an appointment with that individual and time. Then it was stated those texts have nothing to do with the office. I'm not sure whose responsibility it is to notify patients but while I was there, three other patients had an appointment with the same person. How are patients to know a provider is no longer there without notification? I assume the texts I receive are accurate and that's not the case.

This place also cannot keep providers so I think that speaks volumes of the state in which this place has become. There needs to be more support in the front office and providers as well. Management needs to address the issues or perhaps new management is necessary in order to keep patients. I'm considering if I have one more poor experience than I'm gone. I wonder how many others feel the same.|A very very unorganized office.
Appointment was scheduled for 10:30, it is now 1:15 and I still have not been seen.
No one answers the phone.
I wonder how much my time is worth?|The manager at the facility created an unfriendly environment. The manager was so disrespectful to be consequently I decided not to go back there despite me needing care. DON'T GO & STAY AWAY FROM THAT PLACE.|Great doctors and nurse practitioners.  Front desk not so great. They are rude, unwilling to help and nasty.

column48: How many people have been discharged due to office and nurse mistakes
column49: I went here 4yrs and was also discharged for a false positive on a drug I was NOT on and TRIED to tell them 1 OTC med I was on CAN SHOW FALSE POSITIVES FOR METHADONE & that anyone can look the info up online! THEY REFUSED to speak to me & 4x they refused to allow me to speak to manager. I WORKED IN private;  hospital & also was a Managed Care Coordinator for the entire Chesapeake region in PHARMACY 20yrs before dreaded M.S. took me down & had to go on SSDI (federal disability w/ Social Security). This office had the attitude of " "We don't care your meds are INADEQUATE & DOSED TOO LOW" I was taken DOWN to doses I was on back in 06'! I told CRNP at nearly every other visit my doses needed to be raised a LITTLE BIT & he REFUSED at every request. I should NEVER have been put on the med they wrote for breakthrough pain for 4yrs & my federal Rx plan  even argued it to them. NS&P didn't care. I TOOK 14 urine & blood tests & FALSE + was on the last. I WAS CUT OFF ALL MEDS ( on 17yr)  NO TAPER

column40:
Dr. Peruvemba is the world's top pain specialist.  To support my statement; I had my first injection yesterday by Dr. P for my excruciating hip pain for months. It's a miracle that I was able to sleep last night feeling only a little bit of discomfort in my left hip. I was able to sleep from 11pm to 11am this morning! Another miracle because I  haven't been able to sleep for months due to the pain.
Dr. P's office staff are highly professional, pleasant and friendly.
I must mention Dr. P's assistant Jay is the world's kindest human being. Yesterday was icy cold in Maryland. After my injection Jay helped me on a wheelchair and transported me from the doctor's office to the elevator and transported me all the way to the parking lot and helped me get into my car. I never met such a kind and considerate person in a doctor's office in my life. To me Jay is my angel. Thank you Dr. P and Jay and everyone in the front office.
Thank you for such a great experience with all of you!!!|Dr. Peruvemba is a great physician. He treated my mother with respect. Unfortunetly I cannot say the same for his receptionist, Victoreen. We called to schedule a follow up appointment. She called me back to inform me the insurance is inactive. I assured her it is. I work in the medical field and ran this on EPIC that morning and it was active. She insisted she need was going to cancel her appointment until we resolved the issue. I said, well maybe someone needs to call the insurance directly, like we do for our patients to ensure they get efficient care. I even stated I would pay upfront for the cost of this visit. She said I do not work billing, you mothers insurance is inactive I am cancelling her appointment and hung up on me. As a health care worker myself, this is the worst treatment I think I've ever recieved. I tried calling the office back multiple times and she never answered.|Dr. P administered an injection in one of my hip bursa that had been so painful I'd been limping for a year.  Within 2 days I had received near total pain relief.  I'm so glad I finally had this done.  Great staff and very competent doctors.  Thank you.|Dr Peruvemba helped me with my Neck pain which I had been experiencing for about 2 months. After my procedure my neck pain is gone. Outstanding professional. Thanks a lot.|Dr. Peruvemba spent the time listening to and discussing the pain, followed by ordering the appropriate tests and was realistic on the possible treatments available.  Overall, he is an extremely competent doctor and I highly recommend him.|Dr.  Peruvemba, is one of the best doctor's I've ever had in my life.
He's a great listener and he's always given me the best of care.
I've been blessed to have such a wonderful doctor in my life.|Hello good/afternoon everyone. To doctor RAMANI  Peruvemba, HE IS A GREAT, SMART, FUNNY AND CARING doctor, I was there yesterday for my LUMBAR EPIDURAL STEROID INJECTION and he did a great job.  To the staff and Mr. JAY who follow up me this morning about my condition  you guys are did incredible job. Thank you for all your help. I will recommend to my friend. Have a great day! ---Josephine B.|Dr. P has been my doctor for over a decade now. I came to his office depressed,in constant unbearable pain at times and with little hope. There was no miracle pill but his knowledge and expertise in handling pain changed my life, i often get teary eyed when i speak about it. It definitely was a process but with his guidance i regained confidence,had hope and slowly but surely we worked together as a team and my life and pain is manageable now.  I will forever be grateful to Dr. P and his staff.

Struggling with constant pain is one of the worst things I've ever experienced and it is for millions. Although Dr P can't possibly treat millions, if you're able to be his patient he will do everything in his power to help you. He's also really funny lol

column2: Pain Management Centers of New England
column3:
At Pain Management Centers of New England, we are dedicated to alleviating pain and restoring quality of life for patients throughout the New England region. Our team of physicians, advanced practitioners, and compassionate staff understand that pain is a deeply personal experience, which is why we take the time to listen carefully and develop individualized treatment plans based on the specific cause of your pain and previous treatments you've tried.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of specialized pain management services including:

  • Personalized pain assessment and diagnosis

  • Innovative interventional procedures

  • Customized treatment planning

  • Ongoing pain management support

Beyond our main Newburyport office at 21 Highland Ave #16, our providers staff multiple locations throughout the North Shore of Massachusetts, including the Beth Israel Lahey Health Patient Care Center in Danvers and Addison Gilbert Hospital in Gloucester, making quality pain care more accessible to our patients. Learn more about our comprehensive approach to pain management by visiting our official website or call us at +1 978-992-4580 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
The physicians, advanced practitioners, and staff at the Pain Management Centers of New England focus on alleviating pain and restoring quality of life for patients throughout New England. In addition to our Newburyport office, our providers staff locations throughout the North Shore of Massachusetts. These locations include the Beth Israel Lahey Health Patient Care Center in Danvers and Addison Gilbert Hospital in Gloucester, MA.
We understand that every person has a different response to acute and chronic pain. Thus, we listen to you and develop an individualized treatment plan based on the cause of your pain and previous treatments that you may have already tried.
