column40:
I have seen many doctors in several cities for my back pain and can say that the doctors here listen with compassion and a thoroughness that is unmatched. Dr. Lee always does such a thorough job on my procedures and also is fun to talk to. Since coming here my pain has only continued to improve.

While the office can get busy at times I would rather drive far to this clinic than go elsewhere where they rush through their patients. I will happily drive further to be seen by attentive and thorough doctors rather than go somewhere close where I am only seen for five minutes.

A lot of free parking and easy to make appointments.|I have been dealing with severe back pain for years and finally found a place that puts my interest's first. Holly always works through my insurance issues. Julie is great for office visits and while it may not always be what I want to hear she does whats right and always has a plan. Dr Q really puts my mind at ease with injections and after my RFAs it is literally night and day pain wise. Highly recommend|I love this place! Very helpful!! Very flexible with appointments!! They slipped me in same day when I had a fall!! Christine and Julie are miracle workers along with doctor Lee!! All thumbs up|Been fighting with insurance companies for years for an mri on my back due to years of chronic back pain getting worse. Finally gets approved.
However I have had nothing but problems with this office. From them waiting until the day before my initial appointment to tell me they didn't receive the referral for my first appointment, to running the wrong insurance not once but twice, to saying they don't have the results of my MRI when I have both the dictated radiologist report and the physical disc with the mri images on it. I just simply no longer trust these people.
Just awful. I suppose there's a reason I take the trip to Boston for specialists and it looks like I'll be going there for my back as well.|I have been going to this office for nerve and disc problems. The procedures I had went very well. Insurance is the biggest problem with adding extra procedures and visits. I really enjoyed the pleasantry of the front office teams on both floors.|Husband seeing after 3 spine surgeries. He's happy so far except they treat every patient as if pill seeker which is not fair. After 3 botched spine surgeries he has permanent pain and nerve damage and they try to take away pain meds right away. We will see if injection actually helps made us wait almost 2 months for that with no compassion for the patient. Not happy with their idea of pain management as it echoes the faltered medical system with patients concerns being dismissed. Me as his wife and advocate as he prefers me to be his voice we have just about lost faith in doctors altogether and at 56 years old have little patience to be treated bad. I am biting my tongue hoping for the best. Always a long wait and not easy access for someone in wheelchair with no automatic doors.
Update...they cut down meds and injections did nothing he is back at square one in pain and unable to move his neck. Waste of time going there thry are just making money off patients. Karma|This doctor's office was recommended due to a poor experience with the reliant medical St Vincent's orthopedic services. The facility is not particularly elaborate and should not be regarded as cutting-edge within the context of medical offices. Honestly, it does not even bear a strong resemblance to a typical doctor's office, nor is there clear signage denoting its status as a medical office from the front of the building. If you can figure out what is the front of the building anyway. Notably, procedures have been relocated to Suite 202 on the second floor. Upon my arrival for a 9:15 a.m. appointment, I encountered a locked door. When I informed the front desk staff, it was revealed that they did not possess the key. This situation was notably disconcerting, especially considering I was scheduled for a spinal injection procedure. The desk person also seemed incredibly new and receiving a billing issue for my insurance I felt asking her would lead to just me getting frustrated as she was not sure what I was supposed to even do to sign in. However, the nurses exhibited kindness and clarity in explaining the proceedings, offering a variety of questions that could be posed. The doctor entered the room and inquired if I had any queries, which I found to be quite helpful. She even indicated the specific region on my lower back where the injection would be administered which I've had issues in the past with doctors being unclear in that regard. Nobody checked if I had a ride as you're not supposed to drive after the procedure that was also a little disconcerting. As I've had similar procedures in the past usually before vitals are taken and which none were prior to the procedure which also was quite disconcerting. I'm left with an overall It is what it is feeling for a doctor's office in Fitchburg which actually might be a little under okay but I didn't completely dislike it so got three stars.|Dr Quereshi saved my life! The pain from my broken back was taking away my desire to live. His ablation treatments took 75% of the pain away! His kindness, compassion, and willingness to explain the treatments were something that I had never experienced before. Please don't hesitate to call and ask for help!
He is the absolute best in his field! I know this because I had seen at least 8 other pain doctors!  Call him!

column2: South Shore Health's Pain Management Clinic
column3:
At South Shore Health's Pain Management Clinic, we provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Our Specialized Approach to Pain Management

We offer thorough evaluations and personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated team collaborates closely with your referring clinician, primary care physician, and other specialists including physical therapists, neurologists, physiatrists, and orthopedists to ensure coordinated care.

We treat a wide range of conditions including:

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Back and neck pain

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

  • Failed back syndrome

  • Migraines and headaches

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-herpetic neuralgia

  • Post-surgical and post-trauma pain

  • Phantom pain

Located at 2 Pond Park Rd #4354 in Hingham, MA, our clinic is equipped with modern facilities to provide effective pain management solutions. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit our official website or call us at (781) 624-8352.
column11:
The Pain Management Clinic offers comprehensive evaluations and treatment plans to patients with chronic pain. The Pain Management Clinic team collaborates with your referring clinician, primary care physician, physical therapist, neurologist, physiatrist, orthopedist and other specialists regarding your care.

Conditions treated include: arthritis, back pain, Complex Regional Pain Syndrome, failed back syndrome, migraines, neck pain, neuropathic pain, post-herpetic neuralgia, post-surgical pain, post-trauma pain, and phantom pain.

At Pain Management Centers of New England, we provide specialized care under the expert guidance of Dr. Charles C. Ho, a distinguished physician with over 20 years of experience.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

Dr. Ho is double board-certified in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, having earned his medical degree from Temple University School of Medicine (now Lewis Katz School of Medicine) and his Bachelor of Science in Biology from Johns Hopkins University. We offer comprehensive pain management services at our convenient locations in Danvers, Gloucester, and Newburyport, Massachusetts, including:

  • Personalized pain assessment and treatment plans

Dr. Ho earned his medical degree from Temple University School of Medicine, now called Lewis Katz School of Medicine at Temple University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He also received a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland.

At North Shore Pain Management, we are dedicated to helping you reclaim the life activities you've been missing due to chronic pain. Our comprehensive approach focuses on providing meaningful pain reduction through advanced treatment options tailored to your specific needs.

column40:
Dr. Shah has a rare quality these days,  he listens to the patient.  After being entrenched in the Healthcare System for way too long, he gives me hope and no patient could ask for more especially when you are in a lot of pain.  I would ask him "what if this doesn't work?" he would tell me we will look at other options....again always giving me the greatest gift of hope.  Thank you so much!|Dr Patel is the worst telling how he worked on Kevin Garnett in talking about other patients as he sticking the Cortizone shot into my back. Also, tje staff  is horrible especially one of the older ladies I was 9 minutes late was told to come back I've never had that happen in my life horrible place if you wanna get better this is not the place ! Also, the doctor Made me feel very uncomfortable|I am new to NSPM and have already had two procedures hoping that I get relief from back pain. I will know in 6-8 weeks. I have the highest regard for Dr. Patel. From the first appt. I left with a feeling that this gentleman was going to do the best he could to help me. He delineated a sequential plan along with a goal of relieving 80% of pain for a good period of time. He is a great listener, gathers all information during and after the initial intake and explains all in detail. I also have been very impressed with the office staff. They are personable, well organized and pleasant. Even if the procedures don't work for me, I highly recommend trying this practice especially with Dr. Patel. I am so happy that I looked for different provider.|Thank you Dr. Patel for my shot . You are warm and caring and made me feel so comfortable! Dr Kohli also had nothing but great things to say about you . Your staff is very efficient and called me this morning to see how I felt . I really appreciate that call . I highly recommend Dr. Patel and will be back for my follow up ! Thank you again|This was my 2nd visit to NSPM (Woburn).   Dr. Patel was professional, kind and really listened to what I had to say.  I received two injections and it was easy due to the minimal pain involved (1 out of 10).  Special shoutout to the tech Sophia.  She really put me at ease pre and post procedure.|I laid on my floor for a few weeks in excruciating pain. I saw Dr. Patel for a consult, and he got me in the next day for a cortisone shot in my back. The pain subsided, and it took several days to feel much better. He gave me back (no pun intended!) my life. I can't recommend him enough!!!!!!|After being hospitalized for a chronic illness, I began to suffer from " atypical " lower back pain. While in the hospital, they did very little to find out why. I was released and shortly after I began Pain Therapy at NSPM Center.
I was referred to this Clinic by my then PCP.  Everyone I spoke too spoke very, very highly of Dr. Patel and after my first visit, I now know why. I've been going to them for many years now for my pain treatment and I will never be able to explain how responsive and caring they were. They did tests and found out the reason for my pain and it's been being treated FULLY since I first went there.
I've had a few different Drs. / P.A's treat me there and I have nothing but great things to say about each person.
They are very caring, compassionate as well as friendly.  Do not think for a moment they will give you what you ask for, as it should be. Follow their rules and treatment plan and over time you will recieve the help you need.
Should you require pain treatment, I'd ALWAYS Highly recommend one of their Clinics.  They gave me back my life as well as my sanity!

* This review was based solely on my own personal experiences with NSPM and in no way was I EVER asked  to provide a review *|Dr Patel is warm, caring and committed to helping his patients live a better life with pain. I've only been seeing him and his support staff for 6 months, but I appreciate everyone's kindness, helpfulness and compassion! It's difficult working day after day dealing with patients in pain... they do it extremely well!! Thank you!

column40: I was there today 2/24/25 and from check-in to check-out I have to say was all good. Nurse's were great, compassionate and very helpful and caring. My appointment was at 10 AM. It is 1132 and I'm still have not been seen by the doctor. Terrible terrible service. Where is the doctor? That's been over an hour and a half half and I still have not been seen. This is ridiculous. This is all to build the insurance here so unless you want to come and spend 3 to 4 hours just to get seen this is terrible service. They need to fix the service department in this building for pain management ridiculous|The staff and nurses are great but the Doctors leave a lot to be desired. No compassion and I've had 4 strokes!!! I can't walk without a walker or wheelchair my back and legs hurt so bad. I'm lucky if I get 4 hours of sleep a night. They had a great doctor but he retired. And be prepared to be there for hours for an appointment. Good luck!!!|If I could rate this with no stars I would. My appt was at 9:30. I'm still sitting in waiting for the doctor to be seen and it's 11:40. There is no reason the appts should take this long. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and I will never come back.|Extremely disappointed with the doctor (DR. Eric Dominguez) that saw my mother today for her initial appointment. He had absolutely no bed side manner and was rude and dismissive. He spent all of two minutes with her and did not exam her or review her info. He basically told her they are not taking new patients and he did not want to schedule another appointment. Said she clearly needs something for pain management but he was not going to do anything or prescribe anything and referred her back to her PCP who initially sent her here because they are supposed to specialize in PAIN MANAGEMENT! Did not even talk about interventions or recommendations and just walked out of the room. Would not recommend this physician at all! Extremely unprofessional!|If I could give 0 stars I would. I have been taking my mother here for a couple months now dude to back and hip pain and every time she comes in the wait times get longer and longer. Being in the waiting room for hours for a quick injection appointment that takes 10 minutes is outrageous. Then another patient walks in waits for 15 min and is called to the procedure room ahead of people that have been waiting for hours. This is probably one of the most if not the most poorly run medical office I have ever been to and I am ashamed for taking my mother here. If I had to give one positive. The doctor was polite.|Literally with my heavy heart, I will try to be exact in explaining yesterday's experience, to start my visit to this establishment was beyond disgraceful,  NO words can really suffice the way this so called leader in pain management (DR. DOMINGUEZ) has SHOWED OUT! I am a 53 year old well educated & plenty traveled women, as a MBA graduate, I have had much sucess in my career throughout the year's, until a unexpected turn of scary health events occurred, which at this clinic to my amazement, I was treated like less than a piece of gum on the bottom of a shoe. Right from the start I was discriminated against and this was before I was able to even discuss any of my unfortunate health mishaps & concerns, while not being heard at all, this mean, Uncompassionate excuse for a Doctor failed to evaluate me , I received no examination, nor was I able to get a word in edgewise. He was so repulsive and belittling towards my tragic health misfortune. Disregarded my entire situation from the absolute minute he walked into the room, he looked at me and said what is that box on your waist? I wasn't even able to explain that I am wearing this Life vest for a reason as he rolled his eyes at me like it was nonsense, while I tried to add in simple words that this is a defilabator vest that I am currently wearing due to a unforeseen situation that occurred after I endured a pulmonary embolism after a surgical procedure and now I suffer from CHF with a heart function of only 30 percent. I suffer from Excruciating pain in my lower extremities and much chronic pain in my hip following my hospitalization.  With this being said he was only in my company for a few minutes, while yelling at me as I'm already in a frightening state to begin with he proceeds to tell me to go back to my surgeon and tell him that he is not able to help me, he also added this was a big waste of my time, which BTW was only supposed to be until I can get stronger moving towards CARDIO REHAB & PHYSICAL THERAPY. I was so distort over him when I left my nurse drove me to the nearest walk-in emergency clinic where I could get immediate vital signs as I was looking meek and faint. They treated me with care there after this inhumane treatment at St.Anne's pain clinic. All I can do now is ask the Lord to continue to be with me during this tough journey with no support from this awful place that I was referred too and in hopes that KARMA does its job. And so does The attorney general.

column38: Alyson Sutherland|Paula Gauthier|L Van Meter|Karen Favreau|odin4eva|Landis Becker Young|Michael Hanewich|Shari Sklar Jacobson
column40:
I have been a patient here for years, and no one else has come close to the care and support that I receive from the team here. They are understanding, compassionate and determined to help. You are not just another "number" here, they truly care about you and what matters to you. From the ladies at the front desk, to the nurses and doctors in back and in the Surgical center.. they're exceptional.

I'm so thankful for Dr. Silk and Hannah! I see them regularly and they have been able to develop a plan to stabilize my pain as much as possible, while we tried to find the root cause. Every appointment I've had, no matter how often, they sit and listen, and they never make me feel rushed. I receive nerve blocks and Botox from them, and they make it as painless as possible. It's great that they can do infusions here too, which has helped me soo many times and saved me from going to the ER!

I've had a complex head pain issue for years where so many neurologists, specialists and hospitals disregarded my symptoms or threw their hands up with no other alternatives. NOT Dr. Silk! He has been the ONLY doctor that listened to me over and over and didn't give up on trying to find the root cause. It's because of his ongoing efforts, the continuous support and willingness to work with any doctor that could help me, that I recently received a diagnosis from the Mayo Clinic that confirmed the symptoms that I had been describing (the same symptoms that others disregarded).|I am 76 and have suffered a life long history of migraines which became chronic and unbearable when I contracted long covid a year ago. I was fortunate to find the Boston Advanced Medicine clinic in Waltham and was able to see Dr. Silk and get immediate relief with his care which is ongoing. Dr. Silk is an expert clinician, highly compassionate and patient, and always makes himself available for consultation and support. I recommend Dr. Silk highly.|This happened about nine years ago and I am still angry about it.  The same doctors that I saw are still there. I came to the Boston Pain Center (now Boston Advanced Medicine) for pain in my leg due to a comminuted tibial plateau fracture. They took scans and couldn't find anything. They gave me back injections, which did nothing but I'm sure insurance paid well.  Then they set me up with their social worker who tried to convince me that the pain was all in my head. I said to myself enough was enough and went to an orthopedic surgeon at New England Baptist.  After taking x-rays, he asked what took me so long to get to him. Apparently according to him, "You have no knee".  So knee replacement was performed.  But yeah, it was all in my head. What painful agony and a waste of my time and my insurance company's money at the Boston Pain Center.|I am happy with the care I have received at Boston Advanced Medicine.   The staff is all super friendly and caring.  They understand what you are going through and do all that they can to help.  I look forward to more visits to hopefully ease my pain.  I would recommend it to anyone.|Such a wonderful group of people! Informative, kind and supportive! Dr Britt is an asset to this team.  Knowledgeable and gentle. She walked me through my options after my leg continued to hurt. After treatment my pain was 99% gone!  I'd recommend this company of professionals  to anyone dealing with injury to the joints!|Can't say enough great things about Boston Advanced Medicine and the Migraine treatments available - they changed my life. Scheduling appointments is easy, every staff member is helpful and wonderful. The care  is truly top notch.|I cannot say enough about the exceptional care Hannah Espie AGPCNP-BC and the team at Boston Advanced Medicine provide.  I have been a patient of Hannah's and Boston Advanced Medicine for over seven years.  As someone who has undergone multiple spinal fusion surgeries (fused C3-T2), chronic pain and migraines have been constant challenges in my life.  However, the expert care I receive from Hannah and the team has been a game-changer.
Hannah is highly skilled, knowledgeable, compassionate, thoughtful, and attentive. She takes the time to explain every step, ensuring comfort and precision. She is also a terrific listener.  Her precision in administering the various injections has provided me much-needed relief and significantly improved my quality of life.
I am incredibly grateful for Hannah's expertise and dedication. The team at Boston Advanced Medicine is compassionate, attentive, and highly professional. They truly understand how to work with and treat people in pain. I highly recommend Hannah Espie and the team for outstanding, patient-centered care if you need pain management.

Michael Hanewich|I feel cared for when receiving treatments at Boston Advanced Medicine. The staff is friendly and professional and the Dr's are compassionate and supportive. They are a big part of wellness regimen.

column40:
Office staff is always pleasant and were patient when I got appointments mixed up. I think Dr. Pearl and her medical staff are knowledgeable, compassionate, and kind. I never feel rushed. My pain is managed well and I am hopeful that upcoming procedures will help even more.|I want to preface this by saying i did address my concerns with the office only for Gabby, the receptionist, to call me back and basically say I'm a liar when i have everything in my phone with all the dates and times.
This office takes weeks to return calls, they took 2 weeks to send out my MRI order when they knew my insurance only approved it for one month and they refuse to prescribe anything, even non-controlled/narcotic meds. Not a single person in this office cares about you being in pain but they will rack up the office visits only to waste your time and tell you to get pain meds from your pcp like they told me. Thank God i have an awesome PCP otherwise I would have been abandoned with my pain and left alone to suffer. I have transferred my care elsewhere, I recommend you don't waste your time even signing up here.
Editing since they replied stating i called while they were closed. I knew they would be closing from 12/20-01/02 so I called twice on Friday 12/13, once on tuesday 12/17 and 3 times on the 18th, like I told Gabby who called me a liar. They NEVER worked closely with my PCP until the very end when i asked for my records to be sent to a different pain clinic. My PCP took time out of her busy schedule to call them herself because she never received any notes from any of my visits or any of the recommendations they said they would send over for med changes. My situation is not complex, my MRI was very clear, which i only know because you guys violated HIPAA by faxing my MRI report to my job. That summarizes how unprofessional you guys are.|For no reason I was denied care for my spine and severe stenosis/ sciata on both sides and neuropathy on both legs and feet|I have NEVER worked with a more unresponsive medical staff in my entire life. It takes upwards of 2 weeks to receive responses from these people. When I started seeing Dr. Pearl, I was on medication that put my pain levels at a 4/10. Dr. Pearl put me on medication that made me dangerously tired (Lyrica) and eventually advised me to discontinue it. When I asked for something to replace the Lyrica, she suggested that I take Lyrica. That's not a typo - she told me to stop taking Lyrica and then suggested I try taking Lyrica. She switched my pain medication that was working to something that doesn't last as long nor control pain as well as the medication that I was taking when I started in her practice and then kept telling my doctor to reduce the amount of that medication each week. I called her office sobbing and left multiple messages. They never called me back. My doctor tried contacting her as well - no phone calls nor emails were returned. I am now at a 6/10 pain thanks to the ignorance and lack of care at this facility. Avoid them at all costs because they do not have time for you, don't care about your needs, and will make you feel worse than when you started. Shame on Dr. Pearl for calling herself a pain management specialist. You ignore your patients that you've put into worse off positions than when they sought help from you.

I'd give 0 stars if I could.|I was the second patient on the schedule no one came in the doctor was no we're to be found.
I as therapists would highly advise people not to see Dr. Perl
The staff just left me in the room for two hours with no explanation.
The CNA came in did some vibrations to my shoulder with no explanation after she was done I asked what this was for. She then explained after she maid my shoulder hurt 90% more then I walked in to the office.
I finally after not eating nor drinking anything for almost 24 hours being a diabetic and other medical conditions said enough and walked out 4 hours
Basically come to find out after speaking to the secretary I was scheduled for 12 o'clock with anesthesia and there was another person scheduled for 12 o'clock. How is one physician supposed to do to people? I'm not sure or even if it's legal.
I will be reporting to Dr.  and I will also the state and Attorney General's office.|Good morning my experience have been amazing. Your make me feels so comfortable. Is like we knows me for a long time thank you for that and I'm looking forward to continuous work with you guys. Yes we are the best specially Kate, so see you guys in July and I'm spreading my words around to other people's How much do you guys can do for them?|Dr Pearl and her team have been great. Good bedside manner and she explains the procedures to you before and as she does them.  Her aids are also very friendly and did their best to help me relax, which I really needed. I won't know if the treatment has been effective for a few weeks, but I've been pleased with the overall service and you can tell they care about their patients.|I was incapacitated after a fall. Dr. Pearl gave me my life back. Her and her staff are thoughtful and really work with you to create a treatment plan. I am forever grateful. I never thought I would  see a day where I didn't feel pain. They are incredible.

column40:
I had a bad experience with a doctor at Baystate Pain Management (BPM).  Out of courtesy, which I'm not sure is deserved, I won't call this doctor out by name.  My surgeon ordered a pain management procedure and when I went to BPM for a pre-procedure appt., the doctor at BPM did not agree it was the correct procedure.  This doctor asks me, "why does your doctor want this?".  I'm not a doctor, I can't explain the details of why a surgeon ordered a procedure, other than he thought it was the right thing for my pain, so right away I feel put on the defensive and stuck in the middle.  I explained my feelings and requested this BPM doctor consult with my surgeon who ordered the procedure.  At this point, the BPM doctor got defensive, condescending, and rude.  Some things this BPM doctor said:  "Who is this surgeon, I have never heard of him" (and why that is relevant, I don't understand), "I don't talk to doctors outside of Baystate" (really?), "What do you expect me to say to this doctor" (I stated my rationale that the two of them don't agree so they should consult each other - I'm not going to be in the middle).  Finally, this BPM doctor said, "If you can produce the surgeon on the phone right now, I'll talk to him".  It takes a month to see any doctor in this country, as if I had magical powers to get a surgeon on my phone at any time.  This request was simply ridiculous.  I said I have the surgeon's office number, I can leave it with you and you can contact him or schedule a time to speak.  My offer was not taken by this BPM doctor.  Throughout this, it's not only what the BPM doctor said, it was his tone and how he said it.  Condescending, rude, incredulous, and unprofessional.   I soon came to the conclusion that this BPM doctor had a very bad manner and I didn't want them involved in my care even if they consulted with the surgeon, so I left the appointment and I won't be going back to BPM.
I think it would benefit other patients if the Baystate Experience Team respond here and let everyone know the policies of Baystate.  (1)  Is it an unreasonable request for one of your patients to ask one of your doctors to consult with another doctor about said patient's pain management?  (2)  Is it a Baystate policy that your doctors are not allowed to consult with other doctors outside of Baystate?  Since your doctor stated he "doesn't do this", I'm left to believe it must be the case.  Thank you kindly in advance for your response.|If I could leave less I would. Long- chau- Van belongs in a lab somewhere not working with people. 0 help biggest waste of a copay.|THEY R WONDERFUL, STAFF IS AWSOME!  DR. MANACONTI IS THE BEST, IVE HAD SHOTS INTO MY SPINE SEVERAL TIMES FOR CHRONIC BACK PAIN AND HE NEVER HAS HURT ME.  I HAVE HAD SEVERAL PEOPLE WHO RECIEVED SHOTS IN SPINE ELSEWHERE AND SAID IT WAS AWFUL PAINFUL.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS OFFICE OVER ALL OTHERS, I AM A RETIRED NURSE SO I HAVE GREAT UNDERSTANDING OF QUALIFIED  PHYSICIANS, THEY MEET THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF MEDICAL  PAIN MANAGEMENT  CLINICS!|They are trash they cancel your appointment literally when you're in the office make you spend money on a ride to get there and cancel but can't reimburse you but want payment if you cancel like that|Dr Mani as well as the medical staff who always assist in my cervical spine steroid injections are very caring, they walj me through every step even when getting my procedure. The office always follows up to make sure I am well. One visit I was in tears due to other unrelated symptoms that seemed to point to either RA, PSA, or Lupus. I wasn't looking for a diagnosis, simply to have a Doctor who actually cared, to listen and at least tell me I wasn't going crazy. I had been failed by many er visits and specialists up to this point. Dr Mani took the time to listen to my history of symptoms (as it worked out one visit I was in a "flare") he re assured me that something was definitely going on. Based on a doctor simply giving his time to me, I reached out to Tufts and eventually made my journey to Tufts Rheumatology. I do have cervical spinal stenosis, and have since been diagnosed with Lupus(unrelated). Thank you so much Dr Mani. You are definitely one of the good ones!|My primary doc sent a referral in to the pain center for me.  It took me a month to get a first time intake phone appt. 10 seconds into the call the nurse tells me I'm not a good fit as they are not a prescribing pain clinic nor do they diagnose.  I have no idea what she was talking about. I am in severe pain, scoliosis, spondylosis, herniated discs and possible spondilytis, with severe back spasms. They refused to take me on as a patient for what reason?  2 minutes into the conversation, the phone makes a weird sound and I'm disconnected.  She never calls back..that's it...no doctor for me, no help, severe pain, and self help...no wonder why people self medicate.  I'm not there yet..Just home suffering in my retirement.  SHAME ON YOU!!!|My wife has been going here for almost 23 years. She has RSD and has pain and will the rest of her life. Dr. McKee and the staff have always treated her with respect, compassion and empathy. They have helped her have a life. I am so grateful to them for being there for her all these years. I honestly don't think she would have survived if not for them. Thank you to you all.|This place is bad news. When i had my intake call with a nurse, she had ZERO bedside manner or discernable empathy for me, the patient in pain on the other end of the phone. Told me i'd probably be dealing with my chronic pain for the rest of my life before she even booked me to see the doctor. The day of the actual appointment, the nurse was pleasant but had consent issues about asking before touching me and my clothing. I saw Dr Malick (apologies if i am misspelling his name), he went over my chart (mostly in silence) with a few questions to me, did a physical examination with more questions about my pain, then said that there wasn't anything they could offer me to help my pain. Suggested cbt or tai chi. The rest of the day i was in increased pain from the nature of the examination. Today i'm in so much pain that if anyone touches my back i will SCREAM but there wasn't anything he could do? wasn't even offered cortisone shots.

Thank you again!|I have had Dr El Khatib for almost 9 years. I would recommend him.|I highly recommend Dr. ElKhatib and the staff of SMG Pain Specialists for their genuine concern and care for their patients.  I have been a patient of Dr. ElKhatib for a period of time because he has always taken the time to listen and work with me through my pain issues.  He uses his knowledge to help remedy my issues. He has a genuine concern for helping his patients  and does whatever he can to help. He stuck with me so I have stuck with him.  His staff works with him as a team and  have always treated me with respect and have worked around my concerns rather than legalities and logistics. This is what medical care is supposed to be and why I highly recommend Dr. ElKhatib and the SMG Pain Specialist staff.|I saw Dr El-Khatib recently after having years of stomach pain issues and i loved how nice the staff at the front desk were and how pleasant, knowledgable, caring & helpful Dr.Khatib was. He listened to me and understood me, although we are both still trying to figure out some things to help me, we have a start and a plan and hope and that means the world to me. It is torture living with excruciating pain especially if you are not being helped so it is a relief to find a caring doctor and great nurses/staff. Thank you all so much !|Everyone in the office is very helpful and caring. I Never feel rushed with Dr.El-Katie.
He always explains everything/anything that needs to be explained. The office staff is Probably the most knowledgeable/friendly staff I've ever dealt with!

column3:
Triple-Board Certified Pain Management Specialist in Winchester

At the Pain Management Center of Winchester Hospital, Dr. Kyle Silva, DO brings exceptional expertise as a triple-board certified physician in Pain Management, Lifestyle Medicine, and Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation (PM&R). We take pride in our holistic approach to patient care, focusing on treating the "whole person" rather than just symptoms. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Conventional pain management interventions

  • Personalized lifestyle medicine recommendations

  • Ultrasound-guided procedures

  • Comprehensive pain evaluation and treatment planning

Dr. Silva completed his rigorous training at Montefiore Medical Center and previously served as Assistant Clinical Professor at Brown University's Warren Alpert Medical School before joining our team. We combine cutting-edge medical techniques with education about non-traditional pain management options to provide truly individualized care. Our modern facility at 620 Washington St, Winchester, MA is equipped with advanced technology to ensure optimal outcomes for all patients. For comprehensive pain management solutions, visit our Winchester Hospital Pain Management Center or call us at 781-756-7246 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Kyle Silva, DO is a triple-board certified physician in Pain Management, Lifestyle Medicine, and PM&R. He takes a holistic approach to patient care that focuses on treating the "whole person," to meet their individual needs. In addition to providing the full spectrum of conventional pain management options, he works to educate patients about the importance of lifestyle changes and non-traditional options for pain management.

Dr. Silva completed his training at Montefiore Medical Center. He later served as Assistant Clinical Professor at Brown University's Warren Alpert Medical School before transitioning to the Pain Management Center of Winchester Hospital.

column40:
My entire experience with Connecticut Orthopaedics was efficient and professional. The entire staff was so pleasant - from the receptionist to the nurses to the doctor! I really felt that they cared about ME. Plus, I did not have to wait long to be X-rayed or to see the doctor - and I was back in my car to go home in about a half hour. My painful back condition was quickly addressed, and explained to me in a "plain English" straightforward manner - and a plan to get me back "on my feet" was quickly prepared. Thanks to all!|Dr Silva is awesome!  He truly cares about helping his patients.  He is kind, a good listener and explains everything to you.  He and his staff are outstanding!
I felt comfortable and have full trust in him!!  Thank you Dr Silva and Staff!!!|The office staff was pleasant and professional. The nursing staff was knowledgeable and efficient. Dr. Silva was thorough and communicated clearly and with expertise. The reception area, the examination rooms and the bathroom were immaculate. The general impression of this practice is that everyone strives for excellence and the best patient experience. Dr. Silva's expertise was impressive and reassuring.|Dr. Silva and the entire team at CT Orthopedic are caring, knowledgeable and always prioritize my concerns for least invasive treatment options. Appointments are kept on time and never rushed; I am so grateful for the expert care and treatment.|Doctor Silva and the entire team that work with him at his office and in the SurgiCenter are the most caring and compassionate professionals that you could hope to have provide such valued medical care. Doctor Silva explained every step of the process to ensure that you fully understood what the next steps would be. I would highly recommend this practice to anyone who is looking to improve one's health. Thank you too all. The care and compassion of all involved.|Dr. Silva solved my iliopsoas tendon pain!  Results from cortisone shots can be iffy -- he comprehensively used the ultrasound, found the spot and nailed it!  No pain.  It was a thoroughly positive experience.|Dr. Silva was excellent. I arrived late as a walk-in (about 30 min before they closed) and I heard one of the nurses say "no more walk-ins today." I had already started the sign-in process so I was good-to-go.
When I met with Dr. Silva he was extremely polite and patient. I didn't feel rushed at all despite the clock. He took the time and we talked about a couple of different routes to go with my treatment and I really appreciated being given options.
I would highly recommend Dr. Silva. He was caring, professional, and very friendly.|Dr Silva is absolutely wonderful. I had reservations going in and were quickly resolved after meeting with him going over my test results and the outcome of my treatment.

column40:
Dr Niaki is so thorough and understanding. He is gentle, extremely knowledgeable and I would trust him with my life. I cannot say the same of many Doctors that I have came across during my life. Although he is pain management specialist he is tops in his field. He is not affiliated with Morton Hospital. That alone is a bonus. His Medical Receptionist Courtney is a

sweetheart.|I have been seeing Dr Niaki for many years. He takes care of my severe arthritis, fibromyalgia and migraines through the use of medication and injections.  He is the most intelligent doctor I know. I feel for the other person who said they had problems with the office staff as I also have had problems with them. They rarely answer the phone or return calls, but Dr Niaki is too nice to let them go.|I'd give this office 5 stars if it wasn't for the bad attitude and lack of follow through of the receptionist i believe is named Vanessa. Absolutely horrible. You sit waiting to check in while she plays on her phone talking about remodeling her bathroom. If you address her bad attitude she threatens you with discharge. Today i went to pick up script for relative and called at 3:54 stuck up the street in traffic and nobody answered. I arrived at 3:59 to find the door locked. At 4:01 i was greeted by her ignorance. Then was threatened discharge and had the door slammed in my face. Same person had me on hold 10 min only for me to hang up and have the other receptionist pick up and answer question in less than 30 seconds. The doctor himself has given nothing less than exceptional care to both my relatives. Him and the other receptionist, Ann i believe, are amazing! We need more people like them and not like the other one. She's enough to cause a great doc to lose clients.|transfered to this doctor after belonging to another pain clinic for 3 years. Went in for a consultation. Had to sign a contract even though I had still belonged to my previous clinic. This was July 6th. Now I was told he couldn't even make an appointment until I was released from former pain center. I still had 2 scripts to fill from old clinic and when I asked Sonia the office manager she said I had to fill them because Dr. Niaki couldn't write scripts until I was released from old clinic. I filled one on 7/18/15 and other on 7/28/15. I was formally released from old clinic on 7/30/15 and his office didn't get this release until 8/3/15. So I finally got an appointment for 8/10/15, went in was put on new medication and given an appointment for an injection. I asked Sonia what I should do with the extra meds I had, do I bring them in to be destroyed??? She was very rude snapped at me and said no we don't do that here. Whatever, I went and dropped off the new medication at my pharmacy to get a call the next day saying that they were waiting to hear from Dr. Niaki to confirm I was now being seen by him. I get a call from Sonia saing I was being discharged from Niaki's office, was being flagged at every pharmacy is Massachusetts and called my old pain clinic lying saying I took his script and was trying to fill it at multiple pharmacies!!!! Was not true what so ever. During our phone conversation she said and I quote " We deal with people like you all the time and we learn something new every time" I said stop there I have never failed one of my drug tests at any time at my old clinic which I had belonged to for 3 years and have never, ever had any issues with my medications. I went to talk to Dr. Niaki the next day per order of the medical board and apparently he wasn't aware of his office manager's actions. I explained and still was told I could not be treated. I was telling one of the nurses what this Sonia had done to me in waiting room and how I said I had contacted the medical board and they said I wasn't in the wrong. So Dr. Niaki called me back into room, said I'm writing you a prescription for medication until you find a new pain center. I was prescribed a totally different medication then what I was on and pretty much good luck. So I started this medication 2 days ago and having withdrawals because come to find out it doesn't start working for 3 days, having chest pains, anxiety attacks ETC!! So I called his office today 2 different times to report these symptoms and not 1 return phone call. I am supposed to be monitored closely when switching medications and I was left to fend for myself. So I am waiting a call back from the medical board to go ahead with the complaint because what was done was unethical! So to all please beware, take this as a warning because you will have the same experience!!!|I have Chronic pain RSD and a bad back.  Dr. Niaki has been helping me for over 10 years.  Very friendly, great sense of humor and makes you feel at ease.  If you think that something is weird he says doesn't hesitate to tell.  After having work done on my back, I kept on feeling that my leg was wet and everytime I'd look down it was dry.  I thought it was a stupid question but Dr Niaki knew what it was right away.|I have nothing but good things to say about Dr. Niaki, I have been in pain for 4 years and in the past 6 months he has helped me deal with my pain by means of injections, I am saddened today that he is gone and was told there is no return date for the Dr and I am to seek another pain clinic.

I hope all is well and wish him the best and I hope he will return|This is the worst experience I've ever had.  Today was my 2nd appt with dr. Niaki , last week was my 1st.  I was expecting to get a back injection and for him to take over my pain med as I told him  I wanted to transfer over to him because of transprtation problems.  When I was in the waiting room an elderly woman came out andcould not feel her whole left leg. They just told her to sit there and we in the waiting room had to suggest a wheelchair for her. The Dr. should not even have let her out into the waiting room, but he didn't even check on her after he found out what was going on!!  The poor woman was in tears and finally just left wheeled out by her husband.  When  I was finally called in after waiting 90 min. he acted like he didn't understand what I was talking about the meds - didn't even mention my injection.  told me to go back out to the waiting room and then had his very rude "offiCE manager" tell me to go pick upmy script fromthe other dr .  I  think he just wants to do his injections to make is money , by the looks of things he sees people every week or two.  Looks like he's more concerned about making money than his patients.
I got a really bad feeling from the whole office.  I would never let him touch me with a needle.  Patients beware!!!|Dr.Bijan is so amazing.  He cares about his patients and treats people as they should be treated. I'd reccomend him to anyone who is done with pain and finally wants someone who's on their side

I left numerous messages, had my Primary Care doctor contact MGH Facial Pain Clinic and I never received a call/text/email in return. I suffer from Trigeminal Neuralgia, also know as the Suicide Disease. Fortunately, I found Dr Omar Arnaout at Brigham and Women's Hospital. He is a brillant and caring neurosurgeon who performed my surgery in December 2023. I have no pain only gratitude. If you are frustrated by MGH please try Dr Arnaout.|Absolutely useless. Don't bother going here because they won't listen to you lol. I don't even have a complicated injury but for some reason they think it will heal itself because I am in my 20s? Ok. Wasted 6 months of my life jumping through their numerous hoops with no results despite saying their "treatment" isn't working.  Treatment being a loose term. Go elsewhere - don't waste your time.|They put themselves above patients and refuse to treat certain issues due to legal problems, even going to the extent of repeatedly lying and making stuff up. This is not a hospital for the people, it is a hospital for Harvard. If you have any legal woes these people will never consider helping you, and will leave you in a worse state than you came in. Quoting this from another review here, and it is very true: "They have the power over suffering patients and seem to become angry when they're unable to help, as if it's our fault."

Beware.|I was referred Dec10 2021 for pain and as of today Jan1,2022 after many calls I am still being told I can not even make an appointment as I have to be "approved " and there are no appointments for months. Seems to me if your Doctor Refers you for pain that means you are in need of help now. I have to say this undermines my confidence in this dept ability to treat people in pain or have any compassion. I will not even attempt to secure an appointment there any longer and find an alternative solution for my intense pain. So incredibly disappointed as MGH has a really good rating as a hospital and this treatment has been inhumane.|The last time I was there I saw Dr. Ping Jin! All of the doctors there have always been wonderful however I feel like Dr. Jin was one of the nicest and most through doctors that I have ever been seen by! He gave me hope and suggested alternative therapies that I have been asking for years and always denied! I'm already to most pain medications and have a very rare painful tumor disorder. I can't wait to see him again! He is definitely helping me improve my quality of life!|I was in so much pain that I couldn't stand or sit, much less walk - but apparently the physicians didn't believe me. So I was sent on my way, clinging to side rails in the hallway, and wound up passing out from pain in a restroom. Was there for hours, waking to a "code" and thinking "thank god, it's finally over".

Those docs don't meet my eyes when I see them now. Didn't file a complaint because I was afraid of revenge. They have the power over suffering patients and seem to become angry when they're unable to help, as if it's our fault.|Are you aware patients have the right to choose their provider if they're dissatisfied.
Are you telling patients they cannot switch doctors.
Are you aware of patients rights and Violations.
Are you aware patients must be informed if residence is involved in their care.|Revised my review based on actual treatment experience.  Getting in to be seen WAS a disaster and took way too long for a person in acute pain but once I got the appointment the care was phenomenal.

column40:
There is no parking available. Arrived at front desk 5 minutes prior to appointment time, as I'm standing there the physician walks up and says"is my 10oclock here?" So I speak and say "is her name Marylou because that's me and I could only just get a parking space in your lot." she says "oh" and walks away, then I find out that I have to be rescheduled after standing there for another 5 minutes and coming all this way and wasting gas. Heartless and unethical behavior. I tried calling twice to say that I was circling the parking lot for about 15 minutes and could not even get through to speak to anyone. Don't waste your time here because they don't care about you or your time.|Went to pain management as I didn't want to take opiates anymore after being hit by multiple negligent drivers and I seen Dr Henkle. I have life long Injuries and had many surgeries including a fusion L5-S1. I was labeled a drug seeker even though I myself cut myself down on my pain meds to 1/8th and then they took me off my testosterone even though I'm diagnosed with very low testosterone due to very high stress of pain for many years. I was told to just try taking a swim. I was also seeing an doc for OMT therapy so he told me to just stick with her. I have a mostly paralyzed arm, so in short I guess he was suggesting to drown myself cuz I hand major PTSD and depression.|I go here for SLE, Fibromyalgia, a spinal problem, and chronic migraines.  Dr. Henkle is such a great Dr. He's super intelligent too (as are his NPs). Every person I encountered here has gone out of their way to be helpful to me.  The staff is kind & exceptional. This pain center has helped me have a life back and I highly recommend them.|ZERO Stars! Every appointment I pay my co-payment -- and then receive another hundreds of dollars bill -- total scam! I'm addressing this with the Insurance,  and then a Lawyer!|Carol in the answering for appointment scheduling. This lady is so helpful and kind! I just wish there were more people so understanding as she. Thank you so much for going above and beyond to help me|Late last December, I thought I tore a muscle in my left leg.  After four visits to the ER (where they are loathe to give out painkillers) and a series of x-rays, the cause was determined to be spinal in nature.  Some days, I had to use a cane to walk (I am 77).  I finally got an appointment to the Pain Center on March 8th.  I arrived at 7:30 for my 8 am appointment, did my paperwork, and
paid my co-pay.  I then waited until 9 am for a rather arrogant Dr. Benjamin Henkle to arrive, who gave me all of 10 minutes of his time (another patient was waiting).  He felt the pain was caused by a pinched nerve, but refused to start a treatment plan without the results of an MR (which is still pending).  My next appointment was to be by phone.  I left still in pain and $40 poorer.  Two weeks later, I am still angry about this.  I will not return to the Center; instead, I have just started alternative treatment by acupuncture.  (More on this later.)|Everyone here is so welcoming and an extreme comfort to me when I'm there.  Every time I'm there they have made me feel safe and comforted me when I was feeling anxious during a procedure.  They have been there for me any time I've needed them.  I'm greatly appreciative of this team.|Please do not take your elderly parents to this clinic. If I could give zero stars I would. First of all the man at the front desk couldn't tell us where to go properly when I called for the name and address, he kept referring to a landmark that I didn't know and sounded like he was half asleep. They are not sensitive to patients that don't have access to computers to do things electronically. Had a paper form to fill out and they kept my 96 year old mother waiting while we got all kinds of insurance information and an adjusters name and phone # before they would see her. She has health insurance that they can bill if for some reason there is an issue. Then when we were all done Dr. Adler said she couldn't see her because she was going to lunch. My mother has been in pain for months and finally got this appt after waiting 2 weeks and they refused to see her. I understand that they need insurance info but my daughter was there with her and they refused to see her while my daughter filled out the paperwork. They never indicated that they wouldn't be able to see her until everything was completed during the half hour process of completing the paperwork.  We could've rescheduled and brought the paperwork in fully completed at the next appt.  I work for a doctors office and we would never refuse to see a pt based on the fact that paperwork was not completed, especially someone who is 96 years old and in pain.  We will definitely be seeking care elsewhere and escalating this treatment up the chain of command. I guess they have so many patients that they don't need new ones.

column38: Roger Szkutak|Chris Lewis|NP|Derek Duquette|Lisa M Carroll|Hollywood|Doreen Bove|Dee Minzy
column40:
I've been seeing Dr. Kumar for about 7-8 months. He did an excellent job relieving my knee pain and is currently treating me for back pain. He has a great "bedside manor". I usually do not like doctors but Dr. Kumar is different. I really appreciate his expertise.|I've been going to doctor Kumar for  years he has relieved my pain for years. That's why I'm on this right now because I'm seeking his help again. After 2 years of relieving my back pain. He's excellent at what he does. Hopefully he can relieve it for another 2 or 3 years. Wouldn't seek anyone else|Despite the secretary and the doctor both being friendly, this place is a joke. On my initial visit, I wasn't put in a room till 1 1/2 hrs after my scheduled appointment time, then it took another 1/2 gr before the doctor finally came into the room. I was scheduled for a procedure a few weeks later. They called me the day before to let me know my insurance needed a release form that they never had me sign. I went above and beyond and got them my medical history from my previous doctor and hand delivered it, because they said I could possibly still get it approved in time. The next day, I was told a different story, that the insurance company had denied the procedure because they didn't have the proper paperwork and they (the doctor's office) didn't have time to get it done because they have other patients that need paperwork done, too. I then spoke to my insurance company, hoping to get the approval pushed through quickly on my own. They informed me that the actual reason for the denial was that the secretary had submitted the paperwork with the wrong date, and there was no way they could do anything about it because of that. So not only did they totally drop the ball, but they lied to me, letting me think I could possibly fix the situation, causing me to waste a lot of time, and the gas to drive back and forth to their office with paperwork they didn't even need. Total B.S.|I am not sure why there are any negative reviews. Dr Kumar and his staff are excellent. They are always sweet and professional.
I lived in extreme pain until I met Dr. Kumar. I highly recommend him and his staff.|Have been treated by Dr. Kumar  for several years, and would never seek pain management care anywhere else. He and his staff are compassionate, patient, knowledgeable and professional. The assessment process is thorough, and continuity of care a welcome relief when you have a chronic condition.|Absolutely the most unprofessional doctors office and staff that I have ever seen hands down.

Every time I'm there I have waited 2 hours before being seen, they are low staffed at the front desk, always rude and end up throwing patients under the bus. Incredibly rude nurses and every excuse under the sun has been made to make you feel like it's your fault your there.

I have been almost fired from my job with how many times I have had to reschedule on their behalf because they somehow don't know how to function as a team and as a professional doctors office.|Truly, Dr Kumar is the best ! He has helped me so much with my back. I have been going to him since 2015. He is very caring and he never lets you wait in pain for months. I have always been able to get an appointment right away.|Love Dr Kumar! But his support staff is mediocre at best. Called at 8:10 in the AM and again at 2PM, spoke with Cathryn, a nurse and she never addressed my concerns with the doctor and left me without response or help for the entire weekend .

column40:
They don't really manage my pain . All they want to do is spine shots and I still can't walk well. The shots don't help well at all for me. They did at 2st but now not good|Highly recommend Dr Kumar. You're not just a patient they make you feel more like family. After years of dealing with chronic pain I finally found a Dr that cares. From the staff to the PA's really feel the need to update my comment. Just read a comment from a patient that said they would not recommend advanced pain management. Nothing could be further from the truth she stated that the operating room was filthy riches so false. And that Dr Kumar cares nothing more than money. Sometimes you hear this from people that just come they're trying to get medication and that's not what Dr Kumar does. If he feels that injections will help that is his first. He cares very much about his patients.|I have been a patient at Advanced Pain management for 15 years. I've recommended it to several people. Everyone there is the best. Doctors are great in the procedures. Alway make you feel comfortable and at ease. Would highly recommend them.|The Nurse Practitioner I saw today was wonderful and the staff is always great!  Everyone's job is really hard right now with everything that is going on with the outcome of Covid.  I hope the staff, doctors and Nurse Practitioners are treated with compassion during this time as they deal with our pain.|Had a very pleasant and educational visit with Dr Kumar. Problem is the next appointment was with an associate when I really wanted to talk more with Dr Kumar. Shannon, front desk, very friendly and very helpful.|My daughter Nadia had been suffering from severe migraines for weeks. Her Neurologist
Could not help any more and the pain clinic she was refferre to at Least they was 4 weeks
Away. So I did some online research and found Dr Kumar's website. I called that morning and the receptionist said come right in .Dr Kumar is such a kind and understanding Doctor. He gave her some relief. She is going back on Monday.
If you suffer from any pain don't hesitate y give his office a call . To me and Nadia he is one of God's earth Angel's|I am a patient of Dr. Anil Kumar.  I have a lot of respect for him.  He sits down with you and is very patient and professional and personable.  The staff is so awesome I always enjoy seeing them.  I would recommend anyone to go here as he does help with my pain and I appreciate Dr. Kumar and his associates.  Millie Bowman|October 11th was my first and last visit at the Advanced Pain Management clinic in Stoneham. I saw Dr. Kumar and he was extremely insensitive and rude during our visit. A lot happened during our visit but I'd like to go over what bothered me the most. I have Rheumatoid arthritis and Fibromyalgia along with mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, OCD and have struggled with eating disorders (anorexia & bulimia) for 10 years now. He was asking about my mental illnesses and when I had mentioned that I have OCD, he asked me why I thought that I have OCD so I replied that I was diagnosed with it and he was asking me who diagnosed it and asked for examples so I gave them. One of those examples was that I have obsessive thoughts about my appearance and self.
He told me that I should cut back on one of my medications (Gabapentin) that's really helping me because my weight is on the "heavy side" and the medication is "making me FAT". He put a lot of emphasis on that one word. There are ways to tell someone that you would like them to lose weight in a nice way and when someone has an eating disorder, it's a more delicate situation. That information is in my records and he can see it. I told him that most days are quite difficult for me and I asked him if there are any pain medications besides narcotics that could help me. Also, let me add that Gabapentin does not cause weight gain!
He wanted to prescribe me Tramadol and another medication, Provigil that I hadn't heard of. The Provigil medication was for daytime sleepiness and I told him that I don't have that but apparently because I'm a smoker, I do (That's what he told me). I told him I didn't think I needed that nor did I want a prescription for it. I hate medication which I expressed to him and no one should take unnecessary medications. I mentioned that I had gotten several cortisone shots in the past year or so for my hip and he wanted me to make an appointment to get a cortisone shot and I told him that it wasn't bothering me right now so I didn't see the need for it and he told me I should do it anyway.
He wanted me to quit smoking asap and asked what my plan is to quit. I told him that I would need to gradually cut back before quitting and he told me that wouldn't matter and it would do nothing for me. He wanted me to quit then and there basically and told me that I'm doing nothing about it after I told him that I already have been cutting back.
After he tried to phone one of his staff members so they could write my prescription and couldn't get them after 3 times, he told me to wait and then went to the receptionist area and started verbally abusing his staff members. He was asking why no one answered the phone and exaggerated that he called 10 times, asked where one of his staff were and when no one knew, said "You all are the worst team ever" among other things. If he were my boss, I would have walked out. I wanted to walk out of that room and I should have. I have PTSD from childhood trauma and was already upset as it was but I was trying to keep it together as he was saying horrible things to his staff. He came back in, and then told me that I "need to smile more". I looked at him and said that I have depression. Then I told him about my eating disorders and how what he said about my weight hurt me because I struggle every day with trying not to starve myself, to exercise more, etc and it's hard when you're both in chronic pain and have depression. To that, he replied that I can "sit, cry about it and feel sorry for myself" or I can "go exercise and lose weight". After I just explained how the pain makes it difficult.
More happened but I feel that these are the most important highlights. NO ONE deserves this kind of treatment from a Doctor. I called back later and cancelled the 2 week appointment for a cortisone shot that I was pressured into making and said I won't be filling the prescription that was given to me and that I won't be returning, either.

column11:
Dr. Kaya Shah is a board-certified and fellowship-trained pain management specialist at Sports Medicine North in Peabody, MA.

Dr. Kaya Shah offers interventional pain management care for chronic and acute bone, joint, muscle, and nerve pain. She specializes in the use of the latest interventional and nonsurgical treatments for orthopedic and neurological injuries and conditions. Through her fellowship training, she learned the latest, proven methods in managing pain with medications and state-of-the-art interventional procedures, such as joint injections, neck and spine injections, ultrasound-guided nerve blocks, trigger point injections, and nerve electrical conduction procedures for pain.
column38: Laurie Catalano|Ryan Pezzulo|L D|Elizabeth Grace|Ginny Colarusso|James Purdy|D G|penny cabot
column40: Dr Shah is was very friendly right from the start. She made me feel like there was relief in site for my lower back pain by explaining all my options. She's very intelligent and skilled. Thank you Dr Shah|Dr. Shah is a dedicated and competent professional. she is committed to understanding and addressing her patients needs and meeting them where they are as she knows we know our bodies best. She is both smart and engaged and that can make a significant difference of care one receives.|Assessed me for less than 2 minutes, recommended an injection for my neck pain, and was making moves to schedule it. However, she'd not adequately explained about the injection. I had to ask what level she wanted to inject. She told me 2 different levels,  and one of them was where I had a fusion already, so it was a very unlikely source of pain. I questioned it. The whole reason I was referred to her was for a diagnostic injection, to confirm the level causing the pain before moving to surgery.  Her answer was "standard protocol."   You're picking a fused level based on "protocol"?  I asked her to help me understand that. Instead she took injection off the table and suggest pills instead.  (Gabentin, a heavy-duty nerve pain pill, or flexoril, a strong muscle relaxer - neither of which were indicated based on my intensity of symptoms. I declined.)  Finally, she suggested physical therapy, which I'd already done. This was a big waste of time and money. Zero confidence in this doctor, with her cookie-cutter approach and inability to support her own recommendation with a clinical rationale.|Dr. Shah is delightful and happy to be able to help with her knowledge. She's bettering herself by learning about the process of implants tens devices. She's positive and kind.|Dr. Shah was so pleasant to deal with. She will be available when I need help with pain management. She also informed me of things I can do in the future to care for myself.|Very good  care; very good communication with Dr Shah and developing an initial tx plan; efficient support services|Dr shah is a wonderful doctor! Always leave feeling I needed more time with her. I understand she's very busy and only has a certain amount of time for each patient.|Kaya Shaw is my cornerstone for spine care . She listens , she explains treatment in a comprehensive manner, and most of all she brings relief with treatment . I couldn't imagine myself under any other provider .

column40:
HORRIFIC!!! I've been in Pain management since the early 20s.  I've gotten 6 injections a year for 18 to 20 years. I've gotten injections in my neck here and there also.  This so called Doctor assumed I was a druggie.. He put me through he'll, not everyone is a druggie.  If he even checked or asked about my mri s and my other doctors for my neck and back...shoulder or hips. No he said so did you have another pain doctor before the last one. I said yes, I started with a doctor, he left( went to Boston) and I was sent to my last one. I'm assuming he took over for Dr. G.  DR vaisman says yeah I thought so.  He didn't hear me at all,he heard that I had 2 doctors.  Well that's what happens in 24 years of going to them.  Hes assuming that i change pain doctors. Dr Vaisman told me to loose weight, quit smoking and do PT with no meds.  I take 4 hours to get ready in the am for doctor appointments.  I drag my butt out of bed. Barely can walk in the am.... I fight EVERY SINGLE DAY WITH PAIN!!!!! YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHAT ITS LIKE TO MOVE AND GET OUT BED DAILY FOR SOMEONE WITH MULTIPLE PAIN ISSUES!!! DONT JUDGE SO QUICKLY. MAYBE CHECK THE PATIENTS INFO FIRST BEFORE YOU ASSUME!!! I only went there because my doctor fully retired from his business! Finding new doctor shouldn't feel like your on trial.|I experienced Dr. Vaisman to be a very kind, caring and conscientious physician. He diligently worked to help relieve me of the back pain I have suffered with for decades. A few weeks ago I was about to order a cane to help me walk as I was limping so badly. My only regret is that I wasn't aware of this incredible, wonderful physician and his outstanding staff years ago. I highly recommend Dr. Julian Vaisman as he will do all he can to help you.|Dr. Vaisman and his friendly staff did a fabulous job on my back and I can't thank them enough.

I arrived at the Pain Management Center at the Beth Israel Lahey Health Patient Care Center Danvers, Ma feeling very nervous knowing I was having a procedure done to help ease the awful pain I've had for years. I have to say, I was put at ease the moment I walked through that door. The Staff there are amazing. They are friendly, kind, informative, caring, professional, and down to earth. There were no surprises. All my questions were answered to my satisfaction. Then in comes Dr. Ken Branton, he also is amazing. His professionalism, knowledge, caring, is all encompassing. I loved hearing the question "How are you doing?" from Dr. Branton during the whole procedure. A person's comfort was tantamount there by all the staff. I highly recommend to all that need help to control their pain to make contact with Dr. Ken Branton and his staff at the Pain Management Center at the Beth Israel Lahey Patient Care Center in Danvers, Ma.|I have been coming to the Pain Management Center in Danvers for 8 years now to help manage pain from a herniated disc and I only have wonderful things to say about my experience there. Dr. Kenneth Branton is extremely knowledgeable and skilled in the area of pain management and I always feel confident in his expertise, which is not something to take for granted when a doctor is giving you epidural steroid injections in your spine. My favorite thing about Dr. Branton is his kind, caring, and relaxed bedside manner. Conversations and decisions about my care are a mutual discussion between doctor and patient and I always leave feeling confident in the care that I am receiving and cared for from a "patient first" perspective.  The ladies at the front desk and the nurses who work there are all truly wonderful as well. If you're looking for a pain management center to put your trust in for the best possible care you can receive, the Pain Management Center in Danvers should be at the top of your list.|I injured my shoulder and for several years received cortizone shots and PT. Because of the severe damage, surgeons could not  operate to repair the damage. My Md.PCP recommended Dr. Branton. After one treatment, in a few days, I was able to move my arm with little pain. The second treatment gave me back all my arm motion with little or no pain. Thank you Dr.Brandon for giving me back my health.|TERRIFIC doctor!! Dr. Branton is precise, cautious, caring, and believes in his surgical gifts for his patients. He has a likeable manner, welcomes questions, and offers understandable explanations.
The staff is also wonderful!|they have always been punctual with appt times,very pleasant to deal with and accurate in every way. Highly recommend.|Wife was there three times for their BS steroid shots which did nothing except fill their greedy pockets|Big business, pain scale meaningless|

Dr Roberto Feliz came highly recommended.|My surgeon referred me to Boston pain clinic .
The Dr's and staff are awesome. Very professional and friendly never had an issue  .Best move I did I can't thank them enough for all their help.|My first appointment was with Dr Roberto Falise, I arrived 45 mins  earlier. The Dr had another patient with an emergency.  It was understandable for the Dr to be running behind schedule for other office visits... While waiting in the large waiting area the television was on current news event's, etc.  The medical assistant called me; off to the exame room I went.  Dr Roberto Falise was cheerful,  friendly and made me feel comfortable. He even made me smile...  The treatment options were fully explained using terminology that I could comprehend and to my satisfaction. Each visit is pleasant mainly due to his personality... I'm very happy to be a patient at Hydepark Pain Mgt. I would definitely recommend anyone with severe pain to visit.|Excellent care everyone is polite caring and professional. I have never had to wait more than 10 mins. Dr Eddy Feliz is incredible, he listens and works with you explaining everything along the way. 5 years of struggling and in 10 months I feel I have a level of life back.|This guys a clown. Every appointment I had with this doctor I waited over an hour to see. This is ridiculous. The receptionist  told me they take patients in all the time. Patients without appointments call in claiming they have  pain to increase thier sales for the day meanwhile making patients with appointments wait. My primary care doctor closed his practise. He prescribed meds that were working great for my pain. Doctor Feliz talked me into getting back injections for my back Back pain. They lasted about a week of relief. I told him I wanted my old scripyts I had been down this road before. I ended up going to another pain clinic . They gave me the scripts my PM doctor had been giving me and I feel great. I thought doctors were supposed tolisten to patients and find out what thier need are. This doctor obviously had his own agenda of pushing injections. I know for a fact these pain doctors make a fortune on these injection methods. Dr Feliz kept pushing the injections. Finally I said enough. I went to a differant pain clinic and they gave me the meds my Primary care doctor was giving me and I feel 100 percennt better and 98% myself.  Everyones afraid of prescribing pain meds. Its hurting the patients that really need the pain meds.Pain Doctors are making a fortune on the pain injections.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1and correct  manner.thierb problems|Seriously, the Boston Pain Clinic in Hyde park, Massachusetts is an amazing place! The staff has always been truly genuine, professional, caring, and attentive to me.
I had an accident that resulted in my developing RSD/CRPS. I have experienced unbearable pain and symptoms from the RSD/CRPS!  With RSD/CRPS my life was turned upside down  in every way imaginable and then some! I wasn't sure how much more I could endure, and then I found the Boston Pain Clinic.  I truly do not know where I would be without the  doctors and staff at the Boston Pain Clinic.
From the front desk to the office assistants, nursing staff, and doctors, the level of care has been topnotch. At every step of the way, they all show that they truly care about you as the patient.
Dr. Roberto Feliz and Dr. Eddy Feliz, the doctors at Boston Pain  understands the totality of the physical, mental, and life impact that RSD/CRPS takes on a patient, their entire family and life every day! They understand the pitfalls and headaches of dealing with insurance companies, gaining approvals, and fighting against denials. Dr. Roberto Feliz and Dr. Eddy Feliz not only will they take the time to answer all your questions, but they will actively fight and work  for you and your well-being.
I have begun ketamine infusions to help treat my RSD/CRPS. Know I was so scared and apprehensive about starting Ketamine infusions for treatment of my RSD/CPS, but I knew I simply couldn't go on living the way I was with the constant symptoms a pain  on a daily basis. The ketamine infusions  have been the best treatment and relief I have been able to achieve in the many  years I have suffered with RSD/CRPS. I ABSOLUTELY would not trust ANYONE else to do these ketamine  infusions. The doctors and nurses  are with you every step of the away.  I know that my safety is their #1 priority.
Both Dr. Roberto Feliz and Dr. Eddy Feliz,  are truly superior physicians. They focus on providing individual care and treatment plans tailored specifically for whatever issues you are having.
I do not think you are  going to find a more comfortable, comforting, or a competent group of individuals  and doctors than the ones at Boston Pain Clinic.|I have been referred here by my primary for a specialist to manage my medications.
