column2: Tufts Medical Center Pain Management Center
column3:
Specialized Care for Chronic Pain Conditions

At the Tufts Medical Center Pain Management Center, we provide personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our expert team specializes in managing pain associated with cancer, Myofascial pain syndrome, Complex regional pain syndrome (RSD), Post-thoracotomy and post-mastectomy pain syndromes, Diabetic neuropathy, and Post-herpetic neuralgia. We offer a comprehensive range of advanced interventional procedures including:

  • Therapeutic injections for targeted pain relief

  • Ultrasound-guided nerve blocks for precise treatment

  • Radiofrequency lesioning for longer-lasting pain management

Our goal is to make chronic pain more manageable while helping patients avoid surgery whenever possible. Located in Boston's South Building, our center combines compassionate care with cutting-edge techniques to improve quality of life. Learn more about our comprehensive services at Tufts Medical Center Pain Management Program.
column11: The Pain Management department offers personalized care for those suffering from chronic pain as a result of cancer, Myofascial pain syndrome, Complex regional pain syndrome (RSD), Post-thoracotomy and post-mastectomy pain syndromes, Diabetic neuropathy, and Post-herpetic neuralgia. Various injections, Ultrasound-guided nerve blocks and Radiofrequency lesioning are available to make pain more manageable and in most cases, avoid surgery.

column38: Kellie (Kelliescha)|sue madden|S P|Michelle Cook|Todd Singer|Bran Tuna|Paul Lynch|Dana Berger
column40:
I've been going to Southbridge Interventional Pain Clinic since April 2012 after my previous Pain Management Doctor stopped returning my phone calls & his office staff refused to make a follow-up appointment for me! I was in excruciating pain & could barely move. My previous doctor had me so strung out on Oxycontin (120 mg/day) & Oxycodone (80 mg/day) that I barely answered to or recognized my own name. I ended up in the Emergency Department on a Thursday after not realizing I took WAY TOO MUCH Ambien over a weekend because I was way too strung out on the 2 types of Oxy!!! I immediately DITCHED my old Pain Management Doctor & was referred to Dr. Farid. It was the ABSOLUTE BEST decision I could've made!

I have an EXTREMELY COMPLICATED medical case that causes me to have EXCRUCIATING pain throughout my entire body. When I first saw Dr. Farid, I spent my days in the dark, curled up in the fetal position on the couch, balling my eyes out!!! That was my routine for the first 2 years of getting really sick! I walked into Southbridge Interventional Pain Clinic with controlled optimism for my first visit. Dr. Farid spent lots of time with me that day trying to understand my disease processes in order to determine the best course of treatment going forward. We started out with two specific types of medication, hoping they would help alleviate the majority of my pain. The meds helped, but not nearly enough! The next month at my appointment, we re-evaluated my case & moved on to two new medications. JACKPOT!!! The new meds worked & got my pain down from way off the chart (the smiley face chart used to determine how bad your pain is) to a bearable 91/2 on the chart. After a few months of being on the new medications, we began discussing the next steps. Dr. Farid felt that Radio Frequency Ablation would be of benefit to me. I decided to follow his advice & have the RFA done. Once we determined that injections would alleviate some of my pain, we scheduled my first RFA for the following month. He was right!!! The RFA procedure helped alleviate more of the pain in my back! We scheduled the next 3 quadrants of my back over my next 3 monthly follow-up appointments. I'm still seeing Dr. Farid & having RFA's done on my back as needed in combination with receiving pain meds. The combination of treatments helps keep my pain levels bearable (somewhere down between 81/2-91/2) each & every month.

Dr. Farid, his Medical Assistants, the past Physician's Assistant & everyone in the front office are very kind, compassionate & empathetic!!! They all care very much & go out of their way to help, whether it's fitting you in because something has changed for you & you really need to be seen, getting an answer to a question you may have, helping to reschedule your appointment if the one you have no longer works for you or because you're ill & can't make it into the office when you're scheduled to, or anything else you run into. Dr. Farid is extremely kind, empathetic, caring, compassionate & an expert in his field!!! I got very lucky back in April 2012 when I was referred to him & found an amazing doctor who was determined to find relief for me, but who was also interested in me as a person, what was going on in my personal life, not just my disease processes! Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, Dr. Farid & the entire staff of Southbridge Interventional Pain Clinic, you've all played a huge role in giving me back part of my life!!!!!|the shot i get for my leg pain from breaking my tibia bone an a aritey all at once 2 years ago. really helps me alot an they are always so nice an kind there everytime i go an i was nervous about getting the shot but it really really helps me id recommend comming here:)|Most of these reviews over 1 star are definitely staff members. This is one of the worst places to go if you are looking for help. Yes, pain medicine isn't ideal for most cases but plenty of patients actually need it so they can live their daily lives. My FIL had tried all the things this doctor asked him to try, he said he would try medication if shots didn't work. The cortisone helps for a day and the electric shots put my FIL at risk as he is very prone to seizures and heart attacks. This place lied to my very sick father and so I felt it necessary to write a review. Not every patient is looking to get high off medicine but this doctor judges you harshly. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!|The place is busy. But many people are in pain, especially via aging, injury, or whatnot.  The Doctor and his staff are very caring. It is good to have this localized treatment of painful areas than taking pain meds which lose their effectiveness or become addicting.|I have been a patient of Dr. Farid for eight years now. He has helped stop the intense pain i have had in my neck and back sine a car accident I was involved in on 12/2/1988. He is very professional and caring. I have gone in hardly able to stand and after an injection administered by him walk out feeling pain free. I must say that after getting to know Dr. Farid He is not one of those doctors that just want to prescribe narcotics. so if you're truly needing pain relief He is the doctor for you, but if you're looking for a drug dealer then look somewhere else.|Those who know of me know that my chronic pain conditions are excruciating to the highest degree, and if I can help just one person by writing this, here goes: Don't waste your time here.

If you have a severe and complicated issue that involves most or all of your body, then this place cannot help you. They will sit you down after a long wait, tell you that they don't prescribe medications, schedule you for shots months out at a time, which don't work and are known to cause quite a lot of harm and do very little good, if any at all, and then prescribe you medicine (contradiction?), and then scoot you out the door as quickly as possible. If you're coming here for pain relief, then I'm sorry to say that only those with uncomplicated and localized issues will have a chance at finding relief here. And at that, don't expect relief within the first 3-6 months of making an appointment - between the shots and different meds, it could take literally years to get the right spot and combo to actually get any relief. The lucky ones find relief within the first few visits.

And no, they do not disclose any of this when you first come in.

If you're like me, and you experience very high pain levels on a daily basis, then god bless you, never give up. Keep fighting, and keep looking. Relief is out there, you just have to find it. The right doctor, the right treatment, the right medicine combo, etc. You'll find it.|True story as other reviews have stated in the past. This place is not ideal at all, as they only offer cortisone shots, you show up and there is more paperwork than the dmv to fill out and then you wait well over an hour, again to find out they only do the shot. But your back is feeling better and so you think... I'll think about this.

Fast forward and I'm now in severe pain again. I call 3 times. Hung up on each time. What sort of place is this? Not a professional one. So they get a one star.|My first appointment, Dr. Farid was an hour and a half late to see me. He spent 5 minutes with me and recommended a procedure involving some novicane shots as a test for nerve ablation. I left for 4 weeks with no help.

Today, I called an hour before my appointment to see if I should come on time or late considering the waiting room was very uncomfortable for someone with a broken back. The nice lady assured me that if I came on time I'd be seen right away.

When I showed up, there were two people in the waiting room, and I checked in. Then I sat in the waiting room for 30 minutes before I got up and reminded the secretary of our phone conversation. She brought me right in, sitting me in a room with the same chairs as the waiting room where I waited another 30 minutes before a nurse practitioner came in.

The NP wanted me to consent to 8 steroid injections, one at a time, under x-ray for a temporary relief test, FAR from the novicane shot the doctor talked about, and she admitted I may get more pain for a few days if it went poorly.

I refused treatment and the NP told me that an hour plus, wait is normal for this practice. Apparently injections for temporary relief pay the doctor very well.

column40:
Dr park's  minimized my extremepain  as my hip wound was ripping  me open  from  the  inside  out twice  he told  me absolutely nothing never  did a exray now I'm back  to square  1 neglected  treated like  a pill popping junkie|This office has zero respect for their patients. Second visit I waited for over an hour to go over my MRI results. When I got in to see the Nurse Practitioner Maria Aguiar she was curt and rude to the point where I walked out. I filed a complaint with South Coast. Dr. Phillips called me to apologize. I came back in and waited another 45 minutes in the waiting room. When I went to the window the admin assistant tried to tell me I had the wrong time. (Which I didn't) and even if I did they were still 15 minutes late on that time. I was scheduled an appointment for early August to which the called and told me they had to reschedule well into September. When I told the assistant that enough was enough and I was all set and would be going to a different doctor she was condescending and rude. If I could give this office zero stars I would!!|I had an appointment on February 20th, 2023 to finally have an evaluation done for ADHD. The appointment went well, the people at the front desk were kind and welcoming, and the evaluation itself was done in a very professional, educational manner so I could understand everything that was being done and why it was being done. At the end of the evaluation, Dr. Dorn said I would have a letter sent to my PCP as well as to my home including notes about the evaluation and his diagnosis. He said I would have this letter in "five to seven days".

Now, normally I would think that I was the one in the wrong. Maybe he said 57 days and not 5-7 because it's now May 9th, 2023 and still no letter. But, after the evaluation, he said my PCP should "receive the letter by this time next week." So realistically she should have had it by February 27th in that case.

I've called multiple times over the last few weeks only to be told the notes aren't finished yet. The only explanation I've been given is that Dr. Dorn is "old school." I didn't know old school meant he still carved words into stone because that's the only way I can see these notes not being done.

Not only that, but now they act like I'm bothering them whenever I call. I just need these notes I've been waiting 2.5 months for so I can move on with my life and get my ADHD under control so my everyday life isn't a complete struggle anymore.|I have been seeing Tracy Np for a few years now for my back an neck which I have been in pain an uncomfortable for years with she is absolutely amazing she listens an talks to you about any an all concerns! I have never had to wait long which is very important to me because I have an extra busy life single mom of three work 50 hrs a week! She returns calls timely she is just over a pleasure to have had a doctor! I would recommend her to anyone. She will always continue to try until you are doing well that's so rare in doctors these days|Nina Szulewski was my doctor at a different facility. I would love if I could have her again as a doctor, but I think she might be in a different field now. But who ever gets her and to the facility . She is amazing! Compassionate, really smart and super friendly , also can tell that she works hard and loves to learn! Lucky to have such a great NP and Person.|I just left the building without even being seen. I had just gotten out of work, arrived ten minutes before my second scheduled appointment, and waited thirty minutes after my scheduled time, making my total wait time about forty minutes in the waiting room. I get it, things happen and appointments run late, but at least have the common courtesy to let the patient know. So unprofessional and a waste of time. My first experience was okay, but wasn't extremely happy with it either. Definitely better places out there. I definitely won't be back to this place.|This is letter I wrote to one of the PA's about my experience so far. I stand by it. "Dear _______, today I received a call from scheduling stating the appt for Monday Sept 24th was canceled and to be re-scheduled into October. You know I haven't been able to have a normal life since June, can't walk or stand to any degree. Three of three apps have been canceled on the day of or the preceding work day. There was no followup by the Doc who did the epidural injection. I have also reached out for reviews of the the MRI which clearly show nerve compression. Yet besides your contact there has been a complete dropping of the ball in my care at the SouthCoast Brain and  Spine center.  FYI when you last contacted me via messaging here you said to get a "earlier appt" I tried to but scheduling would't/couldn't provide a date.
Frankly I have never experienced such shoddy care in the area. Please pass my comments to whomever manages this practice. sincerely, Bill Belknap

PS I am one week out of surgery and doing very well . Again I want to say Dr Kanaly is a true professional who has provided excellent care. The staff at St Anne's Hospital is great to. A big Thank You to both!!|I've been coming here for a few years now. You ABSOLUTELY couldn't ask for better doctors and staff. My doctor listens to me genuinely, and honestly cares. He answers all my questions honestly and explains things to me that I don't understand. And the receptionist go above and beyond, they all do. And they do it for everyone. Like I said, you couldn't ask for better doctors and staff. They care

column40:
Dr. Doherty is the best. I've see many at your facility and in the several major hospitals in Boston. He he outshines all of them. Do not let him go anywhere.|I had my first appointment with Dr. Doherty this week. He fit me in a day early due to the expected snow on my appointment day. The facility was clean and tidy. The staff is pleasant, efficient, and knowledgeable. Dr. Doherty had read through my chart and was familiar with my case. He asked questions, gave me the opportunity to answer, and to ask any questions that I had. I didn't feel rushed through the appointment even though the office was busy. I am pleased with my experience.|I was with Granite State Pain for 8 years or so. Dr. Grover and Dr. Tuscano were fabulous! I think it got sold last year?  The new owner has decided to move everything to Southern NH. They just dumped a ton of patients, no warning, no referrals, and no return calls! I met with Dr Doherty in December 2024 and had him do a RFL. The procedure went great and he was great too. He said, " Call if you need anything." Well, a few days later I did need something, I was in horrible pain! I called, several times. Left several messages, and they ignored every single one. I went somewhere else for help, thankfully they helped. When I went in January for my appointment I asked the receptionist why I didn't get a call back. She looked in the notes and said that Dr. Doherty was confused by my message. I replied that I had left my number, if he was confused he should have called, and that I had been in horrible pain. Her reply was this; "Well in our defense Dr. Tuscano and Ashly just up and left, and we do have 1800 patients." My reply, " I can see why they left and now you 1799 patients." I didn't bother seeing the doctor that day, I left. I still haven't gotten a call back. They don't return calls. I was with them for 8 years or so.  They are not the same caring company. I don't recommend them and that makes me sad because they were once very caring, always called back, and always checked on you after a procedure. Now many of us are struggling to get our records from them.|Dr. Doherty is probably the best Dr. i've ever had. No exaggeration.. He listens and always addresses my concerns. The Drs im used to usually give me a pat on the back and say come back and see me and we'll see how that worked. Dr. Doherty does that also, but gives me directions on how to improve my condition . I feel lucky to have a Dr. that hears  what im saying. And not just nodding their heads.
 Thanks Doc !|He's the injection specialist but I felt listened to throughout the entire visit. He gave relevant feedback showing he'd been listening. They handled my doctor leaving w/a smooth transition which I'm grateful for. It was a first visit, I'll be seeing someone else for med management related care. I've had several PA's and physicians over the years. Only a few issues. Dr. Doherty is a good guy.|I have just undergone a serious neck and back surgery, so I had a telehealth appointment with Yelena. We had a great visit. Yelena was very easy to speak with and she really cared about the serious pain I am undergoing. She always takes the time to ask how I am doing and I enjoy the relationship we have built. She's  the 4th provider I have had and she is one of the best provider I have had. I would recommend her to anyone who is having chronic pain issues!! I'm so grateful to be a patient of Yelena's!!|Dr. Doherty provided a very pleasant and professional experience at Granite State Pain Associates in Merrimack, NH. I went to him for a lumbar shot to alleviate nerve pain. He explained the procedure thoroughly, was empathetic, careful and professional. The treatment facility was very clean and I didn't have to wait beyond the appointment time. I definitely recommend him and GSPA.|Dr. Toscano is an incredible doctor who is full of knowledge listens, cares and always comes up with the best care plan for my medical condition...my procedures are always done with the most incredible caring staff.

column40:
I've waited almost 4 years to get answers about what was wrong with me. No doctor at Beverly Hospital, Peabody, Salem, Danvers etc., that I seen could give me an explanation as-to why my left hip/left knee/left ankle/entire left side of my body was so complex. I promise you no explanation from Any doctor, but when my doctor recommended Dr. LoMonaco, I was scared because of my experience in the past, but when I finally did his recommended procedure.....Guess what? I feel like a brand new person. His office staff was gentle, respectful and made me feel welcome. They have a water bubbler, big tv, small decent waiting area, very clean office and patient rooms. They have a elevator and lots of parking. Plenty of food choices downstairs and a beautiful view of the pond out back, and the staff don't look ghetto and are either professionally dressed or in uniform with credentials so you know they are legit. I am so excited for this new journey in my life and am able to do a bit more as I use to and I'm grateful! Definitely recommended to anyone with complex issues similar as mine.

Thank you Dr. LoMonaco and his office staff you guys are like god sent angels.|As we all know. Going to the doctors, usually means we're in some type of distress. And often the doctors office can be uncomfortable.  But dr lomonaco and his staff, are extremely pleasant, and very professional! You feel as if your not even at the doctors. I've been in significant lower back pain. And had a lower back ablation, with dr lomonaco... and it's like night and day.... for real. I have a way better outlook on my situation! This is my first ever review.  I thought it absolutely nessary to leave one! I highly recommend dr lomonaco to anyone if your suffering in neck and back pain! Thanks again dr lomonaco and team! I'm forever grateful, and will continue to go him.|Dr Lomonaco is a compassionate and sincere doctor. I look forward to his services for any future treatments.|Very amenable to listening to your problems.  Sufficient time spent with each client, staff all very pleasant  to talk to  .    Always on time,   no long waiting times for treatment's.

I  have have been in several  other clinics without such  excellantt care  given.  It is always wonderful to be treated here, from all medical staff !!!  This is a great pain clinic  indeed

Antonette  Royce  RNC BS CA  MA|Dr LoMonaco & his team have been wonderful to work with.||

If I could put 0 stars I would. Let me start by saying that Dr. Rustam has been my doctor for a while now. Unfortunately I get chronic bad back pain and have had this since I was a teen.  Recently my back pain has returned. I've  been trying to make an appointment at his office and one of his staff members Jackie  has been very rude. Every time I try to make an appointment she keeps saying "we're going to call you" "were going to call you" ( nobody has called). So today  I went into the office to try to get an appointment since my back is hurting a lot and once again they told I had to see Jackie in order to make the appointment.  (Lol why do I have to see Jackie again smh) So Jackie told me that Dr. Rustam could not see me and she would call me to make the appointment. I got very upset and told her no I need an appointment now. So she told me that the Dr. Said he can't see me until mid March but then told me very rude to find another doctor. My whole life of working in the medical field because I also work in the medical field I've never been disrespectful to a client of mine or seen such an unprofessional staff  if I was you, I would find another doctor. Don't waste your time coming here.|Best!!! I live with pain and discomfort due to a rear end collision that cause me an injury. I am fortunate that I can use alternative pain relief rather than opioids 
Dr Rustum is good at his job and I appreciate that he listens, explains and makes sensible options for the best outcome.|Helped ease my pain, but, gee! when I noticed they were charging worker's comp for the visits appropriately AS WELL AS medicare, I was abruptly discharged. Spoke to medicare about the double-dipping, they took back the money BUT this corrupt billing department repeatedly resubmitted those bills under different diagnosis codes... so many times that medicare just paid them the illegal bonus! ps Doctor vist is extremely brief and I was told by an office nurse that the only reason they do vital signs which, lol, is the most time-consuming part of the visit, is because MVPM discovered that insurance companies pay them more if a blood pressure is taken.|If there was a 0 i would have used that. When you have chronic pain issues and need to find a doctor, you go to a pain management clinic. Not this place. i went to find help and got nothing but a lecture about not trying every surgery possible. Ive already had one back surgery, really cant afford another. So thanks for the pain and the bill.|I have to leave another review... Office stuff is amazing... The main nurse Jackie is an incredibly helpful, professional, and pleasant person... have had back pain for at least 12 years. I have seen many pain specialists during that time with no relief. I went to dr LoMonaco, he did x-rays and a ct scan. after reviewing he came up with a plan on how to treat my back pain. we followed that plan and I finally got satisfaction. my pain is now manageable and I probably have 80% relief on a daily basis. He listens to his patients creating a plan together that works for you. He genuinely cares about you and working to make you well. You will not be disappointed!|I have suffered from chronic pain for a little over ten years now due to an accident I was in 11 years ago where I broke my neck, arms, legs, and ribs. I decided to give interventional pain associates of ma a try a few days ago. Quite honestly, I thought I was a lost cause and had very little hope that they could do much to help me. The Dr. had mentioned that I may benefit from a sympathetic nerve block. So I figured I'd at least try it. Much to my surprise, a day later and I can actually walk almost pain free. I got out of bed this morning and found that I wasn't limping. Words cannot express my level of gratitude right now. If you are dealing with chronic pain and are at your wits end like I was, please do yourself a favor and reach out to them. They were nothing short of exceptional with how they treated me. I strongly recommend them.|This Guy is great! Highly recommend Anthony

The greeting at the desk was ok. We've had better. The Doctor's nurse was very good. The Doctor did not make us wait. Doctor was polite, interested, listened and explained in detail the reason for pain, the report of the MRI and the action needed. Doctor made a referral and explained why. Relief medicine for pain was offered and ordered. The departure was without incident,
Patient was taken to the car by her own driver.. However, a lady (well dressed employee came to the car and offered to help with the patient and wheelchair.|Only my second visit to this facility but so far they've been very good. Dr. Cerasuolo is kind and explains everything thoroughly. The staff in general are fairly nice and attentive. The only two issues I've had is with the check out and scheduling. Everyone has to stand in the same line line for check out and check in. This makes for a bit of a wait on both sides of it. After my first visit they said they'd call me with my next appointment but that never happened. I waited about 3 weeks and wound up calling them for the appointment myself. Outside of those slight inconveniences I find this facility to be very good.|He tried pushing surgery and implants over n over again even tho I told him I want no injection's nor chips in me. I looked at the long long lists of risks associated with the implants on my own time n they were disturbing side effects in which the Dr didn't mention n said they rarely happen which was a lie because there was alot of stories from people who got it n had NOTHING but severe complications with it. I do not trust any Dr who pushes horrible pills n procedures while saying they are safe n effective when clearly that is not the facts. Our health system is now a death system. Do your own research n never take a drs advice without looking 8nto it yourself|Pain management is now just giving injections!! The drs are in fear or totally uneducated on the need for pain medication for those of us with intractable chronic pain, we are not addicts!! Stand up for your patients.  Instead dr Joe opted to walk out during my appt because he didn't want to discuss this with me!!! Yes a dr walking out on a patient!! So disgusting and shameful!!!  Pain mgmt drs aren't really any help anymore for long time pain sufferers!!  There is the lowest rate of opioids being prescribed ever yet overdose deaths are at the highest, why? Because those in pain mgmt do not abuse pain meds!! So drs need to learn the truth and look at the many studies to prove the truth.|I don't even know where to start because I am still blown away and offended of the treatment I received as a new patient my first time ever here .when I went into the room with my wife and the intake nurse she asked me some questions and asked about meds I take then she gave me paper work to fill out and in that paper work there was two forms  called  SOAP. Well when I began to read the question I imiditly felt offended such personal and private questions that do not pertain or have anything to do with pain management these questions I feel are disrespectful and offensive most questions are someone's privacy it is non of pain management's office business to ask patient private questions like this My God I feel labeled it took me over 18 months to go back into pain management and this doctor Cerasuolo didn't even want to touch he only kept going by the notes of a past Doctor whom I wrote an administrative complaint against 18 months ago the treatment the doctor gave Mr was offensive I had to be persistent just so he would check me then finally he said stand up let me ch3ck you that when I found out that my brain injury has cause issue with my arms .if I didn't keep being persistent for this doctor to check me out .he would have never done it .and I would have never know about issue with my arms .I almost did not know of another medical condition I have if I did not push the issue of my health last two years .what is someone sapose to do when a doctor meets you and his first question to was what do you want me to do for you.then it gets even worst when we talk about opioid and he then states to me that he prescribes pain medication to some patients but because I'm over 50 he would prescribe pain medication to me .I was saprised of his answer then he container to explain his reasons not to prescribe me pain medication. Because I'm over 50 and the risk is high in his personal opinion that I will become an addict and become addicted to opioid. MY GOD I'm am still blown away I still hear his voice in my head since yesterday I have ptsd anxiety disorder memory disorder long term back and spine issue he never asked for medical record only went by a doctors notes whom I have a discrimination complaint against I told the doctor he should have all my medical history not treat me by using notes from other doctors I fear of the treatment when I go back there it took a advocate to help me fight to get in that pain management from day one they have treated me like a lesser person. I am Latino I am sick of this treatment. he even ignored everything I was saying about my pain and health I'm still so shocked over my first visit ever to this pain management hospital. I can write so much more even my family is offended of the SOAP questionnaire|Seems that my new dr. Only cares about my "high dose " of pain medication.Then threatened me with lowering my dosages if I happen to have him see me again instead of my regular NP or MD,very unprofessional. I go to a pain clinic for the past 12 years  because I'm in pain.If the lovely dr dosent like treating pain with meds then he should find an alternative that actually works.until then don't threaten people that you have never seen before .|He was very understanding of my extreme anxiety of the lumbar epidural I was having. Help calmed me down and understand everything very clearly. The procedure was nearly painless and only took approximately 20 minutes.|Dr Cerasuolo is an awesome back doctor! He is my favorite!!! Very thorough with his knowledge and bed side manner. So happy I had the opportunity to have him. Thank you Dr. Cerasuolo

column2: MetroWest Spine Care and Pain Management
column3:
At MetroWest Spine Care and Pain Management LLC, we are dedicated to helping patients become pain-free through our comprehensive interventional pain management approach. Our practice understands that when it comes to rehabilitation and pain control, no single treatment works for all patients, which is why we specialize in offering personalized care tailored to each individual's needs.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a wide range of advanced pain management procedures, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint and sacroiliac joint injections

  • Medial branch and sympathetic nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation

Our neurology services include:

  • Nerve conduction studies (NCS)

  • Electromyography (EMG)

  • Botox injections for migraine treatment

Located in Framingham, our team of specialists is committed to providing exceptional care in a comfortable environment. We take pride in listening carefully to our patients' concerns and developing effective treatment plans to address chronic pain conditions. Visit our website or call us at +1 508-834-7725 to schedule a consultation at our medical clinic located at 475 Franklin St STE 205, Framingham, MA 01702.
column11:
MetroWest Spine Care and Pain Management LLC is an interventional pain management practice that is dedicated to helping patients become pain-free. MetroWest Spine Care and Pain Management offers many pain management options, including:
* epidural steroid injections
* facet joint and sacroiliac joint injections
* medial branch and sympathetic nerve blocks
* radiofrequency ablation,
and performs neurology procedures, including:
* nerve conduction studies (NCS)
* electromyography (EMG)
* Botox injections for migraine treatment.
When it comes to rehabilitation and pain control, no single treatment works for all. MetroWest Spine Care and Pain Management specializes in offering a personalized approach to pain management.
column38: Crissy Krueger|Kristy Gemmiti|Jessica Weinberg|Jose M|Melissa Gaudette|Julie Kuliopulos|Rachel Simpson|Jodi Ridolfi
column40:
Dr. Mark Kaplan and Dr. Aaron Shiu have been so helpful in helping me manage my migraines.  I have brain lesions and they're so painful and I've seen so many different doctors but no one has ever listened so well and tried so much to help me stop the pain, without harmful side effects.  That's the biggest thing of all is they helped me get to the right medicine that I feel better and safe from harmful side effects on.  Thank you so much for completely changing my life for the better.  I just wish I found them sooner!

As a side note I have been to MGH Neurology in Boston, other pain centers in Framignham, many other neurologists, etc. prior to coming to MetroWest Spine Care and Pain Management.  I have never been treated so well, felt so heard or cared about in my 30+ years of seeing so many other doctors. Who'd have thought this level of care could be found right here in Framignham?|Video call did not go well. He kept saying he couldn't hear me. But he could see me and told me I was doing movements that I wasn't doing because I can't. I heard him and saw him . He was a little weird. Maybe intoxicated . Ordered a CT scan and MRI for me. It took almost 3 months for MRI and he never prescribed anything for me . Mri tech asked me why I had not taken my meds before procedure. I didn't have any. I don't know what to ask for. Dr Kaplan should have prescribed something she said. CT scan had to be approved and never happened. Horrible experience. I was hit by a man who ran a red light. I'm in so much pain. Cannot get help. Begged the lawyer for a different Dr to no avail. Could not reach Dr Kaplan after several calls. Fired the lawyer. Total incompetence. And he really needs a dentist. Looks homeless.|Dr. Shiu is really helpful in making me feel better. I feel like a new person when I do a trigger point treatment because it helps me with my pain. Linda is very good and nice in communicating with me about my appointments. Avernelle creates a very chill and comfortable environment.|Dr. Shiu and his team, Nellie and Linda does a very good job. I'm very happy after receiving my PRP injection to my shoulder. I dont have pain anymore. Im very happy! I appreciate everything you do for me. Good job. Julio|Highly recommend Dr. Kaplan. He is extremely knowledgeable in his Field. I trust his judgement regarding my injuries in a severe motor vehicle collision.|Dr. Shiu and his office manager Linda are committed to providing an excellent patient experience.  I have a chronic condition that began in my childhood.  As a result, I have seen dozens of doctors over the years.  Dr. Shiu's office runs seamlessly, taking away so much of the anxiety and frustration I felt in the past.  I am always treated with courtesy and respect. Appointments run on time, messages are promptly returned, scheduling visits is quick and easy and virtual visits are even possible. You can text your requests to their office if you're like me and that is so much easier. Dr. Shiu is knowledgeable and kind.  As well, he listens and is genuinely invested in patient care.  I highly recommend Dr. Shiu.  You can trust him and the staff with your care.|Started going to Dr Shiu due to a MVA but I continue to see him. Dr Shiu is THE BEST PAIN MANAGEMENT DR I have been to and continue going.|I've had chronic pain for a couple years now, my feet, legs, back and I was told that I can't possible be in the amount of pain I say... They told me to call them when I was ready for injections.. I will never have any injections in my spine .. Feeling alone again on the medical journey... CRPS1 IS SOMETHING THAT CAN LAST A LIFE TIME.... It's something I've had for over 10+ years... These two guys have no clue!!!!!!

Sat and waited for doctors with no updates.  Scheduling is awful. Making older patients and families waste time.  No consideration for pain or people's lives.|"Dr" Jain was condescending, rude, hostile. He did not listen to my knowledge of my medical condition nor of my past experience of treatments. He said "don't worry about it", "repeat what I said". He stormed out of the room yelling, "I will not prescribe for you, I will not treat you." Jain's manager dismissed my complaint. I had been respectfully treated at this office for a decade or more by Dr Nguyen and then Glenda Boykin NP, and was referred to Jain when G. Boykin NP retired. I was denied an appointment with anyone else in the practice. BHS Pain Management did not give me any explanation for denying me medical care.|Compassionate doctors, PA's, nurses, techs and front desk.  Decided to write a review to support this great team of professionals and the services they provide Berkshire County.|Dr DeMaggio is working under the conditions of hearing every patient come through, complaining of pain.  He remains compassionate, listens, and HELPS!  I highly recommend.|I have heard so many bad things about this clinic that I was scared to show up today januaray 21, 2019 at 10:00am. Appointment was at 10:30am but 30 minutes early to fill out paperwork. So I flaked out for my appointment with Dr. D that I just froze and was a "No Show." Bad things said about him anywhere from he isn't nice, to he is detached, to uncompassionate and dismissive, to he just doesn't care about another person's pain, to there are better options available. These were people claiming to be patients, former patients, employees, to former employees, to working agencies like pulmonary, etc, etc, etc.

Does anyone know if this is true or just rumors and gossip. Not unusual. Lots of gossip and rumors in Berkshire County, I heard. The common message, consistently by others is "stay away from that place" or "don't show up, it's not worth it." Anyone have any advice? I can be timid and shy and nervous, sometimes, so thanks for your feedback.|The worst doctor I have EVER visited and I have had some bad ones. Dr. D is a disgrace to the medical community and should lose his license to practice - denying seriously ill and in-pain patients ANY kind of treatment - even PT or ablation - STAY AWAY FROM THIS "DOCTOR". Bad News, not Fake News.|Horrible office policies. They make one jump through the hoops to make an appointment. And then they schedule you 3 months out while you are in pain.
You might need to go elsewhere.
Doctors are good.|Dr. Demaggio is an excellent doctor. Listens to you really goes the extra mile to help with my pain.

I've been here several times ,wonderful staff,great nurses and can't say enough about Dr.Lubrano,He is terrific keeps me out of PAIN!!!|This was my first visit at the clinic. Staff at the front desk very friendly which made me feel very comfortable. Shelly and Sharon were quite the time the team at the front desk. The RN, Mary was awesome. Spent a lot of time when me which was so comforting. She was not only professional but very friendly. When Dr. Oh came in to see me, I was very impressed. She went over my records and my recent tests. Explained in detail what was going on and when I asked her a question, she was very happy to explain in detail to make sure I had a clear understanding of what the situation was. Even after all my questions, before she left, she asked me if l had any other questions. She was so thorough that when l left, l had a clear understanding of what going on.  I highly recommend this facility and this very competent staff. Not sure it Sonia was in the right office.|Front desk staff is very rude from scheduling apts to just the way they speak to you. Dr O was nice but always seemed to be out for weeks at a time nurses where nice the care was just ok I had to wait 4 weeks for them to send the authorization to my insurance and then they wouldnt squeeze me in. I left and went else where wouldnt recommend|Been trying to get an appointment for over 4 months. I have tried on three occasions but keep getting the runaround. If you call the office, they will be too busy to talk to you and ask if they can call back in 5-10 minutes. Spoiler Alert: they don't call back. If you decide that waiting 2 hours has been long enough before calling back - you will be shocked to find out that they won't even remember your initial phone call. It's kind of funny in its own way. They say laughter is the best medicine, but when you are living in pain and need treatment - laughter doesn't cut it.

If your specialist refers you to this center - please do not listen to him or her. Ask for another center or option. Trust me.|VERY rude front desk staff-dismissive and passive aggressive when scheduling appointments. Communication overall in terms of following back up with patients VERY poor also.|Dr. Oh and her team of nurse practitioners are very unprofessional.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND NOT GETTING YOUR TREATMENT HERE!

After waiting for over a month for treatment, they refused to treat me on the day of my surgery and were rude about it.  I was originally told an Uber car was an acceptable form of transportation after surgery but, on the day of the surgery they refused me, saying it was unacceptable and only a family member can drive me home.  I was not told this beforehand in the initial interview a month earlier, nor was I told in writing.  I don't have family living anywhere near the state of MA so, they pretty much screwed me and the insurance company for the costs of visits and X-Rays.

I filed an official complaint with the HMO and they are now under investigation.  - I'm now forced to find treatment elsewhere, which means going out of my local area, from where they monopolise, and start with a new hospital, a new primary care doctor, and a new orthopedic and pain managment treatment center.|I have been going to this pain clinic for a year or more. I can't say enough about this wonderful staff. Kind, caring and efficient. I wouldn't go anywhere else.  Dr Hellums is a warm, caring, very understanding and is thorough. I want to thank Dr. Ebrahimi and his staff for a job well done!

Dr. Kevin Bernard is a fellowship-trained interventional pain management specialist at Sports Medicine North, dedicated to providing exceptional nonsurgical spine and sports medicine care.

Specialized Pain Management Solutions

As a board-certified physician in physical medicine and rehabilitation, we take pride in offering patient-centered treatment options using the most advanced nonsurgical methods to address joint and spine-related pain. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional pain management procedures

  • Nonsurgical spine treatments

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Customized pain management plans

We understand that pain can prevent you from enjoying life's important moments—whether that's watching your grandchildren grow, participating in sports, or returning to work after an injury. At our practice, we're committed to helping you regain function and improve your quality of life through personalized care. Dr. Bernard welcomes patients at our Sports Medicine North locations in Peabody, Beverly, and Newburyport, Massachusetts. Visit our office at 1 Orthopedics Dr, 2nd Floor, Peabody, MA 01960, or call us at +1 978-818-6350 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Dr. Kevin Bernard is a fellowship-trained interventional pain management doctor at Sports Medicine North who specializes in nonsurgical spine and sports medicine care. He is board-certified in physical medicine and rehabilitation. Dr. Bernard enjoys helping patients get back to the things that are important to them, whether that means watching their grandkids, playing sports, or getting back to work after an injury. Dr. Bernard offers patient-centered pain management options, and he uses the most advanced nonsurgical methods in treating joint and spine-related pain.
Dr. Bernard is available to see patients at our Peabody, Beverly, and Newburyport, Massachusetts offices.

column40:
My experience with the Pain Center was quite negative, not so much because of the clinic but because the BI system is in disarray. After waiting a few weeks for an appointment, I saw a doctor for all of 5 minutes. She asked me a few questions and decided we needed to do an MRI as the next step. (For this, they charged my insurance over $500.) Rather than setting up my MRI appointment, they gave me a phone number to call and sent me on my way. Over the following 10 days, I called that number well over a dozen times. No one ever answered. Every time but once, I was shunted to a voicemail box that was full, followed by a hang-up. Exactly one time, I got to the voicemail box and left a careful message. A month has passed. I never heard back.

Fortunately for me, my pain has mostly resolved, from massage, stretching, and careful exercise. The pain is noticeable but not debilitating, and I plan to go to another clinic. BI needs to get its act together. I strongly recommend going elsewhere.|We first visited in early June and given an appointment for July 22 for epidural procedure, today. There were no instructions given, only the time. When we arrived today we were informed by the doctor that they could not perform the procedure since my husband had never been informed that one of his medicines had to be stopped for three days before the procedure. They couldn't give us another date only suggested going on the wait list. There was no apology for the lack of communication or attempt to correct their lack of communication. It was highly unprofessional. I would not ever return|The recent opioid law and provisions really only hurts cancer and chronic pain patients. My dad had a total laryngectomy, 6 rounds of radiation and has to do 6 more again it's been 2 weeks since his surgery its bad.  3-6 weeks frim surgery he starts radiation again. They offered him antidepressants and gave him a speech about heroin treated him like addict, note hes sick very sick hole in throat now and is a mess no longer has a voice box. They don't care and are too afraid to help sad really because idk how much time left I will have him. And he's suffered the entire time. Choking on water and jello unable to breathe literally dying and he asked for 10mg of oxycodon he's 62. It's all he knows that works for him. They said that's way to much you would overdose.  I will not rant too long because I get it. It's not really the doctor it's the state threating doctor's with prison and losing power They got mad at him because he's dying sums it up.  I love my Dad more than anyone and I will get him what he needs everytime legally or illegaly I don't care anymore  as long as it's a older friend with a prescription I'll pay double the price to be safe and oddly they care more than pain clinics some great people gave me 1000mg in 15mg tablets they had from a knee replacement surgery surgery he wouldn't take money and knew my dad from union work 40 years. I thank God for him seeing my dad get some sleep and relief was the first time i felt happy in 4years of hell.  If I was rich I'd sue every person who denied him for punitive damages and lastly screw mass govt i hope your family never has to deal with this oh wait they wont you know the right people you get pain medicine must be nice|Completely unprofessional. I have to schedule my appointments every 3 months because I have to get shots for pains and they had the audacity to cancel my appointment WITHOUT calling me. I have been coming here for 2 years. The lady could not even find me in the system. I stood waiting for over 10 minutes just to be told somebody had cancelled my appointment a few days ago. DO YOU UNDERSTAND THERE'S PEOPLE IN SERIOUS PAIN EVERYDAY AND THAT IS WHY WE HAVE TO SCHEDULE AN APPOINTMENT? I am very frustrated, this is unacceptable and extremely rude that this is the treatment I am receiving. People think because someone is not over the age of 50 that cancelling their appointments without calling the patient is acceptable. IT IS NOT. And now I am forced to wait a WHOLE MONTH for a new appointment. Train your staff or just shut down the department.|Very difficult to reach someone. Leave messages on voicemail system (no one ever answers phone) and send messages direct to provided through patient site, but do not get a response that way either. How does one get in touch with doctor I am a patient of? This is an ongoing issue and in the past I have actually spent time going directly to the office so I can speak to someone. Please have a better system for patients to communicate information requested by physicians office or to make/change appointment. Thank you|The Pain Center was always great and I was well taken care of when the NP Laura was there. Since Laura left, the new person, Dr. Flores,  doing Botox and nerve block injections is a complete disappointment!  She spends more time during the visit doing paperwork than seeing the patient. I travel over an hour to go there and one day, when I had childcare cancel last minute, I called to say I would be a little late. The receptionist said it was fine and they offer a 15 minute grace period. I arrived 17 minutes late and Dr. Flores herself refused to let me wait until  the end of her day to see me for a quick 15 minute procedure.  The practice manager was no help in remedying the situation or showing any compassion for my situation. If you live outside of Boston and travel far to go, I suggest finding another place if you want fair and compassionate care.|This place is horrible. Please consider going elsewhere if you want any compassion whatsoever and appropriate care. The receptionist was extremely rude, borderline aggressive toward me, completely disrespectful, and in no way wanted to attempt to even help. Absolutely zero empathy. As a medical professional myself, the last place you should work is in the healthcare sector if you feel it is appropriate to disrespect patients and speak in a  condescending tone and raise their voice. Completely inappropriate.
I had my migraine medication approved for a year , until 2023 and nothing has changed since I continue this medication as I depend on it every month. So instead of filling a prescription for me that I have been taking for over a year now, they demand you have a follow up appt and can't book you until the new year! Oops sorry we're booked 4 months and can't do anything to help. A speciality medication that has literally saved my life I am going to wait five months to get my prescription??Not to mention this was noted in my last visit: follow-up visit in 6 months,  as needed should symptoms worsen or fail to respond to treatment plan as outlined..notice it states as needed!! I don't need to change anything and nothing as changed in terms of side effects etc. Therefore, my medication should continue to be prescribed to me! Too much red tape at the cost of the patients suffering. Also, it has only been 7 months since I was last seen, a whole month after their timeline. If you want to be miserable and put through pain and suffering, then go see them. I wish I knew how it was possible they even have patients that they are possibly booking so far out . I'm sure if they continue in this way they will lose all their patients. Good luck.|I've never written a google review in my life but feel strongly enough about this place to advise folks not to go here. The first consult appointment I had I was told because I'm transgender and the name I go by doesn't match the name on my insurance card that they would charge me $500 if I didn't jump through all these hoops within the next 48 hours to get that sorted out, even though it is a health care provider's responsibility to know how to address patients of all different backgrounds. When I actually got to go in for treatment I could not get a straight answer about insurance coverage and billing and spent 1.5 hours on the phone being shuffled to different billing departments before ultimately being sent back to the first number I called, that couldn't help me. It's unacceptable to not tell patients how much they are being charged for their care, and to not even have a way for patients to find that information out before being slapped with an expensive bill. This is the worst healthcare experience I've had in my entire life, and that's saying a lot because i'm a trans person of color with chronic pain.

column40:
Dr Mousad is the kindest, most caring doctor that I've ever had the plot seeing. I've been a patient of his for close to ten years. I've never had any doctor who's listened to me and given suggestions (that work!!!) the way that he has. I've also never had a medical professional who was able to administer an EMG without pain- but he did. I was extremely terrified, but he assured me he wouldn't hurt me AND HE DIDN'T! I've had them previously and had to stop them mid-test because of the excruciating pain. Dr. Mousad had given me spinal injections, radio-frequency ablations and other injections- all with relatively little pain(at least when compared to other providers I've seen I. The past.) I can't explain what a great doctor he is- he's that great.|I have to share my experience and thoughts of this amazing doctor.... He is a wonderful person! I have been seeing Dr. Mousad for 4 years now. He is the first doctor, that actually found the root of my whole problem. I have chronic back pain and fibromyalgia and I am full of Arthritis. He treats his patience with such respect, and listens to everything they have to say. This man right here has made me feel my age again. When I started going to him I was in my early 50s, but felt like some mornings I was in my 90s. I have had many different procedures in his office. Everything does  he explains everything to you. He is a caring and compassionate doctor. And everyone in his office are compassionate also! I am so happy I found Dr Damien Mousad! He is not only caring for you for your pain but he also cares for you as an individual person. I was going to him during Covid. And got Covid in 2022 October. It's screwed up my whole G.I. system, where I couldn't retain any weight and continued to lose weight. He saw me monthly and could see that things weren't well with me. I was amazed how he was concerned about my health when I was going to him for pain. You won't find a better doctor out there. He's very knowledgeable and what he does! Thank you Dr Mousad! column40:
Maybe it is better if you aren't honest about depression or other mental health issues, but the doctor seemed to have made up her mind before the follow up. It was determined that my back had no stenosis, and thus, all of my chronic pain was due to the depression. Ignoring details about other chronic pain conditions that have been diagnosed and verified, she recommended that I have ECT to treat the drug resistant depression and that I should stop the very small amount of opiate I am taking intermittently in order to function well enough to make it to appointments at all. She further told me that 3 years of homelessness to leave a very bad situation was "just something one must endure". Even a layman looking at my medical file would know that being homeless in my condition is far more than a "little hardship".
After informing me of all of this, and after I told her as well as staff that after the three hour wait my pain medication was wearing off and I was worried I wasn't safe to drive as the pain was too distracting. I was offered Tylenol, but by that point and time, it wouldn't have been enough to help keep my mind on the road. *please note, I was NOT asking for more medication, but imploring them to stop making me wait so long without word because it was causing me anxiety that I may be stuck there, which only makes the pain more intense* Then, sent me away in tears, and now I am fearful that this very small relief I get will be taken away too if because my PC is under pressure to get me off of them.
Maybe if not for the mental health problems I would have been taken more seriously, and those who do not have this problem can disregard my review in favor of those who didn't have to deal with the prejudice, but for those of you who are dealing with mental health, particularly if you and your team have stopped medications for whatever reason,  you may want to save your copay monies.
*in the unlikely event the office is tracking and responding to these, please, do not contact me. I am trying to forget this experience, and hopefully will after I post this review to warn off others who get treated like this too often as it is  and deserve a chance to avoid it in the future.|The worst  these people are at best incompetent, I can't  say  any thing  else without divulging personal info, all I will say I will not be back.|Sasa is awesome ! Best Dr. I've been to for my back pain !

column40:
I have been patient of Dr. Feliz for several years and have no problem if anyone chooses to have it verified.
Dr. Feliz is a knowledgeable professional anesthesiologist specializing in Pain Management. He sincerely cares about his patients. He loves his work, which shows through his compassion. He does not take any shortcuts in treatment plans and recommendations. I appreciate his upfront truths in letting me know where I stand and what to expect with whatever option I decide to pursue in my care. At least with me, he gives honest facts. There are no surprises. He goes the extra mile to inform and treat his patients.
He treated me before and after a major spine operation. Though his office is a bit far for me to use his physical therapy a few times a week, after going to a few local therapists, I started going to his physical therapy department. Within a short time, I was standing straight, walking better, and over all, in a much better place physically then I'd been in decades!  His unwavering concern for my total health has provided me a quaility of life I hadn't had in many, many years! Dr. Feliz and his staff are great. He is respected amongst his peers, as well. On a separate note, he is an extremely devoted family man, and has a great love of life. He takes nothing for granted. And keeps an open mind. No one needing pain management for muscular skeletal related problems could be in more capable hands than those of the highly respected, Dr. Roberto Feliz!|I think Dr Feliz is a great doctor. However his office staff is absolutely horrible. I made several calls to make my initial appointment as my wife knows the doctor very well. I received no return phone calls so I had to have my wife reach out personally to the doctor to set up the initial appointment. Once I met with the doctor and I was very pleased with him and he told me I needed an ablation and a plasma injection. I told him I would get back to him in a few days which I did and got his office voicemail again. I left a message on Monday no return call. I left a message on Tuesday no return call. I left a message on Wednesday no return call . I would love to go back to this doctor but I can't help but wonder if I have any issues if I'm not going to  be able to get return calls. I have never seen anything like this. It is too bad because the doctor is so good and his office staff is so poor.|Dr. Eddy Feliz is a great Dr. But he is always in a rush and does not spend enough time with you unless you ask him too. The communication is horrendous I can't believe a pain clinic that you get the answer machine all the time and if you do get a receptionist they tell you he'll call you at the end of the day when he's finished but you never get a call and he's on call from self and in five years I called him maybe three or four times and never called back or called back I was later and I ended up in the hospital recently because he didn't call back and he didn't even call back the ER doctor so now I'm at a new pain clinic who tried to call him five times got the answering machine four times and got the reception is once and never heard and I was out of medication and that was not right. It's really sad that he should only have enough patients that he can give enough time to he runs room to room  and rushes you just to prescribe the same medication that you're on. He is a good person at heart but the last couple of years it's been different just be on your guard if you go to him . Still to this day I've never heard back from him I called every day for almost a month which is unacceptable I called him because he was uncalled for the Villa arthritic pain I was having asking if I could be on the steroids again which helped but now I find there's a whole different plan and I have more conditions that I didn't know about there's a difference the new doctor I saw went through all my complicated past medical history and knew everything about me let me talk listen to me and it just proves because he called them five times he didn't call him back it's just not professional. I'm not saying  that Boston pain clinic in Hyde Park is horrible but the communication needs to be so much better and you need to take time with your patients. Dr. Eddy Feliz did help me with my migraines quite a bit there's more to my orthotic pain then he knew . I can't say that she doesn't care cause he does but the emotional stress that I've been through the last couple months of been horrible|Dr. Roberto Feliz  has been my pain management doctor for 3 years now . He has helped me so much. When I was 27 I had a spinal fusion because of a herniated disc I had . I was left in chronic pain my pain was worse after my surgery . For a while year I suffered in pain I spend most of that year in bed because every time I moved my nerve pain would go to a 10 it was Excruciating . No one would help me all the doctors I met told me I was fine. It was extremely depressing to know your in so much pain and know these doctors who get paid to help you won't waste their time . I was desperate , I asked my lawyer what to do I couldn't take it anymore . He told me to call Dr Feliz he would help me . I called made an appointment I got in right away . He has been my life savor and I could never repay him the life he has given me back . I still suffer from pain but it is managed enough that I'm getting my life back.

So if you have searched for help and haven't found it you can stop looking because he's the best .
People travel from all over just to have him as their doctor that's how good he is .|This Dr. Feliz is a joke. Don't worry papi somebody will pay $2grand and offset the loss from seeing worker's comp patients. He's the only one around Boston that accepts the actual true rate from worker's comp. He only gets $150 thru worker's comp but if I went there and used MA. HEALTH he'd be able to charge $850.  Then he didn't like that I wasn't going to wait,as he said, up to two years to get my hips checked after my back fusion. I went and got my hips checked and I needed another surgery. He did not like the fact that I knew my body and went over his recommendation of waiting for 2 years.|Have been seeing him for over six years now,  He is the reason I am able to do the things I can today.  I have refered many people to him an just refered another today.  He is amazing in helping with many ofy problems an health conditions.  .  Really don't know what I would have done without his help six years ago.|I've been a patient of Roberto Feliz, MD for several years.  Dr. Feliz cares about his patients and goes above and beyond to try to make you comfortable with whatever ails you.  I highly recommend Dr. Roberto and his brother, Dr. Eddie Feliz.|I've been going to Dr Felizfor pain management 6yrs now. He is a great Dr. I have permanent sciatic from failed back surgery. Without the help of Dr Feliz I would not be able to function on a daily basis. He has got my pain down to a minimum. I would recommend him to anyone who is suffering from daily aches or pains. Arthritis, back pain, If anyone can get you pain free its Dr Ronertp Feliz..

column40: I told Dr. Henkle my body doesn't respond quickly or as effectively to numbing agents and that I would need a little more than usual and a little more time for it to take effect (EDS). He strapped me down to a table to give me a cortisone shot in my spine and insisted his normal procedure would be more than enough. I felt every inch of that long needle and was screaming throughout while he kept insisting that I was just reacting to the pressure. Afterwards the nurses wouldn't let me leave for quite a while because my blood pressure had gone from normal pre-procedure to dangerously high post procedure. I wonder why? When he checked in with me I again told him my experience and he said it was hard to believe and chalked it up to anxiety. He clearly does not take women's pain seriously. My insurance company also caught his office double-charging for a whole laundry list of different things. Avoid at all costs.|I have had a consistently excellent experience with this office. I see Dr. Henkle and he has treated me with compassion and picked up on issues that other doctors either overlooked or didn't listen to me about. He has really helped me to better manage my back pain and although I'm not pain free, I am living. I was extremely impressed when he did my nerve ablation surgery - it was quick and not that painful! His team of nurses are top notch. I would recommend this clinic to any friends or family member suffering from back pain without hesitation.|I have been going here on and off for years, for lower back issues. Dr. Henkle and his staff have always treated me kindly and take the real time to listen. Dr. Henkle tries to make things as painless, quick and stress free as he can. I have been to a few other offices in the area and have not had similar experiences.|I have NEVER been treated so god awful by a physician! He clearly didn't even read my records as he stated three times how I need a rheumatologist to treat my illnesses. I told him each time I have one and he's the one who referred me. He told me my chronic pain isn't treated with pain management however I've had it in the past and my ra doctor said i should be getting them. He had a huge ego and no bedside manner! My entire visit with him was maybe 5 minutes and he shut me down every time I tried to say something! Sadly he owns the practice because unless the board of medicine which I was referred to shuts him down, he'll continue to treat patients like this. I only hope and pray he never gets struck with an illness that gives chronic pain and he may never be treated like he treats others! I drove over an hour because no one near me is taking on any new patients only to be treated so god awful! It wasn't the fact he refused treatment, I asked him what he'd recommend and he wouldn't answer, so again it wasn't the fact he refused treatment but how he spoke to me! He should be ashamed of his behavior and learn bedside manner. The fact I spoke with a patient advocate and she said she has a file of patients who've reported him spoke volumes! Don't go here! You'll regret it|Dr. Henkle is an excellent doctor. He is professional and highly skilled. He is able to work on complex cases and help patients when they think they are beyond hope. Initially I was reluctant to go to a pain clinic. Newer treatments are available here and Dr. Henkle is confident and willing to search for answers. This is the doctor you will want to be on your team. His  staff is excellent.I highly recommend Dr. Henkle.|Thank you Dr. Henkle for all you have done for me.You are a incredible Dr,I have had many procedures done over the years and I have to say you really care about your patients,You have always made me feel comfortable.I am so glad to be your patient.|Not much I can say other than wish he would of listened what I had to say other than him saying that their is nothing wrong with me I have 5 things going on with my back I felt like I was treated unfairly. On a daily basis even at night I go thru pain and unable to sleep as well and for a doctor to say he dont see anything wrong without knowing the status or diagnosis of my issues automatically he judged and has said oh you need to lose weight and there is nothing wrong just because its minimal does not mean I dont feel the pain thru out my back.|Saw me for 5 minutes had zero records didnt know me at all, was rude to me and disrespectful. Acts like every person they see is a drug addict. If l was dying l wouldn't see him. God forbid you ask a question he says your arguing. Asking questions about my own body isn't arguing its smart! Don't see him he's got a superego complex, so never ask a question cuz God forbid he treat you like a low life.

column38: Sam DeFrias|Paula Z|Kjay B|Carolina Santos|Kathleen Turner|SHARON RIBEIRO|Jenn Baptista|Lisa Clark
column40:
My entire experience with Dr.Stowe and his pain management office has been a joke. I have been dealing with pain for 2 years and after a year of playing guessing games with my PCP she finally gave me a referral to a pain management doctor. I waited a lot longer at my first appointment then I did spending time with anyone there. After quickly going through my issues I was told I would be given a muscle relaxer, a referral to PT and an MRI was going to be ordered. My medication was never filled and no orders or referrals were put through and i had to call the office multiple times to find out what was going on. It took a week to get the medication and a week to get a call to be told " we just submitted your MRI order and your insurance denied it, see you at your follow up"

Follow up for what? Needless to say, I went to that appointment. Passed off to Stowes NP, who asked me if I had an mri, no, did I do PT? ALSO NO because no one sent out a referral / told me where i would even be going. They had the nerve to tell me my MRI was denied because I didn't do the PT. Which a letter from my insurance does not list that as the reason. I explained that the medication isn't working either and I'm still taking massive amounts of aspirin which also doesn't help. I explained I feel there is a nerve issue and was told if thats the case there is nothing they can do besides surgery but they will never know unless I have an MRI so keep taking the pills that dont work and oh, do you need a refill on them? I said if you want me to keep taking them yeah, send in a refill.....I still don't have a refill. They told me they were referring me out for PT and this morning I get a call saying the place they sent my referral to doesnt take my insurance and I HAVE TO CALL AROUND to find a place that does and then call their office back for them to send a referral and I'm booked 6 weeks out for another "follow up" appointment with yet ANOTHER doctor ive never seen. To see how the PT has helped for an issue they haven't even diagnosed.

This whole experience has been a joke and rather then play the game of being my own medical team to make sure i get medications and appointments booked I'm just looking for a new doctor at this point.

Dealing with the constant everyday pain I'm in is less frustrating than dealing with this doctor and this office. Save yourself time and go to someone else that will actually help you.

Edit: and after telling me they would send me refills for medication. They never did and when I had the pharmacy try to refill the medication the refill was denied. So basically I'm back to square one and i am looking for another doctor to work with because this office isn't it and i feel bad for those that get referrals here.|Everyone there is great .   Dr Stowe not good. He just didn't listen to me and kept giving me injections that didn't work. They made me feel worse.|I am a Steward employee and have been a patient for quite a while.   I will say this about Dr. Stowe of St. Anne's Pain Management.  There are times when circumstances arise and waiting time maybe a little longer than usual. This place caused me more pain than they helped me relieve. Extremely long wait times and pretty much non-existent pain plan other than "do PT". Was in the office for an hour and a half, and still didn't get to see Dr. Pearl. Just kept being told "She'll be with you shortly". Unacceptable. Definitely cannot recommend.|I was there today, for reference i'm in wheelchair and cannot walk. I saw Dr pearl and she was very dismissive and condescending. she did not give me any advice or literally anything for my SEVERE pain in my legs. she actually laughed at my mother who was with me when she asked if there was anything we can do today and she said "haha i can't do anything without a diagnosis " and the kicker is she recommended i go back on  MENTAL HEALTH medications because "it could be related" and said I should talk about breathing techniques in therapy. i do not recommend Dr pearl.|I have NEVER worked with a more unresponsive medical staff in my entire life. It takes upwards of 2 weeks to receive responses from these people. When I started seeing Dr. Pearl, I was on medication that put my pain levels at a 4/10. Dr. Pearl put me on medication that made me dangerously tired (Lyrica) and eventually advised me to discontinue it. When I asked for something to replace the Lyrica, she suggested that I take Lyrica. That's not a typo - she told me to stop taking Lyrica and then suggested I try taking Lyrica. She switched my pain medication that was working to something that doesn't last as long nor control pain as well as the medication that I was taking when I started in her practice and then kept telling my doctor to reduce the amount of that medication each week. I called her office sobbing and left multiple messages. They never called me back. My doctor tried contacting her as well - no phone calls nor emails were returned. I am now at a 6/10 pain thanks to the ignorance and lack of care at this facility. Avoid them at all costs because they do not have time for you, don't care about your needs, and will make you feel worse than when you started. Shame on Dr. Pearl for calling herself a pain management specialist. You ignore your patients that you've put into worse off positions than when they sought help from you.

I'd give 0 stars if I could.|Staff has always been caring and helpful. In the 8 years with the practice, I have had great success with Dr Pearl.|Very unprofessional doctors and staff

Excellent experience!!  I had severe sciatica in my left hamstring and glute in the middle to late August of 2024 to the extent where I couldn't stand or sit upright.  I tried many things to try and improve my situation, but was unsuccessful.

I then got a referral to Maragel Medical.  My life took a dramatic change for the better due to their wonderful staff, expertise, and treatment.

Their unique three-prong approach of chiropractic adjustment, physical therapy, and nutritional education has transformed me from a middle-aged man (55 years old) to when I was in my 30's.  I have gradually lost my weight from 219 to currently 195 with close to three more weeks to go on the diet I have implemented as a result of their guidance.

The founders of Maragel, chiropractors, technicians, physical therapist, and receptionists are first class. column40:
Looks like the 1 star reviews are from 3+ years ago.
I've been a patient here since 2011. I go regularly, every 3 months. Hence, the 5 stars.
I may spend 5 minutes in the WR before I'm called to a procedure room. A nurse and a fellow greet you; again, under 5 minutes and the nurse is always there.

The fellow, who has finished med school + their 4 year internship with a specialty in anesthesiology,  is becoming a fellow in this specialized field of pain management. They will usually insert my medicine. The internship at this pain clinic is VERY prestigious and accepts about 8-10 people per year. It's quite an accomplishment for them and they are thrilled that they are there. One of the reasons why this program is so competitive to be accepted into is because of the physicians. They are well known in their field. The fellows WANT to learn from these doctors because of their experience and expertise in pain management medicine.

My MD is usually in the room, sometime during procedure. They don't rush me in & out! Both the fellow and my doctor will take all the time necessary with me. It's never a quick, rushed appointment.

The staff are very friendly; everyone there is. Initially, my doctor intimidated me. In the beginning,
I wasn't sure if I wanted to stay there. After almost 13 years, we have a great relationship. It just takes time to realize. As my husband initially said, it's almost like a marriage. We are stuck with each other. Again, this was almost 13 years ago.

I highly recommend this pain management center, conveniently located in Chestnut Hill.
Just my opinion.|Horrible clinic!! Doc I saw had their own agenda, made their own predetermination of a generic diagnosis, was very dismissive of detailed descriptive pages of notes, that i brought in each time, .Doc themselves spend less than 5 minutes with you but have their guru in training spend about 5-10 minutes first.When  a doc doesn't listen or seem to care, do yourself a favor, find a new one.. I did at another hospital and I am SO happy with my new pain management doctor!!!!! Best decision ever! BTW- It ends up that I do have exactly what I had been suggesting I had to the doc at 850 boylston, pain clinic, but had to suffer in extreme pain for over a yr, because they chose to have tunnel vision and not listen.|This place is a factory.
