column40:
Dr Kalava has resolved years of pain I have been experiencing.  For many years my back had been getting worse and worse to the point several.months ago that even walking around my own house and doing the basics of daily life was really difficult, slow and depressing because I was so uncomfortable. I had been in treatment with various chiropractors and spent thousands of dollars which helped only a small amount before it stopped being effective. I have only seen Dr Kalava a few times but his suggestions and treatment program have been incredibly effective (and no.. he did not just try to presribe gabapentin and call it a day) I feel better than I have in literally years. I have always been quite active until my back and nerve pain put a stop to it a few years ago. My mood is so much better with the reduction in pain because not being able to walk, sit, or even lay down without varying amounts of pain really depressing. I don't understand the bad reviews unless they are coming from people who who went to see him simply hoping for drugs and pain meds. His approach is more full and holistic and geared toward actually healing the cause  of your pain rather than just prescribi nh your discomfort away. I realize everyone will not have the fast results I did but i have been in treatment for this for literally YEARS elsewhere without genuine results. Big positive reviews from me . I could not be more pleased and more impressed and I am so pleased to be able to start getting back to my "real normal".|If he can't fix you with his surgical procedures, he will let you suffer for years in agony. He comes into the appointment, and does not even look at you. His back is at you the entire time while he types on the computer.

He asked me 3 times in one appointment if I had tried Lyrica... not paying attention to my answer, and clearly not remember HE was the one that prescribed it at one point!! He isn't listening, and he isn't paying attention.

There is only a very small subset of people that are treated properly here. I called in agony, and their nurse pointed me to a DOCTOR ON FACEBOOK. You HAVE to be kidding me??

If your pain is controlled with Gabapentin, this is your savior! If you have any type of complex pain that may require some thought or action... I highly recommend not wasting your time. It will just make make your mental health worse.

I'm finally out of there, so I can be honest about my experience.|Dr Kalava was amazing  during my appointment! He immediately knew how to treat my spine  .  I was treated with kindness and respect and I cannot say enough about his staff! They are wonderful, professional and take care of any questions or issues immediately!   A definite 5 !|I really like Dr. Kalava.  He's a very busy man, doing injections in between office visits.  So sometimes there's a bit of a wait.  But he has always answered all of my questions, tried all the different medications until we found what worked best for me, and he does my injections when I need them.  He's very business-like, so he isn't into joking around.  But that's fine, as I'm only there for pain management.  I don't have anything negative to say about him, and I've been seeing him for about 10 years.  He has an assistant, Allison Friberg, and she is also great.  I find them both very easy to talk to, and I'm never left with unanswered questions.  It's five stars from me for all of the office staff as well.  All in all, I couldn't say anything bad about any of them.  I feel blessed to be a patient there.|Dr Kalava is a very good doctor. He cares about his patients. He listens to you. He will find a way to help with your pain. Very knowledgeable and explains everything really well. Staff is caring.|Withheld medication as I couldn't get a visit for the next 3 months. Receptionist said "good luck without your pain medicine!" Look I'm not as addict, my meds are an anti depressant that works for fibro. Horrid staff and doctor once said "why are you here even?" To which I replied "because insurance makes me so I can get refills" He rolled his eyes and said he'll get me to an assistant instead|Personally have had a VERY VERY poor experience with this doctor and his office. I have been going back and forth with this doctor for over 2 years now receiving minimal to no results. He performed an RFA procedure on my lower back causing extreme nerve pain that lasted for months and months. Have rotated through several medications some with  some pretty bad side effects, and patches that worked but not well. This doctor and his office told me they were going to try this new patch for pain....but it was coming from Michigan. They wanted me to come in for a follow up to be seen after trying these patches......I never received the patches and when I contacted the office when they stopped providing refills of a different medication, they informed me that they don't know what's going on with the patches..... How can you not know??!!!

I've gone through 2 surgical procedures with this doctor. Both times I waited for over 45 minutes past my scheduled surgery time. It was ridiculous enough that the OR nurses were visibly irritated and were vocal about it.

The communication between the staff and the doctor is very poor. I always wait for over an hour for my appointment when being seen. This doctor will come into the room, completely unaware of your case, the procedures he has performed, and will ask you to remind him. He doesn't listen when you try to communicate with him either. The staff also never seems to know what is going on. I've made complaints to the office manager with no result.

The entire experience that I have had with this office has been so frustrating it has promoted me to write this review to warn others to stay away. If you want proper pain management care you will not receive it with this office and doctor. Thankful that my primary put in a referral to a different doctor and office when I requested. Hopefully my experience with a new office and doctor will be far better than my experience and care that I have received through this office.|Called to ask if accepting new patients, yes we are. I get all my information to them, they say you should hear back at end of week or beginning of next week.so by Wednesday of following week I call and leave message, they call next day and say oh Dr kalava isn't going to take your case. I ask why they say no specific reason givin sorry we can't take your case. So I say I will be up to pick up my records,and end the call. The office calls back and says we shredded your records, so now I have to go get copies of all my records again. So I wonder when did they shred my records,they have wasted so much of my time. And I can tell you why he didn't accept my case, it's because I advocate for myself. I would never recommend a Dr that turns away patients when accepting new patients because your advocating for your own well being. Thers no reason to turn me away in 9 years I have never had a bad urine screening, or bad pill count.  A drug addict takes med's to escape reality, were I take them to return to reality. Rant over ! Again a Dr turns you away without reason is NO Dr!

column3:
Specialized Relief for Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain

At Myofascial Pain Treatment Center, we specialize in providing effective relief for persistent musculoskeletal pain that hasn't responded to conventional treatments. Our approach combines thorough assessment with targeted therapies including dry needling and trigger point release techniques. We take pride in our comprehensive evaluation process, listening carefully to each patient's complete health history to develop personalized treatment plans. Our expertise extends to treating complex conditions including tennis elbow, chronic hip pain, neck restrictions, and debilitating shoulder issues that have often persisted for years. Located in Watertown, MA, we've helped countless patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and return to activities they love. Visit our website to learn more about our specialized pain management services or call us at +1 781-894-9430 to schedule a consultation at our clinic on 203 Arlington St #1.

Our Services Include:

  • Trigger Point Therapy - Targeted release of painful muscle knots

  • Dry Needling - Precision technique for deep myofascial release

  • Comprehensive Pain Assessment - Thorough evaluation to identify root causes

  • Personalized Treatment Plans - Customized approaches for complex conditions

  • Rehabilitation Guidance - Support for long-term pain management

column40:
I could not be happier with Erika as a practitioner. She is not only highly skilled at what she does but she is an excellent listener and very compassionate. Initially I went to Erika for a tennis elbow condition that persisted over one year. I had tried treating it through all the normal modalities without any effect. It took a few sessions of working on it as would be expected but now I can say I'm just about back to baseline and happy about it!
However, the best part was that I have had chronic left upper leg/ hip pain for 4 years that I did not expect her to be able to do anything about. however, because she is very thorough we ended up exploring this. I had had multiple x-rays, chiropractic work, etc., but nothing had helped. Erika acts somewhat like a Sherlock Holmes, she is just so interested in figuring out what's going on, she is always very thoughtful and curious in her quest to help me. Although my pain is not 100% resolved, the pain is  greatly reduced and I'm not finding myself thinking about my hip constantly. I don't have to constantly think about my movements and if the hip pain is going to wake me at night. I'm very grateful to her for this.
I cannot recommend this practitioner enough.|Erika was the only medical professional who was able to alleviate my husbands neck/shoulder/arm pain that was so extreme he would have been happy to amputate his arm.  He finally agreed to see Erika after ER docs, orthopods, and chiropractors tossed out diagnoses they had no great options for.  3 visits to Erika in the space of a week took care of my husbands pain and he has not had this issue since.  That was 13 years ago.  I recommended her to him based on my own 5 star experience where she successfully treated trigger points after I had gone down the traditional "you have rotator cuff tendinitis and need months of physical therapy" as prescribed by my PCP.  I recommend her to all my racquetball playing friends complaining of shoulder and arm pain.|Erika Bourne is an extremely kind, compassionate and skilled practitioner. I cannot say enough about the relief I have achieved from her treatments. I have a very complicated case and she has spent a great amount of time listening to my whole health history and putting together a treatment plan. I have had numerous injuries and accidents that have caused me to have severe, and at times very debilitating pain. After 20 years of trying massage, acupuncture, and chiropractic it all caught up with me in January 2020 and I was unable to get out of bed, walk or leave the house for 2-3 weeks. The pain was that severe. Once I started treatments with Erika I was like a new person. I have been to see her numerous times and it is a process, but I am already feeling significantly less pain, greater range of motion and I am able to exercise again for the first time in 5 years. I am actually having days where I have no pain which is something I have not been able to say for two decades.|I'm glad that she has helped people but she put me in disabling pain years ago her nails were digging into my shoulders and the dry needling went horribly wrong that's caused limited side to side up and down motion in my neck|

I had my 1st back epidural with Dr. Dominguez this a.m. and saw him a week prior to that for an initial assessment. On both times I had many questions for the Doctor and his staff. I was well informed and left there feeling extremely satisfied and having no problems at all. I have seen many doctors over the years and I wouldn't lie or exaggerate a review on a Doctor.
This Doctor to me was pleasant, cordial, professional, Great bed side manner. Treated me with respect and made me feel like I have had him for years.
He never got short or angry with me like some reviews have said.
I will recommend him to all my family and friends should they ever need the assistance of a Great pain management /  anesthesiologist  Doctor.
I hope this will help if someone is reading these reviews and is wondering " hmmm..is he good? Can I feel safe and well taken care of? ", etc.
Put your mind to ease. If you have questions ask the Doctor. Be completely open and honest with him and all his staff.
I have been in the Medical / Mental health field for 15+ years and have had and seen my share of Doctors who had that " complex " about them. Granted Doctor Dominguez is a Harvard Graduate, so that alone entitles him to respect and patients who can appreciate a man who has the background and experience such as Doctor Dominguez.
Well I hope this helps.
-Great bed side manner.
- More then happy to spend the time explaining and making patient feel comfortable
- Professional and courteous
- A dry wit, but has an affable affect.

Could go on but, I think you get the gist. If you are in need of a great Pain management Doctor, staff and organization, Saint Anne's is right there at the top.

Take care. Hope you feel better and remember, this man and his staff are well above average or good. Like I said. I am picky and very investigative when it comes to my body and who is caring for it.

This Doctor and staff are very, very good.

column2: Charles C Ho, MD at Pain Center at the Beth Israel Lahey Health Care Center
column3:
Expert Pain Management in Massachusetts

At the Pain Centers of New England, we provide specialized care under the leadership of Dr. Charles C. Ho, MD, a distinguished physician with over 20 years of experience in pain medicine. We're proud to be double board-certified in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, offering comprehensive treatment options at our Lahey Outpatient Centers in Danvers, Gloucester, and Newburyport. Dr. Ho completed his medical education at Temple University School of Medicine (now Lewis Katz School of Medicine) after earning his Bachelor of Science in Biology from Johns Hopkins University. Our practice focuses on delivering personalized pain management solutions through:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Multidisciplinary approaches to chronic pain

Our main Danvers location at 480 Maple St Suite 203 serves as our central hub where we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our Pain Centers of New England website or calling us at (978) 304-8601.
column11:
Charles C. Ho, MD, is a skilled and experienced Doctor of Medicine specializing in Pain Medicine and Anesthesiology at Pain Management Centers of New England at the Lahey Outpatient Center in Danvers, Gloucester, and Newburyport Massachusetts.

He is double board-certified in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and has been practicing for over 20 years.

Dr. Ho earned his medical degree from Temple University School of Medicine, now called Lewis Katz School of Medicine at Temple University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He also received a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland.

Dr. Lee is excellent. He uses various methods he feels work best after your evaluation to help alleviate pain. I felt results after only 1-2 visits. They are really caring, kind, knowledgeable, and professional healthcare professionals. Dr. Lee and the massage therapist here has helped me immensely with my injury and pain issues after a surgery and general pain from bad postures. I cannot recommend both of them enough if you have complex and lingering injuries/pain issues or you would like some good maintenance for physical health.|In terms of direct patient care, I had no complaints. The massage therapist I saw on several occasions was kind, professional, and attentive to my needs.

The environment was a little strange though, with rooms that have 7ft walls (meaning they don't go to the ceiling) and paper sheets over beds. It feels much more like a poorly cobbled together doctors office than a pain clinic or massage parlor.

I went here for 4 visits via the VA Choice program for therapeutic massage and on the third visit was accosted for a tip. When I told the gentleman at the front desk I had no cash but would happily tip on the next visit, he emphatically pushed me to withdraw money from an ATM next door at the liquor store. I refused and the next visit was my last.

I have no intention of returning to this thrown together establishment that lets customer service, environment, and patient care play second fiddle to their costs and overall environment. The feeling (and I stress it is a feeling, not something I have any proof of, other than the yelling of one therapist at the owner) I got is that the therapists and professionals here are grossly underpaid and rely more on tips than anything for their salary.

I feel so fortunate to have had the proveldge to be a patient of his for several years now and he has always steered me in the right direction for my best outcome. I have recommended many family members and friends to him who now are benefitting from the same expertise and success with pain management and procedures that I have had the joy of experiencing to get optimal pain management with all of my pain issues. There is no one I trust more when it comes to my health. He's more than generous when it comes to advice, even if it's something he needs to refer you to another Dr. He will put you in the best hands as though you were his own family member. You just don't see Dr's this dedicated anymore. It's such a mixed up messed up world out there. He just eases your fears and gives you hope, answers and truth and is the first to be open to thinking outside the box if things become complex. I just can't say enough good about this Dr. He truly Cares and you feel that every time you see him.|Love this doctor and facility. I'm treated so kindly, the doctor is phenomenal, Dr Washabaugh he has helped me with so much pain disorders. He performs the most advanced procedures for his patients and takes his time so you understand the condition and the treatment options. Thank you Dr. Bojrab, the wonderful front desk staff, and Zoe!

At Neuro Pain Consultants, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Bloomfield Hills and surrounding Michigan communities. Our dedicated team of pain specialists combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located at 359 Enterprise Ct in Bloomfield Hills, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to provide personalized treatment plans.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

Our physicians listen attentively to each patient's concerns, developing individualized treatment approaches that address the underlying causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms. column40:
The office is great. I am treated with respect and my wait time is less than 5 minutes.
Dr Lininger continues to take excellent care of me.  He listens and answers questions so that I  understand.
I highly recommend him.|Friendly front office and staff (nurse assistants etc). Trust Dr Wittenburg to give me good care ~ he is always kind and listens well. I have seen the PA, Marlene, as well and she is knowledgeable and kind.|Dr Wittenberg is very nice and shares information for your concerns. The quality was high and the knowledge base was great. Still working through some issues but I'm sure that will be addressed as always.  Great people in every aspect. Highly recommend|Dr. Sikorski has demonstrated a deep knowledge of his specialty, has been hands-on, and is always available to answer questions.  On two occasions over the past 14 years he has methodically found the lowest dose medications to effectively control my chronic pain that initially resulted from a surgery (and later recurred as a result of an accident), and he additionally treated me last year for back pain.  On the two occasions requiring significant pain medication, he has tapered me off the meds in a manner that has been relatively easy to tolerate.  Bottom line, he has been a real God-send for me and my family.|Excellent pain doctor, Dr. Wittenberg, has changed my husband's life with his accurate and super successful ablation on his back. He used to be couch bound but now can bicycle and go on walks without an aid. I highly recommend him. The staff are very friendly and professional, have never had billing or scheduling problems.|Neuro-Pain Consultants is an exceptional organization. The employees are kind, smart and organized. The doctors are the top in their field. I see Dr. Lininger who is an exceptional Doctor. He is experienced, patient, kind and is very skillful at giving injections. He has helped me so much. I am so grateful for his care and expertise! I highly recommend.|Whatever you do, do not see Lisa Provenzano. She made me feel like she understood me and cared, but then after about 3 appointments she flipped on me. I had told her I had a very long history with pain management and various treatments.  I explained that I naturally have always had a high resistance to medications of any kind even dental numbing. At one point she said to me, "stop trying to shove your sob story down people's throats,no one cares about your past". I responded telling her it was important to understand my past history with surgeries and pain management to be able to treat me going further. She then on a future visit told me after frustrating conversation and many snide comments that she thought I had only been on medication for a short while and told me I was an addict. I told her again my long history and reminded her why it was important to know someone's history as a dr, and that I was NOT an addict (confirmed later by 2 different doctors specializing on addiction. And that was just the tip of the iceberg. She called me a liar and that I was stupid for not knowing about a medication I had never tried. She screamed over and over that she couldn't help me anymore, that she would not help me anymore overand over and over. I asked her what would she do in my situation and she didn't even care. Keep in mind I had a 4 level fusion in my back last summer and a further surgery months later from infection from the previous surgery. So the level of pain I was in was understandable why I needed help. I asked her that if she couldn't help me then refer me to someone who could. She said she wouldn't do it and continued to scream that she couldn't help me. So i walked out crying and swearing I would never see her again. That's when I read all the other reviews on her when you search her name. Take it for what you will. Everyone has a different experience. I only say this to warn that you dont want to get on her bad side (which doesn't take much to be on).|Love the great care from Dr Wittenberg and his staff. Dr Wittenberg is outstanding at listening to patients and most importantly he knows what needs to be done to relieve pain. His staff make the experience as good as it can possibly be. A+

At Michigan Advanced Pain & Spine, we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions at our Warren, Michigan location. Our dedicated physicians, Dr. Martin Quiroga, DO, MBA, and Dr. Ramiro Perez, MD, specialize in identifying the underlying sources of pain and implementing innovative treatment solutions that effectively relieve discomfort and restore functionality.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We welcome patients aged 12 and up, offering specialized care for:

  • Complex pain management cases

  • Injuries unresponsive to conventional treatments

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

While many of our patients come through physician referrals, we encourage anyone experiencing pain issues to contact us directly to determine if our specialized services can benefit your situation. Our team is committed to providing exceptional care at our convenient Warren location, where we combine medical expertise with a patient-centered approach to help you regain control over your pain and improve your quality of life.
column11:
Michigan Advanced Pain & Spine in Warren, Michigan, provides compassionate and comprehensive care to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain. No matter what causes the pain, Martin Quiroga, DO, MBA, and Ramiro Perez , MD, determine the underlying source and provide innovative treatments that effectively relieve pain and restore function.
The team welcomes people aged 12 and up, managing complicated cases and injuries that don't respond to other treatments. Many people visit Michigan Advanced Pain & Spine via physician referrals, but anyone may contact the office to see if they can benefit from the team's care.

column2: Ryan Hijazi, DO - Minimally Invasive Pain Specialists
column3:
At Minimally Invasive Pain Specialists, we are led by Dr. Ryan Hijazi, a board-certified pain management specialist dedicated to treating neurological and musculoskeletal disorders.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We utilize evidence-based, non-surgical approaches to address both acute and chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Targeted medication management

  • Customized physical therapy programs

  • Advanced spinal injections

  • Innovative spinal cord stimulation

Our cutting-edge facility employs procedures validated by the latest research, ensuring effective outcomes for our patients. We take pride in our multi-disciplinary approach that thoroughly analyzes biomechanics, joint motion, and the condition of skeletal, nerve, and muscle tissues to develop personalized treatment plans. If you're seeking relief from persistent pain, visit our website or call us at +1 586-284-2643 to schedule your appointment at our Sterling Heights location.
column11:
Dr. Ryan Hijazi is a board-certified pain management specialist. He focuses on neurological and musculoskeletal disorders. He utilizes non-surgical methods such as medications, physical therapy, spinal injections, and spinal cord stimulation for the treatment of acute and chronic pain disorders.

Minimally Invasive Pain Specialists is a cutting-edge facility with procedures proven effective by the latest research. We are committed to providing a comprehensive and multi-disciplinary approach for each individual's pain complaints to provide the most appropriate care. Our approach includes analysis of biomechanics, joint motion, as well as skeletal, nerve and muscle tissues. Contact us to schedule an appointment!

column40:
My first visit was an excellent experience. They took my blood pressure four times because I felt the reading was a little high and I appreciated the verification without any difficulty. The doctor spent a good amount of time with me asking lots of questions about my pain and Made suggestions for options of relief that didn't include being medicated. He respected the fact that I didn't like pills and would prefer a more holistic approach. I have a follow up appointment in one month and I look forward to seeing the progress that I make. I'll definitely follow up if anything changes, but I don't see any problems with our communication. For clarification, I went to the Dearborn office.|They were good doctors at first but after a while I began to feel judged and profiled. Whenever I had to reschedule due to me or my children being sick, which has happened quite a lot over the last few months, they would get angry with me. They would push and push for surgery and it seemed if I didn't agree they would discharge me. My home life shouldn't have anything to do with them but I wasn't always able to see them or the surgeon but I made every attempt to communicate with them, they didn't seem to care. I told them I wanted to take care of some personal things and mental health before I agreed to the surgery and once again, they got angry with me. I had to reschedule, again, due to waking up with a high fever and when I called them, mind you it's a new year, they said I've rescheduled too many times and they're letting me go, when I've only reschedule once this new year, after giving me addictive medications and not offering a proper tapering agreement, now I'm having horrible medical issues due to their decision. Also, the front desk staff laughed at me, put me on speaker, and denied information when I told them about their high fever policy and asked about their board members information. I feel their decision was unjust and I would be apprehensive about your decision to receive care from this doctor.|The office staff ladies are wonderful always pleasant and professional. The office is always clean and never a long wait to be seen. The doctors are very knowledgeable and takes the time to listen to you and explains what's going on with you. I'm very grateful to have found such great care at Dr. Hijazi office. Keep up the great work.|The staff is very kind and efficient. Dr. Hijazi is wonderful. I am weird that I like to know exactly what is going on with my procedure and Dr. Hijazi learned this about me right away and since I was awake during my procedure he communicated with me as to what he was doing the whole time. He quickly learned what his patient needed to be comfortable and complied completely! Amazing!|They were very nice at the front desk. The PA was very thorough and asked a lot of questions.
Then the Dr. came in after he had talk to the Pa they are getting the MRI from where I had it done.
He asked me to come back in a week to have an injection in my back next week. Possibly increase my Gabpapentin to help with the leg pain so we will see but I thought he was very nice.|Dr Hijazi is a very good doctor. He is extremely knowledgeable about alleviating pain. He starts with the least invasive treatment and goes from there. He listens to me and we discuss treatment options.
I still have pain, which is why I am still his patient, but we continue to work towards a pain free future. When I have an appointment, I feel that he is focused , thoughtful, listening and always thinking of how to make things better. He notices when I am depressed about my pain and gives me encouragement. His staff is kind and helpful and his N.P. Is also knowledgeable and attentive. I would recommend his practice to anyone in need of pain management.|Had an excellent experience here with the  Physician Assistant. Everything went well. I signed a new contract, agreed to physical therapy and we'll take it from there. Hopefully I'll finally get some much needed relief. Dr. Hizazi came in, tried to lower my medicine and I said no. I'm here because I'm in pain "with" the medication. I'd recommend Dr. Hijazi and his team, they listen to you and addressed my issues and concerns. Surgery was mentioned and I went off. For the most part I was taken seriously and I'm not getting injections. Great job team. All around good experience. I'm also a breast  cancer warrior.|Highly recommend.

Dr. Hijazi is an excellent, understanding physician who really addresses your pain needs. He had the forethought to order referrals and tests that I needed and I was called by those facilities the next day to make my appointments. The referrals were sent immediately. I would recommend Dr. Hijazi  and the staff at MIPS to anyone who needs a pain clinic that gets you the treatment and medication you need without hassle. One of the best experiences I've had with a doctor.

Don't set foot near those fraud of medical treatment then over charging medicare for many treatments I wasn't there for after catching their illegal billing this all transpired with no treatment for 68 year old man causing Elder abuse far past normal practices for medical professionals|I just wanted to make u guys aware of an incredibly awesome medical assistant that is under your employ.

Don't bother wasting your time with this prancing new shoe man an his joke of a staffers who don't care about you or your pain issues. They can't help you with anything but cashing in on us stupid older adults with horrible pain. Don't let the big herds sitting in loddy fool you. Their all waiting for nothing cause he's not humanly capable of any thought other then spending his big wind fall of cash flow going through that office. Ineffective pain management if he was trained they all forgotten first oath they've all taken. Stay clear of this place of horrors, they only make you worse. Leave you with nothing but finding other real professionals who do what they can to help.|If not for the circus I had to deal with today I would give a 5 star review. However, I had an appointment for Dr. Shenava scheduled for TODAY that was scheduled nearly a month ago. All of my appointments are scheduled for the same day because I live so far away and I have to find someone to drive me. He cancelled my 1:30 appt at NOON, AFTER I was already in the building (and had spoken with the receptionist in person for an early check-in) and wanted me to come back next week. I told them to cancel the appt for next week as I COULD NOT be there and keep today's appt as I was ALREADY there. They refused and told me to come back TOMORROW to see a different doctor (Dr. Rampersaud). I asked to schedule the appointment for the next date that I would be there (in November) and was told they would get back to me today and let me know. I have 3 other doctors in the building who I HIGHLY recommend (Neuro - Dr. Chaudhry, Ortho - Dr. Sarmast and Dr. Schupbach) but after the b.s. today I would definitely NOT recommend Dr. Shenava!! I am hoping to hear back from Dr. Rampersaud's office soon regarding an appointment.|This place has turned into a joke. On 9-18-24 I went in for my monthly visit and had a new dr., dr. Khan. He was so rude, and just because I wouldn't agree to let him put some implant into my shoulder, he really got rude and took me off from my pain meds that I have been on for almost 10 years. I have been going there for quite a few years now and NEVER have I been treated so bad. I think they are trying to expand their place now because they call their self a "surgical hospital" now. It always used to be just "Insight pain management".  So if you're a patient there, and don't agree to let them perform some weird procedure on you, be aware. They have always been a helpful place when you have chronic pain but now it seems that is no longer the case. He tried to replace my pain meds with some pill that most likely would have interfered with my depression and anxiety that I have had for a long time now, as well as my sleeping issue, according to the paperwork I received with the meds.
You sure can tell by the way you're treated there now days that it's ONLY about the money. If you don't let them use you for a science project so they can bill the crap out of your insurance then they just drive you away.|This is a warning to anyone who is forced or needs to come here. Don't! Find another place and avoid this place at all costs. They are not honest doctors they do not take their Hippocratic Oath seriously at all. They do not care for you as a patient or your needs,  only more ways to line their pockets. Their facility is run down, stains on the floor and every person down to the check out people are rude. I had the absolute displeasure of being a patient of Julie Winiskes and Dr. Dr. Siva K. Sripada, DO. They should be ashamed to call themselves health professionals. They will lie and do whatever it takes to protect themselves for any medical malpractice or unethical practice. It will be their word against yours. I could not begin to explain what my last years have been like with them but a stark warning..do not ever question their practice methods or argue with them for something they have done wrong. I am relieved to not be a patient here anymore! Stay away!!! Far away!|Dr. Khan only wanted to treat his way and doesn't listen to his patients. Kept pushing Botox and nerve injections even after multiple tries that made me worse. Wouldn't transfer to another Dr. Found out they have in house rule if you refuse to see one Doctor at insight you won't be allowed to see another or pick your own. Illegal.|I have been going to pain management here ever since the first week they opened the pain clinic. I have never had any issues until recently. I saw Dr Shah many years ago for back injury and he referred me to the new clinic that was about to open. Over the years I had to have surgeries from Dr. Shah. I was on permanent disability and between Dr. Shah and pain management they got me back to work. My arthritis has gotten much worse and I am requiring more injections. I have very good insurance (teacher insurance-messa) now they are trying to not do sedation but I thrash around too much. So now I can't schedule my appts. I have to be called and it takes twice as long to get my injections. When the injections wear off I go from 6 to 10 pain level and there is no relief. My insurance never refuses my sedation so I believe the person who does pre authorization has too much on their plate because I call my insurance company ever time and the tell me they have not heard from insight yet and the authorize most stuff same day. Something needs to be done with this and I feel they are just trying to save money by switching to oral or nurse sedation so the do not have to pay for a CRNA. Dr. Shah, Board of Directors or someone needs to fix this for the people that wants real help not medication.

column3:
At Metro Pain Clinic, we believe that pain is never just a condition to manage—it's a symptom pointing to an underlying cause. Under the leadership of

Dr. Nazih Iskander

, our practice is founded on the philosophy that effective pain management requires identifying and treating the root cause rather than merely addressing symptoms. We provide comprehensive, nonsurgical pain treatment through a holistic approach that considers the whole person. Our specialized services include:

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations and diagnostics

  • Acupuncture and alternative therapies

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Physiotherapy and physical rehabilitation

  • Customized pain management programs

Located in Southfield, Michigan, our team of dedicated professionals works collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs. We invite you to experience the difference at Metro Pain Clinic, where we're committed to helping you achieve lasting relief and improved quality of life. Contact us today at +1 248-212-0256 to schedule your consultation at our office: 21751 W Eleven Mile Rd #215, Southfield, MI 48076.
column9: Doctor|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Physiatrist|physiotherapist|Sports medicine physician
column11: Dr. Iskander's philosophy in pain management is that pain is a symptom and should never be treated as a disease in itself. There is always a cause behind the pain and if this cause is not diagnosed early and treated properly, then we are just tackling the branches, not the root of the problem. We provide a broad range of nonsurgical and holistic pain treatment programs.

Nice one doc. I also left office with high blood pressure and no refills no concern at all. My blood pressure due to pain not being controlled and mind you he did send hospice my way. Killer much?|For working with people in pain and chronic illness, the front desk ladies are the most impersonal ladies I've met in a doctors office. I arrived at my appointment time but was told I couldn't be seen because I didn't arrive 20 minutes early to fill out paperwork. I apologized and said we had trouble getting on the road as my purse was stolen from the apartments that morning. She already had attitude and asked for my ID, I said I don't have that either but have a photo of it I could email or have my office fax it to her. She said it was fine if my office faxed it as long as she had something on file. She went back and spoke with another woman and they stood at the computer telling me he had no other openings that afternoon and to come back. He had been with a patient so couldn't ask him. It would've taken two seconds for one of my coworkers to fax over my ID and I could've done the paperwork for as long I was waiting there and the doctor wasn't even ready for me yet. I understand patients need to come with all these things and I should've called but if it was okay why cancel and make me come back? Our office sends quite a few patients here and Dr. king came highly recommended for my situation. I'm saddened his office staff doesn't seem to uphold those same standards or take 5 minutes out of their day to act like they care about patient care. I've been waiting a long time to be seen and sat in my car and cried. I didn't even get offered a Kleenex or any sort of acknowledgement on my way out. This isn't an office I would recommend if you're looking for compassion from your health care team.|Dr. King is incredibly knowledgeable and personable. He thoroughly listened and has been a champion and advocate for my unique pain issues caused from Shingles. Yeas, often times there can be a longer wait to see him but I've realized when he's met with me, he never rushes me or makes me feel like my situation isn't his top priority.  He will stay with me until I feel completely comfortable and knowledgeable about our plan of care.  I imagine he does that same level of care with all of his patients so it's worth the wait in the office.  Dr. King has been progressive in his approach to my pain.  I'm also impressed that he's able to perform many procedures in office without the need for a referral to another specialist or another location.|Update:
Dr. King called me and we spoke about the matter. I appreciate that he called and talked over the issues I had with what happened. He was very professional and even offered to recommend me elsewhere if I chose to not come back to his office. I decided I would return to his office. I have an appointment tomorrow.

I am very disappointed in Dr. King's office. On what would have been my third appointment I was running a few minutes and I called to say that. By the time I got through on the phone I was getting ready to pull in, whoever answer told me I was fine. Then someone else yelled I couldn't come. So I said I'm here I'll just come in. So I came in and they said after 10 minutes they cancel. I said it's literally just 10 minutes. I asked to speak to a manager.  I waited at least 10'minutes for someone to come out, she also said they wouldn't see me. I told her this was a follow up on injections and they hadn't helped and also the medication prescribed wasn't helping and that my husband has took the day off. I also told her the last time I was there,,there was a woman talking with another patient and she hadn't finished her paperwork and the nurse and the desk girls were saying she was 4 minutes past her appointment and the still seen her. Then they informed me I was seeing someone named Matt who was a PA and not the doctor. I was told he said no. She asked if I wanted to reschedule and I said no and asked her if she could please let the Doctor know what was going on and my feelings. I waited again and she came back and told me they still said no. I honestly didn't know if I wanted to scream or cry. Being in constant pain is hard enough, and then to wait weeks for appointments and be turned away for being 10 late and having called to tell them. I will not be returning to
Dr.King's.|The lack of communication or not calling back was bad enough, but the final straw is taking my money for a shot that I never received and only give me back a portion of it because "you talked to the doctor, so it counts as an office visit" it's not even supposed to be in office visit because it was supposed to be a shot so now I am out a lot of money for a waste of time for no services I have received if you're in a lot of pain, I suggest finding a different pain specialist.|Worst pain management ever. Dr. King wanted to take me off the meds that work and put me on cymbalta. Its an anti anxiety drug that isn't supposed to be taken by people with heart issues and I had a heart attack 6 months ago. It also isn't supposed to be prescribed to diabetics and he obviously didn't read my chart. I was discharged because I refused to take cymbalta then his pa said he knew my dr outside of work and was going to talk to her. That is a violation of the hippa laws he doesn't have permission to speak to anyone about my case not even my primary I set it up that way cause I have had too many problems with pain doctors. I would not recommend him or his offi to anyone worst ever|I can't believe the negative post I have been reading. I have been going to Dr. King for about 8+ years. I was actually his 3rd patient when he started. I have NEVER been mistreated by him or his staff. I have seen several pain doctors over the past 20 years, and he is the ONLY one who taught me how to control my pain. I used to be on several pain meds, but now I take 1 and only as needed. Instead of the meds, he uses different procedures to help the pain. I have CRPS (Complex Regional Pain Sydrome), which is the most painful disease you can have. There is no cure. I get urine tests frequently, and if something shows up, they talk to me with care to see what supplement I may be taking to cause concern. I have referred several people to Dr. King and will continue. Thank you to Dr. King and his staff for always being kind and professional. I'd give you a 10 if I could.|He's personable and friendly. However, if you're in severe pain Do not go here. It will be a suffering contest for you and he will question your toughness when you need compassion. My pain was so neglected I left with permanent arrhythmia problems because he questioned other doctors diagnosis. There's a vast difference between exemplary medical care and being completely incompetent.

column2: Toma Spine & Pain - Bryan Toma, M.D.
column3:
At Toma Spine & Pain, we are dedicated to bringing the newest advancements in pain treatment to adults suffering from chronic pain in Dearborn, Michigan. Our practice is led by Bryan Toma, M.D., a board-certified Anesthesiologist and Interventional Pain Specialist who utilizes cutting-edge technology to help restore function and quality of life for our patients.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

We emphasize minimally invasive, research-driven techniques that deliver fast, effective, and cost-efficient relief without the risks associated with major surgery. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Minimally invasive spine treatments

  • Customized pain management plans

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

We proudly accept all chronic pain patients, regardless of perceived complexity, and are committed to providing compassionate care in a comfortable environment. Contact us today at +1 313-998-8662 to schedule an appointment at our conveniently located office at Toma Spine & Pain, 2841 Monroe St Second Floor, Dearborn, MI 48124.
column11:
Toma Spine & Pain is bringing the newest advancements in pain treatment to adults suffering from chronic pain in Dearborn, Michigan. The practice is led by Bryan Toma, M.D., a board-certified Anesthesiologist, and Interventional Pain Specialist.

Our approach emphasizes minimally invasive, research-driven techniques that help our patients achieve fast, effective, and cost-efficient relief without the risk of major surgery. Dr. Toma utilizes the latest technology in minimally invasive interventional techniques to help restore and maximize the function and quality of life of patients. We will accept all chronic pain patients, no matter the perceived complexity. Contact us to schedule an appointment.
column38: Msmsisrs S|David Mallinger|Tina|Michelle E|Gaye Smith|Jennifer Sano|jeremy shuford|Diana Nelsen
column40: I was skeptical at first. Dr. Toma is awesome, his bed side manner and attitude is always reassuring and makes the visit pleasant. office staff is good, been through some changes over the last year. noticed a lot of good changes coming forth for Dr. Toma. Highly Recommend|I had been dealing with sciatica pain for over 6 months. Done all the different recommendations, stretches, chiropractor. I was a miserable bastard. Nothing helped until my specialist recommended pain management. So they set me up Dr. Toma, I understand that there many pain management places. Dr. Toma takes the time to explain everything, even when he's doing a procedure he talks you through the whole process. His staff is very friendly and caring and always smiling.|Always very helpful here. Very smart Dr and the staff is always friendly. I have had a few back procedures here and they may not have always worked for me but I do know that I am in good hands while they're being done. Thankful to have such a great Dr finally in the downriver area who understands back pain and offers many different solutions based on your needs. Thank you Dr Toma and staff for always being so helpful and kind!|It was really nice meeting everyone today! Everyone was so sweet and nice! Dr Bryan Toma sat with me and explained everything he wanted to do to help me with my back! Thank you to all! I can't wait to come back and see how everything is going in 6 weeks!|From the first scheduling to the last goodbye on my appointment day, this practice was AMAZING!!  The ladies at the front desk were all super friendly, professional, and helpful.  Dr. Toma was also super friendly, professional, so nice, and explained everything in detail.  I would recommend this practice to anyone dealing with pain that needs some type of help and management!|Dr. Toma is an excellent doctor and his Associate is a great person. Wonderful staff. My pain is so much better and I am very thankful. I highly recommend Dr. Toma for extremely high quality care|Place was clean. Front desk lady's very nice and very helpful.  The guy that checked me in the room and did my paper work was great, absolutely loved his energy.  The doc was very personable, understanding, I am a recovering brain surgery patient and certain things have became hard for me....he made talking so easy.  First time I felt someone heard me and had a true care to resolve my issue.  This was my first visit but I feel like I will be a patient for a long time.  Thanks for making me feel so at home.|Been going to Dr. Toma for a couple of months now. I have quite a few issues. He is very kind and knowledgeable, and seems to genuinely care about helping his patients. His staff are very caring and friendly.  Never a long wait so far. All of the procedures I have had done have went well and were just about painless. Thank you guys.  See you guys soon to kill off this headache once and for all!   It's ablation time next!! Dr. Toma eased my mind a little on this. Thank you.

column3:
At Comprehensive Pain Specialists, we are dedicated to providing exceptional pain management solutions for patients throughout the Saginaw area. Our team of specialized physicians offers personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions with compassion and medical expertise.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We provide a full spectrum of pain management treatments including:

  • Interventional pain procedures and injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Medication management

  • Nerve ablation procedures

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

Located at 4450 Fashion Square Blvd in Saginaw, our modern facility is equipped with advanced technology to deliver the highest standard of care. We understand that living with chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take a multidisciplinary approach to help our patients regain function and improve quality of life. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website or call us at +1 989-792-4090.
column38: Megan Waddell|Jeff Lamoria|Michelle Long|Melinda Stanfill|Dave|Kimberly Bullock|Cody Lee|Felicia Hull
column40:
I can't say enough positive things about CPS. I had my first injection today with Dr. Ortega, and him and all the nurses went so far above and beyond to help me feel comfortable. Genuinely empathetic and compassionate people. They made such a tough experience into one that that didn't make me feel so alone. They are the some of the first people that have really validated my struggles with pain and gave me hope for the future. Very grateful to have found them!|They want you to do everything they want. Fill out the questionnaire but they never read it. I said on it I was depressed on 9 for 3 questionnaires. So they don't read them or they don't care about the patient. But when your 5 minutes late for your appointment when they had a full room of patients like the last 3 times there. They where running 45 minutes to a hr late. So don't get mad and say to them while walking out that you should find a new pain clinic. They where not bad till they moved to saginaw and the nurse practitioner took over and the doctors where doing there there prosegers in the back of the clinic.  Then they send your records to all your doctors that they make you out as a drugey. I can't figure it out that they say all that to your doctors. If I was that bad whey did I get my pills every 3 months, and there drug tests are a joke.|This place is terrible! Don't go here! They take advantage of you because they know that you need your pain meds and charge you for ridiculous things, like borrowing the books in the office. They charged me $150 for having 4 books out for six months. I returned them and they said if I don't pay the $150 I can't be seen! Constant drug screenings that insurance doesn't pay for, and don't be a few minutes late, because they will turn you away! Strongly suggest  that you not use this place!|I had been going here for almost two years seeing Dr E. He's been fine and I agreed with his original plan of care. He wanted me to go off what meds I currently was on and go on methadone. Well the last 6 months I found out I have a autoimmune deficiency disease and several heart problems which is severe. I am frequently ill from numerous pneumonia episodes, sypsis, and anemia and hospitalization. Come to find out my family Dr and heart Dr didn't think methadone was a good med for me to be switched to, so what does this place say...IF they don't want you on the med "I want you on" then have that Dr write your scripts. What a A!! Been there yrs and get told in a round about way told...we don't care about your health you either do as we say or leave. This place is all for injections and nerve ablation procedures on your spine which don't work and after they don't work they ignore that fact and then just keep pushing for more procedures. They make money on over Thousand dollar procedures not just a office visit to write or refill you a script. So unless you make them money they'll slowly become hard to work with and force you out. They do not care about your health and NEVER EVER TELL THEM YOU ARE UNHAPPY OR WHAT YOUR OPINION IS or they'll say we don't think things are working out here's a 30day script and find a different pain dr to see you. Funny  I've called several different pain drd and all are atleast a 6-12month period of a wait. I was in hospital w a heart attack while I'm in the ER, the nurse and office manager call me double tag teaming me on speaker ..yelling "how dare I say im unhappy with their service and the nurse yells why are you in the hospital??? I say CRYING WITH PAIN HAVING A HEART ATTACK and the nurse in the background says oh she's gonna cry now,  they don't stop harassing me on thr phone they continue to be rude and say what I complained about to the office about after my last appointment was borderline offensive...OMG all while im getting a IV for heart meds to save me..How kind they are. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE ITS ALL ABOUT THE BENJAMINS NOT YOUR CARE CAUSE THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT YOU AT ALL ONLY $$$. THEY ARE FAKE NICE AT FIRST BUT YOU WILL DO AS THEY SAY OR LEAVE YOU IN MORE PAIN THAN YOU WENT TO THEM FOR!!.RUN! ILL BE JUST FINE WITHOUT THEM.|I have been going here for many years.Dr.Papenfuse has been my main Doctor here.For a long time I didn't have a General family doctor and he went above and beyond to help me..I have had neck fusion lower back fusion and much more he installed a stimulator and many treatments. When I had stomach issues he got me a general dr that found 2 bleeding ulcers. No one was helping me and he did.The staff there have always been so good.Ruby a nurse has went above and beyond also and the scheduling department has also helped with changes .If you have chronic pain these people help.Dr.Eagleson also has been great.|Was a patient here for 13 years. I liked and trusted Dr Lingenfelter and found Papenfuse competent. I loved my long term nurse Margaret and when she retired, Nicole.
I was a few minutes late to my appointment last week because I had my time mixed up, the receptionist refused my appointment and would not give me any advice or referrals even though I was begging. She condescendingly said "no begging".
I trusted this place completely when they prescribed opioids and told me I would need to be on them the rest of my life. I didn't ask to be on this addictive medication! Of course I'm going to become dependent on it when prescribed it for so long.
I've never once abused it and could not believe that she wasn't trained to offer some kind of help or advice when they won't see you for being late.
People die from opioid withdrawal!
I am sick, in terrible pain and miserable still, seven days later but I will not be a slave to their pharmaceuticals anymore.
They will not get another dime of my money.
Run away as fast as possible!!!|The 'contact us' page of the website appears to not work since the website has been updated. There's no confirmation that shows if your message was actually sent or not.

Recently had multiple back surgeries and can't find a pain clinic located in the tri citys that takes my insurance or doesn't have a waiting list that you can't get on

I've been trying to go to this clinic for a few years and have reached out multiple times. When the Bay City office was open I called and was told there's a waiting list. After calling 2 years later they told me the waiting list was extended and to just keep checking back.

Before I had surgery my family doctor sent over a referral and then told me comprehensive pain specialists said they don't take my insurance (Mclaren medicaid). However, when I reached out to CPS through their website and sent a message I was told Mclaren Medicaid is the only type of medicaid they currently accept.

I sent a second email about making an appointment and never got any response back.|My provider Dr Eagleson has been a caring compassionate doctor. I am glad to finally to finally be in a clinic that is helping me find the root of my problems instead of pushing them aside. Finally I can hopefully get some relief. Overall the clinic staff has be very responsive and I've had no issues. Thank you so much Dr and clinical staff.

Our team is led by physicians Jeffrey Rosenberg and Fawad Rizvi, both dual-board-certified in anesthesiology and pain medicine, who are committed to improving each patient's quality of life. We've successfully helped thousands of individuals suffering from various pain conditions regain control of their lives.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of advanced treatment options for:

  • Back pain management

  • Cancer pain relief

  • Nerve blocks and injections

  • Physical therapy

  • Medication management

  • Interventional procedures

Our state-of-the-art facility in Canton combines medical expertise with compassionate care to create personalized treatment plans for each patient. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take a holistic approach to pain management. Visit Prizm Pain Specialists at 6200 N Haggerty Rd #400, Canton, MI 48187, or call us at +1 734-526-8860 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column9: Medical Center|Medical clinic|Mental health service|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Physiotherapy Center
column11:
PRIZM Pain Specialists is a comprehensive, multi-specialty pain treatment/pain management clinic devoted to helping people throughout Southeastern Michigan. We've helped thousands of people with back pain, cancer pain, and other forms of chronic pain find the right treatment solution.

Our physicians Jeffrey Rosenberg and Fawad Rizvi are both dual-board-certified in anesthesiology and pain medicine and devoted to improving every patient's quality of life.
column38: Ale Whyms|John F|Tony K|Happy Couple|Brooke Hochkins|Alfred Brock|Jacki Gonterman|Nick Eaton
column40:
If your doctors are going to be Chronic Pain specialist, then they should be cognizant of what chronic pain does to the every day person and the toll it takes just to get by every single day. There are those who pain prevents them to make it on time. I understand at the end of the day, you all have a business to run and so things have to function in a specific order. If you are going to have a "No-Late" policy, that's fine. I think it's deeply impersonal and inconsiderate to the patients you SPECIFICALLY tend to, but if that's how you need to run a business, sure. But don't tell someone they can "Come on in!" when they call ahead of time and say they're going to be 10 minutes late just to only receive a call back 20-30 minutes later and tell them how they're inconsiderate to the staff and their specialist. DRIVING AN HOUR TO COME OUT TO YOU and FOREWARNED your desk TO BE considerate and NOW you want to tell someone off? I am OVERWROUGHT with disappointment and CLEARLY you all do not have the specialty you say you have. I will never recommend someone to come here. No one who's dealing with pain EVERY DAY of their life needs to be talked to in such an inhumane way.|Wow! I had so much pain. Another clinic told me I should not do my sport again. I was very distressed and disappointed. I came to Dr. Rosenberg as a last resort before throwing in the towel. After seeing him and going to Kees for physical therapy, I was improving and able to get back to gymnastics again. I'm feeling amazing, it's incredible the difference a doctor that cares makes. Thank you Prizm Pain Specialists!|Dr.Brennen is compassionate, caring and a kind person. Would recommend to anyone suffering with a low quality of life due to pain or ailments.  Prizm has been amazing and their staff are all wonderful.|My experiences so far here have been excellent.   Very helpful staff.  Easy to make appointments.  I had severe acute lower back nerve pain.  Dr. administered two steroid shots about 7 weeks a part. Procedure was quick and smooth.  No anesthesia.  I also had PT.  I feel the steroid shots did the trick.  I feel 85% better and am happy with the results.   Now I just need to keep stretching and exercising.  Fortunately my issues weren't worse.  Good luck everyone.|After talking to the office on the phone just now, I am editing my review down to 4.  The doctor talked to me about Ketamine infusions for my pain and mentioned I should try to see a rheumatologist at my eval this morning. I called back this afternoon to confirm when we would schedule the ketamine and they said they don't want to do anything until I see the rheumatologist, which was not clear at all in the appointment. It sucks as a chronic pain patient to once again get shoved off to another doctor and know you're back to living in pain like normal.
---------------------------------
I had my chronic pain eval today and I loved everything about Prizm Pain! The staff was friendly and kind, from the front desk check-in to the nurse assistant. Dr. Rosenberg was patient and caring - he listened to all my concerns and talked about various options without judging or making assumptions. We came up with a plan together and for the first time in a long time I finally have hope I may find some pain relief for the first time in two years. I highly recommend Prizm Pain to any Fibromyalgia or chronic pain sufferers!|A wonderful staff and highly capable doctors make me feel safe and secure.  The offices are easy to get to with plenty of parking.  Handicapped access is not a problem.|I've been  going to Prizm Pain Clinic for about 4 years.  My pain is under control with meds and shots. My caudil shot works about 7 months before it's needed again. thats me. Everyone  is different.  I go for appts at the Livonia office, and the procedures are in Canton. I love my PA'S Tim and Katie, plus my Dr. Rizvi. I'm so glad I found them.|Fawad was a waste of my time, after a hour waiting past my appointment time to fawad not listening to a word that was said. Even answered his phone in middle of me talking was amazing. His attitude and ignorance needs a reality check..

I see the owner replied, what are you talking about? We didn't talk about what to do next all he did was literally dismiss everything that was all my doctors are a joke my physical therapist was a joke and so on. His attitude was complete shyte. Rolling his eyes n so on..

But yea good attempt at trying to make it seem I wouldn't follow his order of care  how can that be when he didn't give one ?

column40:
This place is an absolute joke. The doctor doesn't care if you're in pain if you're young and don't physically look miserable. I have to correct the PA on pharmacy and insurance procedures, and after corrected, all of a sudden, it's against office policy. Do not waste your time if you want someone to actually listen to how you feel. Especially don't go if you plan on doing something else with your day because you will wait at least an hour before they call you back and then another 45+ minutes waiting for a physician. And the wait time for a procedure.... bring yourself dinner.
What happened to doctors caring about quality of life? Absolute joke...|What does Dr Tarabishy look like??? My first 2 visits I was seen by P.A. Marissa, she was very professional. My 3rd visit was for an epidural by the doctor which went fine, but laying face down I never saw his face nor did he talk to me.  NO bedside manner by the doctor or his male assistant Simon.  I was told they recently moved to the office, but not a picture or clock anywhere. Now that I'm established with this practice, if I need to go back I hope I  see improvements. Maybe even get a look at the doctor??? Ya think?|Extremely long waits i.e. 2 or 3 hours past appointment times. office was a mess from construction, the staff was friendly,  but constantly screwed up paperwork and billing . If i hadnt called insurance to see what was going on my procedure was getting denied do to the fact the office never submitted the required paperwork. the procedure room was disgusting with spilled fluids all over the floors , cabinets and equipment . You don't actually see the dr you are dumped off on a p.a. for the normal appointments.  The p.a. ordered un necessary extremely expensive tests and never followed up . when dr came in for the procedure I tried to ask some questions and he clearly didn't want to be bothered answering them .as he would walk away to a far corner of the room and answer with his back turned to me . My first appointment I encountered a patient screaming and throwing a fit because she had waited an entire day in the office " seemed like she was seeking some drugs" this whole office is an disorganized inept disaster from top to bottom.|Do yourself a favor if you want to see a doctor who cares DO NOT COME HERE! I repeat DO NOT come to this office. After 10 months wasted with NO  results for pain relief and also the doctor didn't show up to my scheduled appointments TWICE!!!!! Being completely lied too and hearing from the staff that the doctor is sorry he couldn't make time to see me because they were back up as I was a scheduled patient and waiting there for 4 hours for my appointment is ridiculous! Then the staff says the Dr will
Call tomorrow to speak to you and then NEVER calls!! This place is a joke!!! I would NOT recommend!!!|The doctor actually listens to me, and he treats me with respect. He took the time to explain my MRI with me and the treatment plan. I love Julie at the front desk. She is sweet, considerate, understanding, and knows my name. Which is comforting and relaxing to me. The whole staff makes you feel comfortable and are very friendly.|Dr T and his staff are professional, caring, wonderful human beings. I've had issues and emergencies and they have always said just come in, we will make it work. No other Specialty Dr has treated me so kindly.  Dr T truly cares about his patients and improving their quality of life.  His staff can't be beat, Marissa, Larissa, Mel, Caroline, Zainab, Hass, MO, Simon, Hailey and more all care just as much as doc. We are blessed to be able to have our treatment with Dr Tarabishy.|They have been great! Trying to get rid of my back pain! Staff is very nice and helpful!
Dr. Tarabishy has been very good at trying to figure out what it is I need. Had an epidural and 2 ablations, ( which didn't work) however he is committed to finding out what to do next to alleviate my back pain! Very kind and listens to my concerns. Also very knowledgeable! He placed the immolation t in and it is working well!!!|Dr. Tarabishy, Jen, Simon, Shelby, and the entire staff are great! Professional and caring. I don't feel like a number. They take their time and listen to your individual concerns and find solutions for YOU! After a few different pain clinics, I have finally found the right place. Very Thankful. A+

column40:
I have never experienced a more disorganized office. I had a reaction to the steroid used (Kenalog) in the cervical epidural by Dr. Minott.  I called the office with my symptoms:  red face, sky rocketing blood pressure, confusion. They told me to go to the ER and I did. Fast forward three months and Dr. Minott gave me another injection of Kenalog. It wasn't in my patient care plan. I didn't know she was doing it. Insurance company rejected it in the pre-approval request. Again, I landed in the ER. This time for three days. I may have had a mini-stroke. Do NOT go here. They do not write things down and the office staff doesn't communicate with each other or the doctors. Dr. Wiener gaslighted me and claimed Kenalog doesn't cause the symptoms I had. Evidently, he doesn't know his pharmaceuticals and doesn't use Google search.|Prolozone therapy

Health-wise, 2023 was the most challenging year for me. I was living with unimaginable pain for most of the year. Then, a "Miracle" prevailed - I have been without pain for over three months. I call "Miracle" the several doctors involved in my healing, each with different treatments, and I am genuinely grateful to each one.
I received  Prolozone therapy from Dr. Steven Weiner. Because of my other medical condition, I only received three treatments, which I believe did help in my final healing.
The correct diagnosis that my sciatica pain was caused by the piriformis muscle, not by a bulging disc as previously diagnosed was crucial in my healing process.
Dr. Weiner asks many questions, lets you ask many questions, and gives you the answers and advice regarding your concerns.
I highly recommend you consult with Dr. Steven Weiner at Michigan Interventional Pain Associates if you are in pain.
His friendly staff is always helpful.
Grateful,
Marina C Neves|I am so impressed with Dr. Wiener. I thought I needed surgery for my hip but after 3 treatments of ozone, I am free of pain. My other hip started to bother me so again I went to Dr. Wiener. And again, the pain is gone. If you are told you need surgery, please try this before going under the knife. It is a miracle treatment.|Dr Wiener and Dr Minott are both incredible and knowledgeable! They take their time and really listen. They offer alternative therapies and don't just push you into one option. Staff are all very pleasant as well. I highly recommend|My mom has been a patient there for about a year, she lives with me and suffers from chronic pain from multiple conditions. She went to have her pain medication refilled and we learned from CVS that there's a shortage. We called every pharmacy and hospital pharmacy in the area and there's no medication available. Multiple pharmacies told us doctor's, especially those who practice within pain clinics within the area are will aware of the shortage. This clinic closed for three business days. You're unable to leave a message. There's also no doctor on call or service to connect with. My mother is definitely withdrawing with no help. Talk about opening your practice up to liability.|Dr. Sharon Minott injured my tailbone while giving me an epidural for pain on my lower spine. The tailbone pain has not gone away and it's been many months. She admitted that she was to blame during a teleconference several days later. She wrote me a Rx for a cream to put externally, on my skin, for the pain. It was very expensive. Of course it didn't relieve the internal pain at all.|My experience at Michigan Interventional has been great.  Dr George is a good listener spent time with me to understand my problem.  It's not just the medication but the other therapies meant to reduce my pain.

In addition the staff is great,  you get in at the time of your appointment and don't wait long to see the doctor.

I recommend you go see Dr. George you will not be disappointed.|The staff was very pleasant and so nice. My brother went here for his neck pain and was very pleased with the doctors. They took time and listen to him and went over several treatment options with him. We have no complaints!
