column38: Jim Brandt|Paul Zdanio|Tom P|Diane Paonessa|Christina Erwin|Geri Kessler|Mary Kozak|matt gedda
column40:
I went from skeptical to a believer. After 9 months of lost sleep and difficulty walking due to back pain and sciatica I'm now sleeping well and back to normal activities. I had failed PT and injections and was discouraged.  I had heard the ads and testimonials for Pain Free Life and decided to try that rather than something more invasive. I began the 20 minute treatments 2-3 times a week around Thanksgiving and initially saw no benefit.  I was told from the start that you need to complete the series so I continued despite increasing skepticism. About 2/3 of the way through I felt the pain getting better and began sleeping well.  By Christmas I was back to a normal life. What a relief.  I completed treatments 2 weeks ago and continue to be comfortable.
The staff were all great. Appointments were on time and treatments very comfortable.  I'm a very happy patient.|Desperately looking for an alternative to ankle fusion surgery to get pain relief from severe osteoarthritis, I had read up on laser therapy.
A little skeptical, but when my orthopedic surgeon surprisingly referred me to Pain Free Life Centers, I was confident to give it try.
Though I am still in the program, I hope to continue to improve with less pain, swelling, and inflammation.
Very pleased with the professionalism and friendliness of the staff. Kudos to them for being very efficient with keeping appointments on time.|For several years, I had pain in my left shoulder rotator cuff. I saw the PFLC information as I was website browsing and decided to check it out and get the free treatment. One of the best decisions I ever made. My orthopedic shoulder specialist's recommendations only provided temporary relief.  I can't really say why I am not totally pain free, but my pain level as I write this is so much better. What makes the treatments even better, besides a staff that is the friendliest and most efficient, is that you can arrive 5 minutes before your appointment, be greeted by name and have your totally non-invasive treatment start at the time it was scheduled.|I am editing to 3 stars because I am so dissappointed that the PT department is being discontinued.  I originally went for laser treatments on my right shoulder.  They did not help much at all.  Then I started seeing Presley in Physical Therapy and the results were amazing.  I soon had no pain.  A year later I had pain in my left shoulder.  Presley encouraged me to get an MRI and when he saw the results, he highly recommended surgery.  He explained everything that was happening in my shoulder and the next week he again took time to explain it all to my husband.  He recommended the top doctor for shoulder surgery.  He worked with me before the surgery to prepare me to have a quicker recovery. After the surgery he helped me to recover quickly.  I have been to other physical therapy places and never got the quality care that Presley gives.  He truly cares about his patients.  I am very disgusted at how the Pain Free Life Center is discontinuing his facility.  My husband just started seeing him for an extreme spiral fracture in his leg and was getting great results when we were notified that the facility is closing down the physical therapy department.  I don't even know what we are going to do.  I don't trust anyone else.  Presley is the best there is and PFLC is making a big mistake and has definitely lost my business and recommendations.|I have been a patient here and even though the lasers did not work for me I know it has worked for many. Everyone has been very nice at the Painfree life center.  I had to have a 4 level spinal fusion done and came back this month to see Presley in the PT area. He is one of the best therapist I have ever had and I am so sadden that the Painfree Life centers have decided to terminate the PT department. Presley is very knowledgeable and very caring and spends quality time with his patients.  What brought me back to him after my surgeries is this.  Iona is also amazing and so sweet. I wish we as patients had more notice not just a few weeks to prepare to find another therapist.  I have never had a therapist like this and another place I went to for therapy I felt like a number and with Presley I did not. I am truly sad that you will be losing these two amazing people and the therapy dept.  I am as a patient not happy about it as I am sure many of his patients aren't either.|I started physical therapy with Presley Varghese at PFLC when I was 1/2 way through my laser sessions for my painful arthritic knees.  I am sorry I didn't start sooner when pt was first suggested. Presley presented a customized program and adjusted  as necessary to keep my progress on track. The best part of his treatment was that Presley worked  one-on-one with me, on EVERY visit, so he was always aware of my progress. He never hesitated to add(or back off if necessary) to the program. He was/is very positive and encouraging in helping clients  through some of the hard muscle work. Laser therapy has helped my painful knees, but my sessions with Presley have improved my balance, improved my core making my lower body stronger. I miss working with him. He has set my expectations for other physical therapy places/therapists very high. Thank You Presley.|I had put my back out the beginning of Oct 2024. After multiple trips a week to my chiropractor I was able to walk again but still not able to sit for more than 5-10 minutes at a time.
I had a trip planned to TX on Nov 2nd to see my grandkids and did not want to miss it. I knew withoiut help I would not tolerate a 3 hr flight to Dallas.
I had my first laser treatment on Monday Oct 28th and was told that they would have me better by Saturday if they could laser me every day that week. I had to skip Tuesday to work but was lasered Wed, Thur & Friday. On Saturday morning I made the flight to TX with no problems. I was afraid to stand up when the plane landed but I did without any issues. I was still achy but I was able to walk with no hip or back pain. While in TX I did a lot of walking which has always helped my back.
I returned home 10 days later and started my 3 day a week laser treatments at the Troy location. The staff is wonderful and always on time.
The laser has helped to strenghten my back and the deep hip joint pain I was experiencing prior is gone.
I am a believer in Pain Free Life Center laser treatments and am very grateful for their help.|I have stenosis in my lower back, I bought the package they recommended and went there diligently For all of my scheduled appointments. It really made no difference for my condition so for me, it was a waste of money and time. I don't doubt people who say they got relief from it, but it did nothing for me.

At Comprehensive Pain Specialists, we are dedicated to helping you find relief from chronic pain and improving your quality of life. As one of the largest pain management groups in the country, our team of board certified and board eligible physicians, nurse practitioners, and other highly trained health professionals work collaboratively to design personalized treatment plans for each patient.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a comprehensive range of pain management solutions including:

  • Individualized treatment planning

  • Advanced pain relief procedures

  • Medication management

  • Minimally invasive interventions

Our approach combines medical expertise with genuine compassion. Located in Flint, Michigan, we take pride in providing unparalleled expertise while delivering consistent, advanced treatments for various pain-related conditions. We understand that living with chronic pain can be challenging, which is why we take the time to listen carefully to your concerns and develop solutions that address your specific needs. Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help you regain control of your life through effective pain management.

At Vitruvian Health Advanced Pain Solutions, we are a forward-thinking medical practice dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management services for adults throughout Ionia, Michigan and at our Surgery Center in Grand Rapids.

Specialized Pain Management Expertise

Led by Adam Camp, MD, our team combines extensive knowledge in anesthesiology and interventional pain medicine with a compassionate approach to patient care. We offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Customized medication management

  • Nerve blocks and injections

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

Our mission is to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root cause of your pain while improving your overall quality of life. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we take the time to listen carefully to each patient's concerns and create tailored solutions. Visit Vitruvian Health Advanced Pain Solutions or call us at (616) 841-2615 to schedule your consultation at our comfortable facility located at 431 Swartz Ct, Suite 200 in Ionia.

Specialized Pain Management in Troy, Michigan

At Dr. Martin Glowacki's pain management practice, we provide comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our clinic specializes in a variety of innovative treatments including RFTC procedures, targeted injections, and personalized pain management protocols that help patients return to active lifestyles. Located at 6535 Rochester Rd #102 in Troy, MI, our facility is equipped with advanced technology to address conditions such as:

  • Spinal pain and sciatica

  • Degenerative disc disease

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Post-surgical pain management

  • Sports and activity-related injuries

We pride ourselves on creating individualized treatment plans that focus on minimizing medication dependence while maximizing quality of life. Our professional staff ensures each patient receives compassionate care in a welcoming environment. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website or call us at +1 248-813-0060.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management Services in Flint Township

At Mid Michigan Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients throughout the Flint area. Our practice requires a referral from a Primary Care Physician (PCP) or another healthcare provider to schedule an appointment with our experienced Nurse Practitioner. We take a personalized approach to pain management, offering:

  • Thorough pain assessments and customized treatment plans

  • Advanced diagnostic imaging services

  • Medication management options

  • Interventional procedures for chronic pain conditions

  • Collaborative care with other specialists when needed

Our team is committed to helping patients regain functionality and improve quality of life. If you need our referral form, we can fax it directly to your doctor's office or arrange for you to pick up the form along with our list of required documents. Visit our Facebook page for more information about our services. We're conveniently located at 1230 Linden Rd, Suite 4, in Flint Township, MI.
column11: Referral from a PCP or another provider is required to get an appointment with our Nurse Practitioner. Call to have the form faxed to your doctor's office or to arrange a pick up of the form and list of required documents

column40:
If you're self pay be careful! Especially if you're Cash paying. One of their employees stole $600 worth of my payments of $150 (4) different times I went. I had no idea. When I initially found out I owed money, the girl working the desk would never tell from when or give me proof. Every visit we'd go through the same thing. She told me I had to bring in receipts for every single visit from 3 years!! Come to find out I've randomly seen others that have worked there that recognized me and they told me she was the one that stole my money. I'm pretty sure she no longer works there but still be careful! The owners who wouldn't let me see the doctor the one time I forgot my card, made me go get $100 cash before I could be seen are now saying I saw them 4 times without paying!! Ridiculous! Dr. Ravi is Awesome if you do go there. I'd give him 5 stars & also the nurses. Side Note: I've found receipts of every visit except for (2). I have no plans of giving them anymore of my money. They can get it from their employee who pocketed it.|I go here with my gf who is a Registered Nurse. She is my advocate and makes sure that I am taken care of medically. This place is good in that they got me into an MRI stat. The staff and NP Brian McDermott I saw were all pleasant with good bedside manners. I am in pain everyday and it affects my daily ADL's. The NP said I may need surgery and tried to refer me to Insight which I refused. We are on the journey now of finding an excellent neurosurgeon who will further assess me and perform lumbar surgery so I can live pain free. For a Medicaid place this place is pretty good but they can improve. I will always be thankful that they got me in for my MRI right away. Thank you|Dr.M has been wonderful. I have only had to wait for a long time one time and the staff is great. He is working with me to get my pain under control and is concerned about the cause and not just throwing drugs at me. He is also the best at administering injections! Very happy here!
- It has been another year and at 44 I have finally found staff that cares for the patient and their needs. Both the Nurse Practitioner and the Doc have gone to great lengths to see to my care and have been ever so patient figuring out what will work for me. I love that they have fought my insurance company every step for me to get me the right, less addictive medication!  Everything has been quickly put through because they have stayed on top of the prior-auth process! This practice rocks and I will suggest I to all of my friends!|*UPDATE* It's been 3-4 years now and I love this place (people) even more than I did initially!! I'm in and out in 15 minutes, they're super organized and best of all, I'm treated like family.  Thank you all so much for being amazing, MMPMC!!! 
***********************************
I've only been seeing Brian for a few months but so far, I have to say the care has been far superior to anything else I've experienced over the last few years.  I've been a chronic pain patient for nearly a decade and have dealt with some VERY horrible, demeaning and just plain RUDE doctors throughout my journey.  NO ONE at Mid-Michigan made me feel like a drug seeker.  They ordered imaging immediately, went over the results with me very precisely, they were very careful with prescribing until they knew what they were really dealing with.

EVERYONE in the office has been very pleasant every time I've been there or called.  Sometimes, the wait is a bit long but, it's worth it to me because before I started seeing Brian, I was living my life out on my heating pad on my couch.  Now, I'm at least able to function and he doesn't hesitate to offer anything that may help (physical therapy, injections, etc.).

If you're truly in pain and looking for help and relief, I would highly suggest checking out Mid-Michigan Pain Management.  If you're drug seeking, you should probably keep looking because you won't find what you're looking for here within this group of professionals.|This is a great place to get your pain under control. They will work with you to get the best results. The staff does a great job and are very nice people. If you need pain management this is the place you need. 2024 The lab umed diagnostics makes big mistakes. I looked into it and it seems that there may be someone with a personal problem with me or my name because I had 3 bad labs in a row. Never had a problem until they started changing labs. Iam no longer a patient because I was discharged because of the labs. I did not take meds I was not supposed to. Also I took the meds prescribed to me and did not stop those meds. Be careful because that lab had a problem with me for some reason, hopefully it doesnt happen to you.|It is nearly impossible to get prior authorization done.  I have had to do all the leg work myself. I have been waiting 2 months for a PA to be done by the Staff for knee braces.  It's important as a patient to have
Quality care.  This staff does not show competence.
Dr is ok.  Tries to Multi task when stalking to you. But with Insurance dictating where to go.   I guess the patient suffers|They don't know how to do a proper drug test and they don't treat the problem.|Hadn't even made it in there yet, my neurosurgeons office tried to get me in on a STAT order and was told the earliest appointment was 20 days away, also my INSURANCE company also did the same a week ago and said they would call within 24 hours to schedule, yet STILL NO CALL. NO thank you, I will take my business elsewhere, where there is better management. If you can't manage your own office how can you manage my pain??  Especially when I can't even get a CALL for a STAT order

Dr Haladjian, Jennifer, and thee entire office staff, also Dr Haladjians surgery center staff have always gone above and beyond whenever I am having pain in a specific spot in my spine, leg, hip, neck. Thank you all for the care I have and still receive.|They had my wife in there twice. Each time they put her under. The first time she got shots in her hips. The second time it was shots in her spine. NEITHER worked. We asked them to fill out paperwork for her SSI claim. They refused to do so without her getting a test that is $650.00 and not covered by insurance. We explained that it wasn't covered so they told us to go to our family doctor to have them filled out. Why would our family doctor fill out forms on something they did? Stupid lazy people.|If I could leave negative stars I would. I was interested in coming here  to have my chronic pain illness treated,HOWEVER, after what I witnessed I hope nobody ever comes here. I heard of them through my sister. My sisters appt was canceled twice and when she finally got her appointment had to wait 2 hrs while hearing Jennifer in the back yelling about personal issues on the phone and yelling at her staff. Then  I was on the phone with her trying to keep her calm so she can at least get through this appointment because she had been in severe pain for so long waiting on this appt. After all this only to hear the attending exhibit the most horrendous behavior I have ever seen. While on the phone heard Jen come in and with the nastiest attitude begin to berate my sister as if it was her fault the office was behind and as if  her presence was a nuisance. I have never heard anything like it! This woman is UNHINGED and should not be helping patients in need. Not to mention before even going through a standard examination for a new patient asked if my sis wanted narcotics before even trying to figure out why she was there. That is irresponsible medical work and I wish nobody to go through what my sister had to.|From day one I tried to explain to them what my last PM Dr did for me, he was great, but he back to being an anesthesiologist, so I ended up here, I should have known from day one, they just don't listen, immediately they removed two of my pain, meds, from there, they went into pushing injections and spinal stimulator, with this said I've been through at least 60 injections. They don't work well with me, I found with them they are just waiting for a Gacha moment, they are watching you every second of the way trying to set you up for failure, with this said, I always looked at them and respected them as a doctor, you should always be honest with your doctors, but be very careful, Honesty will get you out the door, with that said I would not recommend them to anyone.|If I could give this place a 0 I would. My appointment was cancelled twice. I was introduced to Jen by her YELLING on a personal call. I asked the MA how long it would be. She went back to asked and she yelled at her and told her I had to wait. I waited 15 mins.. I went to see how long it will be. (I've been waiting for two hours). She interrupted the conversation and began to YELL at me. Yes yell and ordered me to get off the phone. I continued w/ the appointment because I need help. I have chronic pain and was praying I would get help here. She asked if I wanted opiates before even hearing my real issue and basically said she can't help with my fibromyalgia. Such a disappointment.|The staff was excellent and caring and Dr moesner was very helpful professional and caring I will definitely be back again I recommend this place|Great people/staff dr haladjian is wonderful|Dr. Haladgian (Dr. H) has a very awesome personality. Specialized Pain Management in Sterling Heights

At Neuro Pain Consultants, we provide state-of-the-art pain management focused on individualized treatment options for Detroit-area patients struggling with acute and chronic pain. Our board-certified physicians and highly trained medical staff are dedicated to helping patients reclaim full, productive lives through holistic therapies. We specialize in treating a variety of conditions including:

  • Pinched nerves and herniated discs

  • Spinal issues and degenerative diseases

Each patient receives compassionate and thoughtful care at our Sterling Heights facility. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered approach, ensuring that each individual understands their condition and treatment options. Visit our website to learn more about how we can help you manage your pain and improve your quality of life.

column40:
I went to this clinic after being referred to pain management for years and refusing because I don't care for controlled substances. I went cause I'm out of options far as my pain. He pretty much said my pain was in my head and symptoms shouldn't be as bad as my tests. Which don't make sense I can barely walk with sciatica flare ups and chronic muscle spasms. Neuropathy in whole right side a few surgeries between my knee and ankle. I have quite a few injuries all on same side as sciatica. I literally had to be lifted off an mri bed and couldn't even dress my self that's so embarrassing. I vomit from my pain it causes sweating fever flashing severe nausea high blood pressure although I have low blood pressure which is a diagnosis for years the pain cause my blood pressure to elevate way higher than the norm. All I want is relief not drugs figure pain management can do something. I've lost lots of weight I fight my pain and injuries in a gym losing weight significantly didn't even reduce my pain. How the heck can someone tell you you're not in pain.... I never understand that I definitely never ever had a drug problem nor drinking problem. This pain makes me feel like I'm dying literally. I take care of my 10 year old. I just want relief I can't stretch no more therapy no longer helps I do therapy at home with going to gym 5 days a week sometimes I'm at gym and go in an isolated room and just break down and cry I've tried everything that most people don't to try to help myself and my health besides relying on a doctor. I personally hate medication but some form of relief would be great it don't have to be narcotics I careless about drugs I have a squeaky clean record. This was the absolute most degrading experience I have a ever received in my life..... I can't even drive in pain I can't do much myself during flare ups it's so sporadic I could be at gym or even just walking and instantly the pain locks me up and I stop.... Not being able to dress myself in pain or stand sit stretch lay down and wake up out of my sleep sweating and crying I use scorching hot water to try to get relief to the point I have burnt my skin. Epsom salt tried shea butter creams anti inflammatory I've tried everything no one can say it's be I lost weight to try hoping that would give me relief. I wouldn't wish this on anyone. Do not go here if you don't want a dr to humiliate you and make you feel like crap as if the pain isn't bad enough...|All the staff at American Pain have been so kind to me, those women are amazing and awesome! Dr. Osta is great as well, soft spoken, kind and compassionate. I couldn't ask for a better pain management team...|Dr. Osta has always been kind and professional with me. He tells it like it is and I appreciate that. His help has been an absolute blessing after my health system decided chronic pain patients could no longer be treated with pain medication. My quality of life depends on this medication. Thank you Dr. Osta for all you have done to help me with my medical journey.|I've been a patient of Dr. Osta for a while. I find him to be an excellent physician. He actually takes his time with you and always makes sure that he answers any questions that you may have. I would definitely recommend him to anyone.|Just put in a complaint and I'm glad I have him on recoding violating my rights I will be reaching out to an attorney he was more concerned of what my psychiatrist was doing and prescribing me my fiance was in the room and actually had to restrain himself of the way he was screaming and speaking to me . I attempted to contact office manager he Osta takes phone and gets to yelling more and hang up . I have put a grievance with my provider also I have contacted Laura . I see there was a complaint left a month ago , I wish I would have seen that before stepping in his nutty ssa office no one discharged me it was my first and last visit so to have a interaction with a patient questions your response to my review he also replies to everyone review I have screenshots and recordings and have submitted them to the proper departments. Good luck|Dr.Walid Osta ,is a great doctor. he talks to me with respect and concerns about my health.and his staff is very kind and i will continue to be his patient for five more years.Thank you Dr. Osta.Annie Griffin.|This Dr Walid Asta is a flat out disgrace. I feel awful made the mistake of looking this place up for my husband. He is a vetran and is 100 percent disabled. He has permanent injuries to his body from serving. He attends physical therapy and sees his dr regularly I was suggested a pain clinic for him since the steroid shots physical therapy nothing is working.  This dr accused my husband of falkng his identity faking his injuries from the service when we brought all of his diagnosis AND VA paper work which shows all of.his ailments and compensatations. He also had all his diagnosis from his primary care dr and even offered to bring up his henryford mychart info but this dr did not want to help him he insited my husband was lying and had 0 proof of being In pain and said it sounds like he has anxiety my husband was there for pain he has a left hip femoral acerubulae impingement which means his left hip basically is stuck popped out so he's in pain always. Even sitting. He barely csn make it to work he also has severe connection for left knee  patellafemoral arthritis  so to walk is very painful.His physc. Dr handles his anxiety but this dr wanted to use that his anxiety was why he is in pain????  This is a pain clinic right??? So not only this dr mistreat a US vetran he doubted his pain doubted his identity basically accused him of lying said his paper work was trash. If that's the case how are you able to treat any patient??? It's disgusting the way he was treated. But you made sure to write him a script for SUBOXENE??!!! Now that's a fraud, suboxene is for opiod addicted patients trying to recover. My husband first of all is not a opiod addict and second of all was there to to seek help a second opinion maybe thinking he needs surgery nowhere did he ask for a script of any kind..with that being said I see exactly what's going on at this place. If you look the part of what this dr thinks you should look like you will get help. But if you are an outsider or don't look the part even with all the proof he will assume your asking him for drugs and maybe even write you the script but only if you look the part and he "believes" you. Well my husband came to you for help he served this country and he's 100 percent disabled and in pain every day he didn't even ask you for a script and you treated him like a criminal.  You are whats wrong with this country and our health system people like you are the reason why so many live every day In pain or why so many end up in the streets. I made the mistake of choosing this place for him, and am so disgusted with how he was treated. It's just wrong. Good to know you are recklessly writing people scripts for subkxene but you claim you don't have any proof of their ailments? You contradicted yourself and you show you pick and chose who you help. He came for help he brought everything  and could of even checked his henryford mychart you chose to judge him instead. You don't deserve to be a doctor.... Period. Oh and your little pre written response doesn't change the fact of what happend it's all facts and the proof is all there so it doesn't make a difference what you wrote back and by the  looks of your reviews that I just took the time to read you only help certain types of women and Arab men which furthers proves my statement.

Adding more,this  doctor is mad about this review and has called.my husband leaving voicemail yelling at him! What a  psycho!! How  are people like this even allowed to be Doctors!??? From what I read and this experience  this doctor gets mad when people call out his shady unprofessional behavior and then he threatens or gas lights them...and violates patient HIPPA patient rights.......pathetic.  Maybe stop blaming the people who come to you for help and Adding to the response you just flat out lied because Dr didn't know I was on FaceTime the whole appointment while my husband was seen and my husband or myself is not a liar. So go ahead and put on your little dog and pony show. Your  lying your dr is lying and for that now I will never take down this review|I have been going to American, Pain and spine Center for many years! I love the personal treatment. Everyone there makes me feel like I am family. The girls are so kind.  Dr. Osta is very thorough.  I recently went through a terrible tragedy in my family, and Dr. Osta, was incredibly compassionate. He made me feel heard. I moved pretty far away, but I make the trip out there every month, and I will continue to do so, forever.  Thank you for taking the time to read this.

column49: Dr. Osta treats every patients with respect and compassion, especially if the patient is disabled.  However, Dr. Osta and his team have the medical and moral responsibility to keep every patient safe. If a patient gets discharged from our practice, this is due to safety concerns (whether the patient is using illegal drugs or misusing/abusing their narcotics). There is absolutely no bias and no prejudice. Our mission is to help patients but also to keep them safe. Some people get upset when discharged and go on google  to fabricate lies and misinformation. However, this does not stop us from practicing in the best medically and morally acceptable way because nothing is worth somebodies life.

At Michigan Interventional Pain Center, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Brownstown Township and surrounding communities. Our dedicated team of pain specialists provides personalized care using advanced interventional techniques to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of interventional pain management treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

It's just absolutely ridiculous to me considering every time he's gone they've had him wait 30 minutes before he's even been seen.|I have had the most positive experience with this office and all of the staff. They have been nothing but caring, kind, helpful, and truly concerned about how I am feeling. When you are in pain finding help can be difficult and frustrating. I would highly recommend this office to anyone who is ready to be heard. My treatment here is truly appreciated and sincerely respected.|These people are completely incompetent. My mom has been trying to get a shot there for a month. She completed all of her pre work and when she showed up for her appointment they said they did not have her MRI.

Second visit the left her in a room for an hour only to tell her that she could not have the shot because it was not scheduled.

Third visit same story.

Don't waist your time and money here.|I am not one to usually leave negative reviews but I have to agree with all of the recent negative reviews. I called 3 times without anyone answering. I randomly received a call back several days later. Individual I spoke to on the phone was very short (rude). I explained what I need Ed and she scheduled my appointment. She scheduled the appointment wrong and it wasn't for the procedure that I thought I was getting. She didn't explain that I needed a doctor appointment prior the procedure appointment. It was a complete pain!
The doctors are great and do amazing. They just need help in the front offices.|I used to see Dr moessner she was very nice but Jen the practitioner she made you feel like you were after drugs only not the pain so I left that office I would never recommend this office|I'm sorry, but, it is only fair to correct my review and be  honest even if it hurts me with my doctor and he gets upset with me. I  changed this review to a 3 star and thats pushing it due to the receptionist actions with me and how I'm spoken to. I wrote this review 10 months ago and gave a good review when in fact i should of spoken the truth; to the community I apologize, but I was afraid to make my doctor mad at me but the public deserves the truth on how the receptionist treat me at the Intervention Pain Clinic. I've been having some problems with the receptionist dating my prescriptions on Sundays when my pharmacy is closed, and my pharmacy calls the receptionist to let them know they're not opened, the receptionist tells my pharmacist oh well I have to wait until Monday that they will not change the day to Saturday when in fact that would of been my fill date. also the receptionist refuse to honor the 2 day before I'm out of medication window to fill my perscription. The receptionist service is not  excellent, its bad and sad they're rude to me when the doctor is not around, and then there is Jen the NP Nurse Practitioner whom makes me very uneasy from my very first visit with her the tension was so thick I wanted to get up and leave. Jen the NP made me so uneasy the way she would eyeball me as if i was a liar. I pick up vibes with ease and sense strongly and from my very first visit with Jen the NP I sensed she didn't like me so I requested to never, ever  be put on her schedule again  and she would try and walk in to see me and I'd say sorry I'm seeing Dr. Halajjian,  thats when the receptionist started messing with me and my dates of medication refills and my appointment with Dr. Halajiian being either way to soon or a week past my refill date. Also,  as I'm waiting to schedule my next appointment Jen comes out and whispers something to the receptionist i feel it has to do with my next appointment, Because I end up calling to reschedule so I  keep it on my right track 2 or 3 days before I'm out of my medicine, not a week early or a week  past due, heck, I even switched office buildings so I did not have to see or pass by  Jen the NP's path ,but low and behold she ended up coming to that office too. One appointment Jen walked in and I said, sorry, but I'm seeing Dr. Haladjjian Jen said, well your seeing me your on my schedule I said I asked not to ever be put on your schedule and was forced to see her that day; I was very upset, uneasy, uncomfortable feelings I dislike. I told Dr. Halajjian he made sure that I'm not seen with Jen again shew. I knoticed that the office isn't crowded like it used to be although Dr. Haladjian is a good doctor his receptionist need retraining and on my next visit I will talk to Dr.H and  I hope he listens to me my words when I try to explain and  complain about the receptionist. I've yet to find a doctor like my primary Dr, Dr Steve Atallah , Dr. Steve is now retired, but he will always be my #1 doctor. I was Dr.Steve's patient since I was 18. Dr. Haladjian is my pain management doctor I've been his patient now for 6  years. If things don't change and how I'm treated there are other doctors I can see. All doctor offices should treat patients with respect too. Doctors swear an OATH to, do everything in their power to save lives and heal the sick when possible. Doctors swore an oath to help keep a human life  comfortable as they leave this earthly realm. To help their patients to the best of their ability with kindness and compassion. To  care for a human life is a big responsibility because, we the patients put our trust and our lives in the hands of doctors to whom God gifted them with  the gift to  heal. It  is  God's hand that touches the hands of the doctors guiding it all the way from start to finish, healed.  So, in saying that doctors should be all about healing, helping, listening,  with empathy, caring, and compassion. Dr. Haladjian is a good doctor its the staff that need to check themselves, for without patients they wouldn't have jobs, Truly.|The only way you can talk to Moesner is by appointment only, even after procedure, that didn't work. Made appointment still didn't get Moesner, got someone else.  Just want to talk to MY doctor with so many questions. It's easy to feel like a burden there. I tried to call but always told to leave a message, got call back over a week later. Don't like leaving post like this one I'm frustrated and not sure what next move should be. I recommended this place to someone else, sorry for that!|Dr Moesner is a wonderful physician! She is kind and truly cares about her patients. I first went to see her many years ago after multiple cervical and lumbar surgeries. I was very much at the end of my rope. I wanted to have an internal pain pump implanted. She agreed but asked me to try some interventional treatments first.  Long story short 9 years later I am able to control my chronic pain without opioids and they call me Rebecca OG around the office! Love all these dedicated hard working professionals and I can't say enough good things about them! Thank you Dr Moesner!

Very efficient I had trouble getting injections for my knees and has no issues at his office. column2: Grand Rapids Pain: Keith Javery, DO
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Grand Rapids

At Grand Rapids Pain, we pride ourselves on delivering FDA-approved, evidence-based pain management treatments under the expert guidance of Dr. Keith Javery and our team of specialized healthcare professionals. With decades of collective experience, we develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of chronic pain conditions. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Medication management

  • Diagnostic pain evaluations

  • Non-surgical treatment options

When medication is indicated as part of your treatment plan, our physicians work alongside our certified nurse practitioners and physician assistants to create safe, effective medicinal protocols tailored to your specific needs. We emphasize thorough patient education, ensuring you understand every aspect of your treatment journey. Visit our official website to learn more about our approach to comprehensive pain management or call us at +1 616-727-0083 to schedule your consultation at our convenient Grand Rapids location.
column11: With our extensive experience in the field, we have been providing FDA-approved, top-notch care to our patients for years. If your diagnosis indicates the use of pain medications, our physicians and advanced care providers, such as our certified nurse practitioners and certified physician assistants, will help develop a safe and effective medicinal treatment aspect to your overall plan of care.

column38: Barb Tindall|Cari Hatkowski|Jeff Hoovler|Dorothy Goff|Monica Robati|DeVere Boyd|Sarah Frank|Cathryn Nielsen
column40:
I was a patient of Javery's for about 25 years. After I posted some concerns in reviews about his change to Grand Rapids Pain Javery decided to retaliate against me on two separate injection days. I've always supported him in the past but now that I know more about why his practice has changed to GRP. I don't think anyone should trust him. I no longer am his patient by my choice. I've found a fantastic new pain clinic and it is so much better than Javery's clinic.
Shame on Javery for deceiving many patients. $215,000.00 was Javery's fine for sedation Medicare fraud. This insurance Medicare fraud could be a huge reason why pain patients cannot receive sedation anymore.|I was at a point where I'd have normally considered myself to be a little overdue for my regular procedure, based on my prior treatments from abotjer doctor that I also very much valued, but because of the effectiveness of Dr. Javery's prior treatments for me, my condition didn't deteriorate nearly as quickly and my pain was manageable enough until I could get in again for another cervical steroidal epidural injection procedure that, after only a few of these procedures performed by Dr. Javery, I've had so much more lasting relief and improvement in my overall health and wellness and my daily life in general. It's been very surprising to me how quickly effective this procedure has been each time he's performed it for me - literally giving me instant relief. I always have my procedures done without any anesthesia due to my own preferences, and they are always very quick and relatively painless for me (literally only a moment of pain given in exchange for many months pain-free), but the instant relief from them is a God-send and I couldn't be happier with my care under Dr. Javery's hands.|After a car accident and suffering a neck injury in 2022 Dr Javery treated my pain, after several appointments I made the decision to have a Spinal stimulator implanted. My relief after surgery was immediate, reliving 80-90% of my neck pain and I regained almost full motion. Would definitely recommend the ABBOTT BURST STIMULATOR to all those suffering from chronic neck or back pain. Dr Javery and his staff are the best!!!|I saw Dr Javery for more than one area of pain. He was so thorough in his questions and exam. He suggested more than one avenue to pursue, going forward, and explained the options very well! I worked with him over 20 years ago, and now as a patient I appreciate his wealth of knowledge and expertise even more. I have great respect for him and look forward to being able to be more active once treatment begins. I'm grateful for pain doctors who care, and sort things out, because pain patients are not all the same.
Update:
I just had another injection recently, and my experience exceeded my expectations. Each staff person identified themselves immediately, I didn't have to ask a name. They were kind and reassuring throughout the process, as always.

I received excellent care from the staff, as well.
Thank you Dr Javery and GR Pain. I know I may never get rid of all my pain (though hopefully some will be alleviated), but I'm on track for a better quality of life again.

The thing about a doctor so smart and skilled, is he never stops trying to learn more and become more. That's a win win for all of his patients. He stays on the cutting edge of what's available without big invasive surgeries. Yet he doesn't push you to do what you aren't comfortable.

In between injections, I saw Veronica, NP. She will take the time to explain things clearly, and also let you voice your concerns, then offer clarity. That is what is needed to alleviate concern. I appreciate that. And her assistant, Amanda, is so kind and helpful. I will note it takes quite a while to get injections scheduled and is quite a process.|FYI... Rereading this post I realized some of my date's were wrong so I've edited it to correct them.

I moved to MI in 2016 and started with Dr. Javery soon after. During my 1st, 2 years in MI, my mother developed Dementia and was also hospitalize 5 times in 8 months, passing away in 4-2017. Also, during this time I let my brother move in with me twice, but because he was an addict, I kicked him out both times. Soon after he OD in 9-2018.

My morphine pump, which I received in 4-2011 (after trying everything available, traditional and non-traditional, including a 3 level spinal fusion in 2006), was set at 3.5 mg/day on a continuous feed. When I move to MI, after a 3 year long battle to divorce my husband, I had been on Adderall for 9 years and Klonapin for 8 years (about), but no doctors up here would continue my care.

Being off Adderall, I ended up sleeping up to 16 hours a day. So, of course I thought "got rid of my ex, got rid of the stress, so my pain levels decreased". So I asked Javery Pain Clinic to try turning it down, thinking I'm doing the RIGHT thing. Wrong! I actually got down to .6 mg/ml a day, but the final setting was 1.2 mg/ml daily.

As my mother got sicker, I had to move around more, so hurt more. Of course the stress increased my pain levels (stress outside my control), so I asked for my pump to be increased. I was told to see a psychiatrist. After 20 years of 24/7 pain (1998-2018) I finally broke. I started planning my suicide.

I survived and after treatment, when the nurse came to fill my pump, she actually switched it out with saline, then said I'd have "mild" flu like symptoms. Seriously! Total BS! I was told to get my head straightened out, then I could come back. No way in Hell would I every go back to him. Doing (what I thought was the right thing) just ended up letting them torture me.

After being on morphine from 4/2011 to 3/2019 (8 years) I had massive withdrawal's. Ended up in the ER 2 nights in a row (where they couldn't help at all), and was in hell for a week. Finally, my other brother, who is also a addict, got me some Suboxone (which is used in rehabs I'm told) to control the withdrawals, because the hospital and doctors couldn't help me. A doctor needs a special license to prescribe Suboxone I've read.
If I had the energy to sue them, I would.

Being off Adderall, then Morphine messed up my life so bad (so much for being happy after my divorce). After 25 years (10 in MI), I've just heard the term 'Continuity of Care" and with my psych records (which I've had since moving from Atlanta to MI) finally started back on Adderall. Which has enabled me to start getting my life, and financial affairs, straighten out.

I'm looking into a new pain clinic to start getting morphine again, because I can not lay in bed, in pain for another 5 years. My weight went from 170 lbs. to 340 lbs., I developed type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, etc., just because the doctors in MI wouldn't continue the medication that I started in 2007 (Adderall) & 2011 (morphine pump installed)  to control my pain and other health problems. So yeah, I'd rate Dr. Javery a "0" if I could.|I had a great experience at the Grand Rapids Pain Clinic. Dr Javery and his entire staff does a wonderful job of communicating with you, explaining everything that's going to be done during your procedure and talking you through it gently, because some of these are delicate procedures. I strongly encourage people to get an appointment with the Javery Pain Clinic in Grand Rapids.|Dr. Javery is a charismatic DO. who gives you time to ask questions and concerns about your personal wellness. He gives you information on your procedure and realistic outcomes for your specific situation.
Dr. Javery and Dr. Juneja are an incredible pain management Duo!!
With Kindness,
Sarah|I had an amazing first visit. Doctor Javery discussed my back issues with me in detail. He wasn't in a hurry like many doctors are!  He gave me choices, and I have hope. I look forward to seeing him soon for a non-invasive procedure!

column40:
Alyssa spends a short amount of time with you but your needs are met. The nurse assistants are very kind. The receptionist in the back could be trained a little better. I can clearly tell they have no medical experience as far as scheduling. But they are always kind.  The receptionist in the front desk were exceptionally proactive...The lab staff is always kind..I had a good visit. Although sometimes I feel it's just a job for them cause Alyssa lacks real compassion for what you are going through. she smiles and quickly rush you along with no rebuttal to what you are telling her or anything comforting or coping skills given..other than that she would be a good Physician assistant/ Nurse practioner..But over all it's a good environment to be in especially dealing with daily pain and trying to cope the anxiety of it all.  This place does not trigger my anxiety at all. I recommend this place.|I've been going to that office for a while now, and I just love how the staff is, so nice and polite, and Dr. Doyle is also great, she listens and doesn't rush through an appointment, and she always makes me feel comfortable. It's also not a long wait to see the doctor and I really love that part. Great office and people there.|Very sweet and understanding young lady. She listens to you, she is concerned about how you are feeling. I really appreciate her.|Doctor Alyssa Doyle, is caring and very professional. She takes time and listen with compassion. I also have great respect for the receptionist and nursing staff.  This has been my 4th year coping with my issues concerning my pain management along with my supported outcome. Lastly, the follow~ups with the communication staff via e-mail and text have been a lifesaver and encouragement. Insight  Surgical Hospital has been an amazing  asset to my stages of recovery and wellbeing.|The only empathy I have been graced with has been from the nurse and the woman that called me over the phone. Doctor and PA are cold and bedside manner is non existent. I had an order for an MRI due to having severe swelling and severe pain after a procedure they did, I tried to schedule it and left voicemails w my info  and so did they - we played phone tag. Even if we had touched  base - I had to get X- Rays before the tMRI for some reason...IE wrong CPT codes IE I am post op not pre op.. On top of all that - My husband and I  had a death in our immediate family out of state, from my last visit to this one. So yI hadn't had the MRI and I didn't know about any X-Rays til the day I was there for my appt. Instead of increasing my pain meds  due to severe pain  she decreased them. Her reason- I didn't get MRI yet! I tried and have proof as I left all my personal info on VM.  And a death in my family !!!! Out of state! They already have copies of my MRI from a year or so ago showing my Lumbar fusion and post Laminectomy Syndrome- recent MRI order was to show what was damaged after last procedure they did. This it's s completely unreal to lower my meds because I had an out of state funeral and didn't get MRI before my next appt-  and have proof I tried to schedule MRI as I left multiple vm's. I have repeatedly told PA that I cannot live in level 10 pain. I have no quality of life . I've asked for procedures, stimulators, or even surgery to no avail- Decreasing someone's meds because they had a funeral and because office never called back after I left vm's is unacceptable! Lastly, I couldn't wear these patches anymore because they were burning and scarring my skin and giving me rashes and itching- so she gives me a new script that requires a prior authorization so I'm still waiting for that to be done so I can pick  up those meds. Meridian said could take 2 weeks so office said they'd put a rush on it to make it high priority- it's the weekend now and I'm still in agonizing level 10 pain. I am a human being and we have modern medicine for a very short amount that I reason . I should NOT have to suffer like this ! She  never should have lowered my meds knowing that this could take weeks! Obviously I need more of the other meds until these are filled!!!!! No sick and suffering patient should be left to being bedridden when there are meds out there to ensure people don't suffer. Thank you|Every time I go it's always fast. The staff is awesome.  The doctors are awesome and sweet too. They are so helpful there. The doctors are so caring and listen to you..|Insight Pain Management is the best. I would never go anywhere else. I see Dr. Sripada and his PA Alyssa Doyal at the Warren location. I consider them both to be an irreplaceable part of my care team.
I saw Alyssa Doyal on my latest visit. She always listens attentively to my concerns. Alyssa makes me feel SEEN and HEARD.
Being in chronic pain is tough. It means so much to be given quality care with COMPASSION.|Alyssa is a great doctor and always takes time to listen to what I have to say instead of rushing me..

Visit our website or call us at +1 269-431-4007 to discover how our team can help restore your quality of life. Located at 3770 Glenkerry Ct, Portage, MI 49024, we offer renewed hope for those suffering from persistent pain.

column38: Rick Hebert|E Lee Matthews|Bishop Howard|Amanda Krim|Kim Carlton|April V|Justine Reid|Barbie Villanueva
column40:
Dr. Wild and medical assistant Stephanie have been extremely professional and helpful.  Very satisfied with their care and results in treating sciatica.|This has been by far the worst medical treatment I have ever received in my 62 years of living on this planet. I had a procedure done on my lower back by Dr Matthew Kuiper in August 2023 that caused excruciating pain soon as I left the office. Once I got home, I called them and explained to that I was in serious pain. To my dismay, they told me to take a Tylenol, which I did but that did not relieve my pain. I went to sleep in pain but when I woke up the pain was gone and my back felt much better.
Fast forward to July 2024. My stem cells grew back and I had to have that procedure again.  I explained to the nurse and Dr Matthew Kuiper that without any pain meds just for one day, I don't want the procedure. Dr Matthew Kuiper agreed to write me a prescription for pain.
Just like last time, the pain was immediate. I went to my Walgreens to pick up the prescription but it wasn't sent. I called the pain clinic and they told me that he hasn't written the script...that he's with another patient, that I may need to wait a few hours.
So their idea is for me to leave there in pain, go home in pain, wait until he decides to write the prescription, get back up in pain and go back out to pick up the prescription.
Someone please make that make sense!
Had I actually took the time to read the horrible reviews this place has received, I would not have came here in the first place.
I'll never go back there again!|Who orders $250 worth of food and tips their delivery driver not one penny? Terrible people woth low morals|Dr Wild and his staff are absolutely amazing!! I have now had 2 injections at this clinc. They are always so friendly and welcoming, from the moment you walk in the door all the way to recovery.  You can tell they are busy but always give me the attention and time I need. They are very professional and helped to relive any anxiety that I had prior to my procedures. Dr wild walks your through every step of the injection and tells you what to expect.  Dr wild has truly given me my quality of life back. I can now do house work and play with my kids pain free!!|Always wait for 1 to 2 hours for injections. If I didn't need to be here I would walk out with me Mom. She is elderly and is already in pain and this just upsets her.|My sister has serious neck pain from EDS.  She has had multiple procedures and her neurosurgeon recommended she go here.  They won't even do the recommended shots for the nerve pain and when she asked for oral meds then because she's in excruciating pain THEY COMPLETELY DISMISSED HER!!  First they said they only do shots but then won't do the shots in the area she actually needs!!   However they also were EXTREMELY RUDE to her for asking for any other medications!  Would never ever recommend this place.  They are cruel, incompetent and only want money.  They will not help you no matter how you are suffering!|Terrible office staff. They were incredibly rude when I was first trying to make appointments which was a nightmare with all the back and forth they were giving to my PCM. Finally made it to a couple of appointments and scheduled the next for a Rhizotomy. Then they failed to get the required insurance approvals on time. My appointment was cancelled less than 24 hours notice. I had been without pain medicines to prepare. Scheduled Rhizotomy again. Yet again, they failed to get the required insurance approvals on time. Less than 24 hours notice of cancellation and in excruciating pain from going medicine-free to prepare for procedure AGAIN. You couldn't PAY ME to go back to this clinic.|I had been a patient here for close to three years. I was so happy to finally have someone help with my sciatic nerve pain. Dr. Bez started giving me injections right away, not only for my sciatic nerve but also some in my low back. I would come back every 3-4 months for more injections and every time it seemed like he had to keep doing more and more. After over 2 years of constant injections I ended up having a horrible experience. The pain after the injections lasted longer than ever and I ended up with zero relief!!! When i went back to tell him about it he automatically jumped to the conclusion I was asking for narcotics. I went ahead with injections 2 more times after, he told me he knew what to do differently and they would work. Both times they maybe worked 20-30% and only lasted a few weeks at best. This time I went back to see him knowing I'm pretty sure I do not want to try injections again at this point, I have the names of two medications, (one oral antidepressant used to treat chronic pain and one cream) to ask him about just to see where my options are. As soon as he begins going on about injections I stop him and let him know I'd rather not and try to ask about my other options but I cant.... he bursts out yelling about "no such thing as a magic pill" again assumes I'm a drug seeker and tells me he wont "give me what I'm looking for" then tells me hes writting to my primary doctor about this... I could hardly get two words in! At the last 3 appointments with him HE has brought up narcotics and how he won't give them to me, but I have never once then asked for them!! Of course they work and if things were different I would take them, but that does not make me a drug seeker. Had he given me 2 minutes and actually listened without interrupting I could have showed him the paper I had the names of those other meds I planned on asking about. My low back / spine burns constantly since that bad experience months back. Something went wrong, he knows it!

Patients should be free to ask questions about their treatments and be treated with respect.

Comprehensive Pain Management in Grand Rapids

At Haven Spine + Pain Center, we believe in treating the physical, mental, and emotional aspects of pain while addressing the root cause. Our holistic approach to pain management provides life-changing relief to West Michigan residents looking to regain an active lifestyle. We help patients set lofty goals and work together to achieve them through individualized treatment plans that include a variety of healing techniques:

  • Advanced Procedures - Targeted injections and interventional treatments

  • Complementary Therapies - Acupuncture, yoga, and medical massage

  • Medication Management - Clinically proven medications when appropriate

Located at 2680 Leonard St NE #3 in Grand Rapids, our team is dedicated to providing compassionate care in a welcoming environment. We're now accepting new patients who are ready to take control of their pain journey. Learn more about our providers and approach to pain management at havenpain.com or call us at (616) 317-7246 to schedule your consultation.

column40:
Today was my first injection for lower back with this place and I am so happy that I changed over to Haven. My injections were hardly painful. The staff is amazing, friendly and kind. Dr Nowak was very gentle and told me everything he was doing. I have never had a pain clinic that made me feel important and relaxed. I highly recommend Haven Spine and pain.|So glad to be a patient here, the staff and doctor braty is great! They take there time with you and listen. Dr. Bray cares for his patients, and goes up and beyond . Now my family goes and sees him.|DVery pleasant atmosphere. Dr Bray is very good at explaining the different treatments. I had a good resolve to my lower back aches with the injections . I am having neck and shoulder inflammation  and have made an appointment to see what can be done. Thank you . Office is very helpful and my procedure went well.|Since the closing of another large pain clinic Haven Spine and Pain has really stepped in to help those who were left high and dry. I was able to seamlessly slide into their system and receive all the care I needed- and then some. The staff is awesome- everyone seems to love their jobs. Laurena Schultz NP listened to my concerns and not only addressed ALL of them but also provides  excellent follow up. Dr Nowak is very skilled at his job and I have total faith in all the procedures he performs. Everyone is friendly and kind. They want the best for you and it shows. If you must go to a pain clinic then this is the place. I am so thankful they were willing to take me on as a patient. They are the best.  And looking at these reviews it really galls me when people complain about arriving late and rescheduling. When you arrive late you are inconveniencing everyone and then you expect them to fit you in making the other patients wait who actually arrive on time. Be thankful they offered you a reschedule at all. I have found Haven Spine and Pain to be nothing but professional. My questions are always answered, procedures are explained fully by all staff involved in the procedure.  Very caring and concerned health group.|The work was good but they broke my cell told me to call if it's bad then try to say it was under my jacket which is black so is the cell which was on top wouldn't be on bottom and she just grab jacket and broke my screen how is this my fault|I couldn't have hoped for a more caring staff. I am so glad I was referred to Dr. Voogd, his experience and knowledge helped guide me in making some tough decisions.  I appreciated his honesty and compassion with my case.  Yes, there can be some longer wait times, but the time he spends with each patient giving options and explanations is very much appreciated.|RUN.....This place replies that they want to hear from people to resolves issues. I left 3 messages, not one call back. This place does not care. They give you an appointment for a year and a half. Paperwork and website state reminder call will be given. Had my appointment for the 18th and never received one. Was told by first time receptionist that it was my responsibility and it would be Sept of 2025 for new appointment.
Whoever didn't do their responsibility,  should be suspended without pay or fired.|Doc is amazing. Took the time to listen to my issues. I've seen 5 different types of doctors and haven't gotten answers. While the shots didn't help me, I am now seeing Doreen here and she spoke to doc about my previous treatments and came up with a game plan. Staff is so great, front office and in the back. Thank you|It a joke a bunch of lazy staff.they lied threw there teeth .leave messages and never call you back  don't waste your time  .there's better places|I waited over a year to get into this place and then i spent another year thinking they actually wanted to help me. I should have gone with my 1st instinct when the nurse asked me why i had to use catheters. I told her it was the pinched nerves in my spine. She lauged and said who told ya that. I said my neurologist at the MS center. The head nurse doreen spent all of about 3 minites talking to me. The main issue i wanted to address was severe neuropathy foot pain. I asked about a spinal.cord stimulator and she told me that she thought that would be tbe best thing for my neuropathy and after that she would address my hip pain and other areas. Well the stimulator disnt help at all for the foot pain and when i went back doreen blamed the stimulator company and told me to go back to the VA and ask them to help and give me a drug that ive been taking for 20 years and they should know that. She didnt even bother to crack ny file. And why should she? Shes getting rich off the hundreds of patients coming through!  I seriously doubt theyve ever had a patient with gulf war sydrome before and i foolishly thought becaise Dr Voogd was a veteran he would help but all he seemes to want to do is socialize. Really noce guy but he doesnt talk about your medical needs much. They wanted to do a shot ive had about 10 times over the last 25 years. I told them that its never worked before and they dont care. Again why would they? Thats the problem with our healthcare system in this country...its all profit based!!! I dodnt trust doctors and nurses  before this and fkr aome reason i started to think maybe i could but now i KNOW i cant. And i dont want to hear from anyone there about this because your worried about your reputation. Shouldve thought of that before treating me with such disregard. But thats the way the world is now, nobody wants to take any blame

column40:
Incredible people who are always looking out for their patients.  Dr. Ferro has helped me tremendously.|For some reason, my original REVIEW has disappeared... probably because it ripped Dr. Ferro's OFFICE employee's to shreds...and RIGHTFULLY SO!
Ferro, as a Doctor is GREAT. However his office personnel are terrible!
They never return calls, even when they tell you to get back with them to set up an appointment. I left messages for 6 months straight, (once a week, on multiple extensions, once I realized the ext I was told to use, seem to have no one ever listening to the messages.), asking, then begging them to please let me set up an office visit, or whatever it would take,  to continue with what Dr. Ferro had started...nothing ever came from those calls.
Not one call back.
Finally, I told my referring Doctor about my problem, where he said, he's heard more & more stories similar to this about Ferro's office... and he finally referred me to another doctor.
It's simple, I just want to walk again. Ferro saw my problem, stated he could help me out... and due to his personnel incompetence, I was left with more problems...
To me, that's just mean, and nasty... and totally unacceptable!
Thanks for getting my hopes up, only to let them fall to the ground & crumble. RUDE!

KGilson~|This office saved my life.  I have a very painful rare disorder called Trigeminal Neuralgia. I went to many big name hospitals and was told they couldn't help me.  My neurologist sent me to Dr. Ferro. I was ready to give up on everything.  Living in my bed was no life. With Dr.  Ferro's help I was able to get out of bed a few days.  When the cervical spinal stimulator became an option he told me about it.  It changed my entire life. It's not a cure but I can say I have more days out of bed then in bed now. I feel human again.
His staff is to notch.  Kind and caring.  I highly recommend him if you have pain they will do everything they can to help you. I love Dr Ferro and his staff.|I love this Dr I got my life back, I could not even bend over when I came in. Great bedside manner!|I have to change my review. I have been trying to contact his office for about 8 weeks. I received 1 call, got the order for x-rays 3 weeks ago. We hand delivered the x-ray and have not heard anything, his practices for contacting patients is the worst. I am so much disappointed. Now looking for a new pain doctor. I am an established patient since 2020. Good luck on being contacted.|Dr. Richard Ferro is a truly fantastic physician.  He is caring and compassionate as well as extremely knowledgeable and skilled in the management of pain. He has done more to reduce my chronic spinal pain than any other physician or treatment has been able to do, and he's enabled me to manage my pain much more effectively.  All of his nurses and staff are equally wonderful, all are genuinely compassionate. I always feel in good hands in his practice.|Great pain Clinic  just long drive.Dont understand  why he put me on  stronger meds than my GP doctor  he sent me to Dr Ferro  have one roller coaster off  ride 7 surgery's in a year have pain pump needs  service every 3 month to big  for my anatomy Dr's words so it sets in at angle after two surgery's  so it rubbes on the muscle on left side of spine has leads that run up  spinal fusion to upper back trickles narcotics  down  spine eventually  absorb in to tissue don't do that much for my back mostly takes care of the pain in back pump if it fit properly would be lot better out  come, kinda off a oxymoron to me but just heavy equipment operator not doctor.Have to drive from west side off Battle CREEK  Mi drive  up there once a month to pick up script or have post dated so don't have to make drive. On right side I have Tenses unit with  leads  that run to ribs that where unnecessary  removed by Thorasic  surgeon  that has moved am working on legal action that is another story, Suprising  the  tenses unit gives  alot more relief than exspected.My only complaint is ask if he could change my pain pills not increase they where giving me acid reflux and to strong so was prepared for decreasing  amount  big mistake  he took me from 20mg Oxycodone  to norco 7.5 mg big drop  even person  filling  my pump agreed with me had fell down  and hit right side and back still swollen so my pain level was higher so sent me home with steroid  for swelling working good so far but my pain  level  has not changed told him may run out of meds can't get my pain  under control guess if run out off meds   go emergency  room? Or go to Veterans  hospital suside watch lost all my quality of  life either in fog from narcotics  or in the worst pain ever!|I have been with Dr Ferro I think for 11 or 12 years now.  He's been amazing.  When I went in the beginning I was not sleeping but a couple hours a week because I had a really bad sciatic nerve issue.  I truly miss Dr.  Ezzo , he was the counselor that I visited every 2 weeks, he was very kind as is Dr. Ferro.  It affected many of terribly when he passed.  The office staff had always be kind to me and helpful.  During the pandemic they have been understanding of my autoimmune issues and my fears of coming in last year.  Thank you so much for your understanding.  Marcie N.

From getting an appointment to seeing the Dr. to the procedure, it is all done in a timely manner, all staff is courteous and helpful and Dr. Gitlin  takes the time to listen. I easily give them a five star rating.|I have been seeing Dr. Gitlin for quite some time now and I trust him 100% he always has my best interest at heart he is a great doctor he is helping me with my problems with my back as well as my legs if you're looking for a great pain management doctor I would recommend Dr. Gitlin.|Anyone with pain knows the difficulty of finding a pain specific Dr. and pharmacy is not easy. Moving to MI caused me real concerns until I was referred to and met Dr. Gitlin, he listened to my pain issue and my concerns and he was able to allay all my worries, agreed to see me regularly and having a pharmacy adjacent who would fill pain RXs was a Godsend.  He's been easy to talk to, he takes care of my pain and stress and I would refer him in a heartbeat to anyone suffering from chronic pain and a desire to control or eliminate that pain.  He's awesome s is his office staff, you're all appreciated

Greg Scherr|This practice is the best experience I have ever had. The staff in front are very pleasant and the medical staff in the back as well as the surgical staff are the best. I have never come in contact with anyone in the office that was not professional. They helped me to understand some of the changes with my insurance. The physicians are awesome and they are willing to take the time to explain things.|Dr Gitlin is an amazing pain practitioner. He is very careful to NEVER over prescribe opiods for fear of negative consequences. He has researched different pathways of treatment and is cognizant of my history with disability. As a person, Dr Gitlin is always kind and considerate during my appointments  and is never condescending the way some physicians can be.

The staff is the best! They have worked with me many times regarding insurance issues and appointment scheduling. I honestly couldn't ask for better treatment or care.|Dr Gitlin is very thorough and compassionate about your health and making it better. He also includes you in decision of next steps of treatment.|My experience has always been very professional and very good.  I wish Dr. Gitlin could take care of all of my problems, however the ones that he does take care of he does a wonderful thorough job. Thank you neural pain and bless you Dr Gitlin.|Been seeing Dr. Gitlin regularly for issues in my shoulder, knee and foot. I was given some trigger point injections. The relief from pain is outstanding. I couldn't be more grateful for his help in giving me my life back.

column3:
At Michigan Pain Consultants, Dr. Bindu Popat-Lewis brings exceptional credentials and experience to pain management in Grand Rapids. With a Bachelor of Health Science and Master of Physical Therapy from Oakland University, followed by a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine from Michigan State University, our approach is uniquely comprehensive. Dr. Popat-Lewis refined her expertise during 10 years of physical therapy practice at prestigious institutions including William Clay Ford Center for Athletic Medicine-Henry Ford Health System and William Beaumont Hospital.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer advanced interventional pain management techniques including:

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Targeted pain injections

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Personalized treatment plans

Dr. Popat-Lewis completed her Anesthesiology residency and AOA-accredited fellowship in Acute and Chronic Pain Management at McLaren Hospital of Greater Lansing. This dual background in physical therapy and pain medicine allows us to provide truly integrated care at our Michigan Pain Consultants practice located at 2060 E Paris Ave SE, Grand Rapids. For appointments or questions, call us at 800-281-3237.
column11: Dr. Bindu Popat-Lewis earned her Bachelor of Health Science from Oakland University and Master of Physical Therapy degrees from Oakland University in Rochester, Michigan. She practiced physical therapy for 10 years at the William Clay Ford Center for Athletic Medicine-Henry Ford Health System, and William Beaumont Hospital. Dr. Popat-Lewis received her D.O. at the Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine. She completed her residency in Anesthesiology and AOA-accredited fellowship in Acute and Chronic Pain Management at McLaren Hospital of Greater Lansing. She is trained and experienced in the latest interventional pain management techniques including spinal cord stimulation.

column40:
I've never seen or talked to her. And she prescribed a medication to my pharmacy that caused me to stop breathing. She needs to read a person's file and current medications before grasping in the air and just picking one. I feel that she is just a temp stand in for all the Michigan pain consultants closing, to hand out anything to part of the 60,000 patients of Michigan Pain Consultants who lost their care without notice. I couldn't believe that someone I've never spoken to or met could do that to me. If I had died I know my family would be doing something about it.|I went to Dr Lewis three or four times a couple of years ago two different orthopedic surgeons wanted me to have surgery on my knee! Dr Lewis care of me and I've never had pain since but I also go to someone she referred me to spinal Dynamics and this woman used to work at MPC and she is awesome also! I'm hoping with MPC closing that Dr Lewis is still around|I really miss Dr. Lewis. I wish I knew where she got a new job at. She was a life saver. Got a lot of my pain under control and tolerable.|Dr lewis knows what she is doing and does it well . Her And her staff are a awesome group . When i go to see her I'm never doing too well when I leave in always happy and not in pain Anna always walking the w way I should be . I'm very happy she is the Dr I got when my problems all started  . highly recommend her to anyone|Dr Bindu Popat-Lewis is an extremely caring Dr.  When going into her office I feel comfortable that she is going to do what is best for me.  I have always felt that way.  The first time I went in for a consultation she could see the amount of pain I was suffering and got me right into a room to relieve the pain.  I could not walk and just sitting was causing such great pain.  I have dealt with a lot of pain but this was way beyond.  Dr Bindu Popat-Lewis recognize it.  She got me in a room and helped me relieve the pain.  She explained everything she was going to do and why.  To help me she suggested physical therapy to see if that would help.  She gave me the name of a physical therapist who is amazing.  After I have tried to avoid surgery for my hips I am now taking the advice of my primary care Dr, Dr. Bindu Popat-Lewis, and my physical therapist and going ahead with the surgery.
I tried everything I could not to have surgery.  My Drs kept me as comfortable as they possibly could until I was ready.  I believe God is telling me it's time.   I have been going to Dr. Bindu Popat-Lewis for almost two years.  She is someone you can trust.|Me and my wife have been seeing Dr Lewis for years with great results. She is a very good listener and a pleasant person to be around. Our injection treatments always give relief every time they are given|Dr. Lewis was fantastic listener, when other doctor's shook their heads, unknowingly. She was encouraging as things progressed for me.
Put it this way: she took me from complex regional pain and not knowing if I would walk again in 2015, to 2-3 mile walks, hiking paths, cross country skiing, gym classes. I am eternally grateful to this this woman and look forward to an active retirement. Thank you again and again Doc!|After being treated with morphine & Norco and not being able to walk without pain in my legs & back, for over 20 years, I now can walk almost pain free & no longer fall down. I'm off of Norco & will start lowering morphine soon. It's a miracle, thx Dr.Lewis!
