column2: Lansing Pain Management | University of Michigan Health-Sparrow
column3:
At Lansing Pain Management, we understand the crippling physical and emotional effects that pain can create. That is why our mission is to provide compassionate care to everyone, every time. Our comprehensive pain management teams work to actively improve our patients' lives by treating the whole person - addressing physical, functional, emotional and psychological needs for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Treatment Services

We specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Interventional pain procedures and injections

Located at 1200 E Michigan Ave in Lansing, our facility combines advanced medical expertise with a patient-centered approach. We're proud to be part of the University of Michigan Health-Sparrow network, bringing world-class pain management solutions to our community. For appointments or more information about our services, contact us at (517) 364-5330.
column11: We understand the crippling physical and emotional effects that pain can create. That is why our mission is to provide compassionate care to everyone, every time. Our comprehensive pain management teams work to actively improve our patients' lives by treating the physical, functional, emotional and psychological needs of those with acute and chronic pain, including headaches and back pain.
column38: holly perry|Tami Campbell|It's Just Me|Danielle Shirey|Kenneth Berger|Lindsey ChassM|Jenn McLaren|Richard Vance
column40:
I love the doctors and staff here... Dr.Lee has been my doctor for a long time he now gives me my shots and I see a PA when I don't see him and they are really really good and understanding of my needs, I always enjoy talking with the nurses, receptionist. They care and listen to my concerns and needs.|I have been here a few times and i am always very happy with all areas of care. I always have had good care. And today I had great care. I've also been very happy with all of the injections and procedures that I've had.|Returned to Sparrow  Pain (was a 24 year patient of wonderful caring doctors, but found they had retired upon my return) after being gone 4 years.  The new dr saw my pain meds (originally prescribed by THEM) and drew conclusions before reviewing the test results HE ordered (CT scans).  His "treatment plan" would not include any med refills only injections.
Ive since seen surgeons and found doctors who care and am doing much better.  This place??...?? Only wanted to push injections ...you draw yourself own conclusions. I give them one .|Horrible experience with receiving bilateral facet steroid injections. I was initially told I would not feel ANYTHING during the procedure, nor would I be awake for it. Turns out I was both awake, and in excruciating pain. I asked them during the procedure why does it hurt so much, and their response was "to hold still, it's almost over". As I'm looking at the xray machine and seeing the needle inserted in my spine. I had Horrible pain for months after the procedure that felt like I was being stabbed in the back with those needles repeatedly.

On top of all of this, they injected into the wrong sections of my back. My problem areas are L5, S1 (pain on right side, imagines show problems on the right side), and they did L3/L4/L5 on the left and right sides (6 total injections) So 4 of them were unnecessary/in the wrong spot. I felt zero pain relief and worsened pain after this. I went twice in hopes of it working. They had the nerve to recommend epidural injections since the facet injections were ineffective.

Do yourself or your loved ones a favor and DO NOT COME HERE.|The staff is very empathetic but appear afraid to aggressively attack pain.  I've had multiple injections of cortisone preps to little avail.  My pain levels have only increased including partial paralysis and numbness.  Without resolution, I fear that I'm becoming bed and wheelchair bound.  Additionally, it's near impossible to navigate their phone system and I believe it's on track to be unreachable.  Callbacks are not effective.  I protect my phone against telemarketers and won't answer unsolicited calls.  Thereby, I receive no calls.  On the whole, the personnel making decisions are weak while the subordinates are excellent.|As someone who has been through the ringer with work comp, the staff here have been amazing. They listened, came up with a plan and for the 1st time in 3 years I feel as close to "normal" as I ever have. I used to need help doing daily tasks that would exhuast me after a few minutes due to pain. Now I can do house tasks, run errands and walk my dog without being in excruciating pain. I know it will be a lifelong committement to treating my pain, but knowing I have such a team of caring and determined individuals behind me makes that so much easier.|Gave my family member injections for over a year with no pain relief.  They just do not care about helping with pain.  They would rather stick you with needles and collect their money.  It doesn't matter if you keep telling them it is NOT working.  This is unethical and immoral to leave patients in pain as they do.|I'm not one that normally goes to the effort to post my experiences on my proceedurs however I just need to give praise where praise is deserved.
I've been going to the pain management clinic for well over five year's and the compassion and dedication provided by this extradinary and special group of individuals is second to none. Highly recommend
Thank You for the outstanding care.
Rick Vance

column3:
At Tri-County Pain Consultants, we provide a comprehensive interdisciplinary approach to pain management that offers renewed hope for those suffering from chronic pain. We firmly believe that chronic pain should be treated like other chronic medical conditions such as diabetes or asthma - requiring ongoing care rather than a one-time fix. Our goal isn't to simply cure pain, but to optimize its management for long-term relief and improved quality of life.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a full spectrum of pain management solutions including:

  • Personalized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions

  • Advanced injection therapies and interventional procedures

  • Comprehensive medication management

  • Interdisciplinary care coordination

Under the leadership of Dr. Wisam George, our dedicated team takes the time to listen to each patient's unique concerns and develop customized treatment strategies. We understand that living with chronic pain can be physically and emotionally draining, which is why we approach each case with compassion and medical expertise. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 248-735-8272 to schedule an appointment at our Farmington Hills location.
column11: Tri-County Pain Consultants comprehensive interdisciplinary approach to pain care offers patients and providers renewed hope for relief from chronic pain. Chronic pain should be treated like other chronic medical conditions such as diabetes, asthma or congestive heart failure. Chronic pain requires chronic treatment. The goal of treatment is to optimize management of the pain, as opposed to curing the pain.

column40:
Dr George is very nice
However trying to schedule appointments or even just getting ahold oh his staff is next to impossible
After several attempts to call and get my 5th injection scheduled, I am leaving the practice due to no communication from his staff
It's incredibly frustrating|First I'd like to say that Dr George is great, He has helped me with my chronic pain in my back and ankle. 5 stars for him! On to his staff, these folks are awesome! From the receptionist to the recovery, all of them are amazing. They listen to you and treat you with the upmost respect. They deserve 10 stars!
These folks actually care about you, that's something that you don't see these days. Highly recommend.|I have been going here for almost 9 years now. Back when Dr Zapada was located at this practice. Thru Dr Wright, Dr dobritt, now Dr George. I liked Dr Dobritt and tried to follow him when he left and went to Novi. I Had an appointment at his new office but when i showed up they told me Dr Dobritt  had a "Non Compete Clause" and couldnt work there, very strange, i tried to find him but no idea where he went from there, no idea where he is practicing today, so i went back to see dr george,  Glad i did,  I have lower back pain and down the back of my left leg from an injury and surgery 30 years ago. Tricounty has done a great job managing my pain with a combonation of steriod injections and medications. Its always a plesent experiance from the moment i am greeted by Uganda at reception to all the great PAs right up to when i see Dr George. Uganda upfront is so nice very friendly and extremly helpfull.  I highly recomend Tricounty Pain if you are a suffering from cronic pain.|Many Doctors but not one quite like mines. Dr. Wisam George of Tri-County Pain Management. Words CANNOT express how Dr. George have helped me. 4 grueling years of PAIN day and night I suffered having Lower Lumbar Spinal Stenosis until........ Dr. George heard my cry for RELIEF. Drained literally from pain. He is AMAZING he CARES and he will help you just like he helped me their isn't enough stars for this review so here is mines THANKYOU DR. WISAM GEORGE Also... A Special Thankyou To Uganda for showing Exceptional Patient Services what a Beautiful Personality and Rocking the Front Office !!|I don't understand this office. I was here in 2017 and left ASAP due to scammy business tactics and rude staff. I then went to MIPA and was a patient of Dr. George there for about 4 years.
He left that practice and moved here. I want to continue seeing Dr. George, so I called last week to schedule an appointment. I was told the first available appointment is in June.. which is 6 months from now.|This place went from great to horrible! Dr. George is good but the staff is beyond horrible!
First of all I couldn't walk due to a back issue. We asked for a wheelchair. They brought it to the car and wheeled me in. Then made me walk to the furthest exam room. Then I was going to get an injection and they wanted me to walk into the surgical room. I wasn't asked to change! I was in street clothes. Nothing covering hair and shoes on!
The doctor hit the nerve and I was in excruciating pain! It took forever to inject ladocane which did not help.
The staff was extremely rude as I lye there in pain crying.
I went home. No one followed up. I was scheduled for an MRI the next evening! I went and they never received the orders! The doctors office was closed and the answering service would not help me. I went home and scheduled it again myself and called the office. They insisted that they sent the orders. I had them send them to the new appointment place. On that day I called the place and they had not received the order. The doctors office is closed on Friday but someone answered the phone! I had them send the order's again! They still insisted they had!
I made another appointment with a different doctor in another practice and he ordered my records to be transferred. It took 5 phone calls from me and several from the nurse to get it done!! Stay away from this office! Horrible does not come close to what I experienced! You were warned!|I was referred to Dr. George by another pain doctor. I absolutely love him. He's kind and takes his time with you, he doesn't rush you out the door. I'm extremely happy with him and his whole staff. The office is very clean and everyone takes covid precautions.|Best Dr I can't say one bad thing about him I'm very up front and truthful with him from day 1 and I always give him all my other drs updates and he's the only dr since I broke my in 2000 that will sit down and talk to me regarding test or if I have any questions and he never Rushes me out the door
I've been with many dr and had many surgeries with more to come and he's very patient with me and never pushes to have any treatment lets me take my time
Thank Dr G and his office staff your awesome and treat me like I was family
Means a-lot and makes me feel comfortable not like I'm just dollar signs to them
Awesome job love them all would refer this dr to anyone

column2: Grand Rapids Pain: Girish Juneja, MD
column3:
At Grand Rapids Pain, we provide specialized pain management services under the expert leadership of Dr. Girish Juneja.

Exceptional Credentials and Experience

Dr. Juneja serves as the Director of Michigan Primary Care Partners and Medical Director of West Michigan Surgery Center, bringing over 30 years of clinical experience since 1992. He is double Board Certified in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Pain Management, with a Master's of Science as an Orthopedic Surgeon. His extensive background in orthopedic spinal surgery and comprehensive medical training—including education at JIMPER Medical School in Pondicherry, India and residency at State University of New York at Buffalo—enables us to offer advanced pain management solutions. Our services include:

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations and personalized treatment plans

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Specialized spinal care and treatment

  • Multidisciplinary approach to chronic pain management

We maintain a clean, professional environment at our Grand Rapids Pain Management Center located at 4024 Park E Ct SE, Grand Rapids, MI. For appointments or consultations, contact our caring team at (616) 727-0083.
column11: Dr. Juneja is currently the Director of Michigan Primary Care Partners and the Medical Director of West Michigan Surgery Center. Dr. Juneja attended JIMPER Medical School in Pondicherry, India and completed his residency at State University of New York at Buffalo. Dr. Juneja has an extensive background in orthopedic spinal surgery. He is double Board Certified in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Pain Management. He also has his Masters of Science as an Orthopedic Surgeon. Dr. Juneja has been practicing since 1992.

column40:
Dr. Bez has performed two very successful ablations on my spine. Very "to the point" at the appointments, but terribly late every time. Routinely I've had to wait 45 minutes or more after my scheduled appointment time, and our conversations rarely last more than a few minutes.|So far, I've seen Dr. Bez one time for approximately 4.5 minutes. He sent me for an MRI, which I have done. When I try to call the office, the issue is that no one has ever answered the line. I've tried calling multiple times on different days at different times.|Had my phase 2 Facet block shots of steroids and feel better then I have in years! Phased 1 shots lasted for 6-7 weeks with a level 2 pain until I started dancing and the level 8 pain came back. Hematologist said, I was inflamed again and to lay off the dancing and  straining  activities... Well noted! I actually feels great now with just a little soreness at a pain level of 1-2 ...I feel like I'm getting my life back although this is just a temporary fix. I'm just so grateful to have some relief! Thank you, Dr Bez!|Dr. Bez was horrible. First appointment; He finally came in the room an hour after my appointment time. He didn't introduce himself. He sat down and asked me what's going on. I told him about my back pain. He suggested a procedure where he would put a steroid shot directly into my spine. OK, I'm ready to try anything. At the hospital, he saw me for about two minutes to mark the spot on my back for the shot. When I saw him for the two week follow up and told him it did not work, his response was "what do you mean?" I told him my pain has not changed. He had no other suggestions for me other than physical therapy. I have been through physical therapy three times. The physical therapist even said I need to see a surgeon. My neurologist has referred me to a surgeon at U of M. My primary doctor agrees for surgery. Dr. Bez is the only one I have seen that doesn't think it's bad.  I have a place in my spine that is straight where it should be curved, 2 bulges, and discs in my neck that are pushed together.|I have struggled with pain my whole life due to a devastating accident when I was a teen. Dr. Bez is the first  doctor in 40 years that actually listened and helped me get to the root of things. He is collaborative and makes sure the treatment is what I want rather than forcing an idea. He never fat shamed me despite my size and still sought an answer beyond lose weight.

His office staff is awesome, Sadie is the best receptionist I've seen in any office, she is knowledgeable and caring. The new gent they have is great too. I can't recommend  Dr. Bez and the Pain clinic enough, they changed my life.|Why is the name McLaren pain clinic if you aren't affiliated with McLaren Hospital? Change your name if you aren't affiliated and don't accept their insurance!|Dr. Bez and his staff are welcoming and friendly. I have been very Grateful and Pleased with my treatment. My pain issues are well managed. I am so much better than I was. Thank You so much Dr. Bez and Staff|Dr Bez was rude and dismissive. His only advice was pain shots that probably wouldn't help.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in Holland, Michigan

At Michigan Pain Consultants, we believe that chronic pain requires chronic treatment. Our comprehensive interdisciplinary approach offers renewed hope for those suffering from persistent pain conditions. We understand that chronic pain should be treated like other ongoing medical conditions such as diabetes or asthma - with consistent, personalized care focused on management rather than promises of complete cures. Our goal is to optimize your pain management and improve your quality of life through our specialized services:

  • Individualized treatment planning

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Psychological support

Located at 844 Washington Ave STE A in Holland, we serve patients throughout West Michigan with compassionate, evidence-based care. Our team of pain specialists works collaboratively to address your unique needs and develop effective strategies for long-term relief. Visit Michigan Pain Consultants online or call us at +1 800-281-3237 to learn how we can help you manage your chronic pain and reclaim your life.
column11: Michigan Pain Consultants comprehensive interdisciplinary approach to pain care offers patients and providers renewed hope for relief from chronic pain. Chronic pain should be treated like other chronic medical conditions such as diabetes, asthma or congestive heart failure. Chronic pain requires chronic treatment. The goal of treatment is to optimize management of the pain, as opposed to curing the pain.
column38: Nancy Smith|Laurie V|Tom Melin|Diane Storey|Tony Tryba|Erika DeVee|Mayra G.|Diane Hayden
column40:
The staff is fantastic! The doctors actually listen to you and make a plan of attack to help. They don't just take for granted that you're there for pain. This is the best pain clinic I've ever been to! This is the only doctor's office I look forward to going to. Not only that the professionalism is outstanding! I thank them for helping me to live a good quality life with minimal pain.|Love, love Dr. Growney!  He is compassionate and very knowledgeable.  I will admit it is difficult to get a hold of staff on the phone. Seems like they could use a full time triage nurse to answer phones, not quite how they work the system. Also do often have to leave messages regarding front desk, but they do call back. Have been coming here for about 8 years and won't leave due to Dr. Growney! Using Patient Portal is helpful for messages and refill requests.  Many meds can now be prescribed electronically for 3 months. Big help there. In spite of the phone contact hassle, staff is always kind and treats me well, so still a 5 star rating.|I'm a paraplegic since 1996 and I've been going to Michigan Pain Consultants in Holland and Grand Rapids locations well over 10yrs. I've been to many doctors and this is the only one I look forward to going to, I feel comforted going there. The staff is AMAZING, the doctors are SECOND TO NONE!!!!!!! They have treated me for more than pain, I suffer from PTSD from the first Gulf War and they've helped with that, they've helped lower the amount of other medications I was taking, they truly care about their patients. Most Dr offices/clinics are "money first, patient second" but not here. I know they put ME FIRST before money and I won't get into specifics but please take my word for it, my health and we'll being come first!!!!!! I really love all the people working at these clinics, they're like family.|I had my final appt today at The Holland/ Mi Pain Consultants. I felt like was going to a funeral. I started 20 years ago with Dr.Growny/ now Dr.Nemeth. I am incredibly sad with the situation. Every person, from front desk, nursing staff, people in the procedure room(sally) and of course, Dr.Growney  and now Dr.Nemeth, have treated me so well and with such compassion. Some things worked and some didn't, but they worked on it until it did. I cannot say enough how great all these people were to me. I feel like I lots some good friends.
Thank you for your care and kindness towards me. You will be missed.
Diane Storey|If you have CHRONIC PAIN...  get a referral to Michigan Pain Consultants.  I personally know how Chronic pain interferes with life, relationships, jobs, friends and more.

Dr. Gao and the rest of the team at Michigan Pain Consultants have profoundly improved my chronic pain.  They actually understand what pain does to a person and they have many more 'tools' to treat it than your Primary Care Provider.

Their approach has been methodical and measured.   But most importantly, they've taken time to understand what I was experiencing and applied a variety of methods to improve my personal situation.  We've made more progress in the ~ 9 months I've been a patient there than in the ~10 preceding years at a variety of providers outside of Michigan where I previously lived.

Prior to their working on my issues, I had been treating the issues with "STRONG" pain meds...  To be sure, Michigan is much more challenging (frustrating) to have and maintain access to such "STRONG" medications - but hey, that is on the state not the Doctor's office....

Once that was sorted,  I have honestly been truly surprised at how effective their treatments and approach to chronic pain management has been.  Their treatment regime has made a fundamental difference in my life...  and in what I have been able to do and take on.  Even though I have pain...  it's SOOO much better today...

In closing - Pain is horrible.  Dealing with insurance can also be horrible.  But I truly believe that Michigan Pain Consultants knows how to navigate insurance and Michigan regulations - AND MOST IMPORTANTLY has multiple tools to diagnose, treat and manage pain.|They gave me Cushing's Syndrome, and kept pushing for more steroid shots. Even after my endocrinologist faxed a letter.|I have been seeing Dr. Nemeth at the Holland location for about a year now and he has been such an amazing doctor, he is caring, very knowledgeable and will not stop until he finds the absolute right treatment for you. I would definitely recommend him to anyone. The nursing staff is amazing, the wait time can be a bit long but that's with any office you go to especially when unexpected situations occur.|I have been receiving treatment at the pain clinic at the Holland branch for five years now, at least four times per year. The team of staff are superb. They provide their patients with exemplary service. They go above and beyond to keep their patients comfortable and satisfied. I love the fact that Dr. Growny is very personable with his patients. He remembers and ask about topics we discussed in previous visits even when they're not health related. I would recommend this pain clinic to anyone who desires quality service. Keep up the good work Michigan Pain Consultants you rock.

column40:
Dr. Hussain at advanced pain center is by far the worst doctor I have come across.
I've been a patient of his for nearly 10 years. When I had insurance he insisted on injections three times a year now I have no insurance so I pay cash for my visits. I had an injection in my hand but refused anymore in my back. They do not help. I swear the pain is worse.
I cannot describe how angry I am, this office claimed I had cocaine in my system back when I first lost my insurance and just yesterday they claimed I had no medication in my system. So they refused to see me anymore.
I am 59 years old. Do not drink or do drugs and have lots of medical problems. This office is a scam and only wants people who have insurance so they can scam the insurance companies for money|We just got treated so badly by Ashley at the front desk she hung up on us as we were trying to explain what the pharmacy was saying I can NOT believe the disrespect from her we've been going to this doctor for 3 yrs dr Hussain is great but he needs better help I will be filing a grievance through the state of Michigan nursing board I have lupus and she.locked.the.door.and.left me standing in the cold while yelling at me instead of listening to me never iny life has this happened toe I'm out done|Dr Hussain is a man of few words. But he is friendly and he has given me a different view on injections without anesthesia.|Dr Hussain is a pretty good doctor. In my opinion, the Staff is the Best. They're very courteous, respectful and very knowledgeable. This includes the Nurse Practitioner. I like her a lot...

Apart from APC being convenient for me to get to, I like the fact that you don't have to be concerned about Riff-Raff standing outside the building, or sitting in a vehicle out in the parking lot, waiting for patients after they've left the building.

I've never been approached by a person, or persons trying to sell pain medication, or wanting to buy pain medication. At some pain management clinics, that seems to be a real problem.

Since prescriptions are sent digitally to the pharmacy, that eliminates these issues...|The people that work here are very nice. Dr hussain has a lot of patients, so we need to have patience with them too.  take the time to ask questions if needed let him know what is working and what isn't. get to know them before judging,  then write your review|I just read today how numerous Michigan doctors were convicted for insurance scams by demanding patients have injections and if you can't have them then this doctor does just like the 13 who were charged and given prison time and ordered to pay back millions to insurance! I couldn't safely have spinal injections due to a rare blood clot disorder. I take daily injections of low  molecular heparin. This doctor threatened to take away my oral pain medication numerous times in between seeing him and his PA's. The day he said he was going to take my pain medication away I then agreed to have the injections (chronic pain makes it difficult to survive and have any quality of life) so I agreed. I was then given a pamphlet that said if you are on a blood thinner you must not take it 3 days prior and three days after the injections. When I demanded the doctor looked at my previous medical records that explained the seriousness of my rare blood disorder, he took it out on me, stopped my oral pain medication that day without giving me time to find another doctor or any kind of solution. I know who I'm calling and reporting this clinic to. This is the exact practice the convicted doctors in Oakland and surrounding counties were convicted for! Shame on everyone employeed at this clinic! If you need pain control go elsewhere. I have a feeling this little gig is coming to an end!|I have been a patient of Dr. Aman for approximately a year and a half now and Dr. has performed procedures on my back with great results!
I had a cervical surgery back in 2019 at UofM
and it was the time of covid,
the surgery left my with a very stiff neck and scar tissue, Dr Aman will be doing a procedures to deading the nerve endings!
which I heard has great results.  The Dr. and staff are always available to take your questions and or return your phone calls!
The best help I've had since the surgery!  Thank you so much!
Sincerely,
MaryAnn Zingaro!|My pcp referred me to this place. I read the reviews and didn't have much hope but gave Dr. Hussain a chance.  Please save your time and money. I complained for months and finally fired him last Friday. He didn't listen to me, nor do anything to help me but yet he was making his money. I changed doctors and got immediate response and testing and was informed that I need back surgery. Doctor Hassain decided Lyrica was sufficient for back fractures, fibro and neuropathy. The whole point of going to pain management, is to get some relief. The office manager apologized before my appt and afterwards. My pcp and neurosurgeon were both floored that Dr Hassain didn't prescribe something stronger, nor refer me to a neurosurgeon.

Expert Pain Management Solutions Since 1986

At Chronic Pain Institute, Dr. Kuldip Deogun brings over 35 years of specialized experience to help patients overcome both chronic and acute pain disorders. Our primary mission is to decrease pain and increase function through comprehensive, individualized care. We take pride in our multidisciplinary approach that begins with careful evaluation and precise diagnosis of each patient's condition. Our practice offers advanced pain management techniques including:

  • Neuromodulation (spinal cord stimulators and pain pumps)

  • Nerve ablation procedures

  • Therapeutic injections

  • Customized treatment plans

Dr. Deogun's expertise allows us to provide effective solutions for even the most complex pain conditions. Located in Sterling Heights, we serve patients throughout Michigan with compassionate care that focuses on improving quality of life. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 586-997-5048 to schedule your consultation at our office on 43145 Schoenherr Rd.
column11: Dr. Kuldip Deogun has been a practicing pain specialist since 1986. He is an expert in the diagnosis and treatment of both chronic pain and acute pain disorders. His main goal is to decrease pain and increase function. In private practice, his focus has been on careful evaluation and diagnosis of each patient, employing a multidisciplinary approach to solving painful conditions. Dr. Deogun will use such techniques as neuromodulation, including spinal cord stimulators and pain pumps, nerve ablation and therapeutic injections to provide pain relief.
column38: Grace Phillips|Kristin Zuchora|Penny Ries|Tonz Ardelean|Ul Be|Jacen|Jessica Franz|maria maniaci
column40: Dr. Deogun has changed my life. I have had three back surgeries, And I refuse to have another one. When I Came to see Dr. Deogun I was in extreme pain, When I got up in the morning, I had to hang on to things to move around, Until I took my pain meds for the day. I had no quality of life. I couldn't walk down the street, My husband had to help me with everything around the house. I couldn't stand for more than 5 or 10 minutes, I couldn't sit for more than five or 10 minutes because the pain so bad. The worst thing about it was I wasn't able to Do things with my grandchildren. November 6, 2024 I had procedure called a Bilateral Radio-frequency Lumbar ablation, The procedure was a complete success! This is the first time in years that I have been Pain free, Not taking any pain medication , I am also able to walk for a mile for the first time in years! Dr. Deogun is one of the most compassionate,  knowledgeable doctors I've ever had. His staff is amazing the girls in the front and The girls in the back are so compassionate and caring. If anyone is living with chronic pain, I highly recommend Dr. Deogun.|Dr Deogun and his staff have been taking care of helping me manage my pain from a life changing Motorcycle accident I got into when I was 21.The first time I came to see Dr D he sat with me for almost an hour to go over my case, took the time to educate me on what was going on with the injuries to my spine, and go over options of treatments to try. He listened to my concerns and for the first time I felt like I was on the right path with the right treatment. His staff is welcoming and knowledgeable. When I have a procedure the Nurses go out of their way to make me feel comfortable, especially when Im extremely nervous. I am now 40 and when a new issue pops up with my back I know I'll get great care and I will be ok. If you are looking for a great Doctor with wonderful PAs that will listen, and help find a way to help your pain this is the practice for you.|My daughter has been with dr Deogon for many years. He has helped her to live a normal life with his care from a near fatal accident. She has had 2 fusions in her back and a corepectamy to help her walk. Because of his care she is tolerating the pain well. All her procedure he does with the help of his amazing staff of nurses especially. Thank you all from her mother with much gratitude.|Nurses and doctor are very kind and pro efficient. Smooth epidural injection, would recommend.|This was my place for care of my pain for a long long time. Over 10 years. I am not sure when things changed. After many coming and goings of many different practitioners  things were never the same. As time passed Dr D  has changed too.  Just not that same personalized feeling. Got to be that it was a practitioner that was seen most often.  He does like to talk about golf and an active lifestyle.|The place use to be good when Dr. Kole was there. I was a patient of his for over 14 years! The new doctor refuses to see see me, or even take a phone call from me. I do not recommend this place.|First I want to say that Dr. D is wonderful! He cares and really takes the time and is so thorough and deeply cares for his patients.  I'm grateful for him. His staff obviously with a great leader as he is, they literally follow his lead.  If I knew everyone's names I would put them on here, the only ones I know and apologize if I spell them wrong are Cheyenne and Laura, you both have greatly impacted my life.  You have fought for me and helped me so much with getting approval through insurance.  There aren't many staff anymore that do that for patients, I greatly appreciate that from the bottom of my heart.  You are all truly my advocates, for my pain that Dr. D and all of you are helping me alleviate.  Every time I come in, it literally feels like a family, I really can't thank you enough.  All of you from front to back of office are just angels in my eyes, thank you again|I cannot say enough about Dr. Deogun and his staff. My husbands spinal injections helped him out tremendously, he's able to function and has regained his quality of life back. Great bedside manner with even better results!

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

At Michigan Pain Consultants, we believe that chronic pain requires chronic treatment. Our interdisciplinary approach to pain care offers renewed hope for relief from persistent pain conditions. We treat chronic pain like other ongoing medical conditions such as diabetes or asthma, focusing on optimizing management rather than promising unrealistic cures. Our specialized team provides a range of services including:

  • Personalized pain management plans

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Behavioral health support

Located at 6896 SW Greenville Rd Suite 100 in Greenville, MI, our facility is equipped with the latest technologies to address various pain conditions. We understand the debilitating impact chronic pain can have on daily life, which is why we're committed to helping our patients regain functionality and improve quality of life. Learn more about our comprehensive approach to pain management by visiting Michigan Pain Consultants or call us at +1 800-281-3237 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Michigan Pain Consultants comprehensive interdisciplinary approach to pain care offers patients and providers renewed hope for relief from chronic pain. Chronic pain should be treated like other chronic medical conditions such as diabetes, asthma or congestive heart failure. Chronic pain requires chronic treatment. The goal of treatment is to optimize management of the pain, as opposed to curing the pain.

.|Outstanding. Very professional.This was my second time receiving a nerve block for surgery. I asked to see him to see if he would see if I had a pinched nerve or what. I was in extreme pain that brought me to tears. The assistant went to ask him and he REFUSED to see me!! He said I had to go back to my PCP to be referred for this problem. You'd think he'd have the decency to come in and talk to me. I was crying because I was in so much pain and I was at a pain clinic to see my so called doctor. They let me leave in pain saying there was nothing they could do. I left and called my PCP and thankfully he got me in immediately and he took care of me. I would not go back to this clinic ever as they only care about money. Dr. Sabbagh went above and beyond to relieve my mom from pain. He was able to figure out where all her pain was coming from and treated it in the best way possible. Dr. Sabbagh is extremely knowledgeable, caring, and so informative just the right qualities we look for in a Dr. Thank you for being you. If you are reading my review, please look no further and schedule an appointment with him, you truly will be pleased.|Dr Sabbagh is the BEST Doctor that you could ever ask for when it comes to helping his patients.
I have been suffering for 6 years with   Chronic pain from a auto accident. If it wasn't for Dr Sabbagh understand what I needed to get through this all I don't know what I would have done!!!  BEST DOCTOR EVER!!!|Dr. Sabbagh was very helpful with my back issues. He explains his entire plan of action he has in mind for you. He starts with treatment that fits your pain level and doesnt stop until he finds something that works for you or after he has exhausted all his options. He explans each step of the procedures before and DURING the procedure. I was extremely pleased with him. Unfortunately he had to refer me to a back specialist for he had no options left to treat me. I advise going down there to make an appointment or to speak to anyone in his office.  They wont answer the phones n when they do they put you on hold til you give up.   This review is for the DOCTOR. NOT FOR THE RECEPTIONIST. Unfortunately the doc is getting less stars because of his receptionists. I GIVE DR SABBAGH A 10 !|Office staff was so nice, and patient, the Dr sabbagh was amazing he totally wants to make everyone have the best quality of life. He listens and explains everything. So glad I was reffered to him|I, Sharlene Gant-Greer, was referred to DMC Sports Medicine Group after ending up in the emergency room in late July or early August of 2017 because I could not walk more than 15 steps without terrible leg pain. Shortly after that, I received a diagnosed of Degenerate Disc Disease /Stenosis, within a month after that I had my first visit with Dr. Mahmoud Sabbaugh on September 1, 2017. Dr. Sabbaugh explained my MRI while showing me the pictures, and a brief explanation of how surgery might be able to make me more comfortable but it is degenerate. I was devastated and I am still devastated as today I cried in his office (again)! Again, I received nothing but encouragement from him.

The plan:  Physical Therapy (very low-impact stretches) 3 times a week and at home the other days, for six months, I completed that!  Next: Three injections 30 days apart, the first two were great then the third one was not so good. I fell apart (boo hoo) in his office (again)! I still received nothing but encouragement from him.

Next suggestion: We can try the an implant for pain, I was for it until I found out I had to be off work 6 - 8 weeks that's surgery time why do that twice! Even then, he was supportive and referred me to a surgeon that he highly recommends. About 6 - 9 months ago, I saw the surgeon and his team and I was very comfortable, but clearly not ready for surgery. I have seen Dr. Sabbaugh every 3 months since, nothing but supportive. However, today I informed Dr. Sabbaugh that I am ready to go forward with the surgery, and I will call the surgeon and make an appointment. Oh and did I mention he has the best nurse ever, Connie, she is always there and supportive she was there for every one of my injections! That is my experience with Dr. Mahmoud Sabbaugh. If I could give 10 stars, I would.

column2: Carson Pain Management | University of Michigan Health-Sparrow
column3:
At Carson Pain Management, we understand the crippling physical and emotional effects that pain can create. That is why our mission is to provide compassionate care to everyone, every time. As part of the University of Michigan Health-Sparrow network, our comprehensive pain management teams work to actively improve our patients' lives by addressing all aspects of pain.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We specialize in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions, including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Headache management

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

Our approach is holistic, treating the physical, functional, emotional, and psychological needs of each patient. Located at 102 S 3rd St, Suite 300, Carson City, MI 48811, our facility is equipped with the latest pain management technologies. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit our official website or call us at +1 989-584-6321.
column11: We understand the crippling physical and emotional effects that pain can create. That is why our mission is to provide compassionate care to everyone, every time. Our comprehensive pain management teams work to actively improve our patients' lives by treating the physical, functional, emotional and psychological needs of those with acute and chronic pain, including headaches and back pain.

column40:
Very kind and friendly.they listen to what you have to say.|This is my most favorite Dr's office I have ever experienced in my life. I even kept this Dr. after having moved 53 miles from Carson City. The Dr. has a phenomenal staff also that all work as one team. Very rare "find" now days.
Thanks to all of you for being so kind and genuine about the care I get.|This doctor does not like and is scared now of prescribing pain medications with the two new government laws passed this year (2018) and only his two female RNs will if injections or a small surgery doesnt work for you!!! I dropped him immediately when he would not increase my schedule 6 narcotic, (tramadol), do to it wasnt doing anything for my pain. So i asked to have it increased to see if that would help i was told no. I then new and had terrible insurance prior to being put on the tramadol but was will to bite through the financial issue and ask just to be put back on my schedule 2, (percocet), that i new worked great. He had his assistant call me and tell me he took another look at my most recent MRI and he sees no reason to continue nor do i need any pain management. Well the last surgeon almost 3 years prior wanted me in for a immediate secondary fusion surgery of my lumbar spine. I was told by my old pcp and a couple more spinal surgeons that my lower spine will only get worse not better do to the several issues i have going on with it. I will have to remain i pain medications for the rest of my life i recently brought myself to that conclusion, so i can continue to provide for my family working many hours with a very physically demanding job i cant get out of just yet. I have been exercising, conditioning and slowly get back into strengthening mybody especially my abdominal area to help with my back. After dropinng this individual as my pain doctor i thought my new pcp most certainly would have prescribed my percocet. That was until my pcp was told by this pain doctor that i was abusing the tramadol. I was disgusted that this pain doctor lied to my pcp and in return my pcp took his word over mine. If you want help for legitimate chronic pain where only narcotics are the only option after all other treatments you've tried have failed- DO NOT SEEK HELP BY THIS DOCTOR!!!!!|I very much enjoy the staff that works here. All though I cannot understand the doctor and have been waiting over a hour to be seen... im getting alittle upset today|Drove 30 minutes for an appointment that lasted 5 minutes horrible doctors don't take into consideration what works and doesn't work for you would not recommend this group of so called doctors|Absolutely terrible doctor. Accuses you of selling your meds among other accusations. Does not treat you, assumes everyone misuses their meds. Does not help your pain issues at all.|Bhimalli doesn't care about anything except doing procedures and shipping patients off for surgeries, even if they're unnecessary or won't actually help the patient.|Awesome doctor. Great staff. They care and work hard to help.

column2: Henry Ford Pain Management - Jackson Medical Center
column3:
Chronic pain doesn't have to control your life. At Henry Ford Pain Management Center - Jackson, we focus on providing effective pain management solutions to improve your quality of life. Our

Multi-Disciplinary Approach to Pain Relief

brings together specialists who are experts in diagnosing and treating a wide range of painful conditions. We understand how pain can interfere with your work, impact your relationships, interrupt your sleep and negatively affect your overall sense of well-being. That's why our team specializes in comprehensive treatment for:

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Diabetic neuropathy

  • Chronic headaches

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Back and neck pain

Through personalized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, and therapeutic approaches, we strive to help you regain function and reduce suffering. Located at 1201 E Michigan Ave, Suite 200 in Jackson, our center is equipped with advanced technology to address your pain concerns. Learn more about our comprehensive services by visiting our Henry Ford Pain Management Center - Jackson website or call us at (517) 205-4841 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Pain can interfere with your work, impact your relationships, interrupt your sleep and negatively affect your overall sense of well-being. At Henry Ford Pain Management Center - Jackson, we focus on providing effective pain management to improve your quality of life. Our multi-disciplinary care team specializes in the diagnosis, treatment and management of painful conditions, such as complex regional pain syndrome, diabetic neuropathy, headaches, neuropathic pain conditions, and back and neck pain.
column38: Savannah Keffer|C Webb|xsyotosx|Kaitlyn Foxdale|Eileen Bujno|Clown Whisper|Thomas Ruszkiewicz Jr|Jennifer Phelan
column40:
I'm not sure where the recent negative reviews are coming from. So far I've had two steroid injections with them into my spine for herniated discs compressing a nerve root. They've been super nice and professional. Of course, it doesn't completely take away the pain. Nothing will. That's why it's called Pain Management and not Pain Resolution. They do their best, but they aren't miracle workers. For what they are and what they are there for, they do a good job.|Don't waste your time come in here if you're looking for help with pain relief, if it ain't terminal, you won't get no meds other than NSAIDs what a joke waste of time. I need multiple bone fusions and they offer me physical therapy and NSAIDs.|Management for pain is a joke at best.  Both medications theyve given me didnt touch pain, but told to just hold off for multiple weeks without any relief.  Informed them my injection didnt touch me and again told to hold off for 3 weeks with nothing to try pain management.
Staff is friendly when there but outside of the clinic its a joke.|I was scheduled for a procedure on a Monday, they called me on the Friday before to tell me that they don't have authorization for the procedure!  Spoke to my insurance to find out what is going on only to find that no authorization was ever sent to my insurance!  Trying to sort this out on a Friday before a procedure is unacceptable to say the least.|The first visit for my lower back pain after having spinal decompression surgery spoke with Dr Choe he want me to up 2 of my meds. I can not take pain meds or anti inflammatory meds just meds I take for my fibro muscle relaxers and nerve blocking. He said I wasn't taking a high enough dose. I take 3 pills at night of muscle relaxer 750 mg each and two of the nerve blocker 309 mg each but okay I will try.he said he would call in a prescription to make sure I had enough of the muscle relaxer pick prescription up it's for 500 mg so email office the nurse email me back and tells me I've been taking 500 mg for the last couple of year so I send her a picture of my prescription and a picture of my list of prescription for the last year all 750. Get email from doctor apologize for this saying it was a mistake he will call in for the 750. Okay so now comes the next refill let them know how much I using now so the prescription is correct and will last get a email saying a message was left for me because they are not sure why I'm not taking meds as prescribed. Now I'm out of meds and I work so during the weekend had to stretch out what little I have left and I have to go to work in a lot of pain because either the doctor is not updating the file or the nurses do not read them. So I'm done with them will go back to my normal dose and call it retirement time.|I have had nothing but a positive experience dealing with this wonderful group of professional caregivers!
My life was a living hell before I contacted Allegiance Pain Management Center now it is bearable and I find some comfort throughout my day. I am able to participate in life if only on a limited basis but it's better than living my entire life on a sofa.

I honestly can't think of one negative thing to say about the organization or people that run it they are absolutely wonderful|The worst staff and pain management care ever. Bring a lawyer|Takes FOREVER to get an appointment and if you're more than 5 minutes late they will cancel your appointment....but wait, it takes another 1.5 months to get rescheduled. They are also charging a lot of money for their services. I'm returning back to Chelsea Pain Management. Although its an inconvenient drive for me, I get much better service and lower bills. This isn't even all of it. Think twice when asking your provider for a referral. Consider making the trip to a different facility.

column2: Southern Michigan Pain Consultants - St. Joseph
column3:
Specialized Pain Management Care in St. Joseph

At Southern Michigan Pain Consultants, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients struggling with chronic pain conditions. Our physicians have completed advanced training through Pain Fellowships beyond their primary medical specialties, which may include Anesthesiology, Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, and Osteopathic Manipulative Medicine. We take pride in our specialized approach to treating various pain conditions, particularly spine-related issues. Our services include:

  • Personalized pain management plans

  • Advanced pain relief procedures and injections

  • Comprehensive evaluation and diagnosis

  • Ongoing pain management support

We work collaboratively with each patient to find the most effective methods to reduce pain and improve daily function. Our philosophy treats chronic pain like other chronic medical conditions such as diabetes, requiring thoughtful, ongoing care. Located at 3950 Hollywood Rd #260 in St. Joseph, MI, we offer renewed hope for those suffering from persistent pain. Contact us at (269) 431-4007 or visit southernmichiganpain.com to learn more about our specialized pain management services.

column38: Laura Bolde|Taylor Z.|Sherri Labins|Peter Stathakis|Sue Burkhard|Sheila Howarth|Pam Hemenway|Chardele Miller
column40:
So today I called the saint joe office to update my insurance info and to ask a question about my recent mri results. The receptionist transferred me to the nurse line to answer my questions,I left a message and got a call back within 10mins. So far everything is good. The nurse I talked too was very short(not sure if she is having a bad bad or what) I asked why my previous mri results I got from another dr was not shared with whomever read my current mri. She became very mean, talking to me like I was beneath her and did not know how the medical industry works.telling me its not in the medical industry for drs to share previous mri results to new mris unless they where done by the same facility(which I know is wrong and a medical malpractice suit if something is missed)I did fill out a medical release form the 1st day at my appointment in 2021 so that southern michigan pain consultants would have all my records from the dr I was seeing in indiana which that included the cd of the mri in 2021, the paper which that dr wrote up about my mri, and all other medical records. How does a dr help their patients if they don't bother reading previous medical records nor send previous findings in an mri to the current place doing the mri?! Mri in 2021 states that I have an extra vertebrae and needs careful attention to that so that reading future mris are accurate!!! If thats not shared how does the radiologist read correctly??!!|Doctor was almost an hour late. Phlebotomist was not good at getting an IV in my arm, caused me to bleed profusely and wasn't in a rush to clean up. Staff took a half hour to get me one Xanax pill. I recommend going anywhere else.|My experience is the opposite of another patient. Tom has always been kind and caring. Dr. Kolinski was when I had a better insurance. When I got a divorce and lost my insurance, he would only spend maybe one minute in the room with me. It's nice to have someone that doesn't treat you different, because they may making less money.
Thank you Tom!|Extremely satisfied with what Dr's Ward and Ulrich have done to help me. They are both great communicators and make me feel comfortable with the directions and treatments.|Great staff, always caring and compassionate. Dr Bez has helped me put off back surgery for several years now with a variety of tools in the pain care toolbox. They are efficient and work with you if you need financial assistance programs.|Dr. Beez was an answer to my prayers. I was having so much pain I was spending much time sitting in a chair or in bed. On my first visit he talked to me about the different things they had to offer and we decided the pain shots would be best to try. Within 24 hours I was pain free. I've been going every four months now and have always been treated with respect and concern. I would recommend Dr. Beez to anyone.|Friday, Oct. 4. Worst experience EVER! Had to see Tom PA for consultation for a SCS implant. He was rude, condescending and unprofessional. Our meeting was short. I'm thankful for that. I've been a patient of Dr. Kolinski for quite a few years and have literally  put my life in his hands. He's been caring and kind and did everything he could to help with my pain. I appreciate him so much. I guess I was foolish to think I'd get the same professional treatment from Tom. There is no excuse for his behavior and I relayed that information to the nurse that followed up with my instructions. I can only imagine I'm not the only person he's offended/mistreated. I would like to see some kind of reprimand/solution for Tom. My recommendation for anyone else is to refuse to see Tom.|Dr. Wilde & the office personnel are the best of the best! Extremely knowledgeable, professional and personable.
The most efficient operation I have experienced in the Southwest MI area.
A huge thank you to Dr. Wilde & staff!
Thank you for your continued support & pain relief!
Chardele A. Miller

column38: Marcia W|James Mapletoft|Patti Hazen|Lauryn Ashley|Shirley Julin|Robyn Smith|Marcia Lonteen-Martin|Ray Ortiz
column40:
FIND A DIFFERENT FACILITY! On my fifth spinal steroid injection, Dr. Sapeicka and his team missed the spot for the epidural steroid injection. I roared with pain on the table and the response from the doctor was "What do you want me to do about it? I've never had this happen before".  I'm not a doctor and had no idea what to say.

Needless to say, while no injection is guaranteed to work, they aren't supposed to leave you with more pain than you came in with. The shot utterly failed. Not only did I get no relief, I've had deep spinal bruising, steroid flush and lower back pain from this disastrously botched procedure for more than two months.

Despite a visit back to see the nurse and multiple calls with their office manager, there is "nothing they can do about it" and that this is just something that happens and I should schedule another appointment. No way. There are better doctors that won't hurt you. Don't go here.|Been going there for 6 years. Doctors and all the staff have been outstanding. I complement them when I leave.|My sister, who has been addicted to pain opioids for over 30 years comes here. Unfortunately in October her colon ruptured due to constipation from Norco abuse and now has an ostomy bag. This was all due to the amounts of Pain pills she was given after her 5th back surgery. Imagine a script written for 5 Norco pills a day for a month. A month script of 150 pills! This is not what I call Pain Management. It's aiding an elderly addicted senior.|They gave me the wrong medication. I had a consultation with the PA and let her know that I don't handle steroids well at all but I've had kenalog (triamcinoline) in the past and it worked well. I let her know that I had a bad reaction to dep medrol and that I cannot tolerate that medication at all. She said that makes it easy for her and the Dr and she would order a kenalog injection for my back pain. I went for the injection and was not informed what medication I was getting. I was just told it was a corticosteroid injection. I assumed it was the kenalog since that's what I was told at the consult appointment. After the visit I was walking to my car and the pain was getting worse and worse. By the end of the night I could barely sit or stand up or do anything other than lay flat on my back. I began to feel nauseous but have horrible food cravings, developed a bad headache and my scalp and jaw line had broken out in hives. The following day I checked my aftercare sheet to see if it had any info and it said I was given the depo medrol injection. I called the office and they gave me a number to call and complain to but it still doesn't fix the problem. Most of the staff were very kind less the initial nurse I saw before I met with the Dr and nurses in the injection room, but kindness doesn't fix that I was given a medication that I specifically said I cannot handle.

Returned for a follow up visit and met with a nurse practitioner who was extremely dismissive of my pain and blew me off, told me all I could do was rest and brace my back.. which is what I have been doing for years. I have exhausted all other treatment options, that's why I'm at a pain clinic. This place is hands down the worst medical experience I've ever had in my life so far.|yesterday afternoon i received an injection for pain.  i had a different doctor, that i gave a hard time  (not really hard)
But today i feel a million times better!  Sorry I don't have the Doctors name...   but i feel so much better *****
Thank you all, doctor and all the ladies who took care of me!
Shirley Julin|I am very surprised at reading the negatives reviews. I've been going to this location for about two years and have had nothing but good experiences every time with nurses, doctors and office staff. I've never been made to feel like I'm a drug addict and I feel as if the doctors really do believe and understand (as much as they can) my pain. I've utilized their psychological department in the past and even those doctors and staff treated me with nothing but respect and empathy. Even though there isn't much that can be done for my pain except the current treatment I'm under, I appreciate that they have always had a patient ear while I talk about my pain, and have made various suggestions of things I can do to help me stretch the hours between dosages so that I do not take more than I should.

I now need to update my review because in the past three months I have had terrible experiences with this clinic, especially with the PAs. They are not managing my pain nor showing any empathy. I have proven to them over three year's time that I do not abuse the medication but when an incident occurred recently that greatly increased the pain I have been experiencing, putting me in the Emergency room three times and admitted to the hospital twice, they accuse me of being an addict. Of course I am addicted! One cannot be after using the drug over a period of time. But I am not an addict in the manner they present it to me, which is an insult. I do not take the drug for some quick high, I take it because I have pain. So I am highly disappointed in the clinic and am considering finding a new pain management facility.|I have been getting lumbar injections here for a couple years. The worst part is the office problems. First of all, I've never called an office that is so anti patient as this. It's almost impossible to get someone on the phone to make an appointment. The staff seems to feel that they are more important than serving their patients. HOW COULD IT BE THAT NO ONE EVER ANSWERS THE PHONE????  People today are very mobile and most of us work, so it may not be possible for them to call you whenever their little mood strikes them. Yesterday I called at 10:55 and never got a call back.  This happens every time I need an injection. One time I just called and called all day to see if anyone would ever answer. No one did. Another time I pushed another button and got someone from another area and finally got her to get someone. How does this place even stay open?  Also a certain member of the office staff is very rude and always seems to try and talk me out of injections.  She tells me I will regret getting this now because I have a certain amount of time left in my 6 months cycle and even lies telling me my insurance is changing and it will be 8 months now. This was never true.  I reported her to the office manager with 2 instances of rudeness and she ended up covering for her.  I do like the doctors, but it's hell on earth getting past the endless bureaucracy and laziness up front to get to them.|This review is for a visit I had in September 2019.
For about 8 weeks prior to my visit I had been suffering severe pain as a result of some spinal issues. Bulging discs and spinal stenosis produced pain so severe that I couldn't walk or stand for any length of time. My quality of life was greatly affected by this. I was determined to get relief and thought this place would help me with that. After all, it is a "Center for Pain".

In reading all the reviews I can understand why they are mixed. Some had a good experience while others did not. I learned that, after going here just one time, the experience depends on who you are seen by.

I believe that most of the staff here are compassionate and caring health care professionals.  In my first and only visit, I had the misfortune of being seen by possibly the only staff personnel who is the complete opposite.

The first two staff members I encountered were pleasant. But then I was seen by a physicians assistant. His callous attitude and belligerent behavior left me feeling that I would not get the proper care and treatment I needed.

Needless to say, I did not return there to get the epidural injection I was scheduled to receive, nor for any additional treatment at this facility. My decision to not return there was based solely on the way I was treated by just one person there.
column47: Wheelchair-accessible entrance, Wheelchair-accessible parking lot, Wheelchair-accessible washroom, Washroom, Appointments recommended
column48: What's the dr name
column49: I am aware that this question is a year old but wanted to do my best to answer it in case either you; or others in our community, are still in need of an answer. This practice is a collective of Doctors of Anesthesiology specializing in Pain Management. As well, there are NPs and PAs. Unfortunately, there are only two to three providers within the practice that are willing to consider & utilize any modality of treatment to assist in the alleviation of chronic pain. The majority of the practice is only willing to provide injections. Injections are a gift when effective but sometimes a multi-modal approach is required to achieve optimal improvement in quality of life. And; yes, sometimes opioids are an appropriate supplemental option. If you have insurance and are searching for competent and compassionate care, I would recommend this practice. If your case is complex, you will most likely be handed over to one of the few providers that keep all options open & available.

column3:
At Michigan Spine Specialists, led by John Chatas, MD, FIPP, we provide advanced interventional pain management through our state-of-the-art multidisciplinary facility. What sets us apart is our team of three Board Certified Interventional Pain Doctors who specialize in treating the most challenging cases.

Advanced Pain Solutions

We excel in minimally invasive spine surgery and complex pain conditions that other clinics have failed to resolve. Our commitment to excellence has resulted in achieving the best outcomes for difficult-to-treat pain problems in Michigan and nationally. As leaders in our field, we actively participate in multi-center national research to advance pain management techniques. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

  • Advanced interventional pain techniques

  • Specialized treatment for complex pain conditions

  • Personalized pain management plans

Visit our Michigan Pain Specialists website or call us at 734-373-7246 to discover how we can help improve your quality of life at our Ann Arbor location.
column11: Michigan Spine Specialists is a state-of-the-art multidisciplinary pain facility with 3 Board Certified Interventional Pain Doctors. We are not a typical pain clinic. We specialize in minimally invasive spine surgery and difficult to treat problems. In fact, most of our patients have been to other local pain clinics with the result of no help. Of these difficult cases we get the best outcomes in Michigan and nationally. We are leaders in our field, performing multi-center national research.

column48: What is anesthesiologist
column49: He's the Dr. Who handles the anesthesia for the simplest definition.  An anesthesiologist is, during surgery,  the doctor who keeps who asleep while monitoring your breathing and heartrate to make sure you don't die.  Dr. Chatas is also are very knowledgeable about pain, pain management, and the nerves and spinal cord, and how they work in relation to pain. This is a very generic explanation. If you look up his website you can get more in- depth information. He's a great physician, with a wonderful staff.

column40:
Dr. Sukumaran is a great physician. During my apts he was professional, patient, thorough, respectful and interested in gathering all evidence before proceeding with any procedures. He was not eager to perform surgery and instead wanted to make sure the timing was right and the primary issue was first addressed. He listened to my concerns and input. Is is definitely not ego driven. I would definitely recommend Dr. Sukumaran to family and friends or anyone in need of his specialties. There is no doubt I will continue seeing him when necessary.|THIS REVIEW IS A MUST READ!! I have been seeing pain specialist doctors since 2012, and to be honest my experience has not been all that great. Long wait times, feeling like a number and not a patient, most times looking around the office I felt like I was in a legal drug house. And I dreaded on the last 11+ years the monthly visit to the pain management office. But that changed when I started seeing Dr. Sukumaran!!! The office is clean, the staff is phenomenal, and Dr. Sukumaran is so kind, empathetic, knowledgeable, and thorough. He takes time to really research what's going on with you, and is concerned about your quality of life, not just prescribing you a ton of medication. I am FLOORED how this doctor and staff have changed my complete experience with a Pain Specialist Doctor. His staff goes over and beyond to help you in any way possible! And Alicia is AMAZING!! Please Dr. Sukumaran give her a promotion and a good raise. She helped me every step of the way to find a pharmacy that would fill my prescription and for me I am forever grateful. I am truly thankful to have a Pain Specialist team who cares about me and treats me like a human being. Please consider making an appointment with this office. You thank me later.|I saw Dr. Sukumaran for Spinal Stenosis and we discussed the possibility  of my being a candidate for the MILD Procedure. He explained the procedure in detail answering all of our questions. I underwent the procedure in October 2024. Everyone at the Michigan Pain Clinic were very professional and pleasant. I spoke with Dr.. Sukumaran shortly before the procedure and it all went very smoothly. Recovery has progressed and I am feeling much better. I would recommend Dr. Sukumaran to anyone considering this option.|I just saw Dr. Sukumaran for severe back pain. Since I've seen him, I've needed medicine change due to severity of pain and called his office and left numerous messages for him and over four days no call back. He's not too concerned about his patients. I was advised from someone in his office to make an appointment to see him and express my concerns of his lack of response. So it's just to get the office visit payment? He hasn't returned a single message. So unprofessional.|I saw Nicole, Dr. Sukumaran's PA or NP. She's very professional! She asked me how I was doing since the MILD procedure. I'm doing very good.
She genuinely cared about my health.|Dr. Sukumaran is the best doctor I've ever met.  He sincerely cares for his patients and goes above and beyond to make sure that they get the best care possible.  He is a life saver and I cannot recommend him enough.|After 2 neck surgeries, I am disabled.  My life isn't what I hoped for or planned it to be, and it has been frightening to suffer every day and worry that medicine will not be available.   When I met Dr Sukumarah, I was downhearted because due to transportation issues, I had to find a nearer doctor.  What a blessing to be treated by this kind, patient, soft spoken and excellent doctor.  I thank God for him. He has helped me so much.|Dr Sukamaran has saved my life not one but twice. Highly recommend. Office staff not so good, tough to get through to a live person. The voice mail to text messages does not work well. Hours of operation not listed. Various opinions of closing time.
Office staff unaware of pricing of procedures. Pack your patience.

column40:
I have been going to Dr. Rahimi for a few years now and he has helped my pain immensely! I've been suffering from lower back pain for 15 years and had a spinal surgery, pain management is huge to my quality of life and Dr. Rahimi and his staff have made a drastic improvement on my quality of life! When I first came to him I was on disability for my pain and could not work. With his and his staff's care I am now working full time and managing my pain monthly at his office! His staff is amazing and so sweet|Still trying to bill me for missed appointments I told their secretary to cancel after she laughed at me for describing back domestic violence situation. I told her to cancel my apps, asked for a supervisor, she hung up on me and I have been unable to reach anyone by phone to discuss but they keep sending me bills for the missed appointments.|My pain was out of control when I heard about Dr Rahimi.  I had already tried two other pain clinics but I felt that they were pushing medications.

Dr. Rahimi has my pain much more controlled. When I started at his practice I was barely walking due to arthritis in my spine, 4 hip surgeries with a replacement and arthritis in most of my other joints.  Through a combination of gym and pool therapy, spine adjustments, spinal injections, medication and braces for my back and knees my life has improved drastically. Dr. Rahimi treats the whole person not just the areas that hurt.

Thank you Dr. Rahimi and staff I don't know what my quality of life would be like if I had not found out about you and your office.|This place is top notch. The physical therapists are tremendous.  I've been to other places that are just okay, this place is great. They do a wonderful job assessing the cause of pain, and apply their expertise to address it.

The office staff is really helpful and personable too.

Dr. Rahimi is is also very knowledgeable and knows how to treat pain.

My experience has been great!|Dr. Rahimi is a very kind doctor and listens to everything you tell him. He goes above and beyond to help patients with their pain.

I was bedridden from the neck and back pain for a while until he started treating me. I cannot thank him enough for everything he has done for me.|Dr Rahimi literally saved my life.  For 10 years and countless neurologist appointments, and hospital visits from falling over (all of which told me my tremor was from anxiety) he diagnosed me with Parkinson's after about 5 minutes.  This man is amazing, I will always be forever grateful to him for finally making me feel better. 10 stars!!!!|I have had nothing but positive experience with Dr. Rahimi and his staff. He's an extremely dedicate and caring physician and goes above and beyond to care for his patients. With Years of experience under his belt, a fully equipped facility and his dedicated staff I'm positive that I have received the best care possible.

Dr. Rahimi truly takes his time to assess the root of the problem. I strongly recommend him.|I've been seeing Dr. Rahimi for over two years now as a chronic pain patient. I had several bad experiences with another high profile pain doctor in Grand Rapids who's only an anesthesiologist by training, yet has a massive, assembly line style pain practice. That former pain doctor failed to offer me a full menu of much needed treatments in addition to injections, since all he wanted to do was inject me with steroids and be done with me. But I needed more help than that. Turns out, I actually needed things such as bracing for my spine, knees, wrist and neck, physical therapy, vagus nerve stimulation, non steroidal injections, etc. All those additional treatments were only offered to me for the first time by Dr. Rahimi. Because I have a connective tissue disorder, I actually needed them years ago, yet it wasn't until I left that other pain doctor, disgusted with his arrogance and lack of interest in my personal situation, and came to Dr. Rahimi, that I finally got them. I wasted years with the wrong doctor and deteriorated because of it.
I'm a former reporter and I find Dr. Rahimi to be highly intelligent, caring and thoughtful as a doctor seeking to control my pain. I wish I would have found him years ago, but am glad that I eventually left that other practice and found him. Physical therapy is fundamental in the control of the progression of my Ehlers Danlos Syndrome. Dr. Rahimi understands my disorder fully, and offers a PT program in his practice. That fact, right there, tells me he cares about the long term interests of his patients.
There are many pain practices in the Grand Rapids' area, yet I know of no other that offers a full array of options to manage chronic pain. If you truly value your health and seek the best long term outcome with a pain practice that uses many different strategies in pain management, you'd do well to consider Dr. Rahimi.
