column40:
Arrived ahead of schedule, checked in at front desk, went smoothly, everyone was professional and courteous. Taken into exam room and waited a short time, doctor came in and reviewed my charts and explained my issues very well and we put a plan in place.
All in all, a very good experience for me.

The surgical center has been excellent the three times I have been there for blocks and an ablation.

In addition, Dr. Peter's PA is excellent in answering questions and providing information regarding my concerns.|Dr. Peter is great! I began seeing him about six months ago as recommended by my rheumatologist for many areas of back pain due to inflammatory arthritis and degenerative changes. He strongly advised me against getting cervical fusion surgery and I am SO THANKFUL for that. He promised we would figure out a solution and eventually we did with a cervical rhizotomy. It is a somewhat long process but that isn't his fault. His wait times are much more reasonable than any other doctor I see (and I see a lot of doctors). I'll see him in office and he suggests a steroid injection at his outpatient facility and they'll call me to schedule it within a week sometimes. Anyway, my neck pain was so severe for about two years and about a 9/10 pain level for past year almost daily. I was desperate and hopeless. Dr. Peter made me a person again! My neck pain is now just a 3/10 (which is like a zero to me). He didn't give up like all my other doctors. The last time I saw him I wanted to give him a huge hug so bad but he doesn't seem like the hugging type, haha. Highly recommend this intelligent, super skilled doctor. He will find the right spot! His staff is all super nice and friendly as well. I almost enjoy going to the pain clinic. I definitely believe listening to this man's opinions is worthwhile and that he is trustworthy. This is not the case with every doctor, unfortunately.|Dr. Peter was very nice and thorough when I visited him this past Monday. He listened and answered my questions and I was very pleased with his treatment plan. Thank you for an awesome experience! Kia was very good as well! Kudos to the staff for their timeliness and dedication to treating their patients with respect and dignity. I recommend Dr. Peter highly.|Dr. Peter is very knowledgeable, caring and thorough.  I had some problems with the scheduling though. He put notes in the paperwork that I could only come in on a specific week and my paperwork said I was diabetic so I was supposed to have an early appointment but the scheduling staff only offered me to come in on a week I couldn't due to my husbands surgery or to take a late appointment.   That was the second time.  The first time they had to rearrange the sched to get me in early.  I don't know why they don't presort by diabetic and not for scheduling and/ or special notes.  Poor planning and scheduling. The shots haven't worked for me but the did for my husband but it was a different Dr.|Great DR, really cares about helping your pain go away, also I've had 2 epidurals and don't have to wait more than a few minutes before I you get called back the procedure is relatively quick and pretty painless, you just feel a lot of pressure where they did the procedure. Dr Peter has been a great doctor for me and he is a great pain Dr to for anyone unhappy with where that are going.|I first saw Dr Jason Peter for steroid injections in my back related to a wotkplace injury in 2010 at another practice and was beyond happy to become his patient again after 14 years! Dr Peter has the magical touch! I look forward to continuing our patient, doctor relationship for as long as he can help me! He also has a great sense of humor!|I love Dr. Peter and his team! They work well together & value their patients in every way. I've been a patient for about 4 years & my pain management has been a great experience.|Dr. Peter and his staff are phenomenal. I told my sister about Dr. Peter & his staff PA's M. Hawk & Dave! Now she's a patient!

This review is from Chyrell Nawatny|I was a patient of Dr Bez who is no longer with the practice. I was required to see a different (fill in) Dr who did absolutely nothing for my pain and sent me on my way. He put in place both a temporary and long term plan for relief and I am so grateful. I felt heard by the practice, I felt safe and in good hands, and finally I am going to be pain free again. I can't thank them enough. I've been so miserable costing me my quality of life. At Midwest Spine and Sports Center, we focus on providing sustainable solutions for both short and long-term pain management, helping our patients return to a higher quality of life. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Pierre Rojas, DO, a fellowship-trained physician, we specialize in diagnosing and treating a comprehensive range of acute and chronic spine and sports injuries. Our South Lyon location serves as a trusted resource for patients seeking compassionate, effective care.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice addresses a wide spectrum of conditions including:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Pinched nerves and neuropathies

  • Musculoskeletal injuries and degenerative conditions

  • Headaches, concussions, and traumatic brain injuries

  • Arthritis, tendonitis, and cancer pain

  • Spasticity and functional/neurologic impairments

  • Spinal cord injury management

We invite you to learn more about our comprehensive approach to pain management by visiting our website or calling us at +1 248-963-6900. Located at 214 S Lafayette St in South Lyon, MI, our team is committed to helping you achieve optimal health and wellness through personalized care plans tailored to your specific needs.
column11: Midwest Spine and Sports Center focuses on sustainable short and long term solutions to managing pain and returning patients to a higher quality of life. Wow I am soooo glad I found a REAL doctor that fixed my back, I am pain free and had to fight for myself to find a competent doctor with the help of my excellent PCP. 2 docs at this clinic failed me Dr. Patel and Dr Haladjian , thank God but their  partner doc listened to me and fixed my back. . Synergy Health is truly a top-tier medical facility that deserves every one of its five-star reviews. From the moment you walk in, you can tell that patient care is their top priority. The convenience of having a pharmacy, physical therapy, and a wide range of specialty doctors all in one place makes managing healthcare so much easier.

My family and I have received exceptional care here, especially after our car accident. The doctors take the time to listen, thoroughly evaluate concerns, and ensure we receive the right treatment. The pharmacy staff is efficient and always makes sure prescriptions are filled quickly, which is a huge relief. The physical therapy team is knowledgeable, supportive, and truly dedicated to helping patients recover.

What sets Synergy Health apart is not just the quality of medical care but the compassionate and coordinated approach they take with their patients. It's a one-stop healthcare facility that provides everything you need under one roof, with a team that genuinely cares. A MONTH!! Doctor suggested I get the injection and let me tell you I was scared to death. I was scared of the injection, but just as scared, maybe more of the sedation. column40:
Referred to Dr. Jason Peter from another doctor.  His staff at Pain Clinic of Michigan in Troy are very pleasant. I have only good things to say.

The front desk is helpful and it is best to complete all paperwork on line, so you don't have to worry about anything else when you arrive.

Dr. Peter started my evaluation on my neck by reviewing my X-rays and MRI on my first visit.  Then he explained what was going on with my neck and discussed what options I have.  I decided to get the 2 blocks and an ablation on the neck.

Had both blocks and ablation completed at the Oakland Surgi-Center.  Neck is definitely better than it was before I had these procedures completed.

All of my experiences to date have been outstanding. Dr. Jason Peter and his PA-C Ben Carolan. and the entire staff have been pleasant to work with in Troy.

I would definitely recommend Dr. Jason Peter and the Oakland Surgi-Center staff.|Please believe these reviews and run while you still can.  I had been seeing him for sometime.  Dr. Peters pulled my RX history and commenced to question me about why doctors had me on certain medications.  My medicines had been like this for a long time.  Instead of contacting those doctors and getting clarification He chose to cold turkey stop my visits and stop writing my script for pain meds and told me to go someplace else.  This is something that is life threatening.  A pain mgmt patient is NOT advised to cold turkey a pain med yet tapper it off.  It took me weeks to get into a new doctors visit to continue my care which could have caused me major complications beyond the withdrawals that it sent me into. Thankfully  I called my primary care and they wrote my script to hold me over until til I could get in with a new doctor and stop the withdrawals.  You can kill a person my discontinuing their medication like that.  And it goes against the rules of any pain mgmt office which makes you sign a contract.  Which in that contract it states that should a problem arise a script will be written until you can get into see someone else because stopping cold turkey is dangerous.  He went against all of that and didn't care and decided to argue with me tooth and nail..........even using profanity!  At that point I left to keep myself from doing something that would not have turned out nice!  I now see a wonderful pain mgmt doctor who is very caring and handles things properly and professionally.  And all of my circumstances are the same!  You appreciate a good doctor coming from a bad one!|Dr peters hubris is only surpassed by his ignorance of chronic pain patients. He called me a liar when 11 different pharmacies informed me that the er meds prescribed were unavailable for months, go if you want to but be prepared to be talked down to|I have been seeing Dr Peters for several years . My mom actually was seeing him before me , he took EXCELLENT care of my mom was not only a very good Dr. but cared about her well being . I switched from the Dr who I was seeing ( he was a pill pusher and wanted me to take very strong narcotics!!!). When I seen how WONDERFUL Dr. Peter's was with my mom i decided to switch to him. Again I've been seeing him for many years .He has performed many procedures on me when only needed . I Love him ! I highly recommend him .  The office is clean and the staff is awesome!  5 stars plus !|Anyone thinking about going to this office should think twice. Dr. Peter was horribly rude and argumentative. Asked who referred my son to him and when we told him the doctor he said he doesn't know him and doesn't know how they get his name? Does it matter? When I told him that one of my son's doctors no longer sees him because he doesn't have good insurance anymore I was told that no doctor should take his insurance because it's garbage. That they don't get any money from them. Really?  My son didn't ask to be sick and unfortunately is now on disability. I guess anyone on Medicare doesn't deserve good treatment.|Reception was very kind. I had all of the information recommended in the information packet provided prior to the appointment and checking in was smooth and timely.
Dr. Peter was thorough with his exam and his reviews of the images I presented related to my several back surgeries. He is professional, efficient, kind and is clearly in the profession to help. I highly recommend his services for anyone dealing with chronic pain. I sought him out to help me manage my pain and therefore improve function and recommend further testing and services as needed. After my first appointment I am confident he will provide and recommend what is necessary, no more and no less.|Besides a crazy amount of paperwork, I had a great visit. Dealing with DDD and swelling in the back causing pain, he spent a while going over my MRI images with me and walking me through my options with pro/cons. He spent a lot of time making sure I understood my younger age can play into these options as I still have a ways to live. He was professional, kind, and let me speak freely. I had a migraine when I saw him, so I probably was not the most friendliest when I came in, but he still treated with me respect. While I didn't get injections as my spinal doctor encouraged, I do believe the alternative method Dr. Peters directed me to will be better long-term. Thank you!|I had previously visited another pain management doctor for chronic neck issues I have been having however, I was dissatisfied with the care that I received and Dr. Peter was recommended by a trusted colleague. Dr. Peter took his time reviewing my history and symptoms and having a discussion with me and offering me some options. Excellent bedside manner, all of the staff was polite, and I would definitely recommend

Dr Webb is amazing.  She has made it so I can be active again.  She is kind and caring and listens to her patients.|My Dr. is Jill Ross and she is just the sweetest ever! She's truly so kind and knowledgeable.  She's the first doctor to know about my rare diagnosis and the best way to treat it. She's patient and works with you. I won't go anywhere else. Unless she moves facilities in which I will follow her there. The office staff is very kind and works with your schedule. The facility is very clean and just a great place all around. I was scared when my old doctor retired and I had to come here but now it think it was a blessing in disguise.|Use to be Exceptional! Use to be great! Now, it's barely tolerable.  They deserve negative stars, but Google doesn't allow that.

Dr. only showed up part-time. And it may not be the same Dr you saw late time. Why? Because s/he left the office or company. Many times when you are informed that the Dr. will be with you. It's the nurse practitioner (NP), not a Dr. Also, during my appointments, NP has to repeatedly leave the appointment room to grab paperwork to explain issues and answer questions. Many times, it doesn't answer the question that I asked. She doesn't answer all the questions posed to her, nor does she provide the requested material/contract I signed.

She doesn't have any idea of what we were meeting for at my most recent appointments; despite having requested an MRI repeatedly, having to contact or come back to this office repeatedly for authorizations or complaints aboutthe missing document, and constantly remind her and the rest of the people in this office I'm still waiting on the authorizations MRIs her office requested.

This is in addition to the constant disregard of pain and seriousness of my pain. Only to inform me (insult me) by saying several times that my pain is just "normal wear and tear.". My husband stated that if my pain was normal, then everyone would be here with this issue, including him. (He's several years older than me without any back problems.)

The disregarding of me and my husband's comments, concerns, and requests; the dismissive way they handle our complaints regarding my pain; lack of empathy; and their bedside manner has made me look for another pain management team. Especially since this team lacks everything a good pain management team needs, should have, and should be required.|Do not let your loved ones go here. This place is nothing more than a prescription mill. They just blindly prescribe Percocet. They do not manage or care about side effects. They do not look to see possible and potentially dangerous drug interactions. They do not monitor abuse or misuse stemming from chemical dependency.  They do not check for hepatotoxicity, which is actually mind blowing seeing as how most modern pain killers are cut with Tylenol.  It's my opinion that there is some type of financially beneficial, kickback, agreement between the prescribers here and Endo Pharmaceuticals and the other Oxycodone manufacturers.

Do not let your loved ones go here, especially elderly loved ones.|This place is disgusting so is the nurse Jill Ross who thinks shes a doctor. I went here after being in a flip over car accident. I suffered two broken legs and three broken ribs. I have a total of seven fractures. Anyways, when i went to my appointment which was at nine am and the weather consisted of freezing rain and snow. I made my way there with my driver and i arrived on time. My driver came in the room with me. Then in comes this obnoxious lady Jill Ross. She proceeds to tell me shes not going to give me anything for pain because last time i was there i didnt finish PT i told her i was suffering at the time with psoriasis and i had a very bad break out. I said my husband went to the hospital last night after work to the hospital to get my ct scans and radiographs. She said im not going to look at them Im not even going to give u anything so just leave. I said no im not leaving i want to see a doctor but this nasty lady replied im the doctor here today. I said you are no doctor your a nurse practitioner. It was a horrible experience this lady does not belong helping a rat. She was so nasty, obnoxious and rude. Im currently filing a complaint with the state of michigan. Beware of this uncaring creepy place and Jill Ross.|This place is the absolute best for my pain management. Dr. Sapeika and his staff always find time for all of my questions and have helped me tremendously ! I had a previous pain management that left me with a bad taste in my mouth for injections/ablations. I totally trust this Dr. and the staff. Thank you so much for your dedicated care to my needs.|This was my worst experience at a clinic, there service was unprofessional. I arrived on time I even called ahead, I was told to go to registration and check in, after checking in  I was told to have a seat I waited, an after 15 minutes I was told to go down the hall. I got there and they told me I had to be rescheduled because I was late. I informed them that I wasn't late that I did everything that was asked of me they faulted me anyway they were rude and gave me attitude without reason. I have been waiting for this appointment for over a month an a half in pain needing to get some help. They treated me like I did something wrong like this was my fault an as if my pain and time doesn't matter.|Get staff very knowledgeable about what is going on in your body they sit make sure you understand your treatment.As far and long as I've been coming there as long as you have appointment there really isn't a long wait.There understanding careing professional all of staff an doctors

column40: My grandmother has been coming here for a couple years. The office staff used to be amazing and superb, however, there are a few newer and younger girls that are absolutely terrible. They're rude, they lie, they raise voices, and are genuinely just vindictive. Being a healthcare professional, whether you are a private practice or not, if you accept state insurance, you abide by state insurance policies. There was an appointment that was cancelled 24 hours in advance due to a sickness (called on a Sunday, appt was Tuesday) and they still charged $25, said that if next appointment wasn't attended, then it would be an extra $25. Go in the next day and they try to turn her away due to using debit card instead of cash, which they never specified. I wouldn't recommended them to anybody, being in the healthcare field, the girls are incompetent and genuinely make themselves look extremely bad. They think they're "baddies"  however, they definitely need a humbling. I would recommend Kotob go over professional development with them.|I have been seeing Doc for 5 yrs.i am full of arthritis and hurt every day he has made my daily life very manageable. Himself and his staff are very kind to me anytime I visit I have never had a bad experience at this office  Thanks Doc Toni and the rest of the staff|My spine has arthritis from top to bottom. I have had two surgeries, one in the lower back, and one in the cervical area. Dr. Kotob saw a problem in my spine with pressure on my spinal column. Surgery followed. I need the anxiety meds as no other ones have worked for my severe panic attacks and anxiety and as long as I'm ok with mixing the meds and my other doctor is there shouldn't be a problem. Now I'm in pain for years without any meds because of this doctor|After only a few visits with Dr. Kotob, he wanted to schedule me to have injections the following week. column40:
I've been coming here for just over 6 years, not what I wanted but I can't imagine anyone actually wanting to have to go here. On that note I absolutely must say that they take care of your actual needs. Brian Prize is just that, a prize if you're so lucky to have him. The receptionist is an absolute angel, the nurses are fricken amazing & a few of them are SUPER cute. I couldn't have asked to be put in better hands. Thank you BCFPM, because of you I can walk without crying like a little girl (I'm a 48yo man)|They have changed hands. Now run by NORTHSTAR ANESTHESIA, based in TX. The pieces are now falling into place. Loss of the better PA's (Anita Parker PA)(Dr. Cain Dimon) and other staff. Pray that you don't get assigned to Brian "Booby" Prize. This greenhorn had 8 months exp. when assigned to me, no knowledge of pain mgt. or bedside manner.
He took over the morphine weaning process started months earlier by PA Anita Parker. Then he sent me 8/05/2020 for morphine / bupivecaine Intrathecal Pump removal at WBH Royal Oak and I came home with meningitis....INFECTED with PSEUDOMONAS AERUGINOSA by "surgeon" Dr. Larry Manders. He was more concerned about taking photos of my teeth before I came out of anesthesia than my headache, nausea and neck pain.
Four days after outpatient surgery I returned to ER after feeling as if I had been hit in the back of my head with a baseball bat. Pain shot across my head ear-to-ear, and down my neck & spine past my shoulder blades. Hurt so badly I did not lock my front door or shut my computer down (which was hacked for $1700 sent to Tran Van Minh in Hue City, Vietnam).
I arrived at 10PM Sunday, 8/9/2020. Five hours later I was dumped into a bed at 3:00AM. NO ONE TOLD ME during my 9-day ER hospitalization I had meningitis....INFECTED with PSUEDOMONOS AERUGINOSA. My ins. company says I AM LUCKY TO BE ALIVE. I did not learn of the infection for 13 months when infectious doc posted it to my Beaumont Chart. I went untreated for 4 days before I put my foot down and complained to PA Anita Parker that each morning I get visited by 5 docs doing their rounds, but NO ONE WAS TAKING ON RESPONSIBILITY FOR MY CARE. She turned me on my side and commented she could see my spinal fluid leaking around the staples in my lumbar incision.
Oct.13, 2020, came Dr. Shivani Singh, MD who took a culture of my leaking spinal fluid. Within hours I was having a PICC Line installed so they could pump me full of Vancomycin, an anti-biotic so toxic it would eat the tubes of a normal IV.
August 2021 I was given a different type of drug test by PA Jolene Koganti. She remembered I had drank three bottles of water and previously spent 4 hours trying to give a urine sample in a bathroom with motion detecting lights. There I was, penis in hand with my plastic cup, IN THE DARK with ASSOCIATES CONSTANTLY POUNDING ON THE DOOR; "ARE YOU OK IN THERE?".
The new test was a wad of felt stuck under my tongue.  The associate said let me see it. It turned blue-turquoise but she said put it back in.
When she took it out again it was in 2 pieces which she put into a plastic tube.
Oct.12, 2021 I returned to get the hydromorphone refilled which I had recently been changed to. I had been having digestive trouble for 36 hours. Did not eat or drink from Sunday afternoon until after my Tues. appointment. I was weak, dehydrated, and cranky because the toilet trips did not end until 4:00AM the same day as my 12:30PM appointment. Looking back, I should have cancelled. I did not urinate until 12:30AM, Oct.13,2021.
In less than 5 minutes Mr. "BOOBY" Prize said I am discharging you because you failed your last drug test. WHAT? No failures in the previous 8 years as a patient. Despite filling out a request for my medical records I STILL HAVE NOT SEEN EVIDENCE OF A FAILED DRUG TEST. That was a bogus test and he knows it.
He knew nothing of the meningitis or PSUEDOMONAS AERUGINOSA compliments of his sending me to WBH Royal Oak.
As soon as he said DISCHARGE I told him to eat sh*t. I immediately knew I would be facing terrible withdrawal from the opioids I had been prescribed for over 20 years. Withdrawal lasted over three horrendous weeks. Allegedly, I SLAMMED THE EXAM DOOR OPEN (is that possible?) and he was more than excited to tag me HOSTILE and forever ban me from treatment. He has not seen hostile yet.
Don't get the Medtronics Pump if you want to travel for more than 60 days. Also, NO DOCS in USA will refill it. You will be tethered to them as long as you have the pump. Medicare does not cover overseas treatment.|I have regular pain management appointments here and I cannot say enough good things about the entire staff. From my pain management physician to the entire nursing staff, these are health care workers who care about their patients. I've been coming here for over a year now and I've not had one negative experience. Highly recommend!|I have been trying to get a new patient appointment for one month. I have called this office daily at different times; no one ever answers the phone. You will wait on a poor audio quality hold line recording and then be transferred to a voicemail after waiting. I received call back messages while at work and unable to answer, with no information on how to get an appointment. After getting through to a real person for the first time I was abruptly transferred to the medication refill line in error. I left a detailed pleading message asking for someone to please help me get an appointment. I received a call back within the hour to inform me that my referral from one month ago had never been received. I was told "I doubt anything I say will make you happy " I let her know that my happiness is not a concern; I just want an appointment.  Although the caller offered to contact my family doctor for the referral, the fact remains that have yet to be offered a new patient appointment, even though she was clearly and admittedly viewing my Beaumont chart and notes from a previous pain doctor. I have never experienced this kind of difficulty in making a doctors appointment in my entire life. It's still unknown whether or not I will ever be offered to make a new patient appointment. The one star rating will remain until I experience improved customer service. I'm a patient, a human being trying to get help from a doctor,  not a telephone solicitor. It seems like they are assuming that most callers will be drug seeking addicts and give up after never being able to talk to anyone. This situation is a real shame and needs to be addressed by someone who is responsible and concerned with the way patients are treated.|This practice doesn't care about what's going on with you. They're very cold at this practice. Johneen is the rudest person! She is racist and very judgemental. If I could rate them a zero I would! The doctor I only saw a few times getting my shots, they didn't help. All they do is keep making you appointments w the nurse, switching your meds. I don't take anything for pain.  I don't take any opioids, they don't work anyways. They have not suggested anything else to manage my pain! Beaumont is the worst hospital! I'm in the middle of changing hospitals and I'm so glad I did!|My primary Physician has referred me to here for bone and joint pain. I have joint and disc disease and many fractures due to osteoporosis. Their office left me a voicemail sayin she got my referral but in reviewing my chart she saw I also have fibromyalgia and that they do not accept patients that have fibro. Over 5 million people suffer from fibro pain in the US and one of our biggest hospital pain management centers won't treat them. That's horrible.|They can't even tell if a person is  faking pain that is  very sad I tried for many years to be referred to someone who can help me. I found a real doctor who treats me for a very painful nerve disease. I can only hope  that Rachel has become humble and no longer treats people like dirt because she doesn't understand how the human body body works.  Yes Rechal  my muscles weren't working  and You have
seen  my spine. Now  tell  me it's  impossible I hope you finally  paid  your  fine off you don't have to thank me for letting you keep you medical license I figured  that a big  fine would  humble you.|Had difficulties reaching the office and issues with staff when I went in person for help, they did return voicemails but Robokiller  blocked them from my cell phone. I will be seeing Dr Sapieka whom I've seen previously, great doctor, 9/22/2023. I'll give full review then.

At National Institute of Pain Management, we specialize in comprehensive pain relief solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Ariel Majjhoo. Our practice focuses on interventional procedures and minimally invasive surgeries designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. With convenient locations in both Allen Park and Monroe, Michigan, we serve patients throughout the southeastern Michigan region with personalized care plans.

Our Specialized Services

Our comprehensive approach to pain management includes:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Minimally invasive surgical techniques

  • Innovative treatments like the NALU program

  • Customized pain management protocols

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

We pride ourselves on taking the time to listen to each patient's concerns and developing targeted treatment plans that address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our dedicated team works collaboratively to restore function and improve quality of life for our patients. For more information or to schedule a consultation, please visit our website at www.nipmmi.com or call us at +1 734-682-3309. column40:
**Minnesota Institute for Pain Management (MIPM)**

As a first-time patient in pain management, my experience at MIPM has been beyond exceptional. **Tobias G.** stands out for his ability to listen, understand, and go above and beyond in providing care. I highly recommend him.

**Beth R.** made my first experience with physical therapy amazing. Her knowledge, support, and personal touch made me feel like family. If I ever need PT again, I'd go out of my way to see her.

However, I'd recommend keeping your distance from **Dr. Sanjeev A. Just because a person has DR. Before their name does not make them superior to others. 

Overall, Tobias and Beth are two of the best healthcare professionals I've encountered. Their care and compassion make all the difference. Can't forget the amazing staff at the reception. It feels as if their smile alone was made for healing, you feel better as soon as you walk in. A simple smile goes long ways. Thank you all, I hope this helps someone out there.

~Abdul (Babhi) Mohamed|I was sceptical at first. After my first visit I knew I made the right choice. I not only see pain management but also do physical therapy. I made the right decision coming here. Both of the pain specialists are great and listen to every concern. The physical therapist is great. She has great concern for all of your concerns. The front office staff is always so warm and inviting. You always feel in good hands every time you are here. My whole family has been coming here since an automobile accident. Come here and get the proper care you need.|Great staff and doctors. They help me recover from all my pain. Im very please with their professional service.|Really awesome place they actually take there time out to listen to you and help you get better as I'm trying to heal from an accident I just had in the recent year I'm already getting better I would high recommend Minnesota institute for pain management|I had an awful experience here. I switched to this clinic after a long move and had hope due to good reviews, but my experience was less than pleasant. To start, they wouldn't do treatments till they had medical records sent. I kept calling my prior clinic who insisted they had sent them and it said delivered on their end multiple times. They sent my records a total of 3 times and I even showed my dr the records from my phone.
They would take weeks to follow up with appointments. i needed an MRI order before I could be scheduled for a nerve block to which they told me I would be in within 2 weeks. This didn't happen- I called multiple times inquiring when they'd order an MRI and I was always told "I'm not sure but I'll get back to you." I'd never hear back. Finally a month and half later I got an MRI order.
Then my Dr left which isn't their fault BUT they said by September they'd know more and they'd call. I never received a phone call and now it's January. Even if they had no new provider who could take my insurance it would've been nice to know. Although who knows if that's even the case.
How frustrating for someone who lives in pain. I was at the point of depression for how bad my pain got. Luckily I found somewhere else where they've been appropriately treating me and following up when they say they will.|struggling with chronic back and neck injuries and pain isn't easy but, Dr. Orora has been diligently helping me get through it all. Not only through different treatments but also by educating me about the anatomy of the spine in which can trigger certain symptoms as they arise due to me being in two car accidents.Dr. Orora is always actively listening to my concerns about any issues that I may be experiencing. Even the front desk receptionist Maria is always extremely helpful and kind as well as the other receptionists during check-ins and out.|After dealing with an issue that has cause me Chronic Pain since 2011 , in 2021 I finally found someone who literally took time to help me at this clinic! The doctor was wonderful, he started making since of why I'm having these problems I'm having and what has been causing the chronic pain ETC... he did, MRI, X-rays, ET. no other doctor besides one, back in 2011 ((RIP to him)) when I first found out what was causing the pain. So back to 2021 I searched, researched, googled hours ETC and decided to go with this clinic, I was so happy! After going for about 4-5months he finally got me on a pain regimen and I was starting to feel normal like myself ((since 2011)) I was so grateful! In 2022 my Doctor left this clinic I was very, very disappointed but another doctor took over wonderful!!! At first I was very skeptical because I've had such horrible luck dealing with doctors who are quacks! But this doctor was even better and he cared and I never had a doctor like him in my entire life care like he did! So here comes 2023 August to be exact! I go for my follow up and he tells me he's also now leaving! Ugh! When I say I wanted to cry I wanted to cry! This man is amazing!! So come September I get a call to come into the clinic and have an appointment with Doctor Arua, I come to my appointment never seen or met his man in my life but apparently the clinic is his , anywho! The energy was completely off from the other staff I have been dealing with! Mind you the staff has been amazing the scheduling desk ETC.... Everyone is very, very nice and friendly and I'm assuming they care, I never felt any different or felt uncomfortable! Anywho back to September 2023 So I go into meet Doctor Aura and I'm not really feeling the vibe or energy! But oh well I let it slide. I'm just here for basically a 30min - hr visit. He tells me he doesn't have a doctor yet and he doesn't accept the insurance I have. So he said I can refer you to a different clinic or You can do cash. I said hmmm.... Okay, well I really didn't wanna pay out of pocket ((so I said well if you know a good doctor you can refer me somewhere)) which he did. They called me about 5days later, and I set an appointment up. The appointment was set up after the dates my prescription were due! So now I'm really stressed out at this point. Because am I addict to a 3.5 MG and a 5MG Percocet that is mostly Tylenol it's kind of impossible for me to be addicted to any of that! I take 1 every 6hours I mean in all reality you people aren't even writing enough for someone to be addicted to it! Anywho, so I said well let me just called the clinic and ask could he refill them since the date is out, so I talked to a really sweet girl who understood where I was coming from and she said I'm gonna talk to the doctor so I said thank, she called me back 2hrs later and said the doctor said he could this one time ((she told me a lot of patients were calling who got booted out because a certain type of insurance! So I said thank you so much! I really, really appreciate it tell the doctor I'm very grateful. 3 days before my appointment I got sicker than a dog! I was down 2 weeks ((no way I would ever in my life go and contaminate and spread germs to individuals I feel that is one of the most selfish things you can do in life is to know you're sick and go around people and get them sick)) plus my mother is an RN! She would whoop my tail! J/k she is a RN though, been one 45 years, she has ran a entire business ((group homes)) but for the last 13yrs she has been working from home tending to my father who is considered a quadriplegic due to a quack overdosing him with blood pressure medicine and he had a reaction he was out of town in a different state when he took it and he was left by himself on the floor for 3days! When he was found his temperature was a 21 he was slowly dying, anywho. So I do go and help my mother with my dad 7days a week in the evenings after I work a full time job Mon-Fri my days are usually 14-16hrs. My mother is 63 and my father is 78 and it's a part 2 to this, give me a min.|TERRIBLE FOLLOW THROUGH! This place is awful. My doctor wanted me to have an injection done 5 MONTHS AGO.  It has never taken more than a week to get a prior authorization approved for the same type of injection. I have called and spoken to different people there 10 separate times over the course of 5 months and they say they will look into it and call me back and no one ever does. They give me no information as to what the problem is. Also the doctors keep leaving so I have been switched to 3 different doctors now. If you want your time wasted, and want to get moved from doctor to doctor every couple months then this is the place for you. Awful service here.

I will always recommend her to my circle of friends and family!|This place likes to generously give out muscle relaxants (anti anxiety) meds, or meds for neuropathy (gabapentin) to point you don't know if you're coming or going, these can or could make you feel too relaxed (some may like this). The way they prescribed it via 3x a day, if that don't work let's adjust it, by this time you're so overly medicated you agree to anything, could lead to a one car vehicle accident, or a victim of someone taking advantage of you cause you have no knowledge or are totally numb of what's going on. Please do your homework and search side effects before taking anything. Was prescribed a med, they didn't know the side effects until I asked, THEN was mentioned that this may not be good with my other meds. Thinking they should read your chart before prescribing.|Sarah is a top notch provider.  She listened,  did an actual examination and considered my feedback and preferences before coming up with a treatment plan.  Highly recommend to family, friends and anyone who cares about quality care.|I feel fortunate to have Ispine as my pain management clinic. It is so difficult living with chronic pain. They have been supportive through this journey, they have given me options outside of just medication for pain relief and are a great group of physicians and nurses both on the clinic and procedure side. NP Alyssa, Dr. Wolff and Dr. Betting have been my primary physicians for clinic and procedures. They are wonderful and I would recommend all of them to any new or existing patients.|Very good.  PA was very efficient, asked the right questions and verified the loss of feeling in left leg due to sciatica. I have had 2 experiences with sciatica so in my opinion this check could have easily been done virtually rather than having to drive 25 mines each way for a 10 min check. She was able to line up a cortisone shot from her computer before i left.|This appointment was an error, because
She was ready what to tell me.
She had ready my psychiatrist and psychologist names to send me with them, she thinks, I am making my medical issue.
She didn't go to directly to the point, instead she had ready to send me with those providers. She gave me a form to fill out PHQ9, so be careful when you provide give you that form, only you mental provider can give you that.
I tried to be honest but with Danielle Anderson nurse practitioner, but she abused my honesty.

column38: Connie Sutton|Ann Coates|Lori Bauer|Carole Lydeen|Mariah Eggert|mark stevenson|Bonnie Mohr|Monica Cone
column40:
I met with the DR and he was very kind, the whole staff was, The reason I gave 2 not 5 stars is they wont give anything 1st visit even though it's been same meds for over a year, so I've had NOTHING while waiting for my 2 and appointment .
Other pain clinics prescribe expecting people to have "other* things in their system with the understanding & agreement that will stop immediately, and levels will go down, BUT if you have anything vin your system they refuse pain meds, most of us would drink cat pee if it took away the pain, and it's a process to get Diagnosed & then referred to a clinic, this needs to change. This is why you have so many fentanyl deaths, we can't get fair pain management
Thank you
PS: I wasn't implying I had anything in my system, just a point I was making, I failed a ua at a different clinic, something I didn't use, but have figured out how it was introduced to my system, twin city pain wasted my time & my gas & I'm sure billed my insurance for me to come to a 2nd appointment  to tell me they won't help me because of a ua NOT done at their clinic, or while I was their patient ! I passed their UA, that could have been a phone call, meanwhile I'm suffering!! Good job DR's
The medical system and providers are badly broken. I was honest from the moment I made my appointment. I didn't use anything, I did drink something that has something in it I was not aware of this till today 02/18/2025!!!!
It was done on purpose to sabotage a custody battle
May you never be made to suffer like you are helping to make me & others suffer with your f#cked up policy|Dr. Crewdson is an excellent listener and actually read all the background information that I brought in. He was able to identify my problem and suggest a solution. The inner workings of the clinic seemed to be jumbled and the  supervisory staff has a difficult time returning calls and getting information posted to my patient portal. The doctors, nurses, and check in staff are excellent.|This was not an easy zoom. Because of illness, we had to keep switching numbers around to have someone physically with my mom. The IT guy, Montana, worked hard to get us connected. It took nearly 40 minutes but he was very patient. When we finally talked with the doctor, Dr Crewdson, he was extremely patient and understanding as well. Any other company would have said to reschedule, but TC Pain new how difficult our situation has been and took the time to make our initial consultation visit work.|I think I must have the best nurse practitioner in the whole world. Her name is Bethanie and I have been seeing her for well over a year now. She is the most compassionate caring practitioner anyone could want. I have multiple problems from previous surgeries and I'm looking at more Surgeries ahead for me. Bethanie takes all that into consideration with her decision on how she treats me. Twin Cities Pain Center not only treats my pain with medication but they also placed a pain pump in my back to treat my spinal pain. I'm so grateful for my NP and this pain clinic. They have given me back my life.|From the moment I walked in for my appointment,  every staff member was polite,  and very welcoming.  The doctor working with me was very kind,  polite, very knowledgeable and very thorough.  I am optimistic about what they can do to facilitate the treatment i need and look forward to the success.|Dr Will spent an hour with us to explain how things were going to go with the surgery. He was also training a new intern and was so good at letting her know what all the instructions were and having her do some of the explanations.|I was very impressed with my virtual visit with Dr. Will on 1/14/2025. I was given detailed information as to logging in to the visit and the entire visit went smoothly without any issues whatsoever.|Bethany Miller truely cares about her patients! I am so lucky to have her guiding me through my pain issues. I would recommend Twin Cities Pain Clinic to anyone who needs help managing their pain.

column38: Betty Hill|craig essig|Jackie Michik|Tonia Brinston|Christine Victorsen|Ann Hustad|Carolyn Wilhelm|Jaydia Jaxx
column40:
It's always a pleasure meeting with Sally, she always making sure my records are up to date, and anything I need for tests. I am looking forward to my upcoming test of the stem unit.
I am so pleased with TCPC, I've been a patient since 2013. I'm not going anywhere|I have had a number of procedures done at TCPC and have had a great experience every time.  They are prepared when you arrive and are very thorough to make sure the correct procedure is being done in the correct place.  Dr. Haas has been my doctor for several procedures and she is always pleasant and explains what she is doing and what to expect.  She doesn't just follow protocol and go step by step, she also treats the patient to make sure you are doing ok and that you are comfortable.  They have great staff and are always willing to explain or help in any way possible.  They do very good work and I would strongly recommend them to anyone seeking pain management.|After nearly losing my right hand due to compartment syndrome from a car accident, chronic pain completely derailed my aspirations for life.  Over the 16 years that I've been a patient with Twin Cities Pain Clinic, my everyday life has slowly broadened.  They have treated me like a unique individual with different sensitivities and tolerances.  Dr. Haas has been amazingly skillful and wise.  With new technology and treatment options, although I still have some days with pain, they are magnitudes of order more manageable and I enjoy many pain-free days.  It's like being freed from heavy shackles.|I was in so much pain it felt like labor contractions, and I had challenges walking. My doctor had no openings, so I had to see one in Eden Prairie. As long as I've been going to TCPC, I've never asked for pain medication. I was super disappointed that I wasn't offered at least a one/two-day supply of something other than steroids, and call your primary in two weeks if you don't feel better. I even asked for a prescription for pain patches, she said they are over the counter now. Any pain doctor knows over 4% lidocaine has to be prescribed. When meeting a doctor for the first time, I always advocate for myself, especially when they ask me, "Do you have any questions?" I always ask, "Do you believe AAs have a higher threshold than my white counterparts?" I didn't this time. I think I was in so much, and I trusted that I would be well taken care of because of my long relationship with this organization instead of sitting in an ER for hours, which I am probably going to have to do because I am still in excruciating pain, with no relief in my near future!|In general I have had very good experiences at the Pain Clinic.  Amy is wonderful and very knowledgeable and caring.  I am though getting very tired of being hassled about getting an implant that I DO NOT want.  I don't believe this is coming from Amy but from the management.|Dr Sherri Haas was absolutely amazing! She brainstormed with me on my pain solution. She spent alot of time helping with a good alternative. I'm beyond grateful for her care and her knowledge. She's such a wonderful resource. In the world of medicine, Dr Haas stands out!|The Twin Cities Pain Clinic has saved my life allowing me to function outside the house. I still have some pain but it is so much more tolerable. I have an appointment once a month and every doctor has been personable which helps me feel comfortable. I now have a spinal cord stimulator which is an excellent invention. I had no idea I could be brave enough to get one. The TCPC picked up where the Mayo Clinic left off as Mayo does not do follow on as they mainly diagnose and operate - they did my spinal fusion. I needed to find follow on help plus TCPC does injections and SCS and other surgeries. Wonderful!|Everyone I see or speak to has been so helpful and understanding . Sally is the best. I talk with Sam for the first time the other day and She was very nice and was understanding I have nothing but Love and Respect for all at Twin City Pain Clinic in Edina MN

column40:
I would like to say Thank you to nurse Sara (Chaska) for her compassionate care she gave to me. While I was at the clinic I received a call about a  death in my family. She hugged me and consoled me with such kind words .  She showed genuine concern about me and my family. She stayed with me until we both felt I could handle the drive home.  At my next visit, 4 months later, she remembered  me and inquired how my family was doing.|I have been sick for 18yrs and Tobbie is one of the kindest Drs I've ever had! My situation is complicated and she always takes the time to check in with me and how I'm doing not just physically but emotionally! She's amazing!|After my appointment today I don't think ive ever been more frustrated and disappointed.

Dr. Faltas has been amazing and truly cares. I highly recommend him. That's who I thought I was seeing today but apparently not. 5/5 stars for him!

Had I known I was seeing Alexis Bolick -PA I would have rescheduled because she did nothing my first visit with her.

Alexis (who I've seen once in the past and all she did was offer me weed which is the only thing I've ever declined for treatment) literally asked me "what would you like me to do today for you?" I literally thought she was kidding so I didnt answer...until I realized she was serious.
Also said "I don't know what to do for you."
Literally how the 5 minute appointment ended.

I didn't realize I'm supposed to do your job for you. In my opinion I feel like she does not care and wasted my time. Not to mention driving is uncomfortable and to drive there for her to shrug it off. I dont live close by any means. She would see that if she looks at the questionnaire I fill out before every visit. You can see I'm tired because I don't sleep at night because of the pain. You can see clear as day that my MRI proves why I have excruciating pain. For 4 years I've been in pain nearly every day. I have tried everything they have ever recommended (minus weed). Also mention I have never asked for narcotics or anything!! Last time I had any narcotics was for kidney stones almost 10 years ago. So maybe she thinks I'm a drug seeker?

My most recent MRI now shows I need surgery to remove a vertebrae which will hopefully happen in 1-2 months but until then she just wants me to continue to be in excruciating pain until someone else can help me. You went to PA school to help people with pain and today I felt like I was wasting your time but in reality you wasted mine & caused more pain.

How my appointment ended:
With complete frustration & feeling hopeless.|She's really great and professional and makes you feel very comfortable....i like her attitude and how friendly she is... she's a great provider...|Allie Gliadon is such a great doctor. Very clear and knowledgeable and most important a caring and considerate listener.|I'm happy to say Alexander's suggestion to go with the SprintPNS after seeing my MRI is a good suggestion. She's always happy to help you find a solution.|Staff is always friendly from walking in the door to leaving. Alexis understanding and I feel heard by her.|I have been working with Alexis for several years on a multiple of issues. She is kind, supportive and knowledgeable and understanding.  She has helped me get through some icky painful times.  She makes me feel heard.

column40: I normally go to the Burnsville location and see Lindsey. She's awesome. But when they don't have any openings I come to this location. I have read some of the reviews for this place. I can say I've only been to this location a few times, but I've never had any problems with anything or anybody here. As I said I usually go to the Burnsville location. Every location that I have been to treats me with dignity and respect. As a recovering heroin addict it's very difficult to control my pain but they have me on Methadone which is an absolute life saver for me as it's been keeping me away from "H" but they also have me on Oxy for my pain. I wouldn't go anywhere else for my pain cuz they specialize in addiction too. I absolutely love this company. Thanks to Lindsey, Ellie, Christina, Amanda and Dr. George for trusting me and  listening to me and treating my pain. I would not go anywhere else for pain management.|This place is a joke.  The sheer level of incompetence borders on malice towards its patients. appointments that were made months out are rescheduled  or just cancelled unilaterally, with no advanced notice, for no reason at all -- and this is a regular occurrence.  The doctors regard their patients with suspicion and open hostility, refusing to meet reasonable requests with zero explanation. The staff answering the phone are rude and unhelpful. Avoid at all costs.|I'm a PCA for my mother I called to follow up about a referral for her it was fairly urgent a men who didn't speak well English kept telling me what referral she had I told him I didn't understand him. I made it clear I needed someone else on the phone he put me on hold and hung up! Don't go here if you don't have to.|This clinic is a joke.  They make statements that you can not trust and if something happens like a mistake is made because they refuse to just treat the patient totally and the family doc sends the wrong perscription in, they will drop you because they didn't just help you with your chronic and acute pain issues.  It's a really sad time in this day and age that they immediately think you are trying to get something over on them, but really it was a true mistake that could have been avoided by them just doing their job and treating the patient like a human being instead of expecting an issue.  I'm nor even the patient, but my 71 year old boyfriend was treated very badly, then just abandoned by these people.  Treated like a common criminal when they could have spoke to the family doctor to see what went wrong in sending a perscription.  Just beware, if you have acute pain and they tell you to see someone else for it, watch out, make real sure what happens is the absolute correct thing, because even doctors make mistakes, we are all human after all.  You can be dropped like yesterday's garbage.|I have been a patient there for over 2 years. The last 6 months have been pure HELL!! I have not done anything wrong.  Great pee tests. Sivili Vang is the provider.  Every month there is a problem with me getting my prescription.  She forgets to send it in. I call multiple times, and fight to get it. I had to drive into the office one time, for her to release it. This month, she didn't send it in. I called pharmacy to check on it. They didn't have it. This is on the day I was told by provider I could pick it up. 5:00pm, still not sent in. The stress is unbelievable.  If I run out, I'm in withdrawal.  This has turned into the biggest nightmare ever. I'm so disheartened in how this has become such a mess. EVERY  month.|My provider Sivilai Vang went above and beyond helping me with my Rx costs after my insurance changed and no longer covered it. She researched and printed a coupon for my pharmacy and being someone on a fixed income every penny helps! She and everyone at the Woodbury location have always been great over  the years I have been getting treatment there. Highly recommended!!!!|I had my COVID test done here yesterday, and it was so quick and easy, and most importantly, safe. I never left my car. I only pulled down my mask for less than a minute, and we were done! I got my test results back super quick! Like within 10 hours! (Not saying that every test will be like that, but faster than the community sites)|The registration and the testing process was quick and easy. However it took almost 24 hours to get my test results back. Early on in the pandemic these guys were by far the fastest place to get results. They have now been surpassed by other more efficient technology. If you don't need results fast highly recommend. If you are looking for fast results there are other better options.

column3:
At Twin Cities Orthopedics, Dr. Aaron Bloom specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic pain disorders affecting the spine, chest, abdomen, pelvis, and extremities. We take pride in our multi-modal treatment approach that is carefully customized to address each patient's specific painful syndrome.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our advanced treatment options include:

  • Fluoroscopically-guided spine injections

  • Ultrasound-guided peripheral nerve blocks and joint injections (steroid or viscosupplementation)

  • Botox injections for dystonia

  • Nerve ablation procedures for spine, hip, or shoulder pain

  • Peripheral nerve stimulation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

We work closely with our surgeons, physical therapists, occupational therapists, and personal trainers to create a comprehensive treatment plan designed to break the pain cycle. Located in Edina, Minnesota, our team is committed to providing exceptional care for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Contact us at (952) 456-7000 or visit Dr. Aaron Bloom's profile to learn more about our services or to schedule a consultation.
column11: Dr. Aaron Bloom specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of acute and chronic pain disorders of the spine, chest, abdomen, pelvis and extremities. He always takes a multi-modal treatment approach that is customized to address the specific painful syndrome involved. Such treatments may include: fluoroscopically-guided spine injections, ultrasound-guided peripheral nerve blocks and joint injections (steroid or viscosupplementation), botox injections for dystonia, and nerve ablation (for spine, hip or shoulder pain), peripheral nerve stimulation and spinal cord stimulation. Dr. Bloom works closely with our surgeons, PT, OT and personal trainers to comprehensively optimize the likelihood of breaking his patients' pain cycle.

column40:
Very helpful and understanding staff. When unexpected issues arise they go out of there way to try and help. I've been to half a dozen pain clinics and this is my favorite one in the last 15yrs of my chronic pain. It would be a 5 stars but they sometimes forget to get prior Authorization started until after it expires which can obviously have u in withdrawal, which if ur familiar then u know how bad that is.|It is virtually impossible to get hold of anyone. I've called, texted. The only way to reach them is to go there, which is ridiculous. I've never experienced anything like it. I hope your experience is better than mine.|Been a patient for years. This is a pill farm. They do not do the whole body approach. They have horrific customer service, they don't answer phones or give any option for urgent contact for when they screw up your prescriptions. They've got me hooked on opiods and have SEVERAL times put me in danger by putting me into severe withdrawal and pain because they don't care to give proper contact info or reply when they screw up. I've gone all weekend without my meds and cannot get through to ANYONE that works for the company.  I now have to very unsafely drive 20 minutes while super sick to the actual office just to speak to anyone there. I do not feel safe here but have no options because They've got me hooked on specific pills that hardly anyone is able to prescribe. BEWARE. NEGLIGENT PILL FARM|It would be really helpful if you guys looked into better answering services as return phone calls for basics such as scheduling or answering questions about medication's has been a very slow and painful process. Your clinic is by far the hardest clinic to deal with regarding medication's and return phone calls.|Between the smoke smell and the really loud music you would think you were in a sports bar in the 90's. It smelled like they previously smoked in the building, you could smell it as you opened the door and it got worse once you got through the entryway to the check-in desk. The music was so loud you can barely concentrate to fill out the paperwork.  Honestly I was only there 15 minutes I couldn't stay for my appointment, my chest hurt and I was having problems breathing.  So I can't say anything as far as how the provider was, but if you are sensitive to smells or have asthma do not go to the Burnsville location you will not be able to breathe.|I have been a patient at Valley Medical & Wellness since 2022, I started at the Burnsville location and was seen by Lindsay Bergstreser. My experience at first was great, I felt heard and understood, but the wait time to be seen was extremely long.

After about year, I experience financial hardship and I
returned to the Burnsville location for an appointment, and I was approached by the billing supervisor. I had been on a payment plan, but apparently the amount was not enough, and I was told it would be my last appointment. I asked if there was a way to work this matter out since I really like the provider I was seeing. The billing supervisor was rude but gave me an amount that I would need to agree to pay per month to stay at the clinic, I agreed to the amount, and she was going to go get a new contract written up for me to sign. She returned with the updated payment plan, but the amount was double than what we agreed to not even 10 minutes before hand. I questioned the amount, she said, I made a mistake on how much the monthly payment would need to be. I stated I could not afford that payment per month. The billing supervisor then said this would be your last appointment here then and walked out of the office.

At that point, I reached out the clinic manager regarding my concerns and experience with the billing supervisor. The clinic manager reviewed everything, and we were able to come up with an agreement that would work for both myself, and the company.

I started going to the Plymouth location since it was closer to my home. Lauren Holzfaster was the provider I was seeing at the Plymouth location, and I absolutely loved her! Everything was going great; I was making my weekly payments, but then I received the statement in the mail. The statement showed that none of my payments were being applied to my bill. I reached out to the billing team immediately and requested a detail bill summary of my billing history. After reviewing the statement, I had several questions. I was being charged different amounts for the same exact visit every month by the same provider. Where were my payments going for the past 2 months? I also paid out of pocket $350 for a visit due to no insurance, but the statement I received said I owed $350 to them for that appointment. I went back and forth several times with the billing supervisor and I was not having my questions answered, so I went back to the clinic manager.

The new clinic manager had to review everything again and said she would contact me within a week for updates, but meanwhile my weekly payments would be suspended until this was resolved. Three weeks went by, the billing team tried to charge my card twice. I reached out by Klara, no response. After several phone calls into the office, messages on Klara, I finally received a response from the clinic manager.

Basically, said that she found no errors in the billing and that my weekly payments would resume. Also, a new policy was made for patients without insurance would need to pay the day before hand or the appointment would be cancelled. I responded and asked for a copy of the updated policy due to the inconsistencies of the billing department. I also requested a phone call from the clinic manager because I had several questions without answers regarding the billing. I was promised a phone call, but the phone calls were never returned. Finally, the day before my appointment, she reached out. Once again, none of my questions for billing, she had any answers to, but was told this would be my last appointment at Valley Medical due to safety of my care and their "business".

I just wanted my questions answered, I had no problem paying the weekly amount that was agreed upon, but when a company can't answer a question on billing, it's very concerning. The provider as well, did not understand their decision on making this my last appointment. It's been very clear that Valley Medical could care less about patient care.|It does not get worse than this place. They don't call or message you back, they have not called in my meds multiple times, found lies in my medical records, it goes on. There is nothing like it, it's beyond terrible.  The lead doctor also has a dui. They are a risk to your health on so many levels.|Update 1-14-25

-- ANSWER your phone calls! I been waiting g 5 days for a response! I have left you message on klaara and I been on hold for 5 hours. Hire efficient workers!  You guys should be shut down. Your dealing with people's lives here!

---

I been waiting for a call back since Friday due to a smashed up foot and no one is taking it seriously.! I can't get pain meds from my local doctor because I'm in a pain contract with you!

Update!!!

Specialized Pain Relief in Sartell, MN

Are you living with chronic pain that disrupts your daily life? At Center for Pain Management, we understand the profound impact pain has on your overall well-being. Our team of experienced pain management physicians is dedicated to providing advanced interventional treatments tailored to your specific needs. We offer comprehensive pain management services including:

  • Specialized nerve treatments

  • Customized pain management plans

Located at 804 23rd St S in Sartell, our clinic combines medical expertise with genuine compassion to help you regain control of your life. We're committed to empowering you to enjoy life to the fullest through effective pain control strategies. Don't let chronic pain define your future - visit our Sartell location or call us at +1 320-230-7788 to schedule your consultation today.

column3:
At iSpine Clinics, we specialize in helping Twin Cities south-metro residents find relief from painful spine and extremity disorders. Our highly trained team of pain management specialists is dedicated to providing personalized care that helps you reclaim your active lifestyle.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We combine cutting-edge procedures with compassionate care to effectively treat:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Shoulder pain

  • Hip pain

  • Chronic pain conditions

Our approach focuses on developing individualized treatment plans that address your specific needs, allowing you to return to the activities you love. As an approved provider for most major insurance carriers and health plans, we make quality pain management accessible. Visit our Burnsville location at 14000 Nicollet Ave Suite 104, Burnsville, MN 55337, or call us at +1 763-201-8191 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11:
If you're suffering from a painful spine or extremity disorders, the specialists at iSpine Clinics will help you find relief and reclaim your life. Serving residents of the Twin Cities south-metro area, this highly trained team is committed to providing personalized chronic pain management services and helping patients return to healthy, active lifestyles. Combining cutting-edge procedures with compassionate care, these Pain Management specialists work to relieve shoulder, hip, neck, and back pain, allowing you to return to enjoying the activities you love. iSpine Clinics is an approved provider for most major insurance carriers and health plans.

iSpine Clinics has two locations in Burnsville, Minnesota. This is our pain management clinic.

From the moment I scheduled my appointment, the entire process was smooth and stress-free. The receptionist was incredibly kind and helpful, setting the tone for a great visit.

The doctor's assistant was attentive, professional, and ensured I was comfortable every step of the way. Special thanks to Dr. Parmele, who went above and beyond to help me feel at peace with my procedure for sciatic nerve pain. Since March 9th, I had been living with unbearable pain, but after my recent procedure, I can finally walk, sit, and stand without the discomfort I had grown accustomed to.

Dr. Parmele took the time to explain everything in detail, which made me feel reassured and confident about moving forward. I'm beyond grateful for the care and attention I received from the entire team. I can finally say I'm on the road to recovery, and I couldn't be happier with my experience at iSpine!|I've never had such amazing care than I have since I started going to see Jake @ ICL Spine. I'm in & out quickly at every appointment, my next appointment is made before I even leave the exam room & my meds are ready before I get home thanks to the efficient staff sending my refills right away. I'm very impressed with how everything works & the care I've received. For the first time in 10 years I've got hope that things will get better & I'll be able to get off the pain meds. Full-Service Pain Management Approach

column40:
A family friend recommended them. I was very pleased with my visit and have decided to switch to this clinic for my back issues. Dr. Yaccarino was great, he explained things so I understood and discussed options for treatment so that I could decide which path we would proceed with. Very happy to find them. All staff was excellent and treated me with kindness.|I went to the Burnsville Location- very nice location and easy to get to. However that was the only plus of my visit. I had been referred by a specialist at another clinic, AFTER being referred to the referring provider from another clinic, short story this is the 3rd specialist I have seen regarding my back. I have had multiple injections and even medial branch blocks and a radio frequency done, but yet this Dr told me there was nothing wrong with my back and all I needed was to exercise and do PT (mind you this is after he mentioned more then once how many times I have been seen by PT). He also stated my back in my MRI looked just fine even though there was obviously visible bulges in my back. All the provider did was touch my back, make me walk and bend. Hardly asked me any questions about the pain I'm dealing with. My referral also stated "consult for pain pump or spinal cord stimulator" neither of which were spoke about. All in all I would never go back here as I have been dealing with my back for 4 years now with multiple things already done and the provider completely blew me off and told me I was fine and to stretch (after I had specifically stated how hard it is for me to do so due to pain).|The medical side of this visit was great. The Dr was very personable and patient with questions. I only gave 4 stars because when we were in the waiting room after the appointment finishing up some paperwork, we noticed the girl at the desk had fallen asleep leaning against the wall while sitting in her chair. When we first arrived, she was also very distracted by her cell phone. These things made the facility appear unprofessional.|The doctor was very pleasant and helpful. He figured out my issue on the first visit and came up with a plan to get me off my pain meds for life. I'm looking forward to working with them. I tried other pain clinics and they didn't have the staffing and were reluctant to take my case. Twin Cities Pain Clinic was close to my house. Everyone was helpful and happy to assist me.|My visit today went very well, as always.
I was taken right away, and Ashley was in
Almost very shortly after. From the second you step in the clinic, I'm greeted
By friendly, and compassionate staff.
Ashley has been wonderful at explaining
Any new procedures that come up, and she always takes the time to listen to all my concerns, and questions. I would refer Twin City Pain Clinic to all.|I had an appointment this week to update my health records for this year. TCPC has always done a good job of helping me whenever I needed care.
I recommend them to family and friends.|The building is neat and clean.  The doctor is one of the best pain clinic doctors I've ever had.  She's caring and wants what will help me best instead giving me opioids.|I have had 3 visit.all were great. Had injection in my spine.  Went fast. Everyone knew their job and did it. Everyone was fantastic it is the best place to go

column40:
It's always a pleasure to visit with Erin. She is very respectful and nice. I have no problems with Twin Cities Pain Clinic everyone is very caring and nice, thank you for asking.|TCPC was a very pleasant and efficient experience at my last appointment and others. Dr. K has a comprehensive understanding of my several orthopedic issues. She has addressed them and prioritized them to make my life  more functional. Thanks to Dr Kokayeff and staff for their continued care.
Sincerely
John Alt|I tried this place after moving to the area from another part of the country, and it was terrible. They only care about self enrichment. Their primary goal is to bleed you and your insurance dry. They will blow a hole in your budget whether you have in-network coverage or not. Their administrative staff are very nice, but the providers did not care about my well-being whatsoever. They recommended the most expensive diagnostic procedure and disregarded my previous doctor's treatment plan that worked well. They will try force you to do as many office visits as possible and abruptly make you do 'diagnostic' lab tests on the spot. They charge quite a lot for an office visit that mostly involves them reading a you prepared questionnaire. I 100% do not recommend.|My virtual visit went smoothly as always. I was able to get my meds refilled. We discussed my treatments going forward I was reminded to make sure I made another appointment for next week. I had an excellent visit and am thankful for the virtual visits|Erin was extremely informative about how to look at the options for my future care. She put my mind at ease!  Great visit!

I've also seen Bethany Miller at Maplewood, she's fantastic as well.  She took her time explaining a procedure and how it works in my body. Bethany is thorough and willing to help me in my special circumstances.   Very professional, I value that!  I feel lucky to have found these outstanding people!|Dr. Haas is wonderful and very caring.  She, and my other providers at the TC Pain Clinic continually work with me to find the solutions that help.  The entire staff is very kind and the care is terrific.  I can't say enough positive things about the TC Pain Clinic and I am grateful to be able to work with them.|Kierstin Durie introduced herself to my wife and me, and we are pleased that she will be our TC Pain service contact going forward. We hope this arrangement will be stable for a  while (we have been shuffled around to a new TC Pain  person with every new appointment beginning last summer.)
Kjerstin was very accommodating, pleasant and professional, and we look forward to working with her.
Thank you!
Al Seymour|Just another clinic that talks patients into procedures and then provides no follow up care or takes any responsibility for the decisions they talk their patients into.

Edit: As a follow up, they've now corrected their mistake to the best of their abilities but this is our "final" visit as they are only for "intervention medicine" not chronic....

Funny, considering what caused all of the trouble is that you made us sign a pain contract... which is for chronic, right? Then when we were forced to go to the hospital due to pain you said it was "acute" and not your responsibility even though the Dr. there stated it was "100% due to the procedure" and he wouldn't help because the clinic should...

So you signed us up for a procedure, went on vacation, ignored/ didn't respond to our repeated calls and messages and then when we finally talk to someone about what's going on... your receptionist starts repeating your messages verbatim back to us while being offended that I told her we would have to call back due to the Dr who was actually taking care of my wife needing to speak to us...

This place is about as unprofessional and irresponsible as they come. They value their time over your well being, lack planning and then when you call them out on it, they lie and say they don't deal with chronic pain anymore.

I'm glad though, we weren't planning on continuing to use your services anyway as you seem to be incapable of managing patient care anyway. As a warning to anyone who took the time to read this, ask questions about all stages of your procedures and make sure they have a pain management plan in place, cause they'll ignore it and blame you for their mistakes. Good luck and avoid this place if you can!
