column2: Premier Spine and Pain Clinics, PLLC: Louis Saeger, MD
column3:
Expert Spine Care with Dr. Louis Saeger, MD

At Premier Spine and Pain Clinics, we specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of spine-related pain under the expert guidance of Dr. Louis Saeger. With over three decades of dedicated experience since entering private practice in 1986, Dr. Saeger brings exceptional credentials to our practice. He earned his MD from the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine, completed his residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Washington, and pursued a two-year NIH fellowship in Pain Research at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center. Dr. Saeger holds dual Board Certifications in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and is a distinguished World Institute of Pain Fellow in Interventional Pain Practice. Our comprehensive pain management services include:

  • Specialized spine pain diagnosis

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Non-invasive pain management options

We're committed to providing compassionate, patient-centered care at our Edina location. Visit Premier Spine and Interventional Pain to learn more about how we can help you find relief from chronic pain.
column11: Dr. Lou Saeger earned his MD degree from the University of Oklahoma College of Medicine, and entered private practice in 1986, after completing his residency in Anesthesiology with the University of Washington, and a two-year NIH fellowship in Pain Research with the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center in Seattle. He is Board-Certified in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and is a World Institute of Pain Fellow in Interventional Pain Practice. Since the early 1990s, Dr. Saeger has been increasingly focused on the diagnosis and treatment of spine-related pain.

column38: Jeffrey Stafford|Burnt Toast|roxanne birrenbach|Marni Elias|Michelle Doran|Paula Coyle (terriergal)|brooke bakke|Alex Berg
column40: I've only had 3 appointments with Dr. Saeger and I can say with certainty that he is "the man" if you have spine pain. I was injured in a motor vehicle accident in June of 2019 and have seen multiple doctors and had surgery to replace 2 cervical discs but still have left upper back pain. Mary his scheduler was a saint and made intake super easy. All the other girls at the office are sooo friendly and take every effort to make sure you feel welcomed and cared for. Dr. Saeger I already can't say enough about. He is very attentive to you and actually takes time to listen to his patients. He is very thorough and his bedside manner gives you a sense of security that you are in the right hands. I've had an initial consult and two positive nerve block injections.  Next is minor non invasive surgery and I will be pain free after 5.5 years of daily torture. Thank you Dr. Saeger and team!|Both, Mark Stock (Pain Specialists of Minnesota) and Dr. Saeger, have been working with my spine surgeons for over a decade.  I know people struggle to find adequate relief through treatments for pain, especially nowadays, but both Mark and Dr. Saeger have always come through to help.  Having been through multiple surgeries and getting expert opinions, their clinic should be the first stop for anyone looking for compassionate care and results.  Staff is always extremely supportive and understanding too. Thank you all!|Dr Saeger has been doing my injections for over 15 years and has always been amazing. He is so thorough and hill has such a positive attitude. He's so personable and his team makes you feel like family.  I couldn't give anyone a better recommendation.  My husband also see's him and wouldn't go anywhere else|Dr Saeger and his team have always been great. I would highly recommend|Mark is so understanding and through. He makes sure that your treatment is the best for you. I looked forward to my visits with him. He always put a smile on my face and he truly cared about me and my treatment for sure it was fron his heart he cared about his patients. I miss seeing  him he always gave me a positive outlook on everthing!!!!|I have been to see dr Saeger quite a few times in the last four years and it's always a helpful experience, especially after suffering for 6 to 10 years of degenerating disc issues without answers from my primary physicians and another spine doctor affiliated with my local clinic.  I consulted with a spine surgeon, Dr. Sinicropi, and he thought I might need surgery but he wanted to try some less invasive things first to be sure. And that was when he referred me to Dr. Saeger for some epidural steroid injections. Dr. Saeger explains things very clearly and has a different (more thorough) approach than some of the other places I have tried. He listens and clearly cares about what you're going through. His staff all seem wonderful, caring,  and happy to work there, which says a lot. I did also have to have surgery but some of the procedures Dr. Saeger carried out were helpful in diagnosing the need for surgery. The first time I was there and had the epidural injection, I got into the car afterwards and cried because I Felt like I finally had an answer. Between himself and Dr. Sinicropi At Midwest spine  they pinpointed  exactly where the worst pain was coming from, from the same imaging that befuddled my other doctors.|Dr.Saeger is amazing and so is his team! I won't let anyone else do my injections and I drive 3 hours north to see him.|Excellent care in my experience here. The doctor was extremely patient with my questions and very knowledgeable and passionate about his field.

At iSpine Clinics, we specialize in providing comprehensive relief for chronic spine and musculoskeletal pain conditions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. James Parmele, MD, our team of specialists is dedicated to helping Twin Cities residents find effective pain relief and return to healthy, active lifestyles.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management through our conveniently located clinics, with services including:

  • Consultation and thorough evaluation

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Implanted devices for pain management

  • Medication management and reduction strategies

  • Physical and occupational therapy

  • MedX rehabilitation programs

As an approved provider for most major insurance carriers and health plans, we make quality pain management accessible to our community. Visit our iSpine Clinics website to learn more about how we can help you regain control of your life at our Maple Grove location or any of our other Twin Cities facilities.
column11: If you are suffering from chronic spine and musculoskeletal pain conditions, the specialists at iSpine Clinics are her to help you find relief and return to healthy, active lifestyles. Serving residents of the Twin Cities-area at a variety of convenient locations, iSpine Clinics offer a comprehensive, multidisciplinary solution for pain management, with services including consultation and evaluation, interventional pain procedures, implanted devices, medication management and reduction strategies, physical and occupational therapy, and MedX rehabilitation. iSpine Clinics is an approved provider from most major insurance carriers and health plans.

column40:
Horribly went wrong. The lady RN Evelyn started out with confrontation, and confusion of my appointment, I exclaimed to her, I was referred to DrParmele from a football professional. I also have a professional background. Not in sports.  Whoever Evelyn is on his staff treated me as if I needed "recovery" from excessive opioids. I wasn't in the market of bargain shopping. I was put on a reduction previously from a pain clinic for an infraction, as I went over the count due to re injuring myself loosing weight. She did not care to understand the whole and made the decision to completely ignore to hear about my physical conditions... I feel as if the "opioid pandemic" took over and she took her own personal view, in which had a complete influence on my care. I then finally met the DOCTOR, who was a Fabulous Man! I shared a short version of my major dump truck accident and that I had got ejected from an 81/2 ton dump truck 25 years ago. I flew out the driver's window and landed 73 ft into a corn field. I was looked at as an addict. I requested a lower dose then what was on and compromised . Only to return to the office with a completely different plan. I am now in my bed at home and can barely move. Thank you ISPINE. Your the best!|This doctor is absolutely amazing. He has done a few procedures in regards to my health, and he has been completely dedicated. He knows my medical history. He explains things to a certain degree to where you understand. Any question you ask he doesn't make you feel incompetent for asking, and he does his best to explain it.  He is 100% hands-down one of the best surgeons/doctors I've ever met and I would recommend anyone to go to him.|I've only met Dr. Parmele once so far but was impressed with his knowledge and professionalism.  I'm look forward to working with him and getting to know him better.|He is professional. He is personable. Kind and ever so thoughtful as we haven't had anything to eat or drink for many hours.   Thank you.|This was my first visit to iSpine.
This doctor was very personable and got right to the point in his questioning.  Initial screening was done by a paraprofessional staff member as is normal now days. Evelyn was very friendly and professional.  Doctor P. did not minimize my experience of chronic pain, nor talk down to me, but ordered an MRI "to see what's going on", plus offered a non-narcotic medication to mitigate my acute symptoms which has helped.  A further plan of care will follow the results of the MRI, I assume.  I expect to have a positive relationship with this clinic.|I was pleased with the care I received from his team. Gave me very good instructions and follow up after my procedure.|Was so pleased, helped me through my pain, seeing  him again in Chaska to monday the 30. Thank|Wonderful front desk staff and the LPN I had was absolutely amazing. The most caring person ever. Dr. Parmele was understanding about my situation and willing to help me.  Will recommend this clinic to anyone

column40:
I am incredibly grateful for the exceptional care I've received from Dr. Tanner V. Unlike my previous experiences at the Edina location, Dr. Tanner goes above and beyond to make me feel seen and heard. He takes the time to explain diagnoses in clear, understandable terms, ensuring I fully grasp what's going on with my health. I appreciate his proactive approach--he doesn't hesitate to expedite treatment when necessary and always makes me feel like an active participant in my care.

Everyone I've interacted with, from the receptionist to the scribe, has been genuinely pleasant and kind. The entire team creates a welcoming and supportive environment, which makes a significant difference. Thank you, Dr. Tanner and the whole team, for your professionalism, compassion, and dedication. I'm truly fortunate to have you all on my care journey.|I love Twin City Pain
Dr. Erin is an amazing doctor. I feel like she cares about my health. She is amazing. Thanks for caring. Oh Dr Haas is my surgeon she does a great job.|I have been gone for a few months after having some fusion on my lower spine,saw a new doctor Tanner and was very helpful as they usually are. Have only good thoughts about the doctors and the receptionist that I see when I go there monthly. Thank you very much|I greatly appreciate the care I've received from Dr. Pizanski and Tanner, PA, the nurses and all the other staff. I'm truly thankful for all they have done to help me with all the Cervical, Thoracic and SI joint pain issues. Their kindness, communication, and listening skills and referrals for surgeons is top notch. Their kindness I will never forget and anyone struggling with chronic pain be rest assured they will do their best to help you.|They listen, they ask, they analyze fully. They are encouraging of feedback and conversation. They are there for getting you the RIGHT care, not just taking your time and pain for granted to fill the books. I feel treated like a person here, not just another number like I have with other clinics. They are clear about OPTIONS and provide information without forcing you down a single path; this transparency allows for educated decisions to be made and opens up questions and conversation that might not otherwise be discussed with other doctors. They're not afraid to try diagnostics for complex matters or refer to other clinics in order to find root causes and find you the right care. They are looking for root problems and root solutions to ensure true care for the source of pain, not just covering up your symptoms. Online portal needs some serious work though.|I was nervous about the consult. But the ladies at the front desk was very kind. The round lady that took me back and did the pre visit was very nice. The doctor was very nice. They all answered my questions and made me very at ease. I normally get anxious but they was all easy going and I was as relaxed as I could be while in pain. They actually listen to you and answer your questions. So far so good|My experience with this consultant was deeply disappointing. After the appointment, I reviewed her notes from the initial assessment and was shocked to find multiple inaccuracies. She documented that I have urinary incontinence, vision and hearing loss, and elbow pain preventing me from getting off the floor--none of which I said or was asked about during the visit.

During the visit, Aimee made minimal eye contact and spent most of the time typing on her computer, despite having a scribe present. The interaction felt cold and impersonal, and there was no effort to truly understand my concerns.

For a practice that specializes in pain management, this lack of attention and professionalism is unacceptable. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. I left feeling unheard, frustrated, and completely defeated.  I will not be returning.

The only reason I am leaving a review is because they keep sending emails and text messages asking for them.|I met with Tanner, who is not my usual provider because I had a scheduling conflict
I've never been seen by him.  He took the time to familiarize himself with my condition
He was very prepared, knowledgeable and empathetic to my issues.  My normal provider Erin is wonderful.  Tanner, as well as EVERYONE at Twin Cities pain clinic couldn't be better in my opinion.  My life changed for the better once I was referred to them.  I'm exercising, losing weight and just healthier
since learning about TCPC.  I'd highly recommend them!

column40:
Exceptional care! I've been seeing Dr Nascimento for jaw pain and working with Kyle Zenk for physical therapy. Everyone here is so friendly, helpful, and welcoming. I tried a trigger point injection for my jaw, and I got light headed and clammy. They took care of me though by bringing me water, chocolate and an ice pack, and gave me plenty of time to recover. I knew I was safe and in good hands. They even called me back a little later to check up on me as they were all worried. Truly a world-class team, from the front desk staff to the nurses to the doctors and specialists. Dr Nascimento is compassionate and caring, and Kyle is very knowledgeable, encouraging and patient.|The reception staff is always so welcoming.  Dr Saranya. Varuna is a treasure. Not only is she knowledgeable, but she's extremely patient and thorough in all her explanations. She has assisted me with my new oral appliance treating my sleep apnea.|This place is the best! Jennifer is the most  knowledgeable and helpful front desk staff member of all time!! Dr. Fricton is amazing!! I had seen an extensive number of doctors and dentists before I came here for facial pain. Although I already had a diagnosis before coming here this was the 1st place that explained my condition to me at length and with care and compassion! After years of complaining of facial pain and even being diagnosed Dr. Fricton was the first doctor to touch and physically examine my head, neck and inside of my mouth. He offered solutions that hadn't been presented to me before. When I arrived for my first appointment I was crying because I was in pain , I cried through most of the appointment because of pain but when I left I was crying because I finally felt like I landed in the right spot and I felt hopeful for the first time in a long time. I felt heard and I felt seen.
They really care about patients here which should be standard, but its not. They offer treatments here that work and that are not offered by any of my other providers who are on my team to treat TN.
If your in pain, go here!!!|Dr Nascimento is great at explaining every detail to me in regards to my sleep apnea mouthguard.  The staff are all very friendly and knowledgeable too.|Very humorus and concerned staff. Everyone I encountered was willing to  converse and listen about formal and informal topics. Problem solving outlook wa terrific.|These guys have been absolutely amazing!! Between Leslie in Physical Therapy and Dr.Nascimento I can't say enough good things!! column3:
For over three decades, we at Nura Pain Clinics have dedicated ourselves to helping thousands of people reduce their chronic pain and reclaim their quality of life. Our success stems from our personalized approach to pain management—we carefully identify the exact nature of your pain and develop a customized treatment plan specifically designed for your unique needs.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our comprehensive care plans typically include:

- Medication management

- Physical therapy

- Behavioral health counseling

- Minimally invasive interventional procedures

- Advanced implantable pain control options for complex cases

What sets us apart is our team's ability to precision-target the physical generators of pain. For patients with the most challenging conditions, we offer sophisticated implantable pain control technologies that provide relief where other treatments have failed. Located in Edina, our state-of-the-art facility combines medical expertise with compassionate care to address various pain conditions. Visit our website to learn more about how we can help you manage your chronic pain and improve your overall wellness.
column9: Medical clinic|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Physiotherapy Center|Wellness center
column11: Over the past three decades, Nura has helped thousands of people reduce their chronic pain and improve their quality of life. The key to our approach centers around identifying the precise nature of your pain and building a plan of care-personalized just for you. Our plans of care typically include medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health counseling. For more complex pain conditions, our team identifies and precision-treats the physical generators of pain with a full range of minimally invasive interventional procedures, including advanced implantable pain control options for the most difficult cases.

Thank you so much Dr. Peter Schultz and Nura Team.|Where do I start? I have called Nura in regards to this Bill. I've called billing and patient advocate that was over two weeks ago I have heard nothing. I had a back stimulator put in to my back. Which on the morning of my surgery the different leads from my husband's company that were supposed to be put in my back but with my knowledge Nura changed what leads were going into my spine with out telling me or my husband which Nura discussed apparently the night before my surgery but never called me the patient to tell me that I was going to get different leads. I was supposed to get 32 leads in my back from more coverage but I ended up only getting 16 leads in my back. And as of now the stimulator is not working at the braline and it's the entire reason I had surgery. it's been 2 months. Looks like possibly I needed more coverage my husband and I both feel that it's just a way for me to have another surgery to get two more leads put in so I have 16 more contacts. Which means more $$$$$.
I mean my God I was hit by an Ambulance at 75 miles an hour and pushed 250 ft down the highway! I should not even be alive!  Now back to the bill they sent me a bill for an appointment with a PA and a nurse which was $208. Which seems sufficient then a lady came in to fit a back brace she was in the room for under 5 minutes. They charged $1,400 and that had to be adjusted as it was run through insurance and they're now wanting me to pay almost $700 for a back brace that cost between 224 and 250. I actually called the company that makes the back brace plus it's all over the internet you can buy it pretty much anywhere same model same type exactly the same one that they sell. That is ridiculous that they're trying to charge patients this much. I mean I can just buy the back brace new and just return it to Nura.
Then when you have surgery with them they give you discharge papers that say a nurse or someone will be calling you the next day to check on you I've had two surgeries with them The Intercept procedure which I had to do awake because a nurse screwed up on what medications I could take I still have the voicemail and the spinal cord stimulator. Did anyone call me the next day. No. I've had five other surgeries in my life and every surgery I have someone calls the next day. Nura doesn't and makes you think they don't care. If Nura isn't going to do it then they need to remove it from their discharge papers. Maybe start running less ads on TV and hire more doctors and more nurses so that you can handle calling people the next day I'm personally I think your doctors are overworked make decisions without asking the patient and that is what happened to me.|Efficient scheduling and clinical visit. Staff was caring and helpful. Dr Peter Schultz knew my history and had reviewed my lab findings. He suggested treatment options that gave me hope|The efficiency for making our appointment was excellent. The staff were very welcoming, helpful and took great care and concern for my 89 year old mom! Dr Studt was professional with some added humor! I feel as if we have found the answer for my mother's back pain. Highly recommend Nura Pain Clinic|I felt like a pin cushion for their profit. They seemed more concerned with making money than actually helping me.

After a brief exam, the only care that was offered to me was injections or surgical spinal implants.  No physical therapy or other non-evasive options are offered.

Had a very painful injection that caused pain that lasted several months and then minimal temporary relief.  Then abandoned by the care team when results from the treatment plan were not positive.

After doing self-care physical therapy for a year my condition has slightly improved without painful injections or surgery.  They should have suggested this type of care plan for me, but that would have not made them money.

Your response doesn't align with the experience I had.  Your response is just a standard reply to the criticism of your clinic that highlights your ability to be unresponsive.|You need a better phone system. It is so hard to get a hold of anyone there and when you do, you have to sit on the phone forever waiting to talk to someone.  We deal with this all the time. Also my wife has a pain pump which she has to go in and get filled. Why does that have to take 3 hours every time this is performed. It is a ridiculous waste of time when and there should be no reason it can not be all completed in 30 minutes. Nothing changes each time I go, it's all routine but they have to stretch out the whole visit for three hours every time.|My mom's service was crap! They said that the referral that the other place gave Nura to get shots. The 2nd time she went up there, they said they couldn't find the referral. So the lady asked "Is there a desk job at your work" rudely(according to my mom). My mom walked out frustrated, and she wasn't supposed to get the shots in the first place. She was only referred to do a spine stimulation, not shots. My mom's experience at Nura was 0/10.

column3:
Comprehensive Chronic Pain Management to Help You Reclaim Your Life

At Valley Medical and Wellness, we specialize in treating a variety of chronic pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint discomfort, headaches, and arthritis. Our dedicated team understands the challenges of living with uncontrolled chronic pain, whether from motor vehicle accidents, work injuries, or persistent pain following surgeries and physical therapy. We implement a unique multi-therapy approach that integrates:

  • Personalized medication management

  • Physical therapy solutions

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Safer alternatives like buprenorphine

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address your specific needs, focusing on improving daily function and enhancing quality of life. Our goal is to provide compassionate care that helps you manage pain effectively and sustainably. Visit our website or call us at +1 612-444-3000 to schedule a consultation at our Minneapolis location and take the first step toward effective pain relief.
column11:
Chronic Pain Management to Get Your Life Back
Do you need help managing uncontrolled chronic pain? Are you recovering from a motor vehicle accident or work injury? Are you continuing to experience pain following surgeries and physical therapy?
At Valley Medical and Wellness, we treat a variety of chronic pain conditions, including back, neck, joint, headache, and arthritis pain. Our unique multi-therapy approach integrates medication management with physical and interventional therapies to improve your daily function and quality of life. We personalize pain management strategies for each individual patient and offer medications such as buprenorphine as safer and more effective alternatives to other prescription painkillers.

column40:
So far this place is very nice.the staff was amazing and although the wait was extensive, the people made the switch to a new provider very smooth. The only downside is the bare bones waiting room with very uncomfortable chairs and the walk to the bathroom takes you to an abandoned part of the building that I believe is under construction.

The receptionist is warm and kind and friendly. The support medical staff is very professional and the PA that assisted me was very thorough and attentive in every way. I felt like I mattered there and my pain was addressed appropriately. This was my first appointment (from start to finish 2 hours and 30 min)|Very well organised; maintaining safety protocols. Detailed user-friendly step-by-step instructions.
The only drawback: one must have a smartphone to register and follow "online" instructions. Very smooth process. Staff there only facilitate the process; no input with form or queries regarding changes in registration (that is only online).
Suggestion: please add option of "ID verification" (passport number, national ID) in online form at time of registration, also with option (in reasons) for "travel purpose".  I would definitely have given FIVE stars IF the passport number and travel purpose option were already included in registration ... so they can be on printed report : essentially required by certain airlines for report to be "valid" (ID validated and "time stamped").|Shockingly fast and efficient!!! The whole thing seemed to take 2 seconds but they were highly professional and kind and in that brief time I felt cared for. I got there 3 minutes before my appointment and there were 4 cars in front of me. I left, test done, 7 minutes after my appointment time.  I felt like it was "we got this and we got you!" My results also came within 12 hours and as busy as labs are now that was also fantastic and unexpected. Superior rating! They have this thing down! Bravo to this clinic and the staff!|This testing site was very well run! We only had to wait a few minutes and the staff member was wonderful and put all of my kids at ease with the process. We drove up, gave our IDs, and he came back out and did the tests one by one for all of us in our car. We received our results back within 8 hours!|Quickest / easiest COVID testing experience I've had! Plus a very quick turnaround on your results. Emailed directions were easy to follow, but there was not any signage in the parking lot / on-site so that was a little confusing at first.|Very unprofessional. At my boyfriends very first appointment with this clinic the medical assistant showed him her breasts multiple times during his Zoom appointment. After reporting what happened to his doctor they didn't act surprised or shocked about what happened and acted like it wasn't a big deal and was just making excuses. This is absolutely disgusting that a clinic would even allow this to happen in the first place. As medical professionals you should know better!  - I know this story sounds insane and crazy but it really happened.
Edit to add: a few weeks after this incident happened we received a phone call asking for more detail on the situation. The person who called never apologized for what happened and instead accused my boyfriend of lying and making this up. Even though his doctor already admitted and confirmed it happened. Especially after them accusing us of lying I would never ever recommend anyone go to this clinic. This is disgusting behavior and I am still in shock you would allow this to happen.|Really love and appreciate the staff here. They took over my care when my previous MAT provider stopped seeing patients. They made it a very smooth and stress-free transition which ensured I didn't go without my meds.|Amazing services! I got a PCR test done. It was done right in my car without having to get out or park. The medical tech/nurse did a great job of taking the sample. She even did a nasal swab of my 6 month old and the baby slept right through it. We got our results within 7 hours! Definitely recommend this place. They email you your results which is super convenient.

Very satisfied!|Dr. Wolff was respectful and caring and answered all my questions about my procedure, etc.|Dr. Wolff made me feel comfortable through a procedure that I had a lot of anxiety about and that is much appreciated.|They need to provide a full emergency # on their sheet after being discharged. Our dedicated team specializes in helping individuals experiencing both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. With our multidisciplinary approach, we address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain management.

Our Comprehensive Services Include:

We understand that living with pain can significantly impact quality of life, which is why we work closely with each patient to develop effective treatment strategies. column38: Laurie Maartenies-Larmore|Nicole|Not Applicable|Nikki|Jody Parkman|Ericka G|Kelly Murphy|Theresa Claugherty
column40:
I have been a  client of this clinic  for over 15 years. Great service and caring about my issues and quality of life. Highly recommend.  Wait is worth it. Be serious about your expectations and actively participate to maximize your outcome. I will never be pain free but I am able to live my life the best I can. They care.|I have been a patient of this clinic for over 6 years. I had received great care from various physicians until they switched me to Weiya Ouyang, PA. She will not listen to your concerns, she will change your treatment plan and when you try to bring up how it has had a significant impact on your life, it doesn't matter. I asked the clinic to change physicians, but due to short staff, they wouldn't let me. I will not be returning to this clinic and called another clinic immediately to be seen.|All I can do is reiterate a lot of the reviews I'm seeing here. Since Dr Hess left I have been through countless employees, and I call them employees because none of them seem to be real doctors. When I did occasionally get one that seemed decent they were gone within a couple months. I see these people working at other clinics now so something must be scaring them off. The people I'm being seen by there all like to bad mouth their bosses (management). This gives me a very insecure feeling. I'm only going there to get my meds refilled which should be fairly simple but they complicate this and constantly try to change things around for me. I guess none of them ever heard the old saying that if it's not broken don't try to fix it. I have been going there every two to three months for over 5 years and now they just told me that management says that I need to be seen every month. For what? To talk about the nice weather? This almost seems like some type of an insurance scam to get more money from my insurance provider. There's absolutely no reason that I need to go there monthly to get a prescription filled. All that accomplishes is wasting my time, wasting the insurance companies money and forcing me to pay more co-pays. The last time I was there the nurse told me the doctor will be right with me as he is finishing up some injections with another patient. I thought to myself, that poor person. I wouldn't let these people draw blood from my finger let alone stick a needle in my back. All the doctors since Dr Hess been arrogant and plain rude. I was even told by one that if I didn't like how they were doing things then he will reduce my meds. Literally threatening me. As with any company you always see good and bad reviews but I'm wondering about the good reviews I'm seeing here for this place. No offense but are these people actually cognitive and aware of what's going on around them? I have dreaded going to this place for years now but kept going because it was only every 3 months and I could handle it. But now, contemplating going there every month has driven me to start looking for a new clinic and I hope to be out of there as soon as possible. To be honest, I feel that The person I'm seeing currently is just straight out lying to me and I really don't need to be going there every month. I think he just changed it to be an ass. I won't name names because I can't verify any of this but my instincts have always served me well my entire life and they are telling me now to move on. Normally I don't write such a long review but I sincerely feel that people need to know the truth about this place. If you are considering going to this facility I strongly recommend that you do your homework first. I mean think about it, how often do you see 3.0 reviews here. I normally don't even watch movies with less than a 4.0 rating.|United Pain Clinic should not be in business! the doctors there have no bedside manner, they place judgement right away! Don't give you a chance to be seen, heard or even feel worth their time! Save yourself the time, find another provider. Do your research , on the clinic, provider , ask a lot of questions. The thing I look at first are the reviews, they speak volumes. People who have gone through the experience know what they are talking about! United pain clinic is NOT a good place. Find another provider|I have been going to this clinic since 2012, Dr. Hess was my provider.. I adored him.. he listened to me. He tried to help in any way he could. He retired a couple years back, since then I have been through 5 providers at this clinic.. the 2 that I absolutely started to trust, and feel comfortable with has now left.. and I can tell you why.. you wanna know how I know? Because they told me why they were leaving
Having to stay until 7-8pm at night doing charting and whatever they as Dr's do! They were very unhappy working at the clinic!
The politics in the clinic!
The staff gossip about us as we're there, yes that happened as I was walking out the other day from appointment. I heard them!
So.. when the last one left I asked for his recommendation, so I took their recommendation and now that one is complaining about staying late..
I have never in the past 12 years EVER missed an appointment.
Had a bad UA
Never had a miss count la on my pain meds count never over or short!
I do not Dr. shop, I do not get scripts from anywhere else ( pain meds)
Then let's talk about the medication.. yup you guessed it! They want to keep cutting back on my meds.. I am at the bottom of what my pain level can go.. I hurt 24/7 I have CRPS, a torn root cuff I need a complete shoulder replacement,
I have arthritis that has spread from arm/shoulder to neck, and because of my CRPS no surgeon will touch me for fear of my CRPS spreading further!
I went down a lot in meds so I explained to the new provider of all the medication that I weened down/off of.  You know what she said!?
I will tell you!
1) I was told the clinic keeps getting red flagged for the amount of pain meds that they prescribe
2) She told me that the " upper management " is telling all providers to let patients know this.. in other words ( guilt) the patients for needing pain medication and pain management! To make the clinic look better!
3) and then she said, patients can " appeal" the decision if they keep getting meds cut back/off
I have never felt so low as I did when I left the clinic the other day, I cried all the way home.. why do they call themselves a " pain center", if they're not going to help their patients?
Why guilt us in taking away our medication to make them look better?
I have no idea what to do, the clinic needs new management or some type of re branding because this is not right for us pain patients that do not use or abuse our medication.|So disappointed in this facility. Had to change Dr's again for the 5th time because they all have left & the new one I got treated me horribly. Took it upon herself to ween me down when I said no. Been suffering ever since, "Dr said your brain will take over the pain" you should be ashamed of yourselves.  No one should suffer in pain & this clinic lost all there caring Dr's. I have suffered in pain for 35yrs. Even my primary Dr is appalled. This clinic has lost all my respect & me as a patient! My primary care said he won't let me suffer in pain. I use to like United pain clinic, but they do not listen to the patient. They don't care like they use to & it's a shame. I will be reaching out to the medical board and the ombudsman to file a complaint.|This office constantly has staff changes. The staff themselves complain they have staff leaving and it's hard even see a real Dr. They're always scheduling me to Physician's Assistants who can only do so much. They canceled my last appointment the morning of due to the provider being out due to being sick. Instead of trying to help me with my problem or find a solution she told me 3 times to go somewhere else and get a second opinion after being at that clinic for about 10 years.|I've been dealing with chronic pain for decades and I haven't been able to seriously find relief until I went here. The staff are so nice and friendly and my Doctor is very caring and doesn't over prescribe anything. They go by the book and make you as comfortable as can be when receiving any injections. I absolutely love them!!! If you're suffering from any chronic pain degenerative disorders they have everything to ease the pain. I would highly recommend this clinic for anyone suffering.

Comprehensive Pain Management in Minneapolis

At The Pain Relief Centers, we are committed to improving the quality of life for our patients. Our dedicated pain management team focuses on reducing your pain through a personalized approach that includes:

  • Physical rehabilitation programs

  • Active therapeutic interventions

  • Specialized injection treatments

  • Pharmaceutical medical management

We understand that pain is not a specific disease—it cannot be easily seen or measured. The doctors at The Pain Relief Center recognize that each patient's situation is unique and requires individual attention. Our goal is to help our patients take control of their pain and regain an active, normal lifestyle. Located in the heart of Minneapolis, our facility provides accessible care for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. If you're living with pain, contact The Pain Relief Centers where we offer FREE medical consultations. We accept cash payments and auto insurance. Call us today at +1 612-827-7246 to schedule your appointment.

column3:
Expert Pain Management Physician with 25+ Years of Experience

At Twin Cities Pain Clinic, Dr. Andrew Will brings his third-generation physician heritage and extensive expertise to every patient interaction. As a specialized expert in pain management with over 25 years of experience, we're proud of Dr. Will's comprehensive education from the University of Minnesota and his residency completion at the Medical College of Wisconsin. We offer a complete spectrum of advanced pain management solutions including:

- Spinal cord stimulation

- Pain pump implants

- Therapeutic injections

- Medication management

- Physical therapy recommendations

Dr. Will is recognized as one of the nation's foremost authorities on neurostimulation therapies, allowing us to provide cutting-edge treatments for both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team works collaboratively with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life and restore function. Learn more about Dr. Will's approach to comprehensive pain management by visiting our professional profile page.

Located at 7235 Ohms Ln in Edina, MN, we welcome patients seeking relief from persistent pain conditions. Call us at (952) 841-2345 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Dr. Andrew Will is a third generation physician hailing from Bemidji, MN with over 25 years of experience practicing medicine.

He earned his doctorate degree from the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities, and completed his residency at the Medical College of Wisconsin in Milwaukee.

Dr. Will is a specialized expert in the field of pain management. He is highly skilled in virtually all forms of treatment for acute and chronic pain, and is one of the nation's foremost authorities on neurostimulation therapies.

With a variety of treatment options including spinal cord stimulation, pain pump implants, injections, medication management and physical therapy, Dr. Will and his team are dedicated to improving the quality of life for every patient.

Dear Dr. Andrew Will (PART 4)

if you would be so kind to spare barely over eight minutes of your time viewing this video which is the way that I live most of the time. I have found that many medical providers are not familiar with how severe these types of diseases and this disease specifically can be considering it has caused people their lives  I sent this video to the Triage email, which was given to me by one of your employees who asked me to send some information there that's how I got the triage email which I no longer use  my advocate took the time to print out all of the information regarding this extremely life altering disease in which anyone who suffers from will go through an extreme grieving process as there is so much loss involved:: Loss of consortium, loss of physical function, constant debilitating, pain in any part or all parts of your body, feeling corpse like after waking up and never ever experiencing a restorative nights sleep for years and decades. Very often, Medical providers and even clerical workers at medical clinics will doubt the validity of your illness and the extent of your disability and inability to comfortably and effectively make trips to doctors appointments and back. They do not realize that the so-called post exertional Malays, which is very very real cannot someone down simply from them sitting upright or watching a funny movie and laughing or trying to pay a bill online or even talking on the phone with your therapist, it is absolutely impossible to understand and tell you yourself experience it which I would never ever wish on anyone as your life as you know it has ended and you do not know and no one can tell you if you will ever get any of it back the way it used to be

Dear Dr. Andrew Will,
Pain management Nurse Bethanie Miller referred me to an NON TCPC pain clinic doctor to ask him to write my pain medication prescriptions. I am on an PAIN CONTRACT WITH TCPC. TCPC Owner Dr. Will, is this what is professional and ethical or the complete opposite? Please respond to me.
CNP Bethanie Miller  had no issues whatsoever suggesting and scheduling me immediately for multiple treatments and  surgical procedures but is now unwilling to allow me the life saving medications I need to have some quality of life and to even be able to go to your surgery center to have the surgical procedures done.
During my last two visits my new pain management provider, Nurse Bethanie Miller, advised me without any testing whatsoever that my "receptors" are not functioning properly and decided without any input from me or my patient advocate that she will start tapering my pain medications down. I am extremely debilitated by pain and extreme exhaustion resulting from multiple chronic pain syndromes and diseases that Twin Cities Pain Clinic have diagnosed me with including fibromyalgia, myofascial pain syndrome, TMJ / TMD, chronic tension and migraine headaches persisting daily for 15+ years, allodynia, spondylosis with myelopathy, osteoarthritis and ME/CFS. I had my advocate drive some information to CNP Bethanie Miller along with a video which explains the unbearable pain I suffer from. Although this information was sent and she claimed to have reviewed the information and watched the video she insists that my "receptors" are not functioning properly and told me that she plans to cut my pain medication down by nearly 1/2.  I have given her time to explain her theory and made a point to explain to her that medically and professionally this is simply a theory. There is no proof whatsoever that this is what is actually happening. No testing at all has been done to test my "receptors" and I patiently and politely explained to CNP B. MILLER  that the relief I experience from my medically necessary prescription medications can bring me from a level 8-9 pain down to a level 1-2 pain. I went on to tell her that if my receptors, as she says, are not working correctly,  I wonder how I am  experiencing such immense  pain relief taking my medication as prescribed.

I would so greatly appreciate if you would please take a few moments at your convenience to reach out to my care taker and I. We will be hopeful to hear from you in the near future. You may call, text, email at your convenience 24/7. Messages are always fine as well, although  we hope to speak with you in person (phone )  and think that would be most convenient and helpful to resolve this issue .

THANK YOU DOCTOR WILL!
Very Warmest Regards,
TSB and JSB|After months of pain, multiple injections and a botched experience from another physician, I changed course altogether.  I lucked upon Dr. Will at Twin Cities Pain.  After the first appointment I knew that I had found something. Dr Will wasn't counting the clock and rushing through the interview...he actually listened.  We went through my entire history, discussed what had worked, and what had failed. Together, we developed a plan and we put it in motion.

Now, several weeks into the treatment plan, the personal service has not faltered.  I am confident more than ever that my days of debilitating back pain are soon to be gone (or at least manageable).

These folks rock!|Dear Dr. Andrew Will (PART 3)
ME/CFS is a biological illness that affects many body parts. It causes severe fatigue not improved by rest, problems thinking and sleeping, dizziness, pain, and many other symptoms.

People with ME/CFS may not look sick but can't do their normal activities. ME/CFS may get worse after they do any activity -- physical or mental. This symptom is called post-exertional malaise (PEM). After they exert themselves, they may need to stay in bed for an extended time. About 1 in 4 people with ME/CFS are confined to bed at some point in their illness.

Did you know?
It's estimated that between 836,000 and 3.3 million people in the United States suffer from ME/CFS. More than 9 in 10 people with ME/CFS have not been diagnosed by a doctor. ME/CFS costs the U.S. economy about $18 to $51 billion annually in medical costs and lost income.
It is difficult to diagnose because there is no specific test for ME/CFS. One reason that people with ME/CFS have not been diagnosed may be limited access to healthcare. Another reason may be a lack of healthcare providers who know about ME/CFS and how to recognize it.

Anyone can get ME/CFS. It doesn't matter what age, gender or ethnicity they are. However, some groups are more affected than others.

Signs and symptoms
People with ME/CFS are not able to function the same way they did before they became ill. They may not always be able to do daily tasks like showering or cooking a meal.

ME/CFS often makes it hard to keep a job, go to school, and take part in family and social life. ME/CFS can last for years and sometimes leads to serious disability.

ME/CFS is most common in people in middle age but also affects kids, teens and elderly people. Among adults, women are affected more often than men. Among children, teens are more affected than younger kids.

People who are white are diagnosed more often than other races and ethnicities. But many people with ME/CFS have not been diagnosed, especially among people from racial and ethnic minority groups.

Diagnosis
Symptoms of ME/CFS may appear similar to many other illnesses. There is no test to confirm ME/CFS. This makes it difficult to diagnose. The illness can also be unpredictable. Symptoms may come and go, or there may be changes in how severe symptoms are over time.

A doctor should be able to distinguish ME/CFS from other illnesses by doing a thorough medical exam. This includes asking many questions about the patient's health history and current illness. They should also ask about how often symptoms occur, how bad they are, and how long they have lasted. It is also important for doctors to talk with patients about how the symptoms affect their lives.

Treatment and recovery
There is no cure or approved treatment for ME/CFS. But some symptoms can be treated or managed. Treating these symptoms might provide relief for some people with ME/CFS but not others. Other strategies, like learning new ways to manage activity, can also help.

People with ME/CFS, their families, and healthcare providers need to work together to decide which symptom causes the most problems. This should be treated first after discussing possible benefits and harms of any treatment plans, including medicines and other therapies.

Healthcare providers need to support their patients' families as they come to understand how to live with this illness. Providers and families should remember that this process is likely to be hard on people with ME/CFS.

Resources
ME/CFS handout with 3 symptoms
Patient Toolkit
ME/CFS educational tools to help patients and their families manage their healthcare visits.
MAY 13, 2024
USA map multicultural group of young people integration - stock photo
Living with ME/CFS
Patients and their families need support as they come to understand how to live with ME/CFS.

As a board-certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physician with additional board-certifications from the American Board of Anesthesiology (ABA), the American Board of Interventional Pain Physicians (ABIPP), and the American Board of Pain Medicine (ABPM), we offer specialized treatment for chronic and acute pain conditions. Our practice focuses on:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

Located in St. Louis Park, our team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. For specialized pain management from a triple board-certified physician, contact Minnesota Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation at +1 952-251-0609 or visit our office at 5775 Wayzata Blvd #190, St Louis Park, MN 55416.

The pain is gone and the procedure was easier than a dentist visit. You should consider this team for your pain management or at least another consultation. I was/am extremely happy with my results.|My husband, a severe burn victim survivor of more than 43 years,  waited 4 months for an appointment with Burton, after his other pain doctor left this same clinic unexpectedly and without transitioning my husbands care to a new doctor. Dr. Burton then rescheduled and delayed our first appointment with her by an additional month to accommodate our request for a longer appointment time given my husbands unique injuries and the complex changes to his health. She was 20 minutes late to the appointment and when my husband and I tried to discuss his medication she stated no changes would be made because it was our first appt with her. When we tried to discuss it further she abruptly ended the appt 5 minutes in and left us waiting for her return for over 40 minutes. An administrator then came to the exam room we were waiting in and stated the doctor was not returning and had security escort us off the premises as we begged for help.  This pain clinic has repeatedly refused care for my husband. The lack of compassion and empathy is astounding, a doctor should not be working in a pain clinic if they do not have an understanding of how chronic pain impacts a humans overall quality of life.  I would discourage anyone patient needing to be an active participant in their care from seeking help here. There is absolutely nothing caring about this clinic or this doctor. Absolutely terrible experience, has to be a scam. We paid 2 months at $1800 extra Cobra Insurance to keep our deductible already paid when we came here and they were in network. They did six block injections and then nerve ablations burning on three. Insurance came back saying it was an unproven procedure and would not pay it and said I did not have to pay it. Call the billing person here and they said they have seen this before and no I would not have to pay it. So why 3 months later are they still trying to get $10,000 out of me. That procedure caused me new excruciating pain that I still get sharp pain in my neck 4 months later. I screamed so bad on the table with a needle in my neck that I scared a lady down in the waiting room. They don't tell you that it can cause new and more pain than what your trying to get help for. I'm 63 years old and in chronic back pain. What a way to treat a person.
Minus 5 stars!|If I could give zero stars, I would. I waited for over an hour and a half in the waiting room. The doctor saw me for 15 minutes and basically just explained the procedure for a knee injection. All information that could've been on the website. Instead, I wasted 2.5 hours with the 30 min. drive to Edina. But, he got $210 from my insurance company for that 15-minute conversation! Nice scam they've got going on there.|Before the procedures I had very bad pain in my hip and knee joints. The pains were so strong that I could not go down or up the stairs because my legs would not bend. At night my hip joints ached. My doctors told me that the only way out was surgery. Dr. Starchook offered me a less drastic option -- adding stem cells to the problem sites. I agreed gladly. I received two first shots in November 2017 (one to the knee and the second to the hip). After a week the pain improved and I began to walk more easily and was more mobile than before the procedure. A month later in December I received two more shots in my hip and knee as well. A month after the second procedures, the acute pain was gone, but I still could not move quickly. I felt a full recovery only after three months. Last summer, I worked very hard physically, carrying heavy loads while gardening without any problems. This is the second year and I feel like I was born again. I lost weight, feel younger, even look younger than my peers. I want to thank the doctor and his staff for helping me so much, wishing them good luck in treating suffering people! Thank you!|I am 60 years old.  I found Dr Starchook in January while doing an internet search to find resources to help relieve my osteoarthritis knee pain - it was becoming very difficult to walk and exercise because of the severe pain in both of my knees.  After my initial consult with Dr Starchook, I was immediately impressed by his knowledge, his years of experience, his prestigious awards for being chosen MN Doctor of the year and his kind caring honest concern for his patients.

So... January 25 2018 I had my first stem cell procedure completed on my left knee and scheduled my right knee for 6 weeks later.  It was amazing!  After a few weeks, the pain started to diminish in my left knee and every week I would notice a difference in the level of pain from my right knee.  I was improving every week!!  Yesterday I had my right knee injected and I am so happy with my results!!

I am thrilled and beyond grateful to the whole staff at Twin Cities Pain Management that I chose to have the stem cell procedure before I was forced to have a surgical operation for a knee replacement!  This was truly a blessing for me to have found Dr Starchook!|I had the bone marrow harvesting stem cell therapy on my foot on 4/13/18 after a severe wound to my heel and another wound in the middle of my foot from chronic neuropathy that i was seeing a vascular podiatrist since june of 2017. i couldn't put any weight on it as i had a rolling knee scooter and the wound would open again and again. it's 5/4/18 and since the stem cell procedure it really is amazing that my foot looks like a normal foot again from how much the skin healed in 3 weeks. I've been a patient of Dr. Starchook for around 2 years now and he's a great Dr. and has a wonderful staff. i'm really excited i'm already putting some weight on it. i'm optimistic about my foot now when not too many months ago losing my foot all together if it would not heal and i'm only 39 years old.

an update on my stem cell therapy on my left heel, it has remained closed since the april 2018 procedure. i then had a similar problem with my right heel and a problem with my right big toe, the photos are graphic but the results have been amazing, the befores are late october 2018, the procedure was around thanksgiving and the afters are january. i can bear weight on my foot again this is incredible.|I was very pleased with my experience at Twin Cities Pain Managment. Dr. Starchook and his staff were extremely professional and caring. Had having years of pain in my lower back, it was a relief knowing that I had options and the doctor took the time with me explaining all of my options and any expectations. I would highly recommend anyone that is suffering with pain to visit Twin Cities Pain Management and know there is help out there for you. I wouldn't go anywhere else!|I had 3 injections done between my back and hip - fantastic results. It feels like some of it is getting even better with time. Very friendly and helpful staff.|Good care and very helpful when explaining the procedure to me. I do not know why my lower back hurt so much more 5 days after the PRP, butt I am certain they will return my call with an answer.

column40:
Everyone working at this office treats their patients with thoughtful ness and kindness! The Dr works diligently to figure out each patient's specific health situation and what best treatment fits his needs!|I am very thankful for this niche practice, that specializes in helping clients with disc issues. I knew I had back issues and never realized there was this kind of specialist until I met with Dr. Antoine. There services are top notch and especially care about there clients! You are not a number, you are a patient at this practice. I am so very thankful for what they do. I feel so much better after 4 weeks of therapy! I highly recommend them. Thank you!|I have a list of issues I'm dealing with due to some very serious injuries in my early 20s. I've broken 10 vertebrates in my back and have 19 rods in my back that still to this day cause pain and discomfort. Overall I was progressing pretty well since my car accident but always lived with consistent pain, migraines, and nerve pain. It was expected with the type of injuries I had sustained to my back and shoulders but just about 4 months ago in January 2022 I had to face yet another difficult physical challenge that completely took me out of just about everything from work to even the most minimal tasks. I had nerve pain so bad down my legs I barely could walk and my feet would go numb from sitting even 5-10 minutes. I dealt with it for about a month of misery before realizing something serious was going on and I needed to get treatment or surgery. I came across Select Health while doing research and figured I'd give it a chance. I appreciated the honesty and transparency in my first meeting and after getting an MRI I found out I had degenerating discs(@27 years old) and 3 of which were herniated/torn/bulging to go along with my 10 broken vertebrates. I'm not going to sit and tell you that I'm 100% better after 2 months of treatment at select health and I probably never will be 100% with the injuries I have. But these 2 Doctors have been amazing to work with and the treatment they do here is truly life changing. I've been feeling some great progress since I started and it only seems like every week gets a little better. You can't come in expecting to be 100% healed but you can expect to see some great progress and healing throughout your
time here! Both of the doctors are super genuine and great to work with, and the technology they're using is awesome(I'd buy this technology myself if I could afford it hah) I look back on how miserable I was in February compared to where I'm at now and it's truly a blessing for me to see how far I've come. I'm very thankful for these guys and will most likely continue a maintenance plan on my back and neck/shoulders to help the healing process because I see the value at Select health! Last thing unrelated to my disc issues, I suffered from debilitating migraines for about 5 years and when a migraine hits I wanna cry it's so hard to deal with, I noticed since coming here I have NOT gotten a migraine which is officially the longest stretch( 70 total days) in 5 years I have gone without getting a migraine. For someone who was getting them once every other week sometimes multiple in one week, that in itself made coming here worth it. Hopefully this stretch continues and I only see more healing in my lower back and neck as well. If you're on the fence about coming here just do it!!! I don't think you'll regret it. Thank you Dr James and Jamy! Love you both and appreciate you guys more than you know!|I've had severe lower back and neck pain for over 15 years, that had gotten progressively worse as time went on. I spent thousands of dollars and tried various treatments suggested by different doctors to no avail, and no one was able to help me until I came to Asuda Health. Not only did they help alleviate the symptoms and pain for both  my neck and back, but a special blood test was ordered for me because I wasn't feeling well and they was discovered that I am gluten intolerant and am suffering from Leaky Gut condition. I have modified my diet already and feel so much better than before and have a lot more energy. It was money well spent and I am so grateful to both Dr. James and Dr. Antoine for their care in making me healthier. I haven't felt this good in years.|After being in the worst pain of my life, I came to the Disc Institute after a doctor's appointment where I was told that surgery was my only option for relief. After my MRI and consultation with Dr. Antoine, and realizing I had a severely herniated disc with other disc issues, I decided to enter a 12-week program and I've very happy to say I'm 90% recovered and still improving. The staff is very friendly, and each treatment is enjoyable. It took about 4 weeks for me to start seeing improvement, but I'm thrilled that I avoided back surgery!|I am beyond thankful for Dr. Jamy and his team.  I choose Select Health in 2019 as an alternative to having surgery for a herniated disc that was causing extremely painful sciatic nerve pain and numbness in my lower leg and foot.   I wasn't able to sleep, sit, drive, or walk long distances without extreme pain.    As a mom of two young children this injury was affecting me physically and mentally since I wasn't able to participate in our family activities.  After 6 weeks at Select Health I was 75% better.  After completing 3 months of therapy I was completely out of pain.  Recently, I had a flare up and returned to Select Health.  I have experience the same healing.  After 2 months I am completely pain free and have returned to all my normal activities.  I highly recommend giving Select Health a chance. It has been life changing for me and I am so thankful for this alternative to surgery!|I came to Select Health of Edina after suffering for three years with severe neuropathy, sciatica, and spinal stenosis resulting from a bulging disk in my lower back. The chronic, painful journey took me through two spine clinics, three physical therapists, two steroid injections, and ridiculously high doses of gabapentin and nsaids.
I was so very fortunate to find Dr. Antoine and his associates at Select Health. I was a perfect candidate for the state-of-the-art Sanexes electric cell signaling, Lumbar decompression, and cold laser treatments. I began to feel relief immediately, knowing my issues were being treated at the source. After only two months, I have achieved 80% improvement in both back and nerve pain.
At Select Health of Edina, the treatments are scientifically proven and real. If you are looking for the end of your journey to find true relief and healing, Select Health of Edina is the final destination.|I was desperate for help for my polysensory neuropathy and balance issues. I've been sick for the last four years and I've tried numerous  integrative therapies but nothing seemed to work until I came to Select Health! In just 8 weeks of treatments I've noticed more changes than I have in the last four years and I know it's just the beginning but I'm so thankful for this team. It's a miracle I stumbled upon their  page and decided to give them a try. They will listen and give you their honest opinion if they think they can help you or not! Select Health is truly God sent and i am truly thankful!

column38: Joseph Yetman (YETI)|The Earth Stars|Kris Berquist|Paul Gentilini|Ken Yokanovich|Kellie Kondziela|Michelle S|Matthew Sledd
column40:
This is a very vulnerable review, so I ask kindly, treat it with some empathy and respect. I think all pain patients can agree that there is a component of passive suicidal ideation that exists in our daily lives for the sheer fact that we are in so much pain, constantly. A doctor I trust very much referred me to this clinic. I was assigned to Meatta Gaypia upon getting past the initial referral paperwork. I was told they had all kinds of modalities that I've never even tried or heard about, I was sold a vision. I didn't buy it entirely, but I was thrilled at the prospect of my pain going from a 9/10 to a 7/10. I would take any improvement and participate in whatever they asked of me. I'd already tried the most extreme options at other pain clinics, like a pain pump and a spinal cord stimulator. I was sold hope, as long as I held up my end of the deal. I've since been a patient with her for over a year and I'm discouraged to report that the only thing we've accomplished is to put me on Emgality. Due to difficulties with my insurance and the lack of followthrough with the clinic, I got to take one dose. In over 13 months. For a medication I didn't even request, one that doesn't address the reason I went there in the first place, thoracic pain. I had monthly appointments with her in addition to other visits to pain psychology and PT (which I'd already been in for years. They took me from a PT guy I loved to a different system that was terrible.) In all that time, the only thing Meatta Gaypia did besides that, was to talk about adjusting my gabapentin and lyrica. She didn't even glance at my chart to see I've already been maxed out on them for many years. Yet, she still brings up messing with my lyrica and gabapentin at every visit. She just goes around in circles and makes lots of excuses. She has no personal accountability and is downright rude. Her bedside manner is nonexistent. I don't want her to kiss my ass, just treat me with the same dignity as we'd want for ourselves or any other human. In the end, she referred me to another person in the clinic and told me that's what they do there, referrals for other things at other clinics, like spinal injections. Where are all these homeopathic and groundbreaking treatments they said they could offer? I like the support staff at the clinic though, they seem to work very hard. I feel like I wasted a year and some change on Meatta as a doctor, I'm very disenfranchised right now. I have only said this about one other doctor in my life, who eventually was charged with a crime. ::Meatta should not be practicing medicine:: She's dangerous to people, straight up. She will waste your time, bait you into arguments, and push you closer to the edge. People's lives are in her hands and she thinks nothing of it. At our last appointment she said she never realized I had passive suicidal ideations everyday. I have it in my notes from every single session and the paperwork I submitted to them, that I felt this way. Over a year telling her about these ideations and how they relate to pain, and nothing. It was so discouraging and underwhelming to know that she's glossed over those details for quite some time. This woman does not care whether people live or die. I realize that's harsh, but it's true. She needs to be in a different position where she is not facing the general public, like a clinical pharmacist at a compounding lab, not working with people. Could not be more disappointed with my experience. I do have recordings and I'm happy to share them with anyone. I'd release my rights as quick as you can sign up for a streaming service. For those in pain, I would try a different doctor. The jury is out on this clinic as a whole, but I would certainly avoid ending up in her care, if I were you.|The pain clinic has really helped me on my journey and deal with chronic pain. The renovations are nice. If you are dealing with chronic this is a great place to check out.

You may need a referral, but I've had a great experience here.|The doctor I worked with was the nicest and most understanding doctor I've worked with after 5 back surgeries and 3 hand surgeries she really helped me understand the pain I deal with everyday Neyata is awsome I probably spelled it wrong|I would actually give a minus 5-star rating if possible.  My girlfriend, who is in incredible pain constantly from a major stroke, wasted her time here with numerous visits over a long period only to not have her pain reduced one iota.  We explained to Dr. Ferron and Dr. Clavelle that her pain was an even bigger contributor to her poor quality of life than the fact that her left arm and leg are paralyzed and she has to reside in assisted living.  They kept making adjustments to her meds.  They refused to give her a PRN for the Norco that had worked for her, and instead kept playing around with adjusting her Lyrica and Gabapentin to absolutely no avail.  When we finally complained that there had no improvements and zero results from their treatments, they pushed her off to another facility.  WASTE OF TIME!!  My girlfriend missed or cut short many family outings and holidays due to their ineffective treatment, and now she has to start all over|Pain is a very VERY complex condition to "treat" and there is a LOT of money to be made by pharmaceutical companies and orthopedic centers. If you are looking for a quick "fix," injection, or procedure that will make you feel better; this is probably not the place for you.

Do yourself a favor and read The Way Out by Alan Gordon and Alon Ziv.

I first met Georgia as a pain psychologist (private practice) in 2009 after being hit by an oncoming car on while riding my bicycle. It was the suggestion after hundreds of appointments, injections, chiropractic care, and physical therapy. I distinctly remember scoffing at the idea of "welcoming the pain"

Fast forward 10+ years and hundreds of additional appointments for more MRIs, injections, medications, and physical therapy all attempting to help with multiple herniated disks. Neuropathy, burning, uncontrolled twitching, intense pain, and lack of sleep... I was at the point of giving up when I reached out to Georgia in an act of desperation and learned about Riverway Pain Clinic.

Since re-engaging with Dr. Ferron, Georgia Panopulous, Dr Clavel, and recommended physical therapy with Grant Kaper I finally feel like I have a good pain management plan. It has been hard work, takes daily effort, and I feel better than I have in YEARS.|The reviews speak volumes. There are some positive ones, I wish that would have been my experience. Dr. Meatta has no business being a "pain management" Dr. Her bedside manner is condesending, lacks care and any kind of compassion. Dr. Ferron is incredibly educated and can be valuable to understand what the use of pain medication can do and does to your body currently and long term. She should be a professor not a Dr. The program makes sense and I was on board and still am,just not at this Clinic. I cried most times leaving my appointments. I felt no concern for how I was adjusting to the reduction in medications I have been taking for 13+ years. She too was condesending, threatening and I felt like she was holding my meds over my head if I didn't do exactly what she said. Programs I couldn't afford, that I made perfectly clear but she didn't care. Continued to try to force me to do them all. I felt like a statistic not a 60 year old women looking to establish new care after moving to Minnesota from Texas. The ladies at the front desk are professional and caring.|Helped me understand my pain. I work with Dr. Ferron, Georgia & Scott and they took different approaches to helping me. I have seen countless doctors & physical therapist over the last 10 years (and I'm only 36!) and I refused to accept the "this is your life now, nothing can be done" response I received from other clinics. Dr. Ferron tried medications I have never tried before, and also gave me a diagnosis, something I had been looking for, for so long. This was the most relief I have ever found. Scott also was able to teach me stretches that have never been offered up to me before and ones that cater to my specific limitations and/or strengths, and Georgia is extremely empathetic, kind, caring and helpful, focusing on the individual instead of a cookie cutter regimen. The staff listened and saw me as a person and not just another patient, understanding that pain affects people differently and treatments aren't a one size fits all and I think that helped them find a treatment plan tailored to me, and they still keep trying to help me improve. I am not 100% pain free, but they have been able to give me the most relief that I have been able to find, and they keep working on trying to help me get even better. I definitely recommend the clinic if you have tried others without any progress.|Worthless place. Staff doesn't know how to do their jobs. Therapist Google stretches and does not have the proper equipment. The Dr. Will order test and then never go over them with you. When the test results come in the staff can't find them when they are on their own system. This is an all in 1 way to get as much money from you as possible while providing no positive results. I would not recommend this place for your dog.
