column2: M Health Fairview Pain Clinic - Fulton
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

At M Health Fairview Pain Clinic, we understand that chronic pain can significantly interfere with your daily life. Our multidisciplinary team combines expertise from anesthesiology and physical medicine to provide personalized pain management solutions. We bring together pain physicians, psychologists, pharmacists, physical therapists, and nurse practitioners who specialize in helping patients regain maximum function and improve quality of life.

Our approach focuses on non-opioid treatments and the latest advances in pain management. We offer:

  • Innovative pain reduction techniques

  • Comprehensive treatment plans

  • Psychological support for pain management

  • Physical therapy interventions

  • Medication management with a focus on safety

Located at 909 Fulton St SE on the 4th floor in Minneapolis, our clinic provides exceptional patient comfort with valet parking, wheelchair accessibility, and concierge assistance. We're committed to helping you navigate your chronic pain journey with dignity and effectiveness. Learn more about our services at M Health Fairview Pain Management Services or call us at +1 612-273-5400 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Chronic pain often persists in spite of our best treatments. However, if you have chronic pain that is interfering with your daily life, our pain management specialists can help you manage that pain to regain maximum function. The Pain Clinic is a combined initiative between anesthesiology and physical medicine and rehabilitation that includes pain physicians, psychologists, pharmacists, physical therapists and nurse practitioners who have expertise in pain management. Our convenient clinic location includes valet parking, wheelchairs at the door and a concierge to assist patients and visitors.

We provide the latest treatment advances to help reduce or alleviate your pain in the safest manner possible with a focus on non-opioid treatments.
column38: Betty Vanderhooven-SchmaaSchmaa|Gigi Schmidt|Nancy Harms|Tim Davis|Carol Blunt|Sparky1pants|Anku G|Qiyue Zhang
column40:
Remember it's chronic pain that led to that UNITED CEO losing his life.

Dr Erickson is an interesting chap. He cares and is willing to try just about anything for relief, but his tendency to "prescribe" things that aren't covered by insurance is inconsiderate. Everything from OTC vitamins to Ketamine.
I'd not have one dollar left for food if I did everything he suggested. If you're tired of opioids, Dr Erickson is your guy.
The front desk staff, nurses and counselors are kind caring ppl. Just be honest and the ppl here will get you thru.
This isn't your average run of the mill pain clinic.|the day we sold our souls to Fairview is the day we lost a point for being tops in medical field. Pain clinic should be banned especially the doctors that work there. My mother had an awful time due to some issues with pain to the point they wouldn't allow her to find a better option. Instead of doing what's right by the human the doctor does right by the dollar amount which too me is a violation of the oath they take to do no harm. Also giving bad or poor care. We will not be allowing her to treated by fairview health systems. Run as fast you can don't come to them for help run!|Communication couldn't be worse. When in pain, wasting a patient's time & energy repeating the same information in e-check in, with nurse, then intern, then doctor is not helpful. They all seemed unaware of history and records. So far no relief from pain has been provided.
Doctor seemed clueless so made a referral to pain psychologist which I did not do. My pain was completely relieved with twisting in yoga which aligned my ribs.|Just wanted to say a few kind words for the u of m Pain Clinic

Dr. Banik is wondering physician who gets his patients. He takes the time necessary to hear you out.
He also explains things in detail so you can better understand.
I would recommend this clinic to family and friends.

Please continue the wonderful work, you have all done as a team...|So grateful to be referred to Dr. Vashuda Goel at the Pain Clinic at 909 Fulton. Such an outstandingly thorough and insightful physician who understood about my pain and had a plan for relieving it.|The doctor I saw was very LGBTQ friendly he asked my pronouns right away!! Also he helped me until he needed different tools that they didn't have and he hooked me up with the ER that could help further my needs.|Great team that has helped my live my life close to normally. Dr Goel is attentive to my needs.|really really nice and professional doctors and physical therapists!!!

column40:
Although therapy helped in some areas, I was disappointed in the fact that you did not see the therapist you had made an appointment with. This would change without your knowledge. You would still get texts stating it was the scheduled therapist and you would get texts to rate your therapist, which you did not see as it changed.  This did cause some conflicting information to be given from appointment to appointment and I feel it hindered anyone from truly getting an understanding of what was going on with me.

The doctor seemed knowledgeable but was rude, demeaning and made me feel unimportant.

There was a real lack of communication as a whole. Who to contact if you had questions, how to reach them, how to reach the clinic, or who to contact for other services set up like MRI, injections etc.  No one ever gave phone #'s or said, " if you have questions, call this number."  "If you need to cancel or change this appointment, call this number."|Jake takes time to listen to your concerns. He relays the concerns to the doctor so they can move in a direction to help remedy those conditions.  A great asset to the office.|PT doctor Thomas Ebert is by far the BEST PT doctor on this planet. IDC what anyone says or thinks. His compassion and empathy  he shows to ALLLLLLLL his patients are TOP TIER. Because of his attention to detail and concerns for my health I'm getting the CORRECT care I need. I can't brag on him enough for all he has done for me. I have been tossed around for two years trying to get my health in check. Thomas listened to me and now I am on the road to get fully healed. I could go on and on and on how amazing he is. Trust me public he is definitely  the best PT EVER!!!! Thank you ISpine for finding this gem  he can't be matched!!! Thomas Ebert THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR ALL YOUVE DONE FOR MY HEALTH!!! Jon, Sue, Liz, and Riley were absolutely fantastic--thorough, knowledgeable, and empathetic throughout the entire process. They took the time to really explain my back issues in a way that made sense and worked with me closely to ensure I understood how to continue improving. I especially appreciated how they held me accountable to stick with my exercise program at home, which has made a huge difference. I highly recommend this incredible team for anyone in need of physical therapy!|They schedule a ton of "evaluations," but don't consider the full clinical picture and don't do actual assessments. The doctor did not do any assessment on my initial encounter, and he called me back to the office because he forgot - that feels like the whole point of an evaluation, so I was confused how that critical piece was missed. Then the PT never touched me or even looked up from her computer screen to check my form or give me pointers on what muscles to make sure I was engaging. She gave me a book of rudimentary exercises (knowing I have already done 9 months of PT and that I'm very active and know a fair share about anatomy) and they just base their whole program on two dusty machines rather than thinking outside of the box, using their hands, or connecting the anatomical dots. Every appointment was a big waste of time.|Jon is a great physical therapist.  This was my first appointment I've ever had with a PT and he spent a lot of time understanding my unique needs and tailored a plan that I was seeking.|No real sense of support,  caring and patient advocacy w SPINE. column3:
Advanced Pain Management Specialist in Edina, MN

At Twin Cities Pain Clinic, Dr. Sherri Haas serves as our Assistant Medical Director and brings exceptional expertise in osteopathic medicine to our patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We are proud to offer her specialized skills in the most advanced pain management techniques available today. Dr. Haas is board certified in both pain management and rehabilitation, with particular expertise in:

  • Spinal cord stimulation procedures

  • Treatment for degenerative disc disease

  • Solutions for failed back syndrome

  • Specialized care for piriformis syndrome

What truly sets Dr. Haas apart is her certification in performing the highly advanced dorsal root ganglion (DRG) stimulation implant procedure - a technique mastered by only a select few physicians nationwide. Located at our Edina office, we combine cutting-edge surgical interventions with comprehensive pain management strategies to help restore quality of life. Learn more about Dr. Haas's approach to patient care by visiting our physician profile page or call us at (952) 841-2345 to schedule a consultation.
column11:
Dr. Sherri Haas is an exceptionally skilled doctor of osteopathic medicine (D.O.) and Assistant Medical Director at Twin Cities Pain Clinic. She specializes in the most advanced pain management techniques to provide lasting relief and improve quality of life.

Dr. Haas is board certified in pain management and rehabilitation, with a special focus in spinal cord stimulation, degenerative disc disease, failed back syndrome, and piriformis syndrome. She is skilled in pain management surgical procedures and one of a very exclusive few who are certified in performing the highly advanced dorsal root ganglion (DRG) stimulation implant procedure.

Dr. Haas is committed to providing patients with the highest quality care and fulfilling lives.

column40:
1st off: Seems like really high provider turn over. All of the providers that I did very well with~they were very focused on individual care, with empathy and empowerment, left. In just my time there, they have had one massive loss of providers at the clinic. Then again a smaller loss in within a year or so. I've been assigned 4 new providers since I started there a couple of years ago. My most recent provider is extremely rude. After each subsequent visit she has become more outlandish. She does not ask before she starts touching, or LITERALLY poking into me, 8 times in one shot. Leaving me with 2 bruises. I had to tell her "stop, your bruising me". As I stopped reacting to her firm poking, I caught her face and she had an odd smile on her face-VERY creepy. I did NOT even ask. It was too strange. She is very abrasive, accusatory, demanding, unyielding, judgemental and unable to communicate in a normal fashion. She actually began a prolonged verbal abusive assault that went on so long that I had asked her 4 times to stop yelling which she ignored. She continued her assault until I went to turn on my phone to record her since I didn't have anyone coming to stop her or help me. When she saw the phone, she quick finished a sentence and RACED out of the room to try to avoid a recording. The conclusion of my visit was like a continuation of a very bad dream. A hush fell when she left the room, and when I left. They heard her and nobody did a thing. Do not go here. Bullies. Dr. Anderson is the exception just as other's have written. I would imagine he is holding up the walls there after reading the other accounts here.|It's run by M health Fairview now , BE CAREFUL THE DIRECTORS OF THE HMO AT M HEALTH FAIRVIEW TOLD MY DOCTOR TO LIE TO HIS PATIENTS.. The doctor that I have cares but the HMO ARE A BUNCH OF DIRTY LYING SNAKES!!! Be Wary ....|The entire clinic staff is wonderful. Thank you Jackie!!|The doctors and practitioners are great! The only drawback is Dr. Ericksons nurse. She gets orders wrong often and even sends scripts to the wrong pharmacies and it's a hassle getting it straightened out. Also I never know if orders for therapies has gone through or not. Sometimes they have and sometimes haven't. She told me if she doesn't call to confirm thst it's been taken care of, but it sometimes hasn't and again it's a mess.|I also experienced almost the exact experience as also reported by another patient who gave a one star rating. She does not even deserve a one star rating. On my second visit my provider was combative, accusational,abusive,  judgemental and a bully. She twisted my comments around to make it sound as if I  was accusing her of saying things. I was fully prepared to sign a patient agreement which I  described as daunting and somewhat intimidating , so she ACCUSED ME of accusing  her of intimidating me. On my first visit she asked me if I  was still taking therapy for alcohol use. I said that I  was never in such a program and suggested her records were wrong. Before my second visit I checked with my primary physician if there was any record of this in my history. There was not! On my second visit I asked my provider about this question which sent her into a tirade of verbal abuse and accused me of accusing her of fabricating information.
I stayed very calm during her barrage of abuse and have never been exposed to such unprofessional behavior by anyone let alone a healthcare professional. After she stopped yelling at me she made up an excuse to leave the office due to an imaginary urgent phone call she had to take and never returned.
I strongly suspect that the lady and I who had a similar experience had the very same provider. Yes  Terry it was that psycho Jackie|Overall, clinic seemed ok, but avoid the practitioner Jackie.  My husband had an awful experience with Jackie.  He saw her for pain management of chronic pain due to arthritis.  She told him NOTHING about the specifics of their actual pain management program, the conditions and expectations to receive care through the program.  And no mention of patient agreement to be signed.   There was some confusion about his urine test so he left clinic without taking it.  She called and told him to come back in, with no further explanation about importance of test.  As a result, because he didn't return to clinic immediately for urine test, he was "disqualified from the pain program" (which he didn't even know he was in and obviously hadn't signed any agreement about it) because of a "failed" urine test.  Completely unethical and unprofessional.  She also seemed less focused on his current chronic pain issues and his desire to minimize pain meds and more focused on alcohol aftercare (sober 8 years).  When he indicated he's not getting alcohol treatment at this time and also wasn't interested in behavioral therapy, her responses were demeaning, she twisted his words and became combative.  Her professional behavior is reckless, irresponsible and she's a poor communicator.  She definitely has her own agenda and it does not include the health and welfare of the patient.|The staff here is so kind and courteous and my Doctor, Dr Alhatem is absolutely AMAZING! At Nura (formerly known as MAPS), we specialize in state-of-the-art pain management procedures and therapies to support chronic pain patients in their journey back to normal life. Over the years, we've helped thousands of patients manage their pain through our comprehensive approach. What makes us different is our unique methodology - a personalized plan of care that typically includes medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health counseling to address all aspects of chronic pain.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We identify and treat the physical generators of pain with minimally invasive interventional procedures, including:

  • Medication management tailored to individual needs

  • Physical therapy programs for rehabilitation

  • Behavioral health counseling for pain management

  • Minimally invasive interventional procedures

  • Full range of implantable pain control options for severe pain problems

She recommend treatment options to help manage my symptoms and let me decide which direction I wanted to go.   I'm happy I went with her treatment plan. My 13 year old daughter has been suffering TMJ issues and headaches for most of her life. She has been able to prevent some migraines from happening, due to therapy and a customized appliance that was received through this clinic.

This team focuses greatly on body awareness. They are very easy to engage in conversation. I have learned a lot for my own care and I'm just sitting in on the appointments. I highly recommend them to anyone suffering from headaches or stiffness in any area of the head and neck.

column40:
I was referred to the clinic to see a different doctor but she had an appointment run behind, so Dr. Herman took his time to see me! And he has been a genuine breath of fresh air for someone who sees multiple providers and is very worn down of all the medical speak, without explanation. He did a terrific job explaining my issues in terms that were easily able to be understood. He also drew a lovely Picasso style picture to demonstrate the mechanics of the jaw itself for me. And he even led me to a potential root cause to a good portion of my chronic issues!|I was told by my primary doctor that I should ask my dentist about TMJ.  She referred me to Dr. Herman for an evaluation.  The intake person at the clinic was very thorough in understanding why I was there and what my symptoms were.  After all, I had no pain and was at a pain clinic!  Dr. Herman then did a thorough examination and found the source of the clicking sound I had, educated me on TMJ, examined me by having me move my jaw and open my mouth, had me put in my retainer and evaluated my bite with it in, and explained why I do not have TMJ.

The top medical practitioners all seem to know each other.  Our children's orthodontist had referred me to a prosthodontist to do an implant for our son who had a missing tooth, and she referred me to the dentist who referred me to Dr. Herman at this clinic.  Dr. Herman now has referred me to an ENT to address my primary doctor's diagnosis of Eustachian tube dysfunction. Because of his speciality with TMJ, Dr. Herman works with ENTs.  Because he knew our children's orthodontist and prosthodontist as well as the dentist, I am confident he has referred me to one of the very best ENTs in the Twin Cities. I am also confident I do not have TMJ -- which is progress!|If you want to feel like a really low priority, use this clinic!  All their procedures, orders, appointments take a very long time, so you're for sure out several months on receiving any real treatment.  Also, it is impossible to talk to a human being when you call their "reception desk"!  You can not hold for a receptionist and they are constantly on the phone so you will be sent to their voicemail.  Eventually your call will be returned several days after you made it, so don't count on any help for anything urgent and if you complain, they will blame you for not following up sooner.

I have contacted the Plymouth office, they offered no assistance!  They told me to leave a message and they'll get back to me...precisely the problem!!!|Very good experience. Doctor was pleasant, very thorough with the exam and answered all my questions. Many treatment options offered, I felt like I was getting the best care plan.|Based on the examination and an assessment of my situation the doctor explained very well  the different apnea treatment options and which would probably work best for me pending the results of a home sleep study. Very patient, thorough and professional. UPDATE as of 1/23/2005: Dr. Thakur has been great but your billing area has been less than helpful. UHC has denied the $2,000 claim for the appliance saying it's not covered under Medicare to which I submitted an appeal. If what they say is true that's something you should have known and told me about up front in which case I wouldn't have even started down this road. If UHC upholds their denial I won't be visiting your office any longer. In the meantime stop sending me automated payment notices until I hear back from UHC. Btw your portal is a black hole. No one in your office ever responds to any of my messages.
Tony Rees|Dr Thakur is first rate! Compassionate and explained things really well. She was also very clear about the best and most cost effective ways for me to access my health and dental benefits. I can't praise her too highly! Also appreciated the communication with clinic as to insurance and appointment details.|Staff friendly and helpful. Dr Herman and his nurses have my best interests in mind.|I recently had a first-time office visit with Dr. Cory Herman. I was impressed with the speed at which I was taken to an exam room- absolutely no wait time whatsoever. A very thorough intake interview was then performed by one of his assistants, and a considerable amount of time was spent reviewing my medical and dental history and reason for visit. Everything was documented in their computer system, and they also had access to my medical records, which very much helped to bridge the information. Dr. Herman then saw me; again there was no wait time between interview and doctor. He spent a lot of time with me, and listened attentively to my story. After dialog and discussion he put forth several options as a treatment plan for my dental issue, and explained the reasoning behind each of them. Under his guidance, he let me select which avenues to pursue first. I felt that there was a strong partnership between doctor and patient, and fully trusted everything that he discussed with me. I look very forward to my continued work with Dr. Herman, as together we pool our efforts to resolve my dental situation.

column40: I saw Dr Sena Kihtir In 2023 for chronic back pain among a couple other conditions. My condition is very complex, so I prepared a print off of the most important and relevant factors that contribute to my pain, which she totally dismissed. I was looking into a spinal cord stimulator, something supposed to be among her expertise. When it came time to determine if we were to move forward with a spinal cord stimulator, she passed off all responsibility to my previous surgeon who has no expertise in that area. The only thing she did do was the worst possible thing she could do. Without providing something else to reduce my pain, she lowered the quantity of my pain medication, a medication I have been taking as is for over 10 years.  The worst part about everything was she didn't even tell me about it! There was absolutely no discussion of changing my medication during the appointment!!!  I didn't miss anything, my mom Is a nurse and was there with me. I found out Dr Kihtir had reduced my pain medication when I picked up my prescription and realized the quantity was less than it was supposed to be. I also found out she planned to reduce my prescription by the same amount every month.  I asked if Dr Kihtir could give me a call or a message to explain what she was thinking and she refused to return my phone call! She is the absolute worst pain doctor I have ever met!!! I would avoid both Dr Kihtir and the United Pain Center at all cost!|Dr. Kihtir it is time to retire. You treated me like a bother in your life. While reading my chart you rolled your eyes and gave a little giggle followed by OMG. When l asked if there was something funny about my 8 back surgeries you said, come on, you didn't need all that medicine. Apparently you forgot l didn't write the prescriptions l was under a doctor's care. One day she asked me if l knew how bad l looked. The nurse who put me in a room asked me what l did to make her hate me. During a back injection she told me to turn my head the other way, l asked why since l am deaf in one ear. She said the conversation between her and the nurse was none of my business. The nurses were on strike and this one was asking about art fairs. I brought up one they didn't know about. That nurse saw me crying and mouthed, l'm so sorry. I can say l was actually afraid of her, of asking questions. I called on the day of my appointment and said l will not be in today and l'm not coming back to United Pain. No one contacted me to ask why.I should have reported her but the staff told me if l did she would have me dismissed. I would break out in hives waiting to see her. I'm sure she was thrilled when l left. I know l was.|Dr. Kihtir is one of the best doctors I've had. I went to a few other doctors for pain. At first I was worried she would be like all the other doctors I previously saw and just tell me I'm too young to have chronic pain despite the 20+ surgeries I've had. Dr. Kihtir was different. Katrina is my provider and I can not articulate how happy I am with her! She is awesome! I feel heard and understood.  She is so easy to talk to and I feel she really cares about my wellbeing. She always makes me feel good about myself|Everyone is very pleasant and very polite and very helpful,  they talk to you as a person instead of talking at you while you are in office. I've been a patient there for 3 years and I would recommend Valley Medical to my friends and family if they were to ask me about what I think of them,  I'm very satisfied with the care the staff from the Rochester office gives me every month, I absolutely love Katrina and Ivy from the Rochester office, I actually look forward to seeing them every month|Katrina is extremely rude. Does not care about what i had to say and kept speaking over me. I'm honestly shocked that she is a provider. I can't believe my insurance is paying for that i had to leave early because of how she was talking to me, very disrespectful almost yelling at me. If you want help and someone to listen to you go to a different doctor. my last doctor was very nice I don't know what Katrina's problem was but definitely will not ever meet with her again.|Upon hearing that the Mpls location (my clinic) would be closed for renovations, I was highly upset by the idea of having to try to transfer to another clinic. The receptionist, Miss Ivy, was INCREDIBLY helpful and tenacious at figuring out how to accommodate me. (Not to mention Patient and kind- a tough combo to pull off, but she does it with grace!)

There were several back-and-forth calls as she worked with Katrina Gabelko (the best in the business!) to find an acceptable and doable solution, made ever more difficult by the fact that I sustained a TBI in 2011, and my cognitive processing has been compromised.
Miss Ivy and Katrina got things squared away more quickly and thoroughly than I could've ever expected, especially since I'M quite a bit north of the cities, and they are quite far south.
I'm humbly grateful for ALL the extra work they put in, in order to accommodate me!
Miss Ivy and Miss Katrina, I thank you both for embodying the epitome of what healthcare providers are supposed to be.
God Bless, and stay safe!
Thoughtfully,
Joy|I feel very comfortable going to Valley Medical treatment clinic. I'm not judged but I'm understood and that's important when dealing with these issues. I'm very happy with this clinic and would recommend it for anyone that I would need the helop! Thank you!! The Rochester team and new location are excellent!! I always look forward to my visits every month.|Very helpful providers here. Great listeners. Even the front desk cares just as much as the Dr! A welcomed surprise|My doctor was as nice as I could ever ask for. Plus made me feel very welcome and happy to help to work with me|Great Service, the care is top of the line. Very Satisfied and happy with all my appointments.

column3:
At Lake Superior Pain Management, we provide comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients throughout Duluth and surrounding areas.

Specialized Pain Management Services

As both a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management physician, Dr. Davies offers personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We take pride in our prompt, attentive care and professional approach to pain management. Our clinic provides a range of specialized interventions including:

  • Radiofrequency ablation procedures

  • Targeted pain injections

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Individualized treatment planning

Located at 1420 London Rd, Suite 100 in Duluth, our modern facility is equipped with advanced technology to ensure effective pain relief solutions. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we take the time to develop customized treatment approaches. For expert pain management care from a physician dedicated to improving your quality of life, visit our website or call us at +1 218-728-8548 to schedule your consultation today.
column38: Angie Schmidt|coliecam|Heather Gallagher|buddy greene|Nicholas Stein|Eric Nelson|Doug Hilgers
column40: Dr Davies is the best in the Midwest! He is prompt, easy to talk with and very knowledgeable. I also appreciate being able to get in to see him with very little wait time.|If you are referred to  this Dr.  ??, for an RFA,  run, don't walk away.  It's a total scam. I had 2 five minute appointments to to test for approriate treatment. Never returned a call . Every call I made to Lakewalk said, a half a dozen times, " We'll get back to you".  Never did.  This went on four four months until I got a bill for use of the facilities for $750.  Dr. ? Davies had never followed the Medicare protocol for RFA so I was stuck with a $750 bill. Collection called and agreed! it was a scam but said it would cost more to go to court. Other Lake walk providers I have used are top notch but this guy is "dreck"./|Dr. Chris Davis and his staff are incredible. They make the whole experience comfortable from start to finish. I understood everything that was going on and why. I would highly recommend|My name is David  Greene and I don't write many of these reviews. I feel that it is time to write one to do what I can to help others with knowing what they can expect from the pain management clinic here in Duluth Minnesota. I have never had an actual office visit with this doctor to discuss my pain.  It's always been a quick hello " This is what we are injecting into you today", and that is it.  Never have we talked about where I've been in life and what I've gone through to be in the pain I'm in.  We've never talked about the actual management of my pain and if the procedures are even working, it is not personal at all   They know I've been let down, after a couple years of being called every 4 months for appointments it's now crickets.  The people at Lake walk surgery center are very nice, but the pain management isn't that effective.   To me pain management is more than drugs to alleviate pain, to me its developing a plan to manage it long term (hence the term management).   My primary care physician is levels above the pain management clinic in both treatment and personal care. It's the trust care and compassion of my primary dr that has helped me to find sobriety,  which is 3 years and something I am beyond grateful for.  My primary asks me how he can help me, and has taken the time to understand my story and how I got to where I'm at today.  Life is more than the almighty dollar,  and maximizing how many patients can be seen in a day.   The pain management team people are nice, the lady that used to call me for appointments seemed to be the most caring of all of them.  If the entire team could show as much care and compassion as her, I'd give the place 5 stars.  It's hard to put your trust into a medical facility that has never taken the time to understand the problems and how they came to be.  If I had life to do over,  I'd show them how to take things to the next level.  For now I will walk in pain, and search for the place that will take the time to understand my issues which are as follows.  I've been in four severe car accidents,  two that were roll overs that both warranted life flight.  I've been hit by a car as a pedestrian,  and have sustained two TBI's.  I've fallen off of two roofs as well as 3 levels of scaffolding.  I've broken multiple bones and had several soft tissue tears.  Somedays I hurt so bad that I struggle to sleep let alone get out of the house to do much of everything.  Although they are not all pain related, I have been on the table around 90 times in life now for surgeries/procedures. I've had 5 knee surgeries, three shoulder surgeries, and a couple of back surgeries  Some of which cause me a great level of anxiety and stress which is another thing I don't think this facility is built to deal with.   My pain has been so bad at points in my life that I turned to drinking to numb it, and that caused me to be labeled as a bad person and a drug seeker.  The people at the pain clinic in Duluth are nice people, I just wish they would have taken the time to understand my situation so they could have maximized the level of care they are capable of giving. My last visit for injections was one of the worst procedures I've been through. I was conscious for most of it and experienced the pain when they were injecting me. I wish them all the best but will not call them for another appointment,  I'm currently under the sole care of my primary while I search for another pain management facility in the state to help me find a higher quality of life which we all deserve.  If the facility would like to try to help resolve these issues,  they can call me ( I wont be holding my breath or expecting it) to set up an office visit to discuss my physical pain and how they can help me manage it.  In closure, I want to say again that the people associated with the pain management clinic are nice people, it's just to bad that the management part itself is lacking the management.|Chris and his staff were professional, kind, and attentive to me during my visit. Very prompt as well. Highly recommended.|I am very pleased with how Dr. Davies has helped me deal with the pains I experience from a vehicle accident a few years prior . His treatment has helped me more than any other type of therapy I have received since my accident ,where I had a bus pull out in front of my pickup and the result was not pretty . I just wish I would have came to see him sooner . He is a very down to earth honest physician who displays strong confidence in his work. If you deal with chronic pain you should make an appointment today ! 5 stars for me !|Dr Davies has treated My complex pain disorders for over 5 years; WITHOUT EXCEPTION, WELL INFORMED AND A VENUINE KIND PERSON  AND .HIS TREATMENT IS MULTIFACETED AND A RANGE OF TOOLS IN HIS WELL ARRANGED TOOL KIT.A GOOD LISTENER AS WELL.AND HIS CARE FOUNDED IN HIS PATIRNTS SUBJUECTIVE EXPRESSION OF THEIR PAIN

At QC Kinetix (Maple Grove), we provide innovative non-surgical regenerative medicine treatments for residents of Maple Grove, MN and surrounding communities who are suffering from joint pain. Our state-of-the-art biologic therapies offer effective alternatives to invasive procedures like knee replacements and hip surgeries, helping patients find relief without the lengthy recovery times associated with operations.

Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions

Our regenerative medicine treatments address a wide range of conditions, including:

  • Knee, hip, and shoulder pain

  • Elbow, wrist, and foot pain

  • Arthritis-related discomfort

  • Sports injuries and recovery

  • Joint mobility limitations

We understand how chronic pain can impact your quality of life, which is why our dedicated team at QC Kinetix is committed to providing personalized care plans tailored to your specific needs. Our treatments harness your body's natural healing abilities to promote long-term relief and improved function. Schedule a free consultation with us today at our convenient location: 12000 Elm Creek Blvd N l20, Maple Grove, MN 55369. Call us at +1 612-509-8896 to take the first step toward a pain-free life without surgery.

column38: Janet Boone|Jonathan Mercer|Todd Potas|Sam Choate|Tammy Gilson|Mike Marthaler|Kerry Gelschus|Todd Waggoner
column40:
When I started the process at QC Kinetics I was told by my orthopedic surgeon I would need a hip replacement. I wish I had started QC treatments before the hip pain became debilitating, but I was skeptical. After only 5 months I am no longer limping, and can expect another 15 months of healing! The staff is incredible, the injections are less painful than cortisone (I've had many) and the results are real. If you are in the fence-- don't be. I am so grateful I decided to try QC Kinetics!|During my consult with this clinic for a stem cell procedure, I found some questionable practices and lack of important questions present that ultimately kept me from using their services. First, I never spoke to a doctor, just a salesperson who assured me that they could 'fix' me, despite not even having looked at my MRI (I had it with me). The salesperson literally had no idea what was wrong with me, but I was the perfect candidate for the procedure. Second, at no point was it asked if I had recently had a steroid injection or taken an oral steroid. The salesman actually wanted me to start the process that day and didn't ask if I had recently had a steroid injection, which I had, and nearly all regenerative medicine doctors agree that stem cells should not be administered for many weeks after a steroid is introduced to the body. Lastly, the 'physical' they give you prior to approving you for the procedure is merely palpating that doesn't seem relevant to if you can handle a bone marrow extraction and injections. During this portion, I was told that my psoas was being palpated while I was in a standing position- which I've never seen done in practice due to inaccuracy.

In the end, I truly hope that this clinic is helping people and all these reviews are genuine. The pricing for PRP and stem cells was reasonable, and the few people I encountered were pleasant.|Treatment was very effective with no down time.  Golfing and pickle ball were no problem.  Confidence in my right knee being solid without pain has greatly increased.|QC Kinetix has been an absolute life changer for me! I had excruciating pain in my back/leg for months and then I found out I had a herniated disc in my lower back and was told that surgery was my only option. My husband had heard about QC Kinetix on the radio and said we should give them a try, and I'm so thankful we did! After my second treatment the pain was COMPLETELY gone! I am able to do my everyday activities again and keep up with my kids. My mood has improved and I am feeling SO GOOD again!
I am going to the Maple Grove location and when you walk in the door Krystal at the front desk makes you feel so welcome. Her upbeat attitude is amazing! Eric makes you feel at ease when he's getting you all set up and Randy is a ray of sunshine, he makes you feel comfortable while doing the treatments and always has something to chit chat about!
I am so thankful for this wonderful group of people and these amazing treatments! I've got my life back.|I am so very happy I talked the hubby into coming here to QC Kinetix! Guess I listen to the right radio shows The difference has been unbelievable even after just 3 treatments it has made an epic improvement for my husbands pain levels! I am so praying for continued progress for him!
The most welcoming understanding staff, nurses, dr.s....ya'll really make a difference in peoples lives, I just want you to know that!
My husband cannot believe the relief he has gotten from this!  He may not be 100 percent healed, but the ability to tolerate the amount of pain he was in then till now is amazing.Thank you so much!
It makes a difference for the spouse too, believe it or not|I went into the clinic on April 25th and wasn't sure if I would be a good candidate for their services. After the initial consultation with Randy, I was informed that there is a very good chance this procedure would help me. I am bone on bone left knee with a bum right knee as well and two shoulders screaming at me every day. The pain in my left knee daily, made me sick to my stomach often. I am happy to report that I decided to treat all four areas of my body and the results are absolutely AMAZING! I have one treatment left in September but am extremely grateful to QC Kinetix and the entire team! My pain is GONE!
Thank You!
Sincerely,
Mike Marthaler|i haven't sleep more than 4hrs a night because the pain in my knee. After the first treatment I got to sleep 8hrs and woke up refresh the pain in my knee was gone. The staff at QC Kinetix was very friendly.|Went here to get relief for my bone on bone pain in my hip. I'm glad to say it has relieved my pain and given me more range of motion! Would recommend them to anyone looking for help with their injury or situation!!!

column3:
Transforming lives through specialized pain management since 1991, our practice is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Interventional Pain Medicine

Dr. Lon J. Lutz, founder of the HealthEast Pain Center in St. Paul, has expanded our services to multiple Twin Cities locations including High Pointe Surgery Center in Lake Elmo and Minnesota Valley Surgery Center in Burnsville. We specialize in both diagnostic and therapeutic procedures for chronic painful conditions of the spine and extremities. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Spine condition treatments

  • Extremity pain management

  • Diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

At our Oakdale location, we provide personalized care in a comfortable environment where patients can discuss their pain concerns and receive expert treatment. We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we're committed to helping our patients regain their quality of life through effective pain management solutions. Visit our website or call us at +1 651-313-8250 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward pain relief.
column11: Lon J. Lutz, MD has been practicing Interventional Pain Medicine in the greater Twin Cities area since 1991. Dr. Lutz is a founder of the HealthEast Pain Center in St. Paul and has practiced at that location since 1992. He has since expanded his practice to provide service at a number of Twin Cities locations, including High Pointe Surgery Center in Lake Elmo and Minnesota Valley Surgery Center in Burnsville. Dr. Lutz focuses his practice primarily on diagnostic and therapeutic procedures related to chronic and painful conditions of the spine and extremities.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management & Rehabilitation in St. Paul

At Revive MD, we provide innovative pain management solutions and rehabilitation services for patients throughout the Twin Cities area. Led by Dr. Alfonso Morales, our clinic combines traditional medical approaches with alternative therapies to deliver personalized care for chronic pain and sports injuries. We offer a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Pain control treatments for chronic and acute conditions

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Hormone replacement therapy (HRT)

  • Physiotherapy and rehabilitation programs

  • Exosome treatments for regenerative medicine

Our dedicated team takes the time to understand each patient's unique needs, developing customized treatment plans that address the root cause of pain rather than just masking symptoms. Located at 821 Raymond Ave #230 in St. Paul, we're committed to helping our patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and improve their quality of life. Contact us at +1 651-644-6002 or visit our website to schedule your consultation today.

column40: Dr. Morales is amazing! I have been on HRT with him for almost 2 years and it has been life changing. In the beginning I dropped the stubborn 5lbs that came on around my midsection with early menopause and have been able to maintain my healthy weight. I sleep better have no hot flashes and my mood swings are gone. I am a firm believer in HRT and am so glad I found Dr. Morales. I have also had exosome treatments which has helped my skin look amazing. I will continue both treatments to keep me young & fit. I highly recommend booking a consultation with Dr. Morales he is very knowledgeable and keeps up on all the latest research and newest products available he also takes the extra time to reach out to inform clients. You can tell how much he truly cares and is passionate about what he does.|I have multiple sclerosis. That gives me terrible pain. And go to Central Medical Clinic once a month is part of my pain management routine. The doctors, the nurses, the support, and everyone in that office is extremely friendly. I always feel welcome to when I come in, I don't feel like a number or patient they just want to shuffle through, I truly feel like a person who does get respect from everyone and the clinic. I know there are closer clinics who take my insurance but Central Medical Clinic as me as a patient for life. Super relaxed atmosphere, super wonderful people, I will definitely go back.|I had the best experience with a nurse who really understood my situation just with that I slept better last night than I have in a long time and I don't even have my medicine yet. She really took a lot of stress off of me and without being judged unlike all the other Dr's. That was the best experience. If anyone is trying to find a Dr and staff that will listen and help you this is the clinic. I don't feel nervous anymore to go to the Dr's office and believe me I've been trying to find a clinic for 20 years that would help me and not treat me like I'm a drug seeker. I deal with chronic pain and migraines and thanks to the Dr and his wonderful staff I am feeling much better especially not being judged.|DIANDRA and EVERY single staff member are first class, dedicated to excellence and friendly! They treat you with compassion, they're professional-yet personable! HR is brilliant in their interviewed selections and in staffing this clinic!! It feels like home! I'm probably 30 years older but Dr. DIANDRA feels like mom.  PS-I drive over an hour one way, 2 hours and 15 minutes round trip and don't think twice about changing that up.|For a year and a half I've been having pain in my right calf my previous pain clinic and my primary Dr sent me to have an ultrasound it showed nothing so they never did anything else about it well the pain progressed I told Dr Morales about it he sent me to have another ultrasound it turns out I have blocked arteries in my leg which are really bad but thanks to him we are getting it taken care of.... Dr Morales saved my leg I would have never known if it wasn't for him the other drs didn't care thankfully he did, he really does care about his patients, he listens to what you have to say. I've been to many pain clinics and I have to say he is the best I've seen and I would recommend him to everyone ..he's great.|From the 1st phone call the staff and Dr Morales were fantastic. They were able to get me in the same day. He was able to relieve my pain and make my quality of life better, which is something that another pain clinic, my primary and even my orthopedic specialist couldn't do. They listen to you and work with you, they don't just cram medications down your throat and send you on your way. I will and have refer anyone and everyone I know to Dr Morales.|Dr Morales is a very personable doctor. I have found that previous doctors I've visited have not listened to what I was actually saying, but just bouncing me from medication to medication. And get this: He will actually CALL you on the phone!(something the doctors at my previous clinic would never do.   I am very comfortable and confident seeing Dr Morales, even at the expense of a 3 hour drive!|I have been going to the clinic for about 3 years.  The staff, Dr Morales and Mark Stock and Pam have always been very helpful.  Even when I have gotten frustrated about different pain issues, they have always worked with me to make sure I'm taken care of.  I have referred a couple of people.

column40:
I love this place and trust them implicitly. Dr. Haas has done many procedures and all of them have helped immensely. Suzanna, a nurse there, is my angel. She is one of the only nurses that can get the i.v. needles.in on the first time.  She has the best humor and I love it when she is there. Another staff I think very highly of is Ken, an anesthesiologist, because he is so kind and gentle. I feel very safe when he is working on me. Unfortunately, when I got home from my last surgery I had a long review written up on some scrap paper that I was going to type as my review but when I was in the hospital and rehab  for my back, my husband started cleaning up and threw it out. I had spent a lot of time on the review.that I was going to type in for the review.  Unfortunately I ended up falling 6 times and ended up in the hospital and then a rehab facility for my back. I am going to need surgery which will happen as soon as things can get arranged. I appreciate all the things the Twin Cities Pain Clinic have done for me to keep me from having surgery this long.|Had my first epidural steroid injection yesterday, I had a TON of anxiety prior to my appointment. The staff was phenomenal! They did everything in their power to make sure I was comfortable and my needs were met. During the procedure Dr. Haas and staff were diligent, I was thoroughly impressed with their practices and kindness. Everyone was on the same page before they started the procedure, talking out loud making sure I also knew what was going on. I was also concerned about a potential allergy to corticosteroids, they had me pre-medicate with Benadryl and started with a half dose to be safe then monitored me in the recovery room for 10-15 minutes. This was the best experience I could ask for. Thank you so much for your professionalism and authentic care.|I've been here 3 times. LOVE the staff. Dr Haas, Kim (nurse) and the anesthesiologist (the man with black glasses) are all phenomenal. They're kind, fun even.
I experienced a massive headache and they didn't let me sit in pain, and to me, that's really important.
Dr Haas is really nice & compassionate. Kim was great, even when I got sick momentarily from meds, and even going as far as waking my son up out in my truck when he didnt answer his phone.
The anesthesiologist didn't mind my jokes. All in all, GREAT experiences with them. I wouldn't go anywhere else. VERY clean facility, VERY good care, VERY good staff. TCSC & TCPC has the BEST providers I've ever seen!  So grateful.
They're hard to get ahold of though for post problems. BUT, I understand They're busy and don't expect them to drop everything at once.
 Thank you Dr Haas, Kim & Mr anesthesiologist.
Sincerely, Michelle G.|I have been to the surgery center for 2 injections cervical and lumbar. The surgery center is a very clean facility and the staff are all very kind and respectfull. Doctor Sherri Haas is very competent and proffesional.  Twin Cities Surgery Center is one of the best pain management surgical facilities I have
been to for injections. Highly trained staff overall my experience was very good. I give them an exellent rating.|I've been to this surgery center quite a few times for injections. The injections haven't worked but Dr. Hass was amazing. She talked me through the whole procedure each time!
I'm trying to set up an appointment for a nerve stimulator trial and no one is answering the phone or returning my messages. I'm not sure what's going on but I've left two messages and called 4 times in the last two weeks. I'm going to call the Practice Administrator tomorrow.
Edit: The Practice Administrator texted me the next morning and apologized. Someone called a couple of minutes later and I set up my trial appointment. I'm going to  give them 5 stars because they were quick to resolve my issues.
8/24/2023 Edit.
For a while there were people answering the phones. Not anymore. They said before, that my phone calls never registered in their system. I'm guessing that because I now have to leave messages that most of my calls aren't going through even though I get their phone recordings when I leave a message. I don't understand. I'm just going to have to find another provider.|Great place for different types of surgeries to alleviate chronic pain. The staff is extremely friendly and will do whatever they can to make you feel comfortable. They treat all patients with respect and can clearly see they truly care about their patients. Depending on the surgery they want to make sure the patients are fully taken care of the minute they leave the building. This place gives people hope and a chance to feel somewhat normal when they are dealing with not normal circumstances during their daily life.|The staff is fabulous- caring, attentive, friendly, quick in a good way, and the nurses have humor. I like that Dr. Anne talks to you during procedures (helps to calm and is much appreciated)- thank you Dr. Anne. Wish all places were like this- they should be the standard for the medical field and recognized by the state/peers/patients/etc.- seriously, I worked in the medical field before getting sick and seen it all, now on the other end, I find it's difficult to find providers who genuinely care for patients for the long haul and TCSC/TCPC go above and beyond and are consistent. Melissa in billing is awesome- she should be in charge of the billing at the surgery center (ran into issues with previous billing staff over a year ago, glad to see it's changed for the better). Unconditionally recommend!|Terrible customer service! Several attempts to contact scheduling for a procedure to be done. Told lies from the supervisor. Trying to tell me facts about my case and what's going on. Not cool. Over 1 hour and 25 minutes of waiting on the phone to be hung up on more than two times to get zero voicemails and no callbacks after waiting in queue. I do not recommend this place. Good luck!

column48: What conditions do you treat?
column49:
Twin Cities Surgery Center utilizes the most advanced and innovative techniques to treat almost any chronic pain condition, including back and neck pain, joint pain, nerve pain, migraine headaches, sciatica, spinal stenosis, fibromyalgia, diabetic neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgery pain, disc degeneration, and more.

For a more comprehensive list of conditions we treat, visit our website: https://twincitiespainclinic.com/conditions/

column3:
At Advanced Pain Management, we are dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain through innovative, minimally invasive solutions. As

One of the Premier Pain Clinics in the Country

, our specialized team combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized therapeutic services to address the root causes of pain. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our comprehensive approach focuses on three core goals:

  • Restoring Function - Helping patients return to daily activities

  • Relieving Pain - Using targeted interventional procedures

  • Renewing Hope - Providing long-term pain management solutions

Our Mankato facility offers state-of-the-art equipment and a comfortable environment where patients receive individualized care plans. We specialize in various pain management techniques including epidural injections, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, and other advanced interventional procedures. Our multidisciplinary approach combines the expertise of our medical professionals with cutting-edge technology to deliver exceptional care. Visit our website to learn more about how we can help you regain control of your life and manage your pain effectively.

column38: Laura|CAG Original|Karen Hamman|monkeynumber nine|Cheryl MH|John Dough|Jody Jorgensen|James Buckley
column40:
I had an appointment with Micheal it went great he explained to me more about my past back surgeries than the doctors who did my surgeries in (Virginia) and why I was still having the pain in my back he just explained it a lot better than any of the past doctors and until they can replace my stimulator I'm going to try some of his other ways to relieve the pain. The staff and nurses were great and understanding I'm really glad I found Advance Pain Management when I moved up here.|Personally, I felt compelled to change my review. My first experience was positive, but the next one was not.  I had an allergic reaction to one of the injections and no one would call me back. So I never went back.
Then, I had a new injury in 2023. It was a nightmare. I saw so many doctors and they all treated me like I was a drug-seeking addict!. Really?? Walk a mile in my shoes and tell me, you do not need any type of medication to manage your pain. The joke was on them as I could not even have the stuff they were accusing me of wanting.
The injections did not help and unless I wanted more injections I was told there was nothing else they could do to help me.
I've had a lot of bad care at Mankato clinic over the years, but this one took the cake.  I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy if I had one.
The doctors need more pain training and Mankato clinic needs to recheck their policies for how they treat people who come in for pain issues. We want to feel better. If it takes a pill to do that, then give us a pill. I was told injections can do more damage. so why push injections??? That's right because they cost thousands of dollars were as they do not make much on pills.
Shame on you Mankato Clinic.
On the plus side though, the staff on the procedure side were absolutely amazing. And the reception was also amazing.
If you are in pain, go to Mayo or to one of the pain clinics in the cities.  You will be treated better.|Dr. Michael is very knowledgeable when it comes to how the mechanics of the bones, muscles and tendons all work together. He is also very kind, friendly and listens well. He explains thoroughly, and shows me, what's going on with me and what treatments he recommends that may work. I recommend him to find the source of your pain like he did mine and help you find relief for it.|I like the providers and the nurses. They treat people well and are very helpful.
I am updating my review to express my gratitude for the care I receive from APM.
(Now owned by Mankato Clinic)
My provider gently encouraged me to consider a treatment that I was pretty skeptical about (fearful) but eventually I decided to take the steps to try it, and I am so grateful that I did!!
I believe that the providers care for their patients, and if you have a chronic pain issue, please don't suffer forever.
This is a wonderful clinic with caring staff.|Had a procedure done here in July 2020, 3 weeks post-surgery upper right extremity by orthopedic general surgeon, as I was continuing to have intense pain that was excruciating.   I was referred here for a nerve block procedure to help decrease the pain. I never had an initial assessment with Dr. Ifechi, simply made a call for the procedure over the phone with staff. That nerve block was somewhat helpful with my pain, however, I ended up in ER several hours after I had gotten home from Advanced Pain Mngt due to serious side effects that affected my breathing & very serious, which they should have known about my lung disease from the Ortho Surgeon referral. It was recommended I go back for a second procedure, but I opted out. I received a bill for this, which was a considerable amount, but Medicare Part B paid the majority of the bill. I was reviewing my Medicare claims that were submitted & processed one day & glad I did. Advanced Pain Mngt submitted a medical claim to Medicare for an evaluation & diagnosis on a date in July 2020 post-surgery & prior to my scheduled date of the 24th. I never had an evaluation there & knew nothing about a diagnosis involved.  The claim submitted for the actual nerve block procedure  was accurate, but rather spendy. This procedure & billing fraud took place prior to Mankato Clinic taking Advanced Pain Mngt under their umbrella. I did contact Advanced Pain Mngt after they became a part of Mankato Clinic, yet billing statements from previously owned facility were not available & Mankato Clinic could not answer. I did find it interesting when I called Advanced Pain Mngt asking a nurse about this over billing & what this diagnosis meant that Dr. Ifechi found during an evaluation I wasn't even involved in.  She informed me that he generally does submit claims to Medicare with Medicare Advantage plans with a "CRPS" diagnosis CMS Code so insurance will pay. This CRPS (Complex Regional Pain Syndrome) was never mentioned by Dr. Ifechi or by the referring Ortho Surgeon. I will not return even though they have a different Billing Dept now. Unethical business practices & an unnecessary nerve block procedure for a fictitious diagnosis. I highly comnend the staff especially the wonderful caring nurses. I have been seen at a different pain management facility & they take the time to care, they offer options for pain mngt & present the best solutions for each individual with an accurate diagnosis. Advanced Pain Mngt is a "one-size fits all" approach & that is clearly not in the best interest of any patient dealing with severe &/or chronic pain conditions. Ask many questions & get the answers you need. Peace of mind is a wonderful feeling.|Bad Bad Bad.......

Like all the other negative reviews on here, my experience is pretty much the same. Dr. Ifeci Anyadioha does not care about you or even attempt to get personal with you or try to get to know you or your problems. He just does a quick glance at the files and says what HE wants to do. And of course he wants to go right into steroid injections because they cost $3,000+ each, this place is all about money and that's it. There's really no genuine empathy or show of concern towards the patient. It's a total joke.
I've had numerous shots and tests so far, still in the same pain as when I first went there.

As far as the nurses go, they are pretty great, I do like them. That's about the only positive thing I can comment on this horrid place.

Wish I would've gone to the Mayo clinic in Rochester for my back care.

Please consider other options before this place. This place should be a very last resort if needed.|The staff is very nice & professional. The new doctor is nice but very rough during procedures even with anesthesia. Never had that problem with Dr. Metta. I have been going here for years & it used to help, but it seems I'm worse now. I'm going to have to find other options. I will miss the doctors & nurses, because they are all so nice, but I need to find a solution.|I was a patient at the Mankato , MN facility.  Dr. Ifichi is very good at what he does.  He explains things well and performs the epidurals with care and accuracy.  The reason I am giving Advanced Pain Management a 1 star rating is because of their billing department.  They continued to mishandle insurance claims and are very hard to reach to get things fixed.  As a result I had one very large mishandled claim go into collections. My credit rating is in the mid 800's, so it is not like we do not take bill paying serious.  For this reason I will look for another provider and suggest you do also.

column40:
Dr.Hess is the best pain management doctor. I have been going to him since 2018. He's very understanding, caring, takes his time with you. He's helped my pain so much! Every appt he just is always happy and loves seeing his patients. He won't disappoint you! He will help you with your pain. He's the #1 doctor! I haven't met a doctor like him. I have been to a handful! He has been wonderful with my care!|The best doctor I have ever  had! I  miss him very much, I am happy  for him that he retired, but, I  am not happy for me. Even on my worst day's,  I  have had many since 2005, he has ALWAYS MADE ME SMILE!|Dr. Hess is a life saver, for me!!! The front office staff and the nurses are also, so great!! But, he ALWAYS has the BEST, FUN attitude!!! It's refreshing! Because even when you're in extreme pain, it can help brighten your day, even if it's only during the appointment..... Distraction from pain is key, and Dr. Hess rocks at it!!!!|I can't believe years later this doctor is still listed. He is one of the worst out there. He shows zero care and kindness for patients. I can't believe he has ever changed.|I loved my Doctor but I  had no insurance from the end of June until October . I tried explaining my situation . I was told to make an appointment which I did in order to keep getting my medication.  My appointment wasn't until November.  I get a call the next day & was told that I needed to come in there that day . Granted I didn't have $300.00+ for the office visit., besides I let my daughter use my car . She didn't get off of work until 8pm & I had my 3 Grandsons with me .
The female in the office said I was rude to her . By telling her my situation I was rude ?
I WAS MORE THAN WILLING TO PISS IN A CUP BUT I DIDN'T HAVE MONEY FOR THE VISIT .
They made it seem as if I was misusing my medication because it wasn't getting filled at the same time . I can't help that Walgreen's ALWAYS runs out of my medications.  IF I WAS SLEEPING & MISSED A DOSE I DIDN'T TAKE A DOUBLE DOSE. I work a lot & need to stay focused !!
I even asked them for help on getting insurance & I never got a call back .
I WAS FAR FROM BEING RUDE .
I have started at a new clinic & I  hope things are going to get better|Dr. Hess is the best pain doctor practicing in the twin cities.  I have always had wonderful experiences at his office and the staff has always been pleasant.|Dr. Hess is the most compassionate, smart and understanding doctor I've seen in my 46 years of care in my lifetime. Thanks Doc !|I have been going to Dr. Hess for over 10 years and he is the best pain doctor there is. I have never been disappointed in my care at all.

column38: matt busse|Avery Preston|Lindsay Carlson|Rebecca Fredrickson|Galina Vladi|Jennifer Mills|Laura Smith|Kenneth Smira
column40:
I wish I could give negative stars. If you want help or have any questions answered do NOT go here. Mevhibe meral atay is who I saw, very unprofessional and once I started asking her questions she couldn't answer, she stopped listening to me, got very defensive and walked out of the room. I hope no one gets treated like I did.|I saw Dr. Mevhibe Atay yesterday for severe pain for the first time. Immediately when she entered the room, without sitting down or introducing herself, she said "No more opioids! You will never be getting oxycodone here again!" I was given 18 tabs and told to take them every day for my pain because I do treatment everyday that is very painful and would send me to the ER without my oxycodone. She claimed that I was supposed to be taking the tablets they were giving me 1x a week. Which would mean they wanted to give me enough pills in 1 month to last me over a 6 month time frame?? Um no. It didn't make sense. She was yelling at us and getting out of her chair and then sitting down so my partner had to pull out his camera to record in case she became more violent. She was getting in my face and yelling at me while talking down to my partner. She also referenced a packet during my appt. that showed dates of appointments that were not mine. When my partner went back in to try to get the papers (because that's our right) after the appt., they acted super weird about it and said they couldn't prove that the notes she was looking at were actually from my chart and not another patients. My partner and I left scared and confused as she kept saying basically that she would blacklist me now. We never got to speak an entire sentence the entire appointment, she interrupted everything we said. So then when she said they don't offer oxycodone to patients that don't have cancer (even though my friends and family members have gotten it from that clinic!!) we asked what other options I had. She said there were no other options for me. Then what the hell does the spine and pain clinic do for patients who don't have cancer?? She literally would not answer and kept saying how I wouldn't be getting opioids. And we repeatedly kept saying that we understood that but wanted to know what other options there were. Then she randomly starts talking about LDN and prescribes it to me? And at the end she says "Oh yeah and I'm on LDN too." She never said goodbye or anything. She got up from her chair with her papers and just started walking out of the room. When I told her she was being unprofessional, she said "You're saying that because I'm not giving you oxycodone" To which I replied, "No we're saying that because you haven't answered a single question we've had or let us finish a single question we've needed answered" She also said I refused a drug test which wasn't true and I wasn't sure why she was then asking for a drug test if I wasn't getting oxycodone... I just left crying and so confused as to how someone could treat a human being that way and stand over me and my partner and yell at us for asking questions and trying to talk. She seemed very unstable.|I suffer from 2 hurniated discs and arthritis in my back.  I have been getting steroid injections in my back with Dr. Adimi for over a year.  The last injections I got, I noticed they were no longer working like they had before.  I had to go into the clinic and look for next steps/options.  I was assigned to the NP Meral Atay.  I arrived at my appointment balling in excruciating pain.  Something was severely wrong and I couldn't manage the pain.  I was in a wheel chair and could barely walk.  I have never been prescribed opioids with Dr. Adimi.  This appointment was very different.  I have never been in so much pain in my life.  When I saw Meral Atay she was absolutely awful.  She was incredibly insensitive to my back pain and offered me a steroid pill to stop the pain.  The only next option she gave me was to get something implanted in my back to TRY and see if it would work.  When I questioned this procedure Meral said there was "nothing more they can do for me" and WALKED OUT OF MY APPOINTMENT!  My blood pressure at the time of the appointment was 185/99, I don't have a history of high blood pressure, this was clearly a reaction to the pain I was in.  This nurse literally walked out of the office, offering me NOTHING for pain relief and left me there balling my eyes out.  She walked out of the office and then called SECURITY when I asked to see Dr. Adimi.  I never received a call back from anyone.  I limped out of the office balling with a sky high blood pressure.  The absolute WORST experience I have EVER had in a clinic.  They advertise as a "Pain Clinic" but only push injections on you and refuse you any acute pain relief.  They are NOT a pain clinic.  Dr. Adimi knew about this and never even bothered to call me back.  I would never recommend this clinic to anyone.  I believe Meral Atay is the worst nurse I have ever met and I will never enter that clinic again.|I have been suffering with Trochanteric Bursitis which caused severe burning and muscle pain in both hips and legs.  I was referred to Pain Clinic by Ortho.  The first two visits were with Angie PA.  At both visits she recommended that I continue with scheduled Gabapentin and Tramadol and discontinue medical cannabis.

When I realized I needed a refill on Tramadol I called the clinic.  They told me that a visit is required to get a refill.  Angie was booked for the week so I had to see a different PA for virtual visit.  She asked me why I had discontinued medical cannabis and was not aware of my diagnosis of chronic bursitis.  She then told me that I would need to sign pain contract and have UA done for Tramadol to be prescribed.  I was very confused as this was not explained at all by Angie at first two visits.  As another reviewer stated, I felt that I was fighting with the clinic.  They did not give me all of the information and then when I am confused and frustrated they treated me like it was my fault.  The PA told me she would speak to Angie about this and call me back that day.  I never heard back from her.  I am looking to switch pain clinics as I don't like the way I have been treated and don't feel it builds a trusting patient/doctor relationship.|I've been suffering from chronic Lyme disease and pain is inseparable part of my life. The pain reaches its highest in the late afternoon and evening, but with help of Percocet I've been able to function without going insane from pain. The first time I saw Dr.Ademi, he told me that he would start cutting off my medication and then would take me off. Without fully learning about my case (I believe he knows nothing about Lyme), he rushed to apply the same strategy on me that he uses for his back pain patients.
He told me to schedule an appointment in 4 weeks, but wrote a prescription for two weeks only. When I called the clinic to request the refill, they told me that they don't do refills over the phone.
From that time and on, I was in a constant confrontation with the clinic. Instead of being on my side to help me to fight this horrific disease that it is, the doctor instead made me to go through a horrific stress, denying me a medication. Instead of fighting the disease I had to use all my very limited energy to fight the clinic.
When they have finally told me that they are sending the prescription to my pharmacy, I went there only to find out that I didn't have a medication on my name. I called the clinic and left a message, but nobody called me back that day. And then there was a weekend and Christmas.
Without any medication to address the pain, I sunk into a deep depression. It was the most miserable Christmas I ever had.
The amount of stress this clinic caused me is so  great that I am leaving not only this clinic, but all other doctors that I used to see in the same building. Even a thought of being near Spine & Pain Center makes me anxious.|I love Dr. Adimi he is very kind and knowledgeable. Remembers information about his patients that I know isn't in the chart. He is awesome at injections. I get lumbar sympathetic injections. I followed him from another facility because he was good at injections.
I was able to get to know him as a physician better at Ridgeview. The other facility only allowed me to see nurse practitioners at office visits so follow ups were never by the physician. Dr Adimi does his  own follow ups at his office, which I appreciate and givs patient and doctor opportunities to understand what is going on. He is good at explaining things i recently had an MRI and he made sure I understood even though i have a medical background.
I drive 2 hours to see him and it is well worth the trip. Wish I didn't have to have a driver for the injection but that is not his rule its the surgery center even without sedation. If you are looking for a caring GOOD pain doctor look no more.|My first review would be something great 5+ stars. That is when I was being seen by Dr. Ademi.
Now I don't have same opinion.
Not treated as a individual nor feel like I'm being listened to nor do I feel all people directly involved in my care read the important part of my reason for being treated at a pain clinic. When you are treated by someone like Dr. Ademi and someone else comes around who treats you Less as a individual, or importance, listens and treats you the way they feel not what's best as a whole person.
It's hard not to be affected by this change.
No same day call backs ect...
I truly miss being directly treated by Dr. Ademi.
I felt like I was truly cared for.
I will however try to keep a open mind to someone new and hopefully that person will be open to what I'm saying not what I already know and already do to fight my every day pain. And most of all listen and hear me.
Recieve knowledge as to why my pain and other symptoms are more intensified.
So Dr.Ademi is great this is why I chose to change my first review. He's awesome.|The best in the field of many Pain Management doctors I've seen so far. But my pain is still not manageable in places, but not because of Dr. Adimi and the very capable staff. I appreciate the opportunity to see Dr. Adimi for other problems I'm experiencing. Thank you for the time, Kenneth E. Smira

Not sure what happened to her why she turned that way. But send me my money or I'm getting a lawyer|Worst place ever... I have insurance but she will not bill them. Instead she charges me $200 cash and does not give you a receipt. At my last appointment she took my $200 and when I tried to explain my co pay wad only $45 she got mad and told me she was not responsible for billing my insurance and threatened to can the police if I did not leave. She would not give me my money backso I just left. All of her bad is going to catch up with her. Steer clear of her nothing but bad.|I requested my diagnoses for my physiologist because it would've been quicker than waiting for the release of information.
