column40:
Literally the nicest doctor I know. Very thorough with his work and practice. Always takes the time to hear my concerns with zero pressure about the time he spends with me. This is a doctor that makes me feel seen and heard. I see Dr Banik for pain management & although I'm one of those unusual not fixable chronic pain cases, we have found solutions, so that I can at least tolerate standing and walking. For reference I was becoming completely immobile before I started knee ablation procedures. Through every procedure he always lifts me up with encouraging words and laughter. I feel very taken care of by Dr Banik and would recommend him in a heart beat. He's a doctor who cares. We've worked together I believe 4 years now and I plan on maintaining him as my doctor for as long as he's here|I've had two successful epidurals for back and leg problems from Dr. Banik. He spent a generous amount of time ahead of both appointments listening to my descriptions of longtime post-injury issues and targeted the injections exactly. I highly recommend Dr. Banik and his team.|Dr. Banik and his nurse Anna are fantastic!
I receive trigger point injections from Dr. Banik.
This is because I had neck surgery in 2009 and five days later(2010) I had staphylococcus.
My neck surgeon removed all the infected material and by God's will  I healed.  Now, I live with severe pain because the musculoskeletal tissues are permanently damaged.
Dr. Banik gives my injections precisely where I need them for maximum benefit.  He stops and asks where I need more injections to thoroughly cover my pain. He prescribes a pain medication that I am Extremely careful with.
I am also a transplant patient  at the University of MN. Dr.Banik works well with my team.

Dr. Banik has never been late to one of my appointments. He has been kind and thorough with my care. He is aware of my medical history and  takes it all into consideration when treating me. I would and have  recommended Dr. Banik to friends and family.|Dr. Banik was more than an hour late for the appointment. Then he rushed in and asked about my asthma. I don't have asthma. Then he asked about my COPD. I don't have COPD. I have osteoarthritis in my back and several joints from an accident 60 years earlier. Once he pulled up my chart, he explained that I have problems with my back. Gosh; thanks for the news.

His "After the visit" notes were inaccurate as well. I'll never go back.|Dr Banik and his nurse Anna have been critical in me regaining a quality of life. When I first met them I was in a wheelchair in horrendous pain 24 hours a day. 3 years of pain management with them later, I am able to walk, clean my house, enjoy family outings, take care of my kids and grandkids and thoroughly enjoy life 100% more. I owe all of this to them and am so grateful every day!|I was Prescribed a Tens Unit after a Nerve Block done by Dr Banik. It took Months and multipule calls to have his office call the medical supplier and have them send the Prescribed unit to my home. I have made several calls for Tens Unit Leads so you can use this system after having an Apt January 26th with DR Banik. Today is February 14th and I have left VMs made several attempts to obtain the leads for this unit so I can walk! After speaking to 4 different people today I find out there is not a prescription for Tens Unit Leads!? I don't understand what it's going to take to get someone to do there job at this Location I have the call logs proving I have called prior to today! Update 8-31-2023 Dr Banik spoke to me and we figured out there was a communication error. My issue has since been handled by Dr banik. Please speak to this office if your having issues the nurses and Dr will help! Thank you Dr. Banik|Dr. Banking is fantastic.  He listens patiently and he is very kind.|If it were possible I would give him 0 stars. Dr.Banik is a horrible pain doctor. I been going to him on and off for over a year. What has he done to "help"? He told me to ignore my pain that I'm making it a bigger deal than it really is basically saying it was mostly in my head. He told me to get a boyfriend, get a job, and watch some exercise videos of things I can't physically do. He kept making comments about me being on pain meds and that I'm too young. He then kept insisting there's nothing he can do but "guide" me. Every time i saw him i would be waiting for a long time in the room just for him to invalidate me ,make me feel horrible for being on meds insisting i didn't need them, making me feel so depressed I wanted to cry, and he would leave as quickly as he could. I sat in a room waiting for him he comes in tells me there's nothing he can do within less than 15 minutes he was leaving having done absolutely nothing which is what he did for pretty much every visit. he didn't help at all  i have been to multiple pain clinics and he did even less than MAPS clinic did. At least they tried some things while banik did nothing

column40:
I can't say enough great things about Moderni Spine and Cynthia! She is an absolutely amazing medical professional. I initially came to her for post-stem cell treatments, HA, and PRP, and since then, I've relied on her for trigger point injections, SI joint injections, shockwave therapy, and more--basically, I go here for everything now! I literally went from barely being able to walk because my back was so messed up to 95% in 48 hours.

What sets Cynthia apart is not just her expertise but her genuine care for her patients. She has done so much to help me get back on my feet when I could barely move, and her preventative approach ensures I don't get to that point again. I also love that she offers in-house and mobile IV services, making treatment even more accessible. Plus, she provides referrals when needed, ensuring I always get the best possible care.

I'm on their subscription plan for prescriptions and see Cynthia at least once a month. The level of service is top-notch--professional, compassionate, and incredibly versatile in the treatments they offer. If you're looking for someone who truly cares about your health and well-being, Cynthia and Moderni Spine are the best in the business! Highly recommend!|Cynthia at Moderni Spine is my go-to for joint and back care. She has helped me manage pain and mobility with a crazy array of different treatments, keeping me feeling my best. On top of that, her in-house and mobile IV services are a game-changer for recovery and overall wellness.  We get them to come to our house when sickness is running through and they definitely help get us back on our feet.

Whether it's targeted joint care, back treatments, or IV therapy, Cynthia provides professional, effective, and convenient care. Really great service.  My wife and I are very happy that we found someone so good.|I was going through the most painful and disruptive health issue of my life.  I had been to 8 different doctors  in a month  including 2 orthopedic doctors and a neurosurgeon and I was back to ground zero (constant intense pain, not sleeping at all,  and no treatment plan other than "lets wait and see how you feel in a month") but I wasn't going to make it a month.  I found Moderni Spine (Cynthia Konrath) either by dumb luck or divine intervention    by calling spine care places that were listed on my insurance network website.

I left a message and Cynthia called back.  In a ten minute phone call, I could tell that I had found someone special.  I told my friends and family that I think I had found someone that could help and that I was going to see her tomorrow and that I had actually already talked to the person that I was going to see (unheard of in healthcare as I knew it).  Cynthia cleared time for me at 9:00 the next morning and with some emails and record transfers she was more informed  about my situation by the next morning than the previous 8 doctors combined.

From that point on I received better  healthcare than I would have thought possible for an ordinary person.  Cynthia helped me keep the pain under control,  she was easily accessible for questions and assurance that I was moving in the right direction,  she guided me through various treatments,  and she eventually set me up with an amazing surgeon.  I'm now pain free, drug free and I have no physical restrictions.

I'm so thankful that I found Moderni Spine and Cynthia Konrath.  She has a unique business model and she is so good at what she does.  It's hard to put into words how different this place is but if I have any friends or family that need orthopedic care, they won't need to look around.  They'll be going to Moderni  Spine.|Dr, Cynthia Konrath is an angel in the space of pain management and A treasure to the medical community and the people of Minnesota.   Highly intelligent and open to learning she brings a collaborative and comprehensive treatment to the space of pain management.  Leaving no stone unturned and looking for the stones she hasn't turned over you can trust that she will take good care of you using traditional , "alternative", and cutting edge regenerative medicine.  Well networked within the Twin Cities every treatment is available for your care.  I would get an appointment with her now before she's booked up.|From the moment I walked through the doors of Moderni Spine, I was welcomed with warmth and professionalism. Cynthia Konrath, PA, made me feel not only comfortable but also hopeful about finding relief for my chronic neck and back pain. Her extensive expertise in pain management became evident during my very first visit.

I was introduced to shockwave therapy, a cutting-edge treatment that delivered noticeable relief after just one session. What truly sets Moderni Spine apart is the personalized approach to care. Each treatment is meticulously adjusted to ensure optimal results, addressing my specific pain and discomfort.

The clinic itself is exceptional--one of the cleanest and most well-maintained facilities I have ever visited. The environment is not only welcoming but also conducive to healing, reflecting the high standards that Moderni Spine upholds in every aspect of patient care.

An added benefit of choosing Moderni Spine is their collaboration with Integrative Massage, which is conveniently located within the clinic. This service has been an invaluable addition to my treatment plan, significantly accelerating my recovery process.

Cynthia's network extends beyond the clinic as well. She has referred me to several reputable wellness providers, all of whom have contributed to my overall health and wellness goals. Her ability to connect patients with the right resources is just another testament to her dedication and expertise.

I highly recommend Moderni Spine for anyone seeking expert care for pain management. Cynthia Konrath's clinical experience and commitment to patient-centered care make this clinic a standout choice for those in need of comprehensive pain relief.|Cynthia spent time listening to my concerns, significantly more than my regular doctor. She had a variety of treatment options for my pain and discussed the pros and cons of each.|Cynthia Konrath, PA with Moderni Spine has been incredible sharing her clinical knowledge and wisdom to guide me through a perplexing set is issues with my lower lumbar back pain!  She has been patient in answering my many questions in an effort to understand my challenging back pain situation. She is also well networked and was able to refer me to the appropriate spine surgeon who provided an excellent consult on my condition.  I would recommend Cynthia without reservation to provide any individual with comprehensive clinical expertise on their spine issues.|Prior to visiting Cynthia, I saw a neurologist for occipital nerve injections to assist with headaches.  My experience with Cynthia was different in the best way!  She took the time to listen, ask additional questions I hadn't been asked by the previous doctor, and explain/ clarify treatment options and next steps.  The process was more gentle and the ambience of her office was welcoming. I look forward to continuous pain management with Cynthia at Moderni Spine.

Dr. Dan Hanson

, our practice specializes in revolutionary endoscopic spine surgery that delivers remarkable benefits to our patients: faster recovery times, significantly less pain, and minimal scar tissue formation. We take pride in offering exclusive surgical expertise—Dr. Hanson is the only surgeon in Minnesota performing Endoscopic Hemilaminectomies, Foraminotomies, Microdiscectomies, and Nerve Transections.

  • Minimally invasive spine surgery

column11: Minnesota Spine Institute uses the latest technical advancements to provide advanced surgical spine solutions. Dr. Dan Hanson specializes in endoscopic spine surgery, a revolutionary procedure that results in a faster recovery, less pain, and less scar tissue. Dr. Hanson is the only surgeon in Minnesota that performs Endoscopic Hemilaminectomies, Foraminotomies, Microdiscectomies & Nerve Transections.

column40:
I had emergency spine surgery at Mayo for a L4 herniated disc, the surgery failed and the ER staff were awful. A few months later I found Dr.Hanson and he quickly operated on my failed original surgery at the L4 disc. The 2nd time around when he did it was so different. He was fast and I was in much less pain start to finish. My surgery now 6 months out has gone smoothly and I can back to living a normal life. If you are wondering where to go for spine surgery, Dr.Hanson is the needle in the haystack!!|I had lumbar spinal stenosis with pain in my buttocks and back of upper thighs for 6 months. Tried conservative approaches to try and alleviate the condition with no success. This included drugs, cortisone shots, chiropractor treatments and physical therapy. I was introduced to MN Spine by the chiropractor I was seeing. I had a teleconference with Dr. Hanson who had my MRI's and was able to tell me how he would use a minimally invasive procedure to remove the bone spurs compressing my nerves and causing me the pain. I had talked to a couple of other surgeons who wanted to perform 1- 2 fusions, and remove bone spurs. This would entail cutting me open from the front and moving my aorta and then cutting me open from the back. 5-6 hours with 6-month recovery. Dr. Hanson assured me that would not be necessary. Procedure was 1 hour with estimated 6-week recovery. I am in week two and feel almost 100%. Cannot praise Dr. Hanson and his staff enough. Had another surgeon who had previously performed back surgery look over Dr. Hanson's background. He told me that Dr. Hanson was very well trained and not to give a second thought in using him. Procedure was done at Burnsville Surgery Center and this is a top-class facility. I would echo the same sentiments as the surgeon who told me to not have second thoughts in using Dr. Hanson.
Excellent job with fantastic results. Jackie, his assistant was also excellent. Communication is great, Dr. Hanson provides his personal cell phone number for questions/concerns. Never heard of another Doctor that does that. He listens to your questions /concerns and takes the time to address them.|I had debilitating nerve pain from disk compression and bone spurs for years. Finally found Dr Hanson through a friend. My experience from start to finish was first class. I found Dr Hanson to be friendly, took his time to understand my concerns and highly skilled and meticulous with artificial disk replacement.  His entire staff at his clinic and at the surgical center were friendly caring experts. I had more pain after a dental visit than post op disk replacement.  Looking forward to getting my active lifestyle back thanks to Dr Hanson and his staff!
Highly recommend Dr Hanson!|Update to my deleted review.

I'd like to apologize personally to Dr. Hanson. I made a judgement error. I thought I had post surgical complication. But it turns out I have Carpal tunnel in both hands.

So for that I'm sorry Dr. Hanson

My surgery with Dr. Hanson was a success. He is a one of kind down to earth surgeon and deserves a 5 STAR review.

To you and your amazing staff. Thank you.
And thanks for putting up with me.|I was referred to Dr. Hanson as a Top Tier Dr. from insurance. I talked to a handful of people who had seen him & highly recommended him as well. I was told by another surgeon that I needed to have surgery ASAP. I wasn't in a severe situation, but he was concerned that if I hit a pothole while driving, I could be paralyzed. That sounded pretty severe to me, so I was confused about how I wasn't considered severe but needed to have surgery right away because of potholes. So I opted for a second opinion. That 2nd opinion was that of Dr. Hanson. Dr. Hanson gave it to me straight & said I'm not ready for surgery because it would limit my mobility & he didn't feel it was necessary without trying other things first. I've started doing the procedures suggested by Dr. Hanson & have had good results so far. Even though I have moved on with my care to another Dr. & facility, I received a message from Melina at Dr. Hanson's office wanting to update my chart with the info from the procedures I've had done with the new Dr.  I've NEVER had another Dr. or clinic follow-up after I'm technically not a patient anymore. There is a chance I will have to see Dr. Hanson again, so I feel very confident that they will be able to give me the same fantastic care in the future.  I'm so grateful I chose to get a 2nd opinion & it was with Dr. Hanson.  It's the best decision I've made in my search for pain relief.|I had severe back pain and a pinched sciatic nerve. An MRI showed I had a spinal cyst, I was told open back surgery was my only option until I found Dr. Hanson. Dr. Hanson did a minimally invasive surgery to remove my cyst and decompress my sciatic nerve. My incision is so small you can barely see it. I was feeling better the day after surgery. A month later I am feeling amazing. I highly recommend Dr. Hanson and his team to anyone having any back or neck issues. They are amazing, thank you for my life back Dr. Hanson!|Doctor Hanson is an awesome surgeon. He has the skills and training to perform minimally invasive surgeries, that have helped me with painful lower back and neck issues. Doctor Hanson takes as much time as necessary to review your scans and discuss all the options available to resolve your issue. He personally follows up after your procedure and is readily available if you have a question or issue after the surgery. Every surgery he has performed for me, including a fusion on my lower back and an artificial disc replacement in my neck have been successful, with minimal down time and quick recoveries. I have and will continue to put my trust and health in Doctor Hanson's hands.|Update: We finally were able to schedule a consultation with Dr. Hanson and he appears very knowledgeable and was able to explain procedure in detail and answer our questions. Wish would not have to wait 4 weeks. Thanks to Jackie who was kind and helped to make the consultation happen, therefore I am changing my initial review from 1 to 3.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Attempted to schedule a virtual consultation with Dr. Hanson as an option advertised on the clinic website. Was told they need all the records, then they will schedule a consult. After mailing all the records and a CD, I never received any updates on when my consultation will be scheduled.When called was promised to receive a call the following week but again have not heard anything. Asked to at least return the CD as I am going to a different provider now and even that could not be accomplished. Unfortunately very poor impression of this clinic and now reading other reviews I am glad I did not choose to receive care there. It's sad as perhaps Dr. Hanson is a good MD but since I never got a chance to meet with him, my overall rating for this facility is low.

column40:
I am so grateful that I found Twin Cities TMJ. I had been chasing a problem for almost three years. I had originally gone to another TMJ clinic and it was an awful experience. I was feeling a little defeated but Dr. Strief listened to my concerns and took the time to really to get the bottom of what was going on. He came up with a plan and the results have been amazing. Literally night and day. The office staff is so friendly and know you by name which is so nice. I am so happy and could not recommend them enough.|Twin Cities TMJ & Facial Pain Clinic is the place to go for excellent service, care for the clients, helpful resources, integrity, and for the best help for TMJ pain to be resolved.   Dr. David C. Streif,  DDS is the very best doctor I have ever had in all the many years I have experienced problems with my TMJ disorder.   He is professional, friendly,  very knowledgeable, and truly cares for each of his clients who he is helping to get pain relief.  He has made me dental appliances to wear nightly to help align my jaw joints correctly, to help me with the wear and tear that happens to our jaw joints if we grind or clench our teeth, and he has custom made these appliances to fit correctly over my teeth.  He will make sure the fit for these appliances is perfect.  He is a wonderful doctor!   He has surely hired all of the right staff also-  Kim who works at the front desk,  answering calls and making you feel welcome, always with a smile.  Chelle is there to help Dr. Streif get your night guard ready for you, and Jessica is there to assist you also with your night guard and walk you back to the front desk after your appointment is over.  The entire staff all work as a team together and their teamwork is outstanding.  Please give the Twin Cities TMJ & Facial Pain Clinic a call if you are in any TMJ pain or facial pain.  There are solutions and they can be found right here!

I would like to add more to my earlier review that I made several years ago for Dr. Streif. I had not seen him or his staff in over two years, but just came into his office on March 5, 2024. I can't thank him enough for his kindness, caring, concerned attitude, compassion, and professionalism he treats his patients with. Dr. Streif truly wants to see you get out of your pain and will help you do just that. He goes the extra mile for us, works out the best plan for helping you achieve your goals, and he wants you to have a happy life. He truly cares about you as a person and demonstrates that by his words and actions. His staff works with you also, letting you know as well that you matter, and your desire to get out of your pain is important to them. I would say that Dr. Streif and his team treat you as they would treat a family member. A big thank you to Dr. Streif, Kim, and Michelle who definitely helped me so very much when I was there on March 5th!|I have had severe TMJ since I was 10 years old.  I wasn't aware that there were TMJ specialists out there.  My dentist referred me to see Dr. Streif.  Dr. Streif was extremely attentive and created a night guard for me.  It was completely different than any previous dental appliance I have received.  My jaw pain went from a 8/10 to a 0/10.  I am very grateful.  The office team is goes above and beyond as well.  I had a lot of issues with my insurance/billing.  The office team help guide me through the situation and reached out to my insurance company multiple times. I would suggest anyone with TMJ pain to see Dr/ Streif and his team.|After a long, confusing exam the doctor recommended therapy at the therapist next door to his clinic. Both the exam and something like 8 therapy sessions were a waste of time.

My jaw pain has barely improved and the recommended therapists have run out of ideas on how to treat it. I guess I'll ask my family doctor if she has any other options because I'm not going back.|Dr Streif is one of the best doctors I have ever seen!  My issue was somewhat unique, and Dr. Streif took the time to fully assess my situation and got down to the root cause of my issue by asking numerous questions, listening, looking at x-rays, and examination.  He even provided me with a hard copy summary of my visit before I left the office, and it included the diagnose, assessment, treatment plan, and costs.  What set this visit apart from other doctor visits was Dr. Streif's thorough assessment (making me feel confident in the diagnosis), listening skills (didn't feel rushed), and kindness (I felt as though he cared about me and my situation).
Great doctor, would definitely see again and recommend!|Very nice doctor and staff. The night guard has solved all of my jaw issues. Thank you!|Very rude front desk staff every time we called or went in. Called once because of unbearable pain and was referred to the website. column40:
I have worked with Dr. Ariel Petracca Selk for around a month now, and I can't speak highly enough about her! I had been skeptical of acupuncture, and needles, for my entire life. She knowledgeably put my mind at ease the first visit. I had thought that there is no way poking me with a bunch of needles would relieve my pain, but I no longer think that. I suffer from Fibromyalgia and a couple other medical problems, and even after the first visit I could notice a difference in my pain level. The pain relief I receive from going has improved my quality of life, and I look forward to going. Her personality and professionalism can't be beat! The office is easy to get to, nicely decorated, and very clean. She is now a part of my weekly routine, hopefully, for a long time!|I have seen Dr. Kyu and Dr. Chang for acupuncture therapy for about 6-8 months now after going through pain therapy and PT with the Minneapolis VA. They are absolutely wonderful!

If you are skeptical or nervous about recieveing acupuncture therapy, go or call in and outline your questions comments and concerns. They have been a great resource and have explained the different mind sets and methodologies held to be successful here.

For me this has been a great avenue after traditional western medicine was unable to identify or acknowledge the issues I was faced with.

While there is no cure for the aches and pains I deal with, this place has definitely been able to tone the pain down to be manageable compared to the last several years of ongoing back and knee pain from army related injuries.

My advice is go in with an open mind and be willing to listen if you have any reservations on pursuing alternate pain management methods|I go to Lifetree for acupuncture with Amber and it's the number one thing I look forward to each week. First of all, it's helped me tremendously with my allergies, inflammation and hormones. It has also helped me greatly with pain. It's the best thing I've ever come across. Amber is absolutely wonderful. She is very knowledgeable, kind, gentle, takes interest in what is going on, and so much more. The clinic is peaceful and relaxing. It's one of my favorite places to be. So grateful for Amber and this clinic.|Wonderful place! I was completely skeptical of acupuncture, but the VA Pain Clinic said I should give it a try. I have Degenerative Disc Disease, Spinal Stenosis and Spinal Arthritis (I guess I hit the jackpot!) and have only had two visits thus far, but the results have been impressive. Highly recommended. Good people, great ambiance and even better great results.|Amazing clinic! Amber is fantastic, she makes you feel comfortable, easy to talk to, and she's a great listener. I am already seeing amazing results with stress management, anxiety and weight loss. I would recommend to all my friends and family!|I came in for treatment of pain and received acupuncture, manual therapy, and Reiki with Dr. Karen Chang. All 3 were really helpful, especially the Reiki sessions. I've had a couple dozen treatments and am still continuing to go over a year later. It has both reduced my pain and other symptoms too when they come up. I've had chronic pain for many years and nothing has worked completely until I tried Reiki and I finally got relief! I always leave the clinic feeling wonderful and pain free. I highly recommend this clinic for acupuncture and Reiki.|My appointment was canceled for no reason. I was looking forward to my initial consultation for over a month and I received an email stating my appointment was canceled. I tried to call the clinic and nobody answers.

Dr. Tae called me and apologized for the inconvenience. I was able the schedule with in a week for my first visit. I am impressed with Lifetree Clinic and will be returning in the future.|After a car accident I tried physical therapy, chiropractic care and orthopedic specialists with no satisfaction. Acupuncture was something I just didn't believe in but I reached a point where my pain was taking over my life. So I took a chance and I couldn't be more happy with the results. Now I have almost no pain and the movement in my back and neck have improved by 85%. It was the least invasive and least costly of all the treatments I tried. I personally feel five stars better.

column40:
The Advantage Health Group team works incredibly well together to do what they promise and advocate: to treat the whole person, not just symptoms. In less than 5 visits they have shown me different, holistic ways of using my body which in addition to the office visit treatments, have greatly improved my underlying conditions that I originally came in for. I'm also walking better, working out better and focusing on my overall health better! I highly recommend this team and especially their approach to wellness!|Absolutely phenomenal experience with Advantage Health Group. I had been training for the TC marathon and managed to injure my right hip. I came across their booth at the sports expo two days before the race.  I wasn't sure I'd be able to run it, but Dr. Davis worked his magic and I had almost instant relief.  I was able to complete the marathon and Dr. Davis and his team have been an integral part of helping me heal and become stronger.  Super grateful for their help, I couldn't be more pleased!|Every single person at Advantage Health Group is so friendly and super knowledgeable about everything in your body. The entire team takes time to see how your body is moving/hurting comes up with a game plan and an exercise to keep it from happening again. Super awesome place, I drive from 45 minutes away because they are so great.|Always a great experience at Advantage Health! Dr. Davis and Dr. Beau are awesome and the staff, too! Everyone there is so kind, friendly and supportive in your journey back to optimum health. I would highly recommend their services to anyone dealing with pain management.
Debbie Krenz|Advantage Health Group is in a class of their own! Their approach to healing pain is unlike any other.

I've battled with chronic pain for over 20 years. I'm a past competitive figure skater and while it was loads of fun, my body took a beating. I had a hip replaced 10 years ago, and while it fixed the obvious problem, it created other issues after it healed. Since seeing Dr Davis, my hip has never felt better! I've dealt with chronic lower back pain as well, and that has subsided too!

I learned to live with pain for years until I met Dr Davis, Dr Beau, Dr Ben, Allison and Katie. This team really cares about people and with the experience and knowledge they have, PEOPLE WILL LEAVE CHANGED...physically and mentally.

I cannot say enough positive things about Advantage Health Group. Superior!|Advantage Health Group is the real deal! I'm a long distance runner and had been suffering from persistent hip and shin pain for months before coming to them. I have several races on my schedule this year and was concerned that I would be sidelined and miss out on events I'd worked hard to qualify for. From the moment I started working with Dr. Davis, Allison and the team at Advantage, I knew I was in the right place. Dr. Davis approached my treatment methodically and focused on identifying the root cause of my problems vs. treating the symptoms. He paired in-clinic treatment with at-home drills that had direct and measurable impact. Over the course of my treatment, I was able to ramp up mileage and intensity without the pain returning. There were times when I'd come into an appointment truly flabbergasted by how effective the treatment was and how good I felt. The entire team is warm, welcoming and super knowledgeable. I cannot say enough good things about the professionals at Advantage Health Group. They do incredible work and exceed expectation.|I had been suffering from knee pain and Dr.Davis got to the bottom of it like a detective! Advantage Health Group really took the time to listen and come up with comprehensive plan for me.|It was September of 2022 when I was referred to Advantage Health Group. I spent the previous 3 years seeing everybody and trying everything to figure out why I was in so much pain. I had an X-Ray and an MRI and I saw four spine specialists, 3 physical therapists, a nerve specialist, a Gastrologist, and many women's health doctors. I couldn't workout, travel in a car for more than 30 minutes, or sleep without being in extreme pain. Nobody could figure it out until I came to Advantage Health Group.  I walked in and Tricia (Bless her heart) greeted me right away with a huge smile and made me feel very welcomed. Katey then sat down with me in a room and let me know the next steps and she calmed my nerves and let me know I was in good hands as another new Doctor was going to review my case. Dr. Licktieg came in and was the first Doctor in 3 years to spend more than 10 minutes with me. I think it ended up being an hour or so and he listened to my entire case and asked so many questions (which I appreciated). Nothing was missed and I finally had a diagnosis praise the Lord!  I spent the next several months being treated and regaining movement and flexibility. Dr. Bovre  then started working on strength exercises with me and I finally started feeling like myself again. Do your exercises people!  Dr. Davis Bates and Dr. Beau Bates also listened to my concerns and helped out whenever it was needed. It hasn't been an easy road but all four Doctors got me in every time I was in pain and sent me home without pain and more exercises to help reduce future pain. So to Dr. Davis Bates, Dr. Bovre, Dr. Lickteig, Dr. Beau Bates, Tricia, Katey, and Allison THANK YOU for giving me my life back. BEST DOCTORS IN THE WHOLE WORLD!

Overall it's good|I've been a patient of Dr. Vivek Barcley for over 3 1/2 years. I've also seen Nurse Practitioner, Randall. Dr. Barcley has done injections to my neck and back many times, provided pain relief and referrals when pain could not be controlled. His bedside manner and aptitude for quality care is excellent. The care I receive is far better than most. Yes, prepare for extremely long wait, at times. The wait is worth the care you receive.|The best and caring doctors and nursing professionals!!! The man knows me by name at his business and in the street. The man loves to help people and treats them like a person not a number! Thanks so much Mr. Vivek Barclay this world needs more people like you!!!!|I intended to give only one star but added another because they refunded me without (much) hassle.

Short version:
The waiting room is crowded and smells like dirty clothes.
Some of the staff show frustration and a lack of concern.
I waited nearly two hours before walking out.

Full version:
The first thing I noticed when entering the building was the smell, which reminded me of dirty clothes. The hard, plastic seats were crammed together to seat as many people as possible, and none of the receptionists seemed to notice me standing at the window for what felt like a full minute.

I had arrived fifteen minutes early for my 12:30 appointment, finished my paperwork and began what would become a long wait. Around 1:00, I asked to use the restroom, but the receptionist refused because of a drug screen. I waited another fifteen minutes and was again told to wait because I was next in line.

(During this time, one of the nurses called patients to the back. When she learned that one of them had stepped outside, she showed frustration on her face and let out a sigh. At first, I thought it was unprofessional but understandable, but by the end of my visit, I was more on the side of the patient.)

I was finally called back at 1:20 (fifty minutes late), and the nurse offered no apology or explanation. Instead, she hurtled through a series of questions and tests, and my annoyance became anger when she thrust the thermometer into my ear with no apparent regard for my personal space. Once finished, I was finally allowed to use the restroom.

Afterward, I was instructed to sit in one of the chairs lined against a wall, and when I saw the other patients, I couldn't help but think of that scene from The Wire in which the drug dealers bark at their customers to line up so they could be quickly processed.

I waited there until 2:00 and began to wonder if I should just leave. I had already decided I wouldn't be back, so there was no point waiting another hour, but I also didn't want to leave if I was next. I approached the receptionist to ask, but while I was in mid-sentence, she walked away to answer the phone. At that point, I was finished.

I approached another receptionist and told her I wanted to end my appointment and be refunded. However, I had already taken the drug screen, so I would be charged $65 or I could wait for the manager to come and waive the fees. I was told she was speaking with the doctor, so I stood at the counter for twenty minutes, and when she finally returned, it was from the Break Room!

(I should also note that while waiting, I overheard the first receptionist tell someone on the phone that he must arrive within fifteen minutes of his appointment, and I couldn't help but laugh out loud.)

The manager was kind and apologetic and waived the fees without any hassle. She also told me this kind of wait is typical for new patients, and I left (nearly two hours late) without seeing the doctor.|I have used Dr. Barclay for several years and he is a one of a kind doctor!!! He will sit down and discuss all of my problems and always gives me what he thinks best and I do everything he tells me.Once again a very nice and devoted pain doctor!!!|Dr Vivek Barkley is absolutely the best pain management doctor I have ever had. I've been in pain management for almost 20 years now, and going to Laurel Pain Clinic for the last 5 of those 20 years.  I travel 150 miles round trip (I live 25 miles south of Jackson, MS) to  see Dr Barkley and it's worth every mile.|Expect a long wait, once your vitals are taken you know you have another hour and a half until you are called back to see the doctor.  then you only have 30-45mins to wait for the doctor.  5-10mins with doc, then 30 mins waiting on your script to be written, then you can go.. Total Time 4-8 hours of waiting.

At South Central Pain Center, we recognize how difficult and challenging it can be living with chronic pain. Our facility in Laurel, MS is dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions with a focus on minimally-invasive procedures.

Expert Diagnosis & Treatment

Dr. Tariq specializes in accurately assessing pain generators to develop personalized treatment plans that go beyond medication management. Unlike many pain clinics that rely solely on pain medications with limiting side effects, we offer advanced interventional procedures designed to:

  • Minimize chronic pain conditions

  • Reduce reliance on opioid medications

  • Improve overall quality of life

  • Facilitate return to daily activities

Our goal at South Central Pain Center is to help you GET BACK TO LIVING through innovative treatments that address the root cause of your pain. We combine medical expertise with compassionate care to ensure each patient receives the attention they deserve. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call +1 601-425-7500 to schedule your consultation at our Jefferson Street location.
column11: At South Central Pain Center, we recognize how difficult and challenging it can be living with chronic pain. Accurate diagnosis is essential for the most favorable treatment outcomes. Our goal at South Central Pain Center is to help you get back to your everyday life using minimally-invasive procedures to minimize pain and reduce reliance on opioid medications. GET BACK TO LIVING.

column40: I have used Dr. Edwin Dodd for approximately 15 years with major low back and pain issues. Dr. Dodd has consistently resolved my back pain issues and reduced my back pain from an 8 to 10 (on scale of 10) pain level to a 0-2 level. I ride horses, haul hay, hunt, snow ski, and work out lifting weights. I am a very rough and tumble guy. My quality of life changed drastically for the better with Dr. Dodd's professional expertise and medical help.Highest ratings for this doctor.|I've been a patient of Dr. Dodd's for years.  He always takes the time to listen to my concerns and explains everything thoroughly! I would highly recommend Dr. Dodd to anyone looking for a pain management doctor!|I want to start by saying Dr.D was a nice doctor that seem to genuinely care for his patients. Unfortunately, that desire to help may of stretched him into an area of practice that he didn't have much if any training in. If referred to him for spinal CSF leak treatment I'd urge you to look else where. During my procedure I ended up with a spinal puncture that caused an additional spinal CSF leak. It took getting to a speciality clinic (Duke, Durham NC) to find and patch this puncture. While reviewing the case notes it was mentioned that the wrong size needle (way too big) was used for patching increasing the chances of an additional puncture. Additionally following this procedure there was no after care which I now know is extremely important. Sweet doctor but not a spinal CSF leak doctor.|I recently made a change from neurospine to Dr. Dodd.   If you are tired of being "just the next person in line",  make the switch. As Mississippi's #1 Medical Marijuana Card Referral Clinic, we provide comprehensive care with multiple statewide locations to serve patients throughout the region. At Pause Pain & Wellness, we go beyond simply getting you approved for your medical cannabis card - we're dedicated to providing ongoing support for your symptoms and treatment journey.

Why Choose Our Medical Marijuana Clinic

We take pride in being the only clinic in Mississippi with statewide locations staffed exclusively by Mississippi healthcare providers. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Expert medical marijuana card evaluations

  • Ongoing compliance support with Mississippi law

  • Personalized treatment guidance

  • Renewal assistance to maintain your card

column48: How can medical marijuana improve my health?
column49:
Medical cannabis benefits patients who suffer from a variety of conditions. It can reduce inflammation, treat pain symptoms, reduce nausea and vomiting, relax tight muscles, and increase appetite, among other benefits. If you have a question about a specific benefit, consult your doctor.

The following conditions are approved for medical cannabis use in Mississippi:

Cancer
Parkinson's disease
Huntington's disease
Muscular dystrophy
Glaucoma
Spastic quadriplegia
Positive status for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
Acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)
Hepatitis
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
Crohn's disease
Ulcerative colitis
Sickle-cell anemia
Alzheimer's disease
Agitation of dementia
Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)
Autism
Pain refractory to appropriate opioid management
Diabetic/peripheral neuropathy
Spinal cord disease or severe injury

Be careful they will drop you out of the blue. I saw Dr. Marshall in December and she was suppose to call in my message. Well she never did so I went up there to see why well she dropped me abs I had been going there for over 10 years. She gave me a paper showing all kinds of drugs in my test. If I had that in my system they would have said something before now but they never did. When I saw Dr. Marshall she was friendly and did not say anything about something being in my system. They made me go without my medicine all of at once. It's been hard. They done me awful with me being their patient for over 10 years. If anything was in my system it could have came from when I was in the hospital. I've been in and out the hospital every few days and they new that. Just a little warning be careful if you choose to go there.|They are a joke.  Their system is down and cannot send prescriptions to pharmacy.  When left office said it would be fixed in 45 minutes.  It has now been over 36 hours.  No prescription at pharmacy yet and do not answer the phone.  Writing this for a friend.  How can a doctor do this and why not write them a prescription when they leave the office?  Wow and this is a pain clinic.|The doctors are great at this clinic but the staff is lazy and won't answer the phones and won't return phone calls so you can get your prescriptions filled and  not very professional when answering the phone when they do decide to answer the phone. They're mistake can follow me anywhere I go. If you somewhere else to go I suggest you do.|NOPE! Was scheduled for surgery and they didn't send over my paper work! HIPPA violations with insurance cards laying on the front counter desk with IDS and full Medicaid card information for one! My husband and I took off work for the procedure only to find out I was never scheduled with the hospital! I waited over 2 hours and the office never sent over the paper work! I left and went elsewhere! What happen to people doing what they are paid to do? My husband and I lost vacation time and money because we took off! Dr Marshall is amazing and speaks to me like I'm a person not just a number. She is very thorough having found an infection missed my several of my other physicians. Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Oxford, MS

At Progressive Health Pain & Wellness, we utilize a comprehensive, multimodal approach to managing a multitude of chronic painful conditions. As specialists in interventional pain medicine, we treat pain directly at its source through minimally invasive procedures, offering lasting relief where traditional methods fall short. Our goal is to help patients achieve meaningful improvements in pain relief, physical function, and quality of life while minimizing reliance on medications that can lead to dependency issues. We proudly offer:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management (with focus on reducing dependency)

  • Behavioral therapy approaches

  • Comprehensive rehabilitation programs

Our expert team develops personalized treatment plans addressing each patient's unique pain challenges. Located at 2215 Jefferson Davis Dr in Oxford, MS, we're committed to providing effective solutions for those suffering from chronic pain. Learn more about our innovative approaches at Progressive Health Pain & Wellness or call us at +1 662-638-0462 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
We utilize a comprehensive, multimodal approach to the management of a multitude of chronic painful conditions. We offer a vast array of treatments including: procedures, medication, behavioral, and rehabilitative efforts.

"Interventional" pain medicine is our specialty which allows us to treat pain where it originates with minimally invasive procedures.

We look to achieve treatment goals (pain relief, improved physical function, enhanced quality of life) while minimizing the role of medications which can result in chemical dependency and addiction.

column48: Why is my husband Bill  Merritt in so much pain. WHEN HE TAKES HIS PAIN PILLS. HE CAN NOT SLEEP OR ENJOY LIFE. WHY CAN YOU NOT DO SOMETHING TO HELP HIM. .He needs help. He. Is your  patient
column49:
Hi Katherine I am sorry your husband is going through this I have a similar situation. 
Pain pills are just a mask. They don't kill the pain 
We have to find the root of the problem and change diets don't smoke do physical therapy water therapy I find helps but doesn't rid of it. Inflammation medication may help. Ice packs help. You have to work on habits believe me I have had a time with it. It's not easy ! Be consistent at it. Find what eases it. Start saying it ! That it helps when you find something that does help.  We also have to change our way of thinking. It's a battle I have been dealing with for 9 years.
Our mental wellness effects us to on how we feel and hurt. 
Get busy ! Put your mind on a project or something. Get it off of self ! 
Every little thing we do helps. Pray !,

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Tupelo

At North Mississippi Regional Pain Consultants, we provide specialized care for patients suffering from a wide range of painful conditions. Our comprehensive approach addresses both chronic and acute pain through personalized treatment plans. We're committed to improving quality of life for patients throughout North Mississippi with our expert pain management services. Located at 4381 S Eason Blvd, Suite 101 in Tupelo, our facility offers advanced treatments for:

  • Addiction and substance use disorders

  • Neck and back pain (pre and post-surgical)

  • Chronic muscle pain with cramping, soreness, and spasms

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Carpal tunnel syndrome

Our team of dedicated pain management physicians works diligently to develop individualized treatment strategies that address the root cause of your pain. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website or call us at (662) 377-5199.

column40:
Don't waste your time here. I was in severe pain in lower back and right leg. I called them and was given an appointment 2 weeks out. Nothing was done but a drug test and an appointment for a MRI, which took an additional week. Waited 2 weeks from the original appointment for a follow up and to get a resolution started. My drug test was clean and MRI results were L5 at S1 has mild buldge pushing on nerves to right leg. I was literally 10 minutes away on the day of appointment and they called to say the provider canceled my appointment. I was given no further explanation, only told that that the nurse would get the message when they were out of clinic. They didn't even offer a reschedule. Keep in mind I never received any pain management at all.|The wait time is ridiculous even with an early morning appt. I had an 8 Am appt and didn't get in til 9. Then they took patients ahead of me to schedule the next test. My time is as valuable as theirs.|These people are awesome. Especially the
CNP who changed my life monorterig my pain situation. I would recommend this facility to anyone who suffers with pain|Can only rate this place based on my provider there. The provider was Nicole Taylor, like many of the others I would give a zero if allowed. She was hateful from the start, I guess old white man is not her preferred demographic, or at least the way I was made to feel by her. She wrote me a prescription that 3 different pharmacist said they had not seen in over a year.  They thought it was discontinued. Then changed  that to one, that only one place had and it was almost six hundred dollars. Ask her to change back to what I had, so I would have something. She refused and left me with nothing. Don't bother calling the CARE number, some woman called back claiming to be manager for the place,  all she did is start telling me I was wrong.  Called back to CARE LINE NEVER HEARD A WORD,  I do have a question, if a provider put in visit notes that certain things were discussed, but in reality the subject was never mentioned is that not falsifying records?

Edit:  if you notice in NMMC response to me they invited me to contact them through the website.  I did fill out the form on Monday night. Tuesday,Wednesday and now Thursday afternoon and nothing. They just want to look like they care.|The best group on people I have ever experienced. Dr. Windham and his staff honestly care about your well being. These people have restored my faith in the medical industry. I have been the multiple times and it has always been a great experience.

Jason Throop|I am deeply disappointed by the quality of service I experienced at North MS Regional Pain Consultants. My recent encounter was the worst experience I have ever had. Scheduling appointments was a cumbersome process, often requiring weeks of waiting. Furthermore, the care provided by the NP's was subpar, with unnecessary tests being ordered solely for billing purposes, leading to prolonged physical therapy sessions with minimal benefit. The nurses exhibited unprofessional behavior, displaying rudeness and a lack of preparedness, as evidenced by their failure to review my medical history before appointments. This negligence was further highlighted by a misinterpretation of my drug test results, indicating positive for medications I had recently been prescribed postpartum. The overall disorganization and lack of communication within the office only compounded my frustration, resulting in unnecessary confusion and numerous follow-up calls. This experience falls far below the standard of care expected. The overall disorganization, lack of communication, and rudeness within the office are deeply concerning, leading to confusion and frustration.|The back procedure I endured was a three step process. It was necessary to complete each step and have certain results to proceed to the next step. The third step is where the desired maximum pain relief occurs. I completed the first two steps and met with the nurse practitioner to discuss the third step. It was only then that I was told positive results could last from four months to four years. WOW. I was not willing to go to the expense and pain for a possible four months of relief. I should have this information to make an informed decision up front. Perhaps it was withheld on purpose because if all patients knew this business might be drastically reduced.|I just want to say that my mom is now clean of all narcotics that you tried to keep her on when she did not need to be. You had her addicted to all kinds of pain medication's, and tranquilizers and fentanyl. I detoxed her at home twice. Remember me the first time I got her off of everything then you turned around and put her on it again. Well, I detoxed her the second time after I threw a fit and made you tear up all of her fentanyl patches she is a year, clean and doing very well thanks to me, and the good Lord above.  Never again will you try to kill my mother!  Money, Making hungry people who care about no one!

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in Hattiesburg, MS

At Advanced Pain Therapy, we provide specialized pain management solutions under the expert guidance of our medical director, Dr. Todd Sitzman. With his extensive credentials including board certification in both anesthesiology and pain medicine, Dr. Sitzman brings exceptional expertise to our practice. We offer a comprehensive approach to pain treatment through:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Neuromodulation therapies

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Collaborative care coordination

Dr. Sitzman's distinguished background includes medical and public health degrees from Tulane University, specialized training at the University of Virginia Health Sciences Center, and leadership as past president of multiple professional organizations including the North American Neuromodulation Society and American Academy of Pain Medicine. Our clinic is conveniently located at 7125 US-98 in Hattiesburg, where we're committed to helping patients find effective relief from chronic pain conditions. Learn more about our services at Advanced Pain Therapy or call us at (601) 450-7246 to schedule a consultation.
column11: Dr. Sitzman is medical director of Advanced Pain Therapy, a comprehensive pain clinic located in Hattiesburg, MS. He received his medical and master of public health degrees from Tulane University, New Orleans. Following an internal medicine internship at the Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania, he received anesthesiology and pain management training at the University of Virginia Health Sciences Center in Charlottesville, VA. Dr. Sitzman is board certified in anesthesiology and pain medicine. Dr. Sitzman is past president of the North American Neuromodulation Society, American Academy of Pain Medicine, Southern Pain Society, Mississippi Pain Society and the Mississippi Society of Interventional Pain Physicians.

column40:
I am a caregiver for a former patient and unfortunately, we had several bad experiences. One was when they put a spinal stimulator in and told me she had to take medication right when she got home but after asking about the prescription twice found out there was no prescription and ended up having to wait hours because office staff didn't feel it was important to alert a physician. Then, patient was treated like an active drug addict but wasn't on any narcotics. They told the patient she needed a hip replacement but that took time since she is 100% reliant on me and my husband so we
Had to wait until her out of pocket was met. They told her about the pain but offered no help until we saw Dr. Burns. He was willing to help her. After she healed from hip surgery THE PATIENT asked to be taken off of pain medication but spoke to him about spasms in her muscles so they agreed to keep her on muscle relaxers. She explained the ones she was currently taking seemed to be too strong and asked if they could try another one to see if that helped. They didn't. So we went back but this time we saw Ashley who had a tendency not to listen. She told the patient that she wouldn't change the muscle relaxer back to what it originally was instead of talking to doctor burns at her earliest convenience and made her feel like she was being treated like a drug addict once again. We were released by the end of the week because I just couldn't take Ashley treating her like that anymore.

Please find other care. This just isn't it. I have saved a few people who have been referred to them from their unfair treatment and blind eyes and I would hope whoever sees this will take this review as a warning. Total Pain Care as a whole just doesn't care. Ashley doesn't care. We have since found a better option and quality care and the patient is thriving compared to what she was under Ashley. We are pleased with the results since being fired by this clinic.|Horrible service! Dr cook, was scheduled to see patients and do surgery in the same day, so location was changed and was NOT aware.  Other patients had been waiting 2 hours plus. Secretary said it was unprofessional also. I was 15-30 late due to a wreck occurring IN FRONT of me and stopped to help the injured woman out of her car WHILE the woman was pinned in the vehicle and had to take a sawzal and cut the vehicle to get her out. Had to cut her out and keep her conscious and wound up a little later than expected.|My mother-in-law went for her first appointment and it was a nightmare! The doctor was rude, wouldn't take the time to listen, and when she continued asking questions she was told if she complained they would refuse to see her at all. When you're in pain from 4 metal joints and an arthritic ridden body at 77 years old, you should be allowed to complain as much as you wish! Doctors make enough money to listen and actually care for their patients. These folks just want you in and out. They took x-rays as she was LEAVING! Those are needed before and during the appointment, so that's an obvious money grab. To say the least, we're taking her elsewhere. Don't waste your time on this place. The bad reviews are true|I couldn't ask for better care!! Erin Farmer is absolutely amazing and truly cares about her patients. Dr. Tyler Burns performs my surgeries and he's so down to earth. My nurse Shannon is hands down the sweetest. From the minute my husband and I are checked in to the time we leave, we are treated with respect and listened to. They have gone above and beyond for the both of us.|My experience at the center was OK. The man at the reception desk was kind as were the nurses in the surgical center. I drove 3 hours and was told by the intake group that I likely wouldn't see a doctor today because I was 15 minute late. Whatever, it was 10. I was seen and had a cervical epidural that did not take.

Later, I received a bill for an additional $541 for "office fees," so be sure you inquire about those before you agree to services. The woman in billing was condescending and plain RUDE. She must have a miserable life. Bless her. :(|It's not my favorite, they act like we are criminals, I loved dr Cook, & dr. Oliver, my new NP is ok.|I didn't like the service at all the staff wasn't pleasant and the doctor didn't listen to my complaints did do any exam I was there for my pain medication to be renewed and she gave me nerves pills that I clearly said I was allergic to. So I know the doctor dies not care and seem to care more for the white patient more chipper and friendly and they just walk to the front counter pick up oxycodone rx and sell them in the parking lot I have video I sent it to the police office next door but nothing happened|This place has gone through some changes but it literally saved my life. The nurse practitioners I saw were always compassionate and helpful (Emily was the last one - she is excellent). I was referred to their Meridian location where I got stem cell treatment from Dr. Pearson in my spine discs and it changed my life for the better. I still have some minor issues but I didn't need to keep going monthly to the doctor. In fact I haven't been back in over 3 years. It was an expensive procedure that most people can't consider I'm sure, but I haven't spent money on appointments, prescriptions, and time off, so it's basically paid for itself.

column40:
Very professional.   Hope the regimen of treatment
Is successful.   I have been hurting for awhile while waiting on an appointment.|Dr. McLeod has been instrumental in helping me with the chronic pain I have from an injury. I have been seeing him for 6 years now and am so thankful for all his help. He and his staff truly care about their patients and want what is best for them.|Been going to Dr. McLeod since 2020. I changed my insurance to Humana, he got really upset, and even raised his voice to me!! Told the nurse to not put the IV in, and asked me why I changed insurance!!! Said I could pay for the procedure and let insurance company reimburse me! Told me Humana wasn't any good, and everyone was going to stop taking it!! I was there for injections in my back! It was even a couple sitting on the other side of the screen who were also shocked the way he talked to me, as the nurse was also! After that his office totally changed towards me!! I was supposed to get an appointment to get nerves burned in my back, didn't hear from them after two weeks, so I called . Jessica his nurse told me the insurance denied the procedure!! I called the insurance company, it hadn't been denied, Dr. McLeod canceled it! They just out and lied! I got the insurance company to send me a copy of it!! I called his office again and spoke with Jessica about my concerns of being discriminated against because of my insurance, and what she told me wasn't true!!! Also told her I'd find another Doctor because I didn't feel safe with Dr. McLeod doing anything to me!! After the way I was being treated, I'm not taking any chances! She said ok! Never even tried to deny anything!! I'm still just in shock over it! They acted very unethical. Mississippi Sports Medicine takes Humana PPO, but Dr. McLeod doesn't like it! I have filed a grievance with my insurance company!! And have contacted MSM about how I was treated! McLeod knows he was wrong, and he knows exactly what I'm talking about!!!|I was highly impressed with Dr. McLeod and staff. He listened attentively to me as his patient. I was well pleased with his diagnosis of my condition and I do believe I'm in great hands.|Dr. Carroll McLeod has a fantastic personality and very pleasant when explaining how he needs to proceed with your treatment. column40:
After my NP left the practice, I was assigned to Ashley, NP. She cares nothing about where I'm hurting or why. All she cares about are your pill numbers & reducing the number she prescribes. As an RN, I understand there are other factors like the CDC & their corporate office, but they could actually as if they gave a crap about the patient. My previous NP was awesome & I tried to give Ashley a fair shake, but she's an ice cold person or seems to be anyway. Thinking of getting a new dr.|Its obvious that the doctors, nurses & staff here really care for each & every patient. I have been very impressed with the care that I've received.
In the time I have been at this clinic, I've been seen by both doctors & Ashley, NP. Each one has always taken as much time with me as I need, answering every question; it's obvious that they are on top of the latest information re: medication options, procedures, and they have a great understanding not only of pain & how it affects individuals differently, but they also follow rules & regulations to a "T". This is such a great relief to me, as I've had doctors before who prescribed me any old thing, & it was more detrimental than it was helpful.
They give assessments regularly, in order to follow their patients' mental, physical & daily living state. CPS even has a program to assist with daily life for those limited by pain.
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. My other doctors told me I would never be able to walk again, & would be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of my life. Because of the time, treatment & resolve of the doctors at CPS, I am now medication-free, & am able to skip, jump & run!|Long Wait Times, Ignored while waiting
My husband was a new patient with appt at 2:30, we arrived at that time and proceeded to wait. After about an hour, he was called back to give his 'sample' and told to sit in another location which is basically a hallway. That wait was another 2 1/2 hours. I'm not really sure why I waited so long but I finally said to a nurse..His appt was at 2:30, she let me check and came back and said they will get you in a minute. Well, the minute turned into another half hour when he was finally brought to a room.
During all of this waiting in the hallway, not one person seemed to notice that we had been there that long or cared. People were walking back and forth past us, including the doctor who I didn't know would be my husband's.
Once back, the nurse said we have been running behind since this morning. OK, why not called the patients and have them arrive later so they are not waiting for 5 hours. We left the office at 6:00 pm.
Haven't heard from them about a CT that is supposed to be scheduled.|I had my first appointment today and the people was very very nice and friendly I'm gonna like going there great job staff.|After being called to come in early because of cancellations, I sat and waited for an hour without ever being seen by Ashley, NP...I complained to several people and was ignored|Not accepting State insurance plans. My only complaints are that the parking is absolutely TERRIBLE and some of the staff are little bit rude.|Care is good. They call patients by last name only. It's impersonal bordering on rude. A pleasant expression or smile would be nice.|Overcharged me $70 for office visit.  Been over a month and all I get are promises and lies.  Cost me about $500 for a pain block procedure that did absolutely nothing.  Most of the staff are very nice.  Just know before you go.  Will update if I ever get the money owed to me back.  Finally got the $70 overcharge back.  Took many calls and about 2 months.   My advice at this point is, don't believe what Dr Martin tells you.  I'm not saying he lied on purpose, just saying,  the pain block procedure can cost you hundreds, even thousands of dollars with no guarantee you will get any relief. He gets paid either way.|Had a procedure done to alleviate nerve pain in left leg caused by pinching in the spine.  Worked long enough to start physical therapy through different provider.  Total Pain is not  upfront about the co-pay cost of the procedure.  I was told one amount before having it done only be told later that the amount I paid was only half of the co-pay.|I was in pain for at least a year before my general practitioner sent me to Total Pain and I am so thankful that he did. It is about a year later and recently had a stimulator implanted and it was a game changer. It has absolutely given me back my life. I can now do more than sit and be miserable. I am walking again for exercise, I can shop for myself and my family, I am able to do housework again and enjoy my hobbies. I never had a bad experience at the clinic and everyone was always helpful and compassionate. If anyone from the clinic is reading this, thankyou from the bottom of my heart. I could never express what you all have done for me.|The nurses and staff seem ok and mostly friendly but there us one front office staff that tries to give us a hard time. They don't send appointment reminders and don't communicate as well as they should. Front office staff lady tried to tell us we weren't on a family members paperwork but we were there when she put us on it. Turns out she didn't look.|I was a patient for approx. 11 yrs. for a herniated disc in my neck. I was seeing Gayle for my follow ups until she retired in April 2022, I started seeing Danielle, she told me on my second visit that I needed a current MRI or she wouldn't be able to continue to prescribe my medication because the DEA had gotten strict about it . She didn't mention that on my first visit. She was rude & disrespectful and when she started to exam me I asked her not to squeeze my neck because it would hurt she did it anyway saying she had to access me. The purpose of squeezing my neck was to see if it was tender, sense I told her it would hurt  it was not necessary to cause me pain. I really didn't know what to do at this point, I was upset & confused. I decided to call Robin, the office manager to see if I could see another NP & explained my issue I had with Danielle. She spoke with Dr. Pierce and  he agreed with Danielle that a current MRI was necessary and wanted me to give her another chance. I told Robin I'd think about it & let her know. She said to call to set up MRI before my next appt.  I really thought about it. I spoke with Medicare ( my health coverage ) and they didn't know anything about restrictions and having a current MRI as I have been receiving treatment based on my original MRI. I just couldn't go back & see Danielle. At this point I was upset as to why she was disrespectful, rude & caused me physical pain and , at this time, after these many years couldn't continue writing me prescriptions without a MRI. I called Robin & left her a voice message ( she didn't answer the phone) and let her know I couldn't continue seeing Danielle and I was canceling my up coming appt. which I immediately did.|I remember what Dr. Pearson said when I first went to see him. " I may not be able to cure you but I can help you have a better quality of life". They have done that for many years and I am thankful for them.

column40:
I agree, wholeheartedly with all of the bad reviews about the office staff at Suncoast pain management. I was speaking to a friendly person in this office about my appointment with Dr. Chen and when she put me on hold another person named Renee picked up and asked if I was Shannon to which I said no, and she said well you don't have to get an attitude!, Which was extremely rude.! I just wonder if Dr. Chen and his associates know how his staff treats his patients, and I will definitely be sure to let him know. In my opinion, you don't treat people on the phone like that you don't know who you're talking to when you do that it's not a good practice . I am 72 years old and certainly didn't deserve to be treated like that.|I have been under the care of Sun Coast for close to 8 years I believe and my joint disease has gone from a unexplained moderate/severe cervical spine dysfunction and fibromyalgia to bilateral thumb joint deterioration, ankle and knee joint issues. Due to my NP's advanced and thorough knowledge of the somatic disease progression...I was referred to the right specialists and recently achieved a science based and lab confirmed diagnosis of moderate rheumatoid arthritis and Sjogren's Syndrome. I would never have achieved these answers had it not been for the willingness to listen and advocate for my care shown by my NP....and not simply administer meds to mask the disease progression. I now require further extensive treatment and the goal is remission, but I am grateful to have dedicated care and concern and ability to ease my ever growing pain along the way.|I have used Joe Chen MD and staff several times. I have been satisfied with everything they have done for me. They know what they are doing.|P.A. Meeks awesome however, the office manager terminated my care because I needed 2! Days 2 two days to come up with a 25$ payment. I had caught up and owed $25 and they called me on the 1st and said they needed that $25 or they were going to terminate there services I asked if it could be payed on the 3rd because that's when I get payed and the answer was no now or your letter gets mailed out today. So now I'm having issues from the treatment I got from them and can't be seen. That being said if the doc knows about this practice then I'll have to give it a 1 star.|18 months of pain pills, do to a mess up on a back procedure at singing river health system. I seen Dr Chin 1 time in 18 months all they did for me was push pills at me. All they care about is the money they can pull from you and the insurance company! And when you protest about the way you are being treated they will fake a bad UA to get you out the door before you become a issue, matter of fact they will call you day's later and say there was a problem on your last UA even though if there was it would show the day you dropped it. Beware of this place and the way they handle things.|I'd like to give ZERO stars due to the lack of customer SERVICE. I returned a phone call that I received, the person that answered the phone said "just a minute" and placed me on hold, I was on hold for NINETEEN MINUTES! That is NOT good customer SERVICE!
If the office was busy and I do understand offices can get busy and a customer may be placed on hold for a moment BUT NOT NINETEEN MINUTES, at least come back and acknowledge the caller, say I'm sorry we're busy at the moment may I take your information and someone will call you back?

No one did that! I finally hung up and called back; after this second call back and a few minutes someone answered the phone, I told her I was previously on hold for 19 minutes she didn't care, I said no worries about my injection, the injection did not work and I will not be returning to this office again....

No one should be put on hold for 19 minutes. The proper customer service telephone etiquette would be 1-2 minutes tops , NOT 19 minutes AND at least come back to the phone to acknowledge the caller/customer: "I do apologize we are very busy at the moment, may I take down your phone number and someone will give you a call back as soon as possible, if not today then tomorrow." ZERO stars for "Suncoast Pain Management"|I cant be more happy with the results of my injections, won't have to be on pain pills the rest of my like. Really helpful staff, Michelle Graham is the best ! Dr. Chin really really seems to care about his patients.  Nursing staff really nice and good at what they do|Apparently short staffed. I was asked to have my paperwork done and to arrive early.  I followed directions but was not seen at the time of my appointment.   This is a huge unconvincing as sitting in unconfirmed chairs for extended times is extremely painful for me.  After waiting 1-1/2 hours and patients arriving after me were seen and left. I was finally asked for urine sample then left to wait even longer.
A doctors appt should never last more than hour from time of arrival to exit
I  had no choice but don't recommend this clinic.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr. McCoy for almost two year.  I am a real mess, 2 bad back surgeries, a torn rotator cuff, both knees are bone on bone.  Also my sciatica is covered in arthritis.  All these issues are many years old.  I lived in Southern California and had no money after the first botched back surgeries.  I also have Lupus SLE.  And I am a heart patient.  After my quadruple bypass surgery I had to sell my house in Southern California to pay my debts and wound up moving to Tennessee to live with very close friends.  I live my life in pain and at my age 74 1/2 not much can be done.  Dr. McCoy is such a calm man he is just relaxing to be around.  Since I am a chronic patient I now see his Nurse Practitioner and Candace is also a very calm person.  I highly recommend this office.  I am in a wheelchair and the staff are just so kind!|I have used Dr. McCoy for pain management for a while, and he was trying to improve the results of my treatment by doing a simple procedure he does quite frequently. Unfortunately, due to my health condition, during the procedure, things did not go as planned. But through his expertise and level headedness, he literally saved my life. Through the whole procedure I could hear him talking to me, keeping me calm, and in a dire situation, that is the best you can hope for. The medical profession does not get the praise it should, but this wonderful man should get the largest award for being such an incredible Dr!!! Thank you Dr. McCoy, for being such a great Dr. and a caring and compassionate person!!!|Been on 200 mg  Lyrica 3 times a day for my neuropathy in my feet for 4yrs I see him one time and he prescribed me 30 Lyrica for the month,needless to say I ran out after ten days so I called my pharmacy and they said my other 2 refills I got are for only 3 capsules for the month my feet burn so bad I can't even work now! I've been trying to get him to correct my prescription for 2 weeks and still have not fixed it no reason no nothing I wouldn't recommend him to my dead mother|They are very friendly and care about they patients if you need pain management this is the place to go. Like for instance,I was told I had alcohol in my system which was beer. The only reason for that was because,I was told by one of the nurses at the Granada,MS. Hospital because it could be helpful for my blatter and kidney. Which I just had a prostate urolift procedure on 10/08/2024. I'm trying to see what's wrong with alcohol being in your system just because I'm taking painkillers for my pain that I have do to a neck fusion surgery. I can understand if I was a drug addict or a person who abused drugs,but I'm neither and have no record of being one.
