There are some sweet people working at this clinic and the flowood clinic but frankly neither of these clinics (overall) really care about their patients. I'm not the type of person to leave reviews but I felt like I needed to do so now. There is no communication between doctors and patients or at least in my experience. He called in some medication a while back and I was never informed after I was told they would get back in contact with me. (I wasn't able to go to work for two days because I wasn't able to sit for more than 10-15 minutes). I have called multiple times to leave a message for the doctor and it was never put in. About a month ago he told me he was going to refer me to a different doctor. I never heard anything back so I called back to the office today and spoke to one of the receptionist at the flowood and she told me that a referral was sent to a completely different office I don't necessarily want to go there but at this point it's fine I just want to be treated and figure out what's wrong. There definitely needs to be more communication through the clinic with the patients. I wish the best for these offices and hope everything gets situated. A big shoutout goes to Debbie at the flowood clinic for being so kind and understanding every time I would call.
*update turns out the referral was never sent so idk if it just got lost or it was never sent all together idk but it all goes back to the fact of communication|Dr.Cook has given me the ability to say yes I can again! As Mississippi's leading interventional pain management healthcare provider, we at Kevin L. Vance, M.D. CPC are dedicated to identifying and treating the root cause of your pain rather than just masking symptoms. Our comprehensive approach allows us to provide long-term relief for our patients through targeted interventions and personalized care plans. With our state-of-the-art facility in Madison, our team of specialists delivers compassionate care using advanced techniques in pain management.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating a wide range of painful conditions, including:

  • Arthritis and Bursitis

  • Degenerative Disc Disease and Herniated Discs

  • Sciatica and Radiculopathy

  • Neuropathic Pain and Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy

  • RSD/CRPS/Causalgia and Post-Surgical Pain

  • Facet Arthropathy and Sacroiliitis

  • Myofascial Pain and Piriformis Syndrome

Visit our comprehensive pain management center or call us at +1 769-300-0730 to schedule a consultation at our convenient location: 129 Fountains Blvd, Madison, MS 39110. We combine Dr. Vance's expertise as both an anesthesiologist and pain management physician to develop effective treatment strategies that help our patients reclaim their quality of life.
column11:
CPC is the local leading interventional pain management healthcare provider in Mississippi. Our focus is to identify and treat the root cause of your pain so we are treating the problem and not the symptoms of your pain. As a result, we are able to provide our patients with long-term relief.

Common Conditions Treated: Arthritis, Bursitis, Chronic Whiplash, Coccydynia, Degenerative Disc Disease, Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy, Facet Arthropathy, Herniated Disc, Ischemic Pain, Myofascial Pain, Neuropathic Pain, Occipital Neuralgia, Phantom Limb Pain, Piriformis Syndrome, Post Herpetic Neuralgia, Post-Surgical Pain, Radiculopathy, RSD/CRPS/Causalgia, Sacroiliitis, Sciatica, and Shingles.

The doctor after two stimulators put the third one in and he put it in and it's and it is stimulating my upper chest, not my lower legs and I specifically told him that if he is going to put it in make sure he does not put it in and have it stimulate in the same area. I am very dissatisfied with him and his death and his friends Dr Coleman and his cohorts that said I said bad things about Dr T I just told the truth period they could not program it properly answer the programmer gave up. Now I can't get any Orthopedics in the area because of this. And he had a family problem but he kept me waiting for 12 days and I just decided not to have him anymore because he's screwed up again what was screwed up before|My orthopedist referred me to this doctor for what I thought was going to be injections for pain my ankle. He examined my ankle and diagnosed with primary osteoarthritis, but failed to inject. He instead prescribed Celebrex.. I left the practice, shaking my head, because I thought I was supposed to be getting pain relief. When I went back to the orthopedist and told her what happened, she seemed to be confused. As time went on, my pain kept increasing. I asked her to refer me back to him. She referred me back to him, but he wanted to give me injections in my back. He said that the pain in my ankle was coming from pinched nerves in my back.  The orthopedist told him that I had an EMG test that was remarkably abnormal. His wife, the nurse practitioner, told me that she wanted to give me the injection just to rule out that the pain in my ankle was not coming from my back.  The way they treated me was the epitome of gaslighting. I got up and left the practice telling them that there is no way they're going to give me an injection in my back just rule out that the pain in my ankle is not coming from my back. That is the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard of. Needless to say, I left, and I will not be returning because I don't want to be anybody's, guinea pig.|I'm a 64 yr. old woman w/ chronic back pain (arthritis). After 2 tests (his words) and final treatment I've had no relief. During my followup appt. Dr. T insisted I was no longer in pain. I was in tears and so intimidated.
After all the humiliation  & money I now have to search out a 2nd opinion looking for a decent quality of life.|Dr. Tomajian is the best of the best. column40:
Dr Harris is a JOKE!!! She is arrogant and gets off on making people feel like they don't matter. I took my services to another clinic and am 1000x's happier. The worst thing they EVER did was make her the only physician there. Everyone I know that has went there has left and gone to another clinic. It stinks for the nice people that they do still have working there.|I don't usually write reviews, but this place is ridiculous.  From the very first appointment.  I get there about 10mins early, walk in and there are about 5 people in front of me.  2 clerks at the desk and one is on her cell phone with a call, that was not business related from what I could hear, 10 minutes later she decides that it's time to help out.  After my appointment I was scheduled for injections for pain.  The day before my appointment for injections I get a call to tell me what time the appointment will be and that I will have a $100+ copay.  I informed them that VA would be paying for everything.  They rescheduled my appointment for a month later so that they could get the authorization code.  Today is the day before my new appointment, a month later, and they still don't have the authorization code because they did absolutely nothing, so now it looks like the appointment will be cancelled again.

Second issue was my pain meds.  I went to my appointment on a Thursday and waited in the lobby for a good 2 hours for a 10 minute appointment with the Doc just so that he could verify that I am on 4 separate medications.  I get my 2 pain med prescriptions that can't be called in and leave.  I have 2 other meds in my file that needed to be refilled that should be called in since I am still taking them.  I go to pick up meds on Friday afternoon, and medication is not there, because no one had called them in.  Call Docs office first thing Monday morning to get my meds called in and the Doc and nurse out for the week.  I was informed that I cannot get the meds filled and the other Doc in the office, who I am scheduled to see in 2 weeks, wont fill them because they have never seen me.  I had to go a full week without the meds that I needed.  The following Monday morning the Docs office calls and asks me what pharmacy I use so they could call in the medication.  Monday afternoon I call the pharmacy to verify that meds are ready and nothing has been called in.  So I call the Docs office to find out what is going on, and without asking name or anything, I am told that it could take 1-2 days to call in the medication.  Overall this place has been horrible to deal with.  I live in Meridian and was looking forward to not having to drive an hour and a half.  But at this point I would just about drive to the moon.|The best treatment you can get, the Doctors and nurses, also staff are more than helpful, and they will go out of there way to do more than expected  than any other hospital I've ever been to, Thank you all and the best of luck to all at Rush|Wrong diagnosis and charged me for a shot I didn't receive!|Dr Cook Great but he's not there anymore.  Dr Boyette is there she's Great.|This place is horrible. You can't get anyone on the phone . You leave messages they won't return them . This place needs serious help. Are just shut down.|Dr cook is an outstanding dr but his pa mr shaws is not worth a darn for anyone|They are an exceptional bunch of people.

column40:
I've been seeing Dr Mei for almost a year. I absolutely Love him. He takes the time out to answer any questions that I have.

Dr Mei specializes in pain management. He has done injections on my back and neck which has helped me so much.

The office staff is very nice. The wait time has improved from a year ago. I only waited about 20 minutes.

I Definitely recommend using Dr Mei, if you are in any pain.|Dr. Mei is a wonderful doctor--kind, compassionate, helpful, and a good listener. He follows medical best practices, including having patients bring all of their medication to ensure the best care possible. His staff is also knowledgeable and helpful. I am very grateful to have been referred to his office for help with long-term pain management because I could not ask for a better doctor!|Dr. Mei has been a great doctor for me. I was hurting so bad before seeing him but now I am doing so much better!! I highly recommend Dr. Mei.|Dr Mei is great. He really cares about his patients. He takes time to talk to you which is rare. I've been seeing him for several years for pain management. He's also done a nerve block and epidural for me in connection with surgeries. He's very good at them and always explains what he's doing and why before he performs them. I've had to have several surgeries and I always tell my surgeons that I want Dr Mei to do the pain management after surgery. He is strict and expects you to use your medication properly but that's what a pain mgmt doctor should do. I highly recommend him!|I have been with Dr Mei for years ,he is nice so is his staff .He does want you to bring your medication so nothing in mixing together .He takes your health and pain serious.|Terrible Doctor.
He will force you to bring in every prescription you have regardless of who prescribed it and count every pill every time you have to go for another prescription.
He is very controlling and you will wait at least 3 hours to see him.
Then you go back to waiting room and wait another 30 to 45 minutes for them to get you your prescription.
Dont go to this controlling quak.
His office is old and dirty.
Paint is flaking off doors and bathroom is dirty.
Ho elsewhere for your pain. There are many new options available.
You just need to find the right doctor.
Mei is not it.|He is very kind and always willing to help in anyway he can. He has helped me very much. Would recommend him to anyone.|Simply put, Dr. Mei does not listen to patients and has zero compassion. He has an egotistical, very controlling demeanor that is condescending and demeaning, especially to senior citizen patients. Do not initial or sign his contract without reading it entirely; I'm quite sure he's pushing the boundaries of what is entirely legal. He will most assuredly protect himself and his God complex before thinking of you, the patient. Run do not walk to another doctor that will show you their kindness and compassion. Last but not least, being kept there for FOUR hours in an attempt to see and understand him is not acceptable. Don't even attempt to talk or ask him questions, you are irrelevant.

Just say that instead of blowing us off cause you don't know what Dystonia is. Worst doctors office I have ever felt with.|The office staff is horrible. column40:
Dr. Hap is great. The nursing staff is wonderful now for the reason I personally left and wouldn't recommend. The clinical side has shady billing practices and the nurse practitioner only cares about racking up your bill. I chose to leave and wein myself off the pain meds because I got tired of unexplained bills and forever owing them hundreds of dollars without explanation. I can't do business like that. Again I will say Dr. Hapworth is great and the nursing staff is top notch. It's unfortunate the nurse practitioner and billing department are shady.|Dr. Hapworth took plenty of time explaining my epidural before, as well as during the procedure telling me step by step what to expect next. After the procedure, he explained what to expect in the days following. He was very pleasant and didn't try to rush through our conversation.

The rest of the staff were cheerful and helpful. It is their policy to call the day after to check on patient condition. I would not hesitate to return if another procedure is needed.|Wylie Arnett..........

Dr. Hapworth was very helpful at first.
I've had multiple epidurals over the years zero issues
I had my second T level epidural at location - went home felt a little dizzy, eyes blurry, bad headache, and my ears were ringing really loud - called surgery center they told me to lay flat.  Later was told by another Dr. possible spinal leak should have went to ER.  When I had follow up appointment with Dr. Hapworth I was telling him what all happened- like I said this had never happened before so I was concerned- he acted upset - told me the second one was under xray exactly like the first one .......told me hydrocodone can cause ringing- changed meds cut them in half ......lol.....
Guess that will teach me to keep my mouth shut .....anyway asked two pharmacists 30+ years, and two other doctors they said they've never heard that before. I think he was really trying to help me- I'm not mad, and maybe he was concerned about a lawsuit which I would never do with someone who is trying to help me .......anyway I wish him the best|Dr. Hapworth is an incredible doctor! He is very knowledgeable, kind and professional. Dr. Hapworth explained my condition in a way that was easy to understand. I had excellent outcomes with his treatment plan. I am so pleased with the  care I received from Dr. Hapworth and his amazing staff. I highly recommend Dr. Hapworth to anyone!|Dr. Hapworth is a definite asset to the medical community!! He actually sit down talked to me and explained everything he was gonna do in lamonz terms even though I didn't tell him I was A Physical Therapist and was more than understanding of what he was saying but he talked to me like A human being and we set up a game plan if the procedure I was having didn't work. Hope your lucky enough to get him if you go to the clinic. If I had to say something negative there was this nurse with long dirty blonde hair probably 50 just did not want to be there and it showed greatly, but the rest of the nurses and staff were awesome!|I was at Alabama Orthopedics for 3 years until my doctor went into another field of medicine.  I had an awful three months after that and decided to change doctors.  You can read my review on AOC, it was horrible.  Anyway, I like the facility of Pain and Rehabilitation.  Nice facility, nice doctors, quick wait times, etc...  After several appointments, I began to feel uneasy.  I was being given expensive tests with no real help.  I had been on pain medication at AOC and need it for my condition.  Dr. Hapworth said I had to go be screened by a psychologist and would base my medication decision on his prognosis.  I went and the psychologist was extremely nice.  He said he had no problem with me getting my medication and made the recommendation.  I went for an appointment yesterday and was told they would call me.  They called today and said, despite the psychologists report, it was illegal and they can not prescribe.   What they did not know was I had called the Alabama Board of Medicine and they said it was NOT illegal, but up to doctors discretion.  I began to put two and two together.  All they want is money.  I was called three times prior to all 4 appointments to bring my co-pay.  Before my injection in Pascagoula, I was called 5 times to remember my co-pay.  So, here is what they want.  They want to run a bunch of expensive tests on you but do not help.  How about being shocked (hurt like hell) for 45 minutes?  Maybe put a needle in you and run an electrical current (now this REALLY hurt)?  Make you go to Mississippi for some injections that did nothing?  Plus, they are LIARS!  So, if you want a bunch of expensive tests, harassing calls about co-pays but no help, this is the place for you!!!!  Do not waste your time, if you really want help, go find it elsewhere.|Staff is friendly and courteous.  They always have a smile on their faces and really appear to be happy at work.  Dr. Tucker is patient and thorough explaining procedures to me to ensure I understand what's about to happen.  I've been there three times for three separate procedures and every time I've been extremely pleased with the experience.|I live In Alabama  and Dr. Barfield has been doing treatment on me now I'm coming to Mississippi to do the Rf ablation. He is a fine Dr that always explains what he's going to do before hand and is very informative of what he is doing while doing the procedure. Grateful to this man

column40:
In the heart of the South, where the magnolias bloom and the air carries a hint of sweet tea, there's a place that stands as a beacon of hope for those wearied by the relentless ache of chronic pain. It's a place where the fusion of modern medicine and compassionate care creates a symphony of relief and recovery. This place, my friends, is the Interventional Spine & Sports Institute.

Now, I've seen my fair share of medical facilities, from the grandest hospitals to the humblest clinics, but there's something special about this institute. It's not just the cutting-edge treatments or the state-of-the-art facilities; it's the heart and soul poured into every patient's care.

I remember walking through their doors, feeling the weight of years of back pain bearing down on me. But the folks there, they greeted me with smiles as warm as a sun-drenched porch. They took the time to listen, to really listen, to the story of my pain, nodding along as if it were a gospel hymn they knew by heart.

And let me tell you about their medical cannabis certification. In a world where relief is often doled out in cold, clinical doses, they offer a path to healing that's both grounded in science and rooted in the nurturing soil of Mother Nature. They understand that sometimes, the best medicine doesn't come from a lab, but from the earth itself.

Their experts guided me through the process with the kind of expertise and kindness that's as rare as an honest mechanic. They made sure I understood every step, from the initial evaluation right down to the moment I held that certification in my hands. It was like being handed a key to a locked door I'd been leaning against for far too long.

So, if you find yourself in need of a place that combines the best of modern medicine with the timeless touch of Southern hospitality, look no further than the Interventional Spine & Sports Institute. It's more than a clinic; it's a community, a family, and a slice of heaven for those of us who've been through the wringer and come out the other side looking for a little bit of peace.

In the end, isn't that what we're all searching for? A little bit of peace, a little bit of comfort, and a whole lot of healing. Well, at the Interventional Spine & Sports Institute, that's exactly what you'll find.|Kelly really does care about her patients. Such a breath of fresh air after feeling like I had been dumped on the side of the road by my surgeons. I went in for the first visit and was blown away by the empathy shown by Kelly. It truly left me speechless. I'm not even sure if I said thank you, but in case I didn't, thank you Kelly for seeing the urgency in my care. Thank you for the treatment that I will receive in the coming weeks. You truly are an angel!|Kelli, Brian, and all the staff are amazing.  You aren't just a patient to these doctors, they actually care.  They have both helped me so much with my pain and trying to live daily with less pain. I highly recommend them.|Kelli is the kindest caring nurse practitioner. Best bed side manner ever|

As the only board-certified specialist in TMJ and Orofacial Pain in Mississippi, Dr. Riley has established himself as the premier authority that dentists, physicians, and other healthcare providers trust for complex cases.

Comprehensive TMJ and Orofacial Pain Treatment

We offer specialized treatment for a range of conditions including:

  • Severe jaw pain and dysfunction

Our approach focuses on identifying and treating the root cause of pain rather than simply managing symptoms. He truly does care that you feel better and get relief.|The first time Dr. Riley treated my TMJ was 36 years ago when I was 17-18.  After my jaw threatened to lock multiple times, he was one of the dentists that helped put my jaw popping, locking, and pain in "remission".  I moved away from Mississippi, and after moving back- some 20 years later- I began to have jaw problems again.  Imagine my surprise when I was looking for treatment, and found Dr. Riley!

I have been a patient again for 10+ years and he has monitored my TMJ and managed my bite splint, helping me keep the pain and popping at bay.  Dr. Riley is knowledgeable, professional, and nice!  I highly recommend him for treating TMJ.|I cannot recommend Dr. Riley enough. He is kind, knowledgeable, and passionate about the field, and that is evident in how he strives to fix the problem at hand. I have never once felt like he was trying to rush me in and out of his office. I had his full attention each visit and that speaks volumes to me as a patient. 10/10.|Dr. Riley was very thorough and patient helping my daughter with TMJ issues . We really appreciate him steering us away from surgery and pursuing non-invasive treatment instead like PT. His office is very nice and centrally located in Ridgeland. His staff is friendly too.

column38: Misty Doan|L T (PJ)|Rob&Rach Brown|Shawner Tyson|gayle Mcdonald|Penny Ferguson|Shirley Cole|James Griffith
column40:
I had so many problems finding a pain mamagemrnt for my medical conditions. I was referred to Dr Barclay's office and I was skeptical because it's two hours away from where  I live but I gave it a shot. All of the pain management doctors  my area are turning people away then they just have to suffer. I did for a year.
After seeing Dr Barclay the very first time.I was relieved. Not only is he considerate, compassionate, and concerned with your medical condition he treats his patients with the upmost respect. A BIG DIFFEENCE FROM THE PAIN DRS ON THE COAST. They treat you like you are a drug addicts when they are the ones who gets you hooked on the pain medication.. I hated going to the dr every month to be treated like POS..

I have been being seen for over 20 years  for my pain in my back and now I have Rhumatoid Arthrits so that kicked up the pain about 50 %. I just want to thank the staff for being so kind and Dr. Barclay for being a really good caring doctor who gets things done so you see good results. No other Dr had told me why I was in so much pain until I went to see Dr Barclay.  Thank you Doc.|My mother has been trying to talk with the office staff regarding a bill that she received & they have treated her horribly. Absolutely have talked to my 64 year old mother without any respect for person, patient, or customer!!!!  The office personnel are past rude and disrespectful. The issue is that the Ins company said that they used the wrong billing code & Barclay's office needs to contact them so that they can fix the codes. Obviously this offends Barclay's staff and they wouldn't even take it into consideration. These ppl need some core education & training on respect & communication skills with the public especially, when running a medical clinic!!|I fought pain every since my first back surgery. I've seen a couple Doctors in my 16 years of trying to get back some quality of life after these back surgeries. Dr Barclay is definitely the only Dr I've been to that really takes the time to listen and continues to find the right things to manage your pain. Whether it be medicine, injections, back brace or all the above he really does go the extra mile to understand and tries his best to get you a quality of life back.
I owe this Dr my life because without him I couldn't do a lot without having to stop for hours. I started coming to him and after a couple visits we not only got rid of some of the medicine my previous Dr had me on "entirely to much" to finding a medicine that actually worked without feeling doped up! He listened and now I can enjoy more of this thing we call life. Sure I still have some pain at times but that's expected because I don't care what anyone says if you take so much medicine all you do is sleep or sit around then that alone is no quality of life.|He convinces you to get procedures that don't not work just for you to keep getting pain medication. He done a procedure on me in April few months later I had a stroke in the same place he done the procedure. He a is Joke. Not a good at all you be in that clinic all day. Your appointment can be at 10  am you don't leave til 3 or 4. This place horrible!!|I have been going to This Pain Dr For Many Years . He is a Very Caring and Compassionate Dr. I finally got a chance after many years to explain all my complications from Pelvis Mesh and the damage it caused to me. Irreversable severe nerve damage. This made him understand what was causing my severe pain I was going through. I see one of his Nurse Practioners. She is also a Compassionate Doctor. It may take a long wait time. I Look at it like this your Doctor is taking time to listen to you. He or she is taking time to help you understand your problem.|I have suffered with chronic pain for more than half my life. Dr Barclay and his staff has been able to give me the relief I needed to continue working. I am more than grateful to him and his clinic.|Everyone is so nice and knowledgeable. I don't know what I would have done if not for Dr. Barclay.|Hoping this place can give me what I need . Meridian couldn't help!  My personal physician can't help so here I come Laurel Pain Clinic

column38: Paula Kirk|Marc Bullock|Brandy Cunningham|Shelly Jones|brandy McGee|Katie Darby|Kay McDaniel|Scott Fleeman
column40:
I have a long history of back problems and have received pain management services for years.
Last year my long-term physician referred me to Dr. Cole.  I have been seeing Dr. Cole and his P.A., Garrett, for several months now.  Dr. Cole revised my old treatment plan and it seems to be working well.|Dr. Cole and his NP Garrett Jones are awesome. I have been a patient for 5 years now and I will not go anywhere else. The front desk staff and the nurses are always super friendly. I have never had a single problem in the 5 years ive been a patient there.I highly recommend this clinic if you suffer from debilitating pain. Dr. Cole and NP Jones are very caring and listen to everything and create a plan that works. They have several different treatments and will work with you to find the best treatment options for your individual problems.The longest wait I've ever had there was 45 minutes. They really work hard to get you in quick and sit down every appointment and ask if the treatments are working. They accept most insurance companies. I really recommend if you are in pain to give them a try.|I am 5 months into Dr. COLE as my doctor and he has assisted me with a pain management program that has helped me to live almost pain free daily. I have multiple diagnosis that requires me to be on pain management and he genuinely cares about you. I've been to other pain doctors and their wait times and treatment make you feel worse and dread seeing them monthly. I kn ow it's getting harder to find good doctors and I'm glad I found Dr. Cole.|I've had debilitating migraines for 20 years and I have been to many, many, many doctors all over the country looking for long lasting relief. I heard about Dr Cole and decided to give him a shot since he is so close to home.

I went into this experience so full of hope. Dr Cole's treatment plans are unlike any I'd ever heard of. I was in an acute migraine situation so he admitted me to the hospital for almost two weeks. After that I stuck with Dr Cole through office location changes and through his transformation into an infusion clinic.  His Ketamine infusions were a life changer for me! My headaches improved as did my mental health and even my fibromyalgia became easier to live with.

Dr Cole is very smart and applies his knowledge to his unique treatment plans that are intended to treat you as a whole and improve your daily function. My problems with this clinic started when his clinic stopped accepting my insurance. His treatments are not cheap but I continued to see him as long as I could then I had to stop and find someone who did accept my insurance.

I had an amazing experience with his nurses Merilee, Zaffitt, and Kelli. The front desk lady was always not the most hospitable but I didn't let that bother me. I was definitely not fond of the female NP he brought in to help. I was in an acute migraine situation when I first met her. I called and asked to be worked in that day because I was hurting so bad. I was hoping for an injection to help my migraine and the nurse on the phone told me that I did not dictate whether I would get a shot or not that was up to the doctor.  I had only voiced that I needed a shot or something.  I was literally vomiting at the office. When she came in the room she was huffy and looking over my chart then wrote out my normal meds and she was done. I was stunned and told her I was there because I couldn't get control of my headache and asked her if there wasn't anything they could do that day since that was the whole reason I'd came in and she literally looked at me and said "No there is not." I left in tears.

I have new insurance and I've been having a horrible time with daily headaches and migraines. So I called the office and asked if they accepted my insurance and they did so I scheduled an appointment. I was very excited about possibly being pain free for a little while. I got a call from someone at the clinic telling me they cancelled my appointment because I had been dropped as a patient. I was dumbfounded because I had actually canceled my last appointment with my reason being they didn't accept my insurance and I couldn't afford to continue paying out of pocket. I tried to explain that to the lady I was talking to and she said no that Dr Cole had dropped me as a patient because I failed a drug test. I never failed a drug test and when I demanded to know when and what drug test, she said oh no, wait, that's not right. You didn't fail a drug test. Then she said she needed to call me back. She said my chart was packed away and not entered into the new system as they had just moved offices again. She calls back and says that I was dropped as a patient because I was seeing other doctors for pain treatment while I was seeing Dr Cole. I told the lady I absolutely had NOT been seeking  pain treatment from other doctors and I wanted to know who I had seen. I told her I had 4 surgeries during the time I was with Dr Cole but I had discussed those surgeries beforehand with Dr Cole and it was not an issue for him. Every time I asked her to tell me who I saw she said that info was unavailable to her BUT she WAS able to see enough to tell me I had been dropped. I also told her I had never been told there was an issue while I was seeing him.

I had written a good review on their website and had to demand they take it down. I have recommended Dr Cole to many people. I feel so very let down in a situation where I'm suffering and seeking help. Getting relief should not be so hard.|I recently visited Dr Alan Coles office where I received a prescription. I drove to multiple pharmacies and received multiple complaints about how the pharmacy doesn't fill for that provider. I found a pharmacy 5 days and 15 pharmacies later. I have been with that pharmacy since but ran into an issue where the pharmacy wouldn't be able to fill my perception till the following month. The pharmacy suggested that I ask the doctor to change the medication too something they can fill for me the same day or sooner than a month later. I then called the Dr office too see if the change could be made and was told I would get a call later that day.  I never received a call back so I followed up the next day at 8:30 a.m. and was told that the doctor agreed to the change and I would need to pick up the new prescription before they close at 12.  It takes me almost 2 hrs to get to most of my Dr offices including this particular one so when I arrived I was planning on picking up a prescription that could be filled instead I was given a nasty attitude by front desk, was told they didn't have a restroom for me to use after waiting 35 minutes, my prescription was changed too a lower dosage of the same unfillable prescription and was told to take it or my prescription will be thrown on the ground and I could get it off the ground. This has been so humiliating. I asked for workers names and titles and they told me they don't have a title and the names where Alyssa and David. I then asked for a number I can call to complain and was told that they can't give me a number and they will have someone reach out to me. This has been the worst experience ever.|I love Mississippi Pain and Migraine, especially Dr. Garrett Jones ,they are so nice and friendly and really care about their patients from the front door to the back...|I don't know how I'm posting under my grandson's name. My name is Marcia Kay McDaniel. I was a patient of Dr. Cole for years. He literally saved my life. He was the most caring kindest doctor I've ever met. He had to release me as a patient and I don't know why. I know I wasn't taking certain meds he thought I needed. I never even got them filled. I wish I could still be a patient but I'd recommend him to anyone having horrible debilitating headaches. I've had a headache for about 15 years now. Dr. Cole got it to a level that I can tolerate ok. Every once in awhile it gets bad for a day or so and I don't know I lived in that much pain.
There was one receptionist there that was hateful so I guess she's still with him. Rude and obnoxious are the nicest words I can say about that whench.|The most useless front office staff I have ever experienced in my 60+ years on this earth. Incompetent, hateful, and totally worthless. I received an invoice from over a year ago and have called and been sent to voicemail on five different days. I have tried to resolve this and finally called the office itself. I was polite (which is more than I can say about any of their front office. I was disconnected. I called back and was placed on infinite hold. I guess I will wait for it to go to collections as I have detailed notes of my efforts. Go elsewhere!

column38: Susan Cox|Vickie Lewis|Ron Herrington|Caron Downey|Faith A.|Ron Herrington|Missy Johnson|Pam Stamps
column40:
I now understand why Dr. McCleod has only 3 stars on many of the reviews. I loved him when I went in and had two shots. I was told to call back in 2 weeks if I did not have complete relief from the two shots he gave me. He told me to tell his nurse that she was to make another appointment to have him give me another shot. I called back to get an appointment and twice they left me a message I could NOT get another appointment until I had seen my Hip doctor. I was schedule for that on the 27th of March and I was going to that one, but this had nothing to do with my hip doctor. Jessica his scheduler was nasty and did not want to set an appointment, by this time I was furious because none of them would listen to what I was supposed told to do by my doctor.  After the 4th call I had it. I was NOT nice and I asked him to call me.
Again I had to make another call and when the girl answered the phone she said there was a big note on my file that they should not schedule me because no one yelled at his nurses. I was told to go somewhere else. Well, I will he is NOT the only pain doctor in Ms.
I do not understand why people who are in the business of helping someone in a lot of pain do not want to pay attention to what the patient is saying. He had two people that were rude to me the day I came in to see him the first time. One lady who sits on the front desk name Sam, made 3 other couples mad before me. I said nothing, but then when the nurse does not want to listen to me as to why I was calling, I was told to call, and I was doing what my doctor had told me to do, I am the one that suffers and I am the one that has to pay for this because there is NO compassion with the girl named Jessica and a doctor named Carroll McCleod. A phone call would have been nice when I asked him to call, but I was informed HE DOES NOT CALL HIS PATIENTS.  I AM SORRY THAT 36 YEAR S IN THE BUSINESS HAS TURNED HIM INTO STONE. I have two other doctors I use there, and I love them,
I was warned after the shots from another friend of mine whose husband was using Dr. McCleod, and his wife told me this would happen. I never would have believed this. I am really sorry, I really liked Dr. McCleod and he is a friend of my son's, it is too bad he did not know the whole story only heard the last phone call.|I have been a patient of Dr Mcleod's since 2008. He is always personable, caring and attentive during our visits. He does not make me feel like I am only a patient number. He does not rush his visits. He really wants to know how I am doing and if anything has changed since our last appointment. I have recommended him to family and friends. Dr McLeod cares about his patients. His staff is the same way. Nurse practitioner, Brian, is the same way as Dr McLeod.  He cares about the patients and never rushes through an appointment.  I thank God for Dr McLeod and his staff. He changed my life and outlook for my future from the very first visit. Before I became his patient, I could not imagine living another 40-50 years with the amount of pain I was experiencing.  He has helped me so much that I am still able to continue working full time and be an attentive wife and mother.   Dr McLeod and his staff have always wanted to help me live as close to the way I did before my car wreck.  His staff that works with him at the procedure clinic  are just as awesome. They want to make sure you are comfortable, informed and do not rush their patients. Again, a patient is NOT a number. Each patients knows when they leave the office and procedure clinic that they have been heard, examined and given the best care possible.|I am 67 years old. I saw dr. McLeod on advice of a friend.. dr. McLeod is a very personable, professional physician  in my opinion.. this staff is excellent too very nice people. Dr. McLeod did in three or four visits what another physician could not do in a year.folks I can
drop a pencil and pick it up without pain.. I can drive a car/truck 3+ hours and get out like a normal person with no pain. I put up with this pain for so long. I didn't realize how much I was hurting. Dr. McLeod fixed me.. ask my wife. I will recommend dr. McLeod and his staff to anyone with legitimate pain|I love Dr. McLeod, Brian Gates, and all of the staff. Everyone is kind, understanding, and professional. I don't like having pain and I don't like having to take medicines but I actually look forward to seeing this group on each visit. If you have to have pain these are the ones you want to go to for pain management.|I've seen Dr. Mcleod once for hope that he would take me as a patient.  Having chronic pain is not good.  So, if your case is difficult you may want to look elsewhere because I suspected he did not believe my condition.  In other words, he may have thought I was seeking drugs.  He did not know my complete history.  He only criticized my former physicians by stating he did not believe in their methods.  I've read in other reviews that his bedside manner are not up to par, well I can understand why they would state the obvious. But that is not what I was looking for in as a Pain Specialist. I understand Pain Doctors are high risk to lose their license, drug abuse complaints and the other.  I just feel he should have asked for more information before giving me an over-the-counter diagnosis.|Almost a year later he's still my doctor. 5 days now since my last visit I'm painless folks maybe not 100% but 99% is good enough for me. I can't say enough for Dr McLeod I appreciate his effort I can drive a car now without getting out every 15 miles to to get the pain out of my legs pick up a pencil when you drop it without pain. It's the little things I can do that I really like it's so different. I would like to leave a little praise for one of his staff members name is Nathan. I must have looked spooked on my visit cuz Nathan did all he could to assure me everything is going to be ok. I gave Nathan the inopportunity to answer a couple  questions about drugs that he was administering to me. He.jumped on those questions with both feet answered them thoroughly. He sounded a lot like some of my professors in pharmacy school. Nathan had his moment in the Sun but it's not just Nathan it's all of the staff they welcome you with a smile and they depart you with a smile. We'll see you guys in about 3 weeks|Dr. McCleod has been such a blessing to me in helping me overcome my pain from SI joint and bursitis. He's compassionate and understanding, and he will do anything to make sure that his patients are comfortable. I highly recommend Dr. McCleod!|We were supposed to be referred to a surgeon for a procedure for compression fracture never heard from anyone for 3 weeks I called office and no one returned my can after we scheduled with another surgeon we got a call from surgeon they had not been able to get in touch with them either! In meantime fracture got worse due to the waiting and trips back and forth in pain. So sad for an 80 year old that has worked their entire life to be treated like oh you're old we can help you. Feel sorry for them if they age.

column3:
At MidSouth Interventional Pain Institute, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Jackson, Tennessee.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

Our specialized team of anesthesiologists and pain management physicians offers a wide range of interventional treatments designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We operate a fully-equipped surgical center where we perform various procedures including:

  • Targeted pain injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

At our pain management practice in Corinth, MS, we are led by Lisa Hodge, FNP-BC, a dedicated nurse practitioner with extensive training and experience. Lisa earned her bachelor's degree in nursing from the University of Mississippi Medical Center in Jackson and her master's degree in nursing from the University of Alabama-Birmingham. Her calling to healthcare was deeply personal - witnessing the compassionate care nurses provided to her family members during serious health crises inspired her professional journey.

Our Approach to Pain Management

We take a methodical, patient-centered approach to pain management, focusing on improving quality of life through personalized treatment plans. Our services include:

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Individualized medication management

  • Conservative treatment options

  • Ongoing care and monitoring

What drives us each day is helping our patients regain function and comfort when they're struggling with chronic pain conditions. We believe in starting with conservative approaches and carefully adjusting treatments based on individual responses and needs. For more information about our qualifications and services, please visit our official provider profile or call us at (662) 331-1956. Our practice is conveniently located at 3302 W Linden St, Suite B, Corinth, MS 38834.
column11:
Lisa Hodge, FNP-BC, earned her bachelor's degree in nursing from the University of Mississippi Medical Center in Jackson and her master's degree in nursing from the University of Alabama-Birmingham.

"I went to nursing school because several of my family members had very serious health issues, and I saw the care the nurses provided for my family," Lisa says. "I knew that was what God wanted me to do with my life."

Lisa says her favorite part of her job is helping others "when they are struggling to have some quality of life."

Outside of work, Lisa enjoys spending time with her grandchildren, caring for her animals and gardening.

column40:
My mother has been seeing Dr.Sitzman for several years and he has been wonderful. He is very knowledgeable as well as compassionate!! My husband recently went to him for lower back pain and neuropathy. He had been to a couple of drs and a couple of more scheduled to be seen. He has not had anyone explain to him what was going on nor given the treatment he needed. Dr. Sitzman assessed his conditions, explained in detail and presented a plan of action. We will be forever grateful!! He is an amazing physician and a caring man!|Dr. Sitzman is the bomb!  He is a GREAT physician and I can truly say that he really cares about his patients. I have been seeing him for about 6 - 7 years now and my pain has greatly diminished.  I would recommend him to anyone.|Dr. Sitzman and his staff are great. Hip, back, neck, shoulder... he has treated me for these and probably more I don't remember. Very, very good doctor. Pain MANAGEMENT - I've had great outcomes with him.|Dr. Sitzman is wonderful. I feel cared for and respected by him and his great staff. My life is good and I'm able to work despite health issues. I'm so very blessed to be under his care.|Dr. Sitzman is the greatest example of what a doctor should be. He is dedicated to his patients. On a personal note on March 25 1997 my world was devastated in an instant. An 18 wheeler hit my geo tracker and kept on going however this caused me to hit a tree at 70 mph head on. I was told that I would never walk work or have kids. After countless days of surgeries and therapy I went back to work as a fulltime nurse still having to have occasional surgeries and therapy you can imagine how much pain I would have on a daily basis I would have so in 2003 I was referred to Dr sitzman  the first time I saw him I informed him that I was a nurse and this was important to me.  So he has worked with me and my pain. He would work me in on short notice whenever I would have a flare up with me pain. Some of those flare ups would have me in so much pain and he would work his magic on me. So now I have been doing my passion in life as a fulltime pediatric nephrology nurse at ummc children's hospital in Jackson ms.  There is not enough thanks in the world I can say about him  I know that he is the best if you ask me|If you are ready to make an appointment with a uncaring, condescending narcissist, that's what will be waiting for you at advanced pain therapy, Dr. Sitzman is a sociopath with a god complex. He takes responsibility for nothing. And puts certain patients last. If you have any kind of intelligence he is not the doctor for you!|Dr. Todd Sitzman is an anesthesiologist with advanced training in pain management and over 25 years of experience. He is compassionate and provides comprehensive holistic patient assessments. I've been a patient of Dr. Sitzman for 8 years. His fees are reflective of clinical standards/laws driven by Medicare, Medicaid regulations. All patients fees are standard and not unique to the payor source. I've heard Dr. Sitzman tell family members of patient's with a terminal illness and complex pain to call him anytime day or night if their loved one's pain was uncontrolled. I've watch an elderly patient with bone cancer come into the clinic crying due to pain from a fractured him that was inoperable. Dr. Sitzman responded to the family's urgent request for intervention. Within a short time this elderly man was telling jokes and smiling. He takes extra time with elderly patients, veterans, and any one that is vulnerable.

Take time to research his credentials:                                                                           "He is an active member of numerous national and international pain societies: president of North American Neuromodulation Society (NANS); past president of American Academy of Pain Medicine (AAPM), Southern Pain Society (SPS), Mississippi Pain Society (MPS) and Mississippi Society of Interventional Pain Physicians. He is the recipient of AAPM's Distinguished Service Award in 2012. He has authored more than 75 scientific publications including abstracts, manuscripts, and book chapters, and serves on the editorial boards of the journals Pain Medicine and Pain Practice. He is actively involved in patient advocacy and postgraduate medical education, and lectures nationally and internationally on topics related to pain pharmacology and interventional pain therapies."

Pain is complex and requires a physician with special training in evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment of all different types of pain. Pain is actually a wide spectrum of disorders including acute pain, chronic pain and cancer pain and sometimes a combination of these. Pain can also arise for many different reasons such as surgery, injury, nerve damage, and metabolic problems such as diabetes. Occasionally, pain can even be the problem all by itself, without any obvious cause at all.

As the field of medicine learns more about the complexities of pain, it has become more important to have physicians with specialized knowledge and skills to treat these conditions.

Dr. Sitzman has an in-depth knowledge of the physiology of pain, the ability to evaluate patients with complicated pain problems, understanding of specialized tests for diagnosing painful conditions, appropriate prescribing of medications to varying pain problems, and skills to perform procedures (such as nerve blocks, spinal injections and other interventional techniques) are all part of what a pain management clinician uses to treat pain. He is one unique and talented physician I'm thrilled to have as part of my pain management team!|Dr. Sitzman, is the greatest, I've been seeing him for my hip for several years now and he does a fantastic job, he is very professional, and very passionate at what he does, thank you doc, your the best

At University of Mississippi Medical Center, we are proud to have Dr. Ike I. Eriator leading our pain management initiatives. As a distinguished

Professor of Anesthesiology

and Director of the Pain Fellowship Program, Dr. Eriator brings exceptional expertise to our patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our mission is to restore joy and improve quality of life through a holistic, multimodal approach to pain management. We specialize in:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain management strategies

  • Evidence-based opioid (narcotic) therapies

  • Personalized treatment plans

Beyond clinical care, Dr. Eriator serves as Chair of IRB1 and sits on the Ethics Committee of the American Society of Anesthesiologists. His dedication to research ethics, healthcare quality improvement, and pain epidemiology enhances our ability to deliver cutting-edge care. Contact our office at +1 888-815-2005 to schedule a consultation at our Jackson location (N State St, Jackson, MS 39216).
column11: Ike I. Eriator, MD, is a professor of Anesthesiology at the University of Mississippi Medical Center. He directs the Pain Fellowship Program and is also Chair of IRB1. His life goal is to restore joy and improve the quality of life for people by helping to control pain using a holistic, multimodal approach. He subspecializes in using advanced interventional procedures to treat pain. His clinical, research, and teaching interests include pain management, epidemiology, opioids (narcotics), healthcare quality improvement, and research ethics. Dr. Eriator sits on the Ethics Committee of the American Society of Anesthesiologists.

column40: I had a good experience at Pain Management Treatment Center in the Searcy Office.   Dr. Deaver was attentive and had some really good ideas about a plan of treatment for me.   He listened and answered all my questions.  The RN in the office with him was also very knowledgeable and kind!  Everyone from the front desk back was friendly and kind.   Being a nurse myself, that is all very important to me in an office setting.   I certainly appreciated them all.|I was met with respect and extreme concern for my health. The staff was caring and friendly and explained everything with detail and patience. I felt very safe and welcomed by the health care team in this clinic. I would highly recommend this team to anyone who suffers with chronic pain. This team is truly here to help you.|I was referred to this clinic, never got to my first initially appointment. The clinic called 15 minutes to my appointment time to tell me my appointment was canceled. All over a winter storm that eveyone knew was coming into the area long before that thursday morning.|When everybody told me I needed surgery and told me I didn't have a chance without it at 25 years old , Dr Terry got me in the next day for a procedure after not being able to walk for 2 months and I was able to walk out of the building right  after the procedure unassisted. I feel great and my quality of life is improving. And my pain is little to none Very thankful for a fighting chance.|Dr Deaver did not care at all about me, nor would care to work with my Neurologist to figure out what is best. He just decided that he didn't understand my functional movement disorder with functioning seizures so he wouldn't help me. I mean what happened to the days of doctors trying and caring? Just because you may have to work a little bit harder and communicate with another doctor you just give up? Why even be a doctor if you can't even bother to care about a patient?|I will have to say my recent visits and nerve block shots have helped. Nothing will take away all the pain but the relieve I get from the shots help out tremendously.  I sometimes wish I didn't have the work on me everyday then I wouldn't feel as much of the pain, but my life and my body says I can't just sit down and do nothing. There is to much to do in my life. I do appreciate all that they have done for me.|The appointment was for my wife. But I will leave a review as I had asked them to stop texting me but yet they sent another message with a different number.  My wife had her first appointment yesterday. It did not go well at all. They did not have courtesy to tell us her medical records had not come in yet. She has severe PTSD at doctors' offices from another doctor. Any way she had to wait for hours at the office to be called back then wait some more then to be taken into the office of DR. Deaver. Now Instead of telling her that her medical records had not came in like he should have he had her explain why she was there, just to look at her like she was lying and faking her illness. He even told her he did not believe her that the neurologist agreed she should go to pain management for her condition.  He was cruel to my wife by making her go through the whole thing to then tell her he can't help her. If we would have known her records from her main physician and the neurologist were not in yet we could have had at least two hours to call while we were waiting! We had no idea. And my poor sick wife whom woke up already sick with a migraine and throwing up before we left felt betrayed and mocked by Dr. Deaver. And now she has to wait 3 more excruciating weeks before he will see her again even if he gets her records early. And it takes even longer to find somewhere else so she is stuck with someone who now has a bad opinion of her as she was extremely sick when she went in and she gets emotional plus all the stress they cause her.|Ashley has always been nice to me. She is understanding and has always helped me. I always try to make them laugh about something silly, I might say. I recommend her to anyone who might need this service. Since we were in a car wreck and my headaches and memory issues, Ashley and staff have been very nice and understanding.

column40:
They had their mind made up before I even got there, I waited months and was told it was ok to have a THC in my system as long as I told the Dr, I told the Dr and they pretty much ran me out of there more or less & I'm not even a drug user, honestly in my opinion the drug tests should be blood, there is ppl going in there that done speed less than a week before they go in but they can pee clean & ppl like me with severe injuries can't even get relief because I took a couple puffs of marijuana a night to put me too sleep and relax me. They not only lied to me but wouldn't even give me a NSAID injection much less something that actually works. I'm a good honest person that has been suffering for a long time with metal plates and screws and surgeons telling me it shouldn't hurt anymore when they don't have any experience with metal plates and screws in their bones or they would feel different about pain killers. No one can tell Another person how much pain they are in cuz they can't possibly know, that surgeon hit a nerve in my shoulder and my whole arm is useless and I left a bad but honest review bout him so I'm sure he called y'all telling ya bunch of crap when the truth is less than a month after surgery he wouldn't tell the insurance company why I even needed my meds when they kept rejecting them. I don't wanna drink and I've only drank twice in the past year and both times it was cuz I couldn't even get around cuz the pain is dabilatating & it's 24/7. Rubi at Mercy with a bone sticking out of my shouldergsve me a bunch of crap for anxiety and wouldn't even give me a Tylenol 3, with a bone literally sticking out of my shoulder and told me Preston jones the Ortho surgeon in the bluff wouldn't even write me a prescription either so I went around him and he sent me a bill in the mail, before I left that appointment he said 'Now you ain't gotta come back" and looked at me real hard. Alot of ppl don't like me fore some reason, people even burnt my house down that my Mother left me recently, all I wanted was a good honest, kind, & caring Dr to see through whatever junk they been told and find out for theirs what kind of a oerson I am, but unfortunately that didn't happen, he had his mind made up when he walked in the room for the Apt. With over a dozen broken bones and disc disease the new Dr told me he didn't know who got me started on the pain meds but it was ridiculous and in my opinion not giving someone as messed up from head to toe as me is pure negligence & wrong morally. I just need someone to stick up for me & help me, I'm truly suffering and am still willing to try Anything I don't just want pain medicine but it's just all that has given me relief so far, is pain killers for pain., God bless & Sincerely, -Wesley Smith|Dr Roberts was caring and direct. He ordered an MRI and physical therapy and set up a follow up appointment to further assess the problem.|Doctor Roberts is great. He's excellent at explaining, asking your opinion, do u have a question.  His assistant McKenzie if fabulous as well.  I will miss Doctor Roberts when he goes to his new position. I will miss you.  Kim|Knee injections are not fun and they are painful. Not significantly but they are. However, I think that I had a nice distraction talking with my physician. There was minimal setup, just sitting in my chair and no special hospital draping or equipment. In and out. Efficient. My experiences have always been good but this was especially stress free.|So glad Dr Roberts has returned to OHC. He is excellent and caring. I trust his judgement. And McKenna,  Vanessa, and Montana are exceptional in their care of veterans. Thank you all.|Friendly and knowledgeable staff. I liked it there and look forward to my next visit.|If I could give less than 1 star, I would.

My wife went in with severe back pain. The options given were physical therapy, a shot, or surgery. She decided to try therapy first. The physical therapy did not work.

So, she had a follow-up appointment already scheduled. She called beforehand to ensure she would get the shot, and the receptionist said yes, no problem.

Her appointment was with Dr. Caron, who we then found did not do shots, so the receptionist either lied or had no clue. She had to make an appointment with Dr. Roberts and waited over a month to see him. Mind you, she is in pain almost constantly.

She was so looking forward to some pain relief.

On the day of her long-awaited appointment, we showed up to find Dr. Roberts was not in. Instead of scheduling her for the next day, they rescheduled her for another month and a half later. It was not her fault Dr. Roberts was not there as he was supposed to be? Why should she have to suffer another 1.5 months?

Why didn't they call to tell us about the cancelation? Then we would not have wasted time and gas.

We are going to a pain management center in Springfield, where we hope they care for their patients.

The problem we had with Ozarks Healthcare was only with pain management.  We haven't had problems in other departments, at least so far.|I liked Dr. Roberts a lot as he was a very competent doctor, and did a good job.
However when I went to my last appointment which was a follow up & a pre visit to get on the schedule to have another shot put in my back, I was suddenly and without any warning told I couldn't get on the schedule because in two days time Dr. Roberts was leaving the clinic.
While I wish him well in his future endeavors, I also firmly believe that any Doctor who is planning to leave the place they are currently practicing at should send out a letter/notice to their patients well in advance of their departure from the clinic, or at least have their office/company send out a letter/notice well in advance of their departure so that a patient like me will have a heads up in advance giving me a chance to find another provider, and get on their schedule to continue treatment without interruption instead of having me show up for a regularly scheduled follow up visit for treatment just to be told I can't get on the schedule to have another shot in my back like I need continue treatment because the doc won't be there in two days time.

I have been a patient here for several years now. Both the old and new locations. The staff and Doc Sturm have always treated me with kindness, respect, and understanding. Last year I did a Drip and decided to do it again this year. As a treat to myself.
They make a world of difference! I have done both in December, the immune boost. I add B12 & Toradol. Makes the season perfect. Now they have a monthly subscription and I am super hyped.
IF you want to feel better. If you want to be a person and not a number. This office IS your last stop!|This is a response to James Mitchell's review from today 1/13/2025, and high compliments on Arch Pain Management's busness.

I was in the office when Mr Mitchell was there discussing his issue at the office of Dr. Sturm today, and heard much of the exchange.

I've been a patient of Dr. Sturm for several years, as has a friend of mine, and we have the high respect and regard for Dr. Sturm and his amazing staff.  They have always treated us with wisdom, respect and wonderful kindness.

Dr. Sturm's staff discussed their policies and probably state and federal laws clearly and politely with Mr. Mitchell.  If he spends time living in both Illinois and Missouri as his review stated, which are neighboring states, then surely he can find the service he wants in Illinois where he mentioned that he holds a drivers license.

Dr. Sturm provides excellent,  high quality service to the local community in a field that can't be easy to navigate.  He's always up on the latest related information, and spends quality time with each patient.  We've never had to wait long at all, and every member of the staff is polite, engaging, fun and respectful.  Thank you to Dr. Sturm and all your staff for all that you do!  God Bless!|*RESPONSE TO THEIR RESPONSE* Lets say I'm not getting the full story. Why didn't she get the polite option to reschedule? Why did you call her husband who wasn't even there and abandon him as a patient when he is a completely different patient and case? No matter how you spin it, what you guys did and more importantly how you handled it was unethical.*
My mother was completely disrespected here. I read her review and the offices response below and their response was a joke. They said she put everyone at risk over a "just a med refill". Excuse me, being a pain management center, they should know what a big deal that is for some people! She had COVID for almost 2 full weeks and told them "she was at the end of it" when  she was actually feeling much better with no symptoms. So maybe poor wording on her part but she was being honest and still went to her appointment WEARING A MASK. (thinking that was the right thing to do) She wasn't careless or trying to harm anyone like they make it seem in their review response. So are they saying masks don't work? Something doctors strongly believe in?...they sternly told her she could kill someone and needed to go outside and call them back. Didn't ask her any follow up questions, just berated her (I'm not saying yelled but BERATED) for coming in and sent her outside. She wasn't being belligerent or anything. They then told her "she wasn't the right fit" and ended her care right then which left her crying in the parking lot confused on what just happened and shocked. The PROFESSIONAL thing to do would've been to simply and POLITELY reschedule her appointment a couple weeks later and explain the seriousness of their guidelines moving forward. They also called her husband who was not even there and completely unrelated to this situation and canceled him as a patient too for "not being a good fit" as well. My mother has mental health issues, diabetes, and severe fibromyalgia and finding a pain doctor is a stressful task in itself to be abandoned as a patient just like that...without the doctor calling either her or her husband to explain further or apologize. My mom isn't the easiest person but she's not a mean person and was treated so horrible. For what?! She could've called for a temporary refill, yes, but she felt much better and it had been almost 2 weeks! And still wore a mask! She didn't think it would be a big issue. I work at a doctors office myself and I can say that that was handled completely wrong and unprofessional. When she told me, my jaw dropped. Because of this, my mom is left without pain meds that her body has been accustomed to for years and now trying to get in somewhere asap is hard with appointments booking so far out. She is crying daily from the stress this has caused and the pain she is in. Seems this place didn't want to deal with a certain type of patient and abandoned her and her husband (again, he wasn't even there). This could've been handled so differently. This IS patient abandonment and is causing her mental and physical distress. I'm trying to convince them to speak with an attorney.|I arrived for my appointment. i was told they could not accept me because i have an Indiana drivers license. We have residences in both states because of grandkids. I go to VA Columbia where  am prescribed narcotics. I was told i had to have an Missouri drivers license regardless where i lived. They then told me he could not perscribe narcotics for me. I didnt want them. My take away is this place is a big narcotics perscribing doctor. If you want them go see this doctor. Bad people.|Dr Sturm has been my pain doctor for a few years and he is by far along with his staff extremely polite, very professional and very knowledgeable. It wasn't for them I really don't know where I would be in life. Thanks Doc and staff.

I am going to have to add on to my post. I was reading about how some of the reviewers on here were accusing the doctor and staff of being racist. Personally that is a bunch of bull if you are abusing your prescription they have every right in the world to no longer have to have you as a patient. That's your fault. Wants your name gets out there as an abuser of your prescription you might as well just hang it up because no one's going to see you. That's all on you deal with it. It's not because you're a person of color it's because you possibly decided to sell your prescription to make money. Karma's a bi*+@.|We love dr sturm and his team.  My husband had a heart attack and needed pain meds and Justin has been a huge help.  We had problems with getting meds before but Justin steps up and gets them ordered for us.  We highly recommend this place for anyone who needs pain management.|I've been seeing Dr.Sturm for maybe 3 yrs.Ive never had a problem with him,he's always treated me right until last month. He let some of his office team harrass me.So I walked in there for my appointment and I had a mask on because I had covid I immediately told the head girl in there why I was wearing it.She told me very rudely that I needed to leave go to my car and call her.I did she answered heard it was me, and started yelling at me.Then handed the phone to the bigger guy that works in there too and he treated me the same, like they didn't even know me I always got along with them.He said that they all decided I wasn't a good fit for that office know more.That was after I said that when the doctor wasn't busy that I want to talk to him, basically to see if he agreed to me not coming back.They said doctor told them he didn't want me me back.Soo..anyways I sat in my car outside for about 30 min crying, I trusted these people and they turned on me for walking in with a mask on because of covid. I believed I was doing the right thing and they threw me out.It really hurt me because I liked Dr.Sturm and the rest of the crew and they all thought I wasn't a good fit for them hmm.I would never intentionally do something to put anyone in danger thats why I wore the mask.   SB|The doctor was rude, and late every for every appointment. He never examined the patient even after 5 visits. He wrongfully accused her of using illicit drugs even after she took a drug test for them and passed. I would not recommend this place to anyone even people who are seeking a strictly cannabis based treatment.
