column3:
At Interventional Pain Institute, our mission is to provide the most advanced and compassionate care to patients suffering from chronic pain. Our world-class physicians are dedicated to precisely diagnosing and treating the source of your pain, not simply masking symptoms. We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we take a comprehensive approach to each patient's unique situation.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We specialize in minimally invasive, non-surgical procedures designed to help you reclaim your life, including:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Targeted pain injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Interventional treatments for back, neck, and joint pain

Our team of board-certified pain specialists works diligently to develop personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs. We're committed to getting you back to work, back to family, and back to living as soon as possible. Visit our website to learn more about our innovative approaches to pain management, or call us today at +1 636-519-8889 to schedule your appointment at our convenient Chesterfield location.
column11: At Interventional Pain Institute, our mission is to provide the most advanced and compassionate care to patients in pain. Our world-class physicians are dedicated to precisely diagnosing and treating the source of your chronic pain, not masking it. We specialize in minimally invasive, non-surgical procedures to get you back to work, back to family, and back to living as soon as possible. Call today to schedule an appointment!
column38: Susan Raftery|Jennifer Young|Michelle Stewart|Joe Rosick|Elaine Gotthardt|Teri Landry|Jeremy Jaudon|Melissa Walker
column40:
This is the most unprofessional medical center I have ever encountered in 61 years. As I read through the previous reviews, it's to bad "we" the patients cannot begin an "open blog". I have been rescheduled and rescheduled and rescheduled. The first "family emergency, Doctor Brown, if there is a Dr. Brown the receptionist desk? Gave me a 30 minute notice before my appointment Dr. Brown has been whisked away by a family emergency. My re-scheduled, rescheduled appointment was rescheduled because Dr. Brown has been yet again engaged in a continuing "Family Emergency". I am now on my 3 rescheduled ... scheduled appointment. The staff is ridiculous and I really don't think they know anything about anything. It's getting EXHAUSTING and EXTREMELY-
REPETITIVE, over and over. If I could leave a NEGATIVE 5 Star or worse I would. So, if you are considering using this Pain Management Institute, be ready for a REALLY BIG frustrating experience. I am still awaiting for my next reschedule appointment with Dr. Brown, I am currently going on 3 months out . I will be the first to give kudos, I really think it's worth the time to acknowledge good work , performance, ethics especially in the hardworking of the caregivers in hospitals and clinics in this state of Missouri. These professionals truly give it all. IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR Anything close to professional, YOU ARE LOOKING AT THE WRONG solution for your pain. All you are going to get is MORE PAIN and MORE. Jumping around with this pain institute.
One more note Dr. Oliver, the one doctor who helped me was kind and did his best to help me with ONE of my pain debilitating nerves in my spine. This was one week ago I had this procedure.
So, while still waiting for Doctor Brown , the only orthopedic doctor , really??? To return from his never ending family emergency, maybe, just maybe, I can get my shoulder cuff repaired? Who knows. Can you report an incompetent group - staff? If so please let me know.
MY ADVICE go somewhere else.
Thank you Dr. Oliver for your part of my recovery.
Susan Raftery|If I could give zero stars, I would. The office staff is rude, unprofessional, and completely disorganized. Communication is abysmal--no one seems to know what anyone else is doing. My elderly father pays in cash, but they refuse to issue receipts, claiming payments are "immediately entered into the system," which is hard to believe given the constant confusion.

One day, I was told insurance would cover everything; the next, they demanded $250. When I asked for clarity, the billing staff dismissed my concerns, accusing me of lying because "the person responsible has been out all week." This type of treatment is sadly the norm.

After nearly a year of dealing with both the Chesterfield and Troy offices, we've experienced nothing but frustration. My father has followed every instruction to try a device recommended in August, yet it's now January, and we're still waiting. Despite completing every requirement--and more--the process feels like an endless loop of repeated visits and excuses.

Dr. Whitlow, in particular, is unprofessional and avoids even basic responsibilities. He hasn't performed physical exams during my father's last three visits, nor has he reviewed critical information before appointments. How can proper care be provided without preparation or communication?

This clinic is a disorganized mess. The lack of professionalism, accountability, and basic respect for patients is unacceptable. I will be filing a formal complaint with Mercy's governing board.|Dr. Oliver is amazing!! With chronic pain and spine issues, I've come to realize that needles and uncomfortable procedures are a necessary part of my life. Dr. Oliver's technique and bedside manner make the process of getting various injections much less scary. He's extremely kind, knowledgeable, skilled, attentive, and empathetic. I never feel rushed and he's always willing to answer any and all questions I have.  He's one of the first doctors who truly listened to me and believed me without skepticism or judgement when I described the debilitating pain I've been living with. Most importantly, he offers effective treatments for my pain. The relief he has been able to provide is life changing!!|Dr.gheith and his staff are remarkable people. I would not hesitate to send my mother to him...in fact I have. I went in for leg pain and weakness. He thoroughly reviewed my mri's, he noticed a couple artifacts that were in related to my leg pain and got me set up with the appropriate physicians to address these concerns. He could've said not my problem but he brought to my attention and now i feel confident I'm getting ahead of possible future issues.|I was very impressed with Dr. Oliver who I saw at IPI.  He was the first doctor that explained why I was suffering.   He showed my son and I on a spine model and spinal photo where exactly the pain is coming from and what was going on.  I was so relieved after seeing many doctors to finally be able to understand what is going on with me.  He spent well over an hour with me and we discussed further options for my pain relief.   The staff was great, very kind and when I called afterward and left a message they got back to me within minutes.   I would highly recommend this place.|After waiting a long time for Dr Geith to come in the room he tells my husband that he had a heart murmur and atrophied in his legs. Then he wants my husband to go to 3 different doctors he recommended before he does the mild procedure for his spinal stenosis. We walked out!
First of all; my husband pays for a primary care doctor to be at his service. This doctor was his mother's doctor as well. He went to him and told him what Dr Gieth said. His primary doc told him that he didn't have a heart murmur nor atrophied in his legs. His doctor checked him again and said the same thing. Dr Geith must get a kick back for making people go to other doctors. But I just don't understand why he lied to us. I do not trust him!!|I was told that Dr Gheith treated his mother for CRPS and that he created his own method of treating it, I was also told "Not to toot our own horn but we are highly sought after in the nation for CRPS". When I saw Dr. Gheith he said I had only two options, nerve block or spinal cord stiumulator. There's nothing unique about these options and I didn't get the impression from him that any of this was true. I'm concerned because I have a procedure scheduled and I just don't know why they were so persistent about getting me in. Looking at other reviews to see other's experiences. I also was left in the waiting room for a very long time.|Staff is not connecting well with the doctors or patients. Staff said they never received my MRI results which they had and I contacted imaging center to send it again. I know they received them the 1st time bc on my next visit the Dr asked me if the staff contacted me with the results which they had not. Appointments should be spread farther apart to reduce waiting time.  I never received my paperwork via snail mail and it's  extension and should be made available online. Dr should discuss the main side effects. I'm giving 4 stars bc I like my doctor.

column2: Elite Pain Management and Recovery Centers
column3:
At Elite Pain Management and Recovery Centers, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Springfield and beyond. Our

Multidisciplinary Approach

combines advanced medical treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain, addiction issues, and related conditions. We offer:

  • Specialized pain control interventions

  • Evidence-based addiction treatment programs

  • Mental health support services

  • Medical weight loss solutions

  • Customized rehabilitation protocols

Located at 1230 E Kingsley St C in Springfield, our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to deliver effective pain relief treatments. Our team of board-certified physicians and healthcare professionals work collaboratively to develop individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while improving overall quality of life. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily functioning, which is why we're committed to providing compassionate care in a supportive environment. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, visit our official website or call us at +1 417-888-0167.

column38: Bella Dave|Jessica Cline|Shawn Bilyeu|Tom Edmonson|Daniel Keenan|Mickie Abernathy|Kory Kilbourne|Candice Mitchell
column40:
I would give 0 stars if I could. I called and left a message with the receptionist for the new patient intake person to schedule an appointment. I was told I needed a referral after calling twice.  I confirmed with my PCP that the referral was sent, and they confirmed it.  I then physically walked in to provide the referral and hoped to speak to someone. The new patient intake staff was there but didn't come out of her office.  By this time, I called 5 times, left about 4 voicemail messages and Still NOTHING.  It's been 3 weeks now and no one has returned my call. Unbelievable. I moved on to Cox Health.|I was scheduled for a second procedure a few days ago. My appointment was scheduled for after 4pm. I was given the calming pill and hadn't sat for very long when the nurse/tech came back to bring me to the procedure table. My anxiety was high because the pill had not taken effect yet and I knew the previous procedure was painful. I asked if we could wait a few more minutes for the pill to start working and she told me it's "really late in the day" and they could just proceed with the (painful) procedure or reschedule me. I opted for the rescheduling of course. The pill finally took effect about ten more minutes later after i got home. I then received a letter from the doctor in the mail a few days later dropping me as a patient without explanation of reason. I feel there is serious lacking of bedside manner and compassion for me and I've a feeling I'm not the only one. I hope enough feedback will bring some awareness and accountability within the clinic's team.|I have gone here for years with great success. The staff is top-notch! They are kind, polite, and show an interest in not only your progress but also in you on a personal level. I live with chronic pain but thanks to them it is very minimal!|The only thing they care about is making sure you don't take opioids. They don't care if you actually have pain or not. They got me hooked on Suboxone and I couldn't take it because of anxiety. They don't care. Good luck if you have to go here!|Update;  Elite pain Management  gets a Minus 10 Star. This Place Should be Shut Down.
Girlfriend was going to Elite Pain Mangement for pain management.  They were giving her injections in her lower back. She complained to them for months about the pain in the top middle of her back and all they would say,  is we'll get to your top back when we're done working on your bottom back. Well because they didn't listen to they patient, my girlfriend had to be rush to the emergency room
where they did emergency surgery the next morning. She  has stage 4 cancer. No one would listen to her. She almost died that weekend. She doesn't go to Elite Pain Management anymore. She is now deceased. Maybe if someone listened to her, she might be still alive today.
Old review,  First, long red hair receiptionest is got to be the most rudest disrespectful person I've ever met. And to top it off she tries to make you think your the rude person. Second, I was referred to Elite by Cox. Cox said I didn't need surgery so sent me to Elite. Elite said I need surgery and wanted to send me back to Cox. Neither place knows what they are doing. Both places have received a 1 star each for being so incompetent and not turthly caring for their patients. I am now being properly cared for and treated by Mercy. Oh and because of Elite and Cox incompetence, I've been bed ridden 3 1/2 to 4 months in massive pain. And they are very lousy at keeping appointments. Went for my designated appointment and they are so behind they screwed up the rest of my day. Every surprised they have a total 3 star review Also they don't keep their appointment time. Here with other patient as their driver  and they're running over a hour late. Now I change my review from a 1 star to a minus 1.5 star.|Dr. Tonkin and his staff are very professional, caring and respectful! Dr. Tonkin gave me an injection last week so much pain relief, it kept me out of pain till my shoulder surgery which was yesterday. The ppl leaving bad reviews needs JESUS  Dr Tonkin and staff have helped me more than my old pain doctor! So if you need relief see the Best Elite Pain Management Dr. Tonkin and staff YOU ROCK!VERY PLEASED AND SATISFIED! THANK YOU  MAGGIE|BEWARE!!!One of the worst experiences I've had ever in my life at age 48. YOU MUST READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE seeing Dr. Tomkins and learn how about his practice of treating people! It's absolutely awful and it happened to me as well!

I regret not reading other's reviews before seeing him. My wife and I not one, but many bad experiences going there.

Our impression was Dr. Tonkin thinks he is way too important to stop by check on you and see how your progress is coming along like a true professional caring doctor would do. He outsources to his assistants to assess the situation. He showed my wife and I repeatedly he didn't care at all about us. Just our wallets of course! They love to take your money and charge you handsomely for every little thing they can.

They will waste so much of your time! Upfront summary for example -  we had 1pm appointment for a 20 minute visit with a "physician assistant" (not Dr. Tonkin) and we left at 6pm.

At Elite Pain Management for every doctor appointment we had, we had very long wait times before seeing a physician.  One afternoon we had a 1pm appointment. We had sold a home and had a closing at 4:30 pm. After waiting to see a physician,  the actual appointment only last 15-20 minutes, so getting in and out for a 4:30 closing should not have been a problem right? WRONG! We told them several times we needed to be done so we could make this closing at 4:30. They kept telling us OK no problem. We waited until almost 5pm before being seen and we had to reschedule the closing. Every appointment we had was similar to this. You wait and wait and they waste so much of your time!  Literally you'll spend HOURS....not minutes, but hours way past your appointment time to get in for a 10 minute visit with Dr. TONKINS' assistant and on a rare occasion Dr. Tonkins.

OUR FINAL AND WORST EXPERIENCE: We had many terrible experiences there, but this one was our last.

So here's what happened for my last visit there and the last time being their patient/client. I had a nerve ablation scheduled, after waiting for a period of time as usual, it was finally my turn. They got me prepped and ready on the surgical table, but then things went sideways fast. As I was prepped and ready to go by the staff,  Dr. Tonkins was in the other room making small talk.  I had asked 2 different staff members if I could speak with Dr. Tonkin before he performed the nerve ablation. They kept telling me he was busy with another patient, so I waited laying face down on the surgical table with level 9-10 pain. My SI Joint was throbbing and it hurt really bad to stay there in that position, but I had no choice.

Laying there face down and listening to Dr. Tonkin make small talk/flirting/joking around in the next room for over 15 minutes, my pain kept increasing getting worse and worse. The pain was getting so high I was starting feel nauseous. Now I was worried I was going to throw up all over the floor.  On top of that, I was also feeling nervous and uneasy about Dr. Tomkins doing a painful ablation on the WRONG side, but according to the staff, he insisted it was going to be done on the LEFT side not the right side. That didn't make any sense to me. I wanted to have a discussion about the procedure and get an explanation why he refused to work on the right side where it hurt so bad. If he had a good reason that would put me at ease about the procedure, that would have been great, but that never happened.

What happened next is unbelievable! Again, laying there in terrible pain and feeling sick,  I cried out to him for help so he could hear me from the other room. Dr. Tonkin came into the room and shouted out in anger...."YOU'RE DONE" and prematurely ended the procedure and then sent me a letter weeks later dropping me as a client. All because I asked to speak to him about my legitimate concerns I had as a patient of his.

I found Dr. Tonkins to be defensive, egotistical, he doesn't communicate with his patients and is quick to anger. If you ask him questions, he may get angry and ask you to leave and drop you as a client.|To any future patients that wish to attend this facility. There's gotta be a reason why their reviews are only at a 2.9. Could it be that they are making people take morning appointments? I just called and scheduled an appointment with another pain. Clinic that specifically asked me what day and what time can I make this appointment?  Imagine that and I was told today whenever they called me  and fire me as a patient that every Doctor's office tells you that you don't have the option of scheduling in the PM or AM. Well, I just called another pain clinic. And I was asked what time can I come in for this appointment. So if you all are looking for a place For pain management and you can't make morning appointments.Then my suggestion is find another pain clinic.I had been coming to this pain clinic for 4 years.I had nothing but good things to say about the staff.I was still fired because I can't make morning appointments. And by all means, do not voice your opinion about any rules that they make up throughout the year. That's not within your contract. By all means, do not speak up on your own behalf. Because then you will be accused of being rude. The nurses will collab together. Make up ignorant stuff to tell Doctor tonklin.  And he will fire you because of what they say. Because if Doctor Tomlin would have listened to the phone call between me and those nurses? Yeah, he would hear that. I was excited and upset but he wasn't going to hear me being rude to them. Ladies because I was throwing compliments to the ladies this this place is a cash cow that's all this places.  Whenever this new building comes out, that's whenever they started making other appointments. Like these annual wellness Check up. Aint that something that you do at your primary care Doctor I mean, if you're going to the pain management facility for your pain, because the primary care Doctor can't prescribe can't prescribe opiates. Why would you be made to go to an annual wellness Check up at a pain clinic if you got a primary care provider. This is them scheduling numerous appointments to make money. Numerous appointments that are not needed and I think that's another reason why I was let go because I questioned all of these appointments.  I mean I was going to 1 appointment per month and now they come up with other reasons to schedule patients for other appointments. No wonder your reviews don't exceed number 3.
I never had the feeling of intimidation by the staff but I was d*** sure accused of being rude to them whenever I defended myself pertaining to the am. And PM appointments. I know what I heard sitting in the lobby as other people were coming up to get their appointment scheduled and I know what was said to me when I walked up to the Desk to get appointment scheduled.I honestly believe this was an attack on me. I don't abuse my medicine it's bullshit that I was fired because  I can't make morning  appointments. I truly  hope this place fails. I see another of reviews  to where you are supervised during urine analysis.  I can say I was never watched to pee . AVOID THIS PLACE.  Boy oh boy you all are killing it in the reviews keep up the good work. Hire you some more 20 yr old nurses to run the side you never pay attention to. Because  the nurses in this establishment  will Sabotage your Dr.  I was fired for being rude ... I've been  going to this place for 5 yrs and I'm just now being rude.. go figure. Point is .. Unless you get shots in your spine you will never see tonkins face. 5 yrs folks have never seen his face. I literally  had to Google him to know what he looked like. And i've seen another review or a lady said that she was treated like a low life which is not surprising at all.. Considering they literally think that they can read people's minds. Apparently it's not just the nurses that are rude to patients. Here's a thought. How would the city of Springfield or the local news like to hear how you dispose of medication in the toilet at this facility or the health department?  I think I'll call to inform  them and ky3.

column2: St Louis Pain Consultants - Creve Coeur
column3:
At St. Louis Pain Consultants, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Creve Coeur area. Our goal is to provide relief of pain, prevent long-term disability, and return you to your maximal activity level. We pride ourselves on delivering individualized care using state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic treatments.

Personalized Pain Management Approach

We understand that chronic pain has many causes and possible treatments, and no single treatment works best for everyone. That's why we work diligently to find the best possible treatment for each individual patient through our progression program until sufficient pain relief is reached. Pinpointing the source of pain and utilizing a targeted treatment plan makes our approach highly successful. Visit our website at https://stl-pain.com to learn more about our services or call us at +1 314-205-6149 to schedule your consultation at our convenient location: 211 N Lindbergh Blvd Suite 100, Creve Coeur, MO 63141.
column11: Our goal is to provide relief of pain, prevent long-term disability, and to return you to your maximal activity level. We pride ourselves on individualized care using state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic treatments. Chronic pain has many causes and possible treatments. No single treatment works best for everyone, so we will work to find the best possible treatment for you! At St. Louis Pain Consultants our goal is to provide effective treatments through a progression program until sufficient pain relief is reached. Pinpointing the source of pain and utilizing a targeted treatment plan makes our approach highly successful.
column38: John Bastian|Sarah Holland|Christy Jo|Wynn Davis-Shanks|Paul Mann|Donna Hobart|David Ziegler|Sound is my vibe
column40:
My first visit to St. Louis Pain Consultants made me feel like I am finally at the right place to get treated. I have been fighting a very painful situation for the past 4 years and everyone that I have been to kind of ignored me. Dr. Mark performed the most thorough exam I have ever had. He pinpointed my pain areas and reported them to Dr. Christofer who then came in and talked about how to help me. I left there with a plan finally. I am extremely happy with what I have experienced so far.|This is a fantastic office. I've had 6 total surgeries on my thumb and forefinger over the last 18 months including a complete fusion. I had been a patient of a pain management  Dr at BJC for 2 years during my surgeries. I was unhappy with then (they stopped listening, didn't offer any options other than narcotics, and,  when I brought up concerns over withdrawals, they completely dismissed me). I officially left their practice because my surgeon was willing to provide pain medication during recovery of my last surgery. I was optimistically naive in thinking I wouldn't be in pain afterward even though my surgeon had told me I would still be in significant pain. I went to a pain management in Belleville first. She got me mixed up with a other patient several times and answered 2 personal phone calls during our appointment. I was ready to just give up and had decided I'd just be in pain forever and would go through withdrawals on my own. On a whim I called this office. I'm beyond happy I did. The office staff is friendly and Mark is absolutely fantastic.  I walked out of my first appointment with a plan that will hopefully replace pain medication along with a plan to taper me off the pain medication. I feel like I finally found a pain management Dr and PA that actually listened to me and my concerns. I highly recommend this office :)|There is a huge communication issue here. I was never told after seeing the dr on my 1st visit here on I would be seeing her assistant.   Arriving to my 2nd visit I was set in an exam room and told dr Mark would be in.  I asked who that is?  Not my dr.?  But it was her assistant.  I had requested a dr appt. My MRI was no longer in chart and it was not retrieved.   I was never informed of the process that my future appts were not always with the dr.  My goal was to find out definitelythe source of my back. I even had the spit marked by the PT. I was referred by another dr. but did not know it was a pain management facility and so I was sent back  to the physical therapist who did help me.  As time passed, my intense pain had passed unless i moved wrong.  I was encouraged to get injections I didnt feel I needed.  I expressed 1st visit I had an MRI AND CT SCAN of my back but it was not where my pain originated or where it was. I still have not gotten another image of this area.  After multiple months the dr discovered the area but no further images were ordered.  I asked and expressed wanting to know what is wrong with back.  No difinitive conclusions or further testing was ordered. This was my purpose my original and following two visits.  I want to see the dr and be told what is the cause of my pain.  After requesting further information I was told to make another appt.  So after 3 primary appts and 3 appts with an ortho dr, I still do not know the state of my back that still causes me issues.  Im tired of being given pills or offered pain injections, paying numerous copays for visits and images thru an ER or a 3rd dr. After 11 months I still have no answers and the drs told me as much.  They "dont know" either.|I went to see Dr Christopher for chronic back pain on my left side. It was so bad I could hardly walk. She suggested two injections given two weeks apart. The first was fantastic, a barely felt the stick and the results were great. I could
rise from a chair without help, and walked much better. I was telling my husband he should make an appt. I couldn't wait to get the second. Well, the second was very uncomfortable to say the least. She had to stick me 4 or 5 times and probed around , saying , to get around the arthritis.
When we left  I was having a pain in my right hip , which wasn't hurting before. By the time I got home it was worse, pain shooting down the right leg causing cramping. I called the office and got the answer machine. I left a detailed message. No one EVER  called back. The next two weeks were horrible, sciatic nerve problems all on the left side. When I returned for the follow up I thought I would see the Dr but no just her assistant. After telling him what happened he said he would let her know. Still I had no response at all from the Dr. I'm through with them and would not recommend them for anyone.  They don't care!|Receptionist are beyond rude.  I will never trust a provider who does not want to view images. They only want the radiologists report  I understand the role of a radiologist.  But in the 6 years of different providers managing my back pain this is the only one to laugh at you wanting to bring the images.   Im unsure if they provide appropriate services bc I can't trust them to get to that point.|Dr. Chrisopher & her staff have given me my life back. I thought my gardening & other hobbies were just a beautiful memory but not any more. I can see myself doing these again. I suffered from severe back pain for over 10 years. I told myself that pain in life was inevitable but misery was optional. It finally got so miserable, I had to seek help. I found this in the team of Dr. Christopher. I am eternally grateful. They couldn't have more patient @ kind. The follow up even with the Abbott representative has been incredible. I can't recommend her enough. I have been a nurse for over 55 years & known many physicians. Dr. Christopher is one of the finest.     Donna Hobart|I have worked with Dr. Christopher and Physician Assistant-Mark Holder. I have received excellent care and exceptional amounts of time explaining my condition to me. I also received a unique Intracept procedure which has eliminated 95% of the lower back pain that I was experiencing. The whole experience has been professional, highly interactive and highly effective. Thanks for your great care.|Did not feel the personal attention to listening or experience was present at my 2 appts. Yet, they were ready to sell 2 invasive procedures / options to my issues that other doctors I consulted with did not agree with.

column40:
Dr. Beuer was my pain specialist for over a decade and has put 2 Intratheacal Pain pumps in me during that time and has abandoned the equipment inside my body with no one to take over for him as he does not have all my records and just gives my docs "Sparatic Notes" that are incomplete.  His office staff would call me saying crazy things like I haven't seen him in 6 years and need to see him. I told them that was incorrect as my pump was less than 4 years old.  Told them to find my missing medical records but they never did including post-op notes.  The emergency alarm on the pump has been going off since March of 2024 and is still going off now. (Feb 2025).  This doctor has no regard for the health of the spine of his patients and I would be very caution especially if you have serious health problems.  You need to be aware if he did this to me, he will do it to you. Good luck if you choose to keep this doctor.|This office is fantastic. From the Dr, to the PA's, to the Nurses, to the Office staff, we highly recommend this pain clinic. They are compassionate, have empathy, do pre-authorizations correctly, and run their office smoothly.|Couldn't be any happier with the Dr, nurse practitioners, and any other nurse or office worker there. I have been coming here for 1-2 years now, but I've been doing pain management for 15 years now, and this is by far my best experience. Everyone is so nice, caring and make the whole process easy.   I'm about to get neurostim trial very soon.  Hopefully it helps. I've heard many good things.|Dr Beuer and his staff are so caring and professional. In a short period of time,they relieved my  nerve pain through ablation surgery. I highly recommend anyone to give this team a try. They will exceed your expectations.They most certainly did for me! May you too find good success by using their services.
Thanks|Been coming for the last three years for my back just mentioned to Jennifer the Nurse Practitioner about my knee pain. She immediately told me about knee injections and set me up to try them. They do my knees great. Total relief without extra medication to take. They are very knowledgeable and professional staff. Glad I found this staff and Dr. Beauer I recommend this place to you.|I was hurt in 07 and I have tried and done everything suggested  by Doctors.  I went to pain management,  chiropractor, my  primary doctor and neurosurgeon who fused my spine.  Nothing helped the pain.. The pain was horrible.  I could go for days unable to sleep.  A health professional suggested I see this doc.  Recently I received an implanted spinal stimulator.  I am receiving so much relief..  It feels so much better.  Yes, I still have pain, but its manageable with this wonderful device.  Doctor's staff are very kind, helpful and friendly.  I was met with concerned professionalism with each interaction.  Thank you, so much for your understanding, care and help.  I'm sleeping each and every night!|I've been a patient of Dr Beuer for nearly 5 years and since that time I have become a new person.  He is compassionate and caring but lets you know what you need to do to feel better and expects you to do it or he really can't be of much help.  It took a while for me to catch on to this but once I did, there's been no stopping me.  He said if I didn't lose weight, my back pain would never get any better and no amount of medication would help anymore.  I disagreed but he stood firm so I gave in.  Since then, I've lost 163 pounds, I can walk again, I can breathe again, my joints are not nearly as painful as they once were.  I get out again and am seriously considering going back to work full time.  I am not on pills that don't help anyway.  I have an implanted intrathecal pain pump that is exceptional.  It has helped my backpain more that any medication that I have ever taken.  I feel like a new woman and couldn't be happier.  My depression has even lightened up on me a bit.  Thank you Dr. Beuer for you caring kindness, your stubbornness, your intelligence, your skills and the best office staff and radiology staff ever!  I hope I never need to go anywhere else for pain care but you.  But, you could lose the country music in the procedure room.  Whatever happened to classic rock?  LOL|Dr. Beuer and his staff are wonderful.  My daughter has been under his care for a little over a year. She suffers from debilitating pain caused by Metastatic Breast Cancer in her bones. Dr. Beuer surgically placed an Intrathecal Pain Pump which delivers microdoses of medicine right where it is needed. His bedside manner is professional while genuinely caring.  We highly recommend him and his office if you need help in managing your pain.

Dr. Anderson and the nurses were great, but Julie is horrible, she is incredibly dismissive, rude, and will just tell you how it is ignoring everything you try to say or explain. Julie is kind and attentive to hear the descriptions of my pain problems and diligent in trying to find resources to manage it and improve the quality of my life.|Julie is the worst provider I've ever seen and their office staff is two rude, incompetent women who continue to mischedule, ignore patients and mis-chart. They never helped me in the last 3 years. Julie "does things her own way" her words. I could go on but im not putting more health info on the internet than they have already released without my permission.|Dr. Ellen and Dr. Anderson along with the entire staff have all been wonderful. I was referred here after physical therapy did not help. They genuinely seemed to care about my pain and wanted to help. I have had 3 steroid shots so far and every time the whole staff has been so kind and caring. They communicate with me clearly and now that the shots are no longer working they've started a new care plan.|Excellent folks who know their job and are knowledgeable in their field. Provide information to patient to help make better decisions about their health.|Dr Susan Anderson -Jones MD is Absolutely Amazing !!  The Entire staff are the nicest and caring people. Good job gals ! Keep up the good  work. I Applaud you All|Wife was in the Liberty Hospital and was told she needed to have a pain shot. However, she had a UTI which had to be cleared up first. Was released on Monday. UTI was cleared up on Tuesday. Called to get the appointment at the Pain Management Center and was told they had no order for the shot, they would have to check with the doctor who was in clinicals(or something). Never heard anything more Tuesday. Called Wednesday and was told the order had been cancelled. How could an order that they didn't have be cancelled?? Now told it may be a couple of weeks before she can get a shot. Note: only gave 1 Star because it wouldn't allow zero.|My experience was definitely a good one. The only thing that needs changed is the congestion of checking in and out in same location. It's a total cluster.
Rumor has it you no longer recognize retiring staff. What a cheap way to treat people who have dedicated years of service to your hospital. My wife spent over 34 years as a nurse in your facility and you can't show any gratitude by including her and others in your recognition dinner. This use to be a family oriented hospital. Now the bottom line is all that counts. You're losing what made you stand above other hospitals and it's sad.

Dr. Ramis Gheith and his nurse practitioner Mindy are absolutely wonderful. I would never go anywhere else. They keep me out of pain and they're very good at what they do. I have been to other Back Pain Specialist, and none of them have ever been able to practically have me pain free. Interventional Pain Institute are by far the best place I have ever and will ever go to. His nurse practitioner Mindy is so good at what she does. She's kind and gentle. They  talk to you and find out Where the pain is coming from and located. They have found the perfect place For my injections in my back. This time My injection has lasted  eight months. I go back again in August 2024 and I will get another injection and I know it will last eight months as well.|Dr. Whitlow genuinely cares about his patients. He wants to make his patients comfortable. He has taken care of me now for about 3 years I believe. I feel I can talk to him and share my concerns and he listens to me and works with me to have a plan. He is the best Dr for pain management that I have been to and will not change. I have no need to.|Dr. Geith is an awesome physician with an excellent "bedside manner". His office and surgery center staff are very caring as well. Very efficient. Cleanliness was excellent at both  centers. I highly recommend Interventional Pain Institute for everyone suffering with chronic pain.
I am now very hopeful for my future.|First patient appt, dr. Whitlow was awesome. He explained to me that my treatment I was on previously with my old pain management doctor was not good for me because of my age. I got Cortizone steroid injections every three months in my back and knee. Long period of time this makes your bones brittle. He's got me on a new plan and I am super excited. I would highly recommend Dr. Whitlow, but I am sure all the other doctors in this practice are just as good. I walked out of the office with a smiles and excitement. I am 50 years old and I am a full-time nanny and grandmother And I do not wanna slow down.|The staff at this office is pretty incredible.  The doctor took the time to throughly examine and explain everything that's going on in my case. While there,  I experienced an unrelated medical incident and must say they were extremely professional and handled it accordingly. Thank you to the entire team!|I love this office. From the time you walk in they know you name. Your wait time is not long at all. They explain things to you and give you booklets. I had a morphine pain pump put in my body and after some adjustments I can say I rarely hurt.|Dr Gheith is a very friendly Dr.  He listened to my problems and has not brushed me off like other drs.  He put ia Nevro pain stimulator in my back, which has helped, and now we are trying to get my knees pain free.  He and his staff have been wonderful, and I have recommended him to other people.  Thank you Dr Gheith.|This doctor does not return calls. Well, one call was returned at 5:45 am. Really? The others I'm still waiting on a return call...3 weeks now. He does not have his patient's best interest in mind. He acts as though he is higher than the rest of the world.  Left me stranded in the hospital with no way to get in touch with him.
Would NOT recommend to anyone. Find a doctor that cares about your health.
UPDATE..Doctor has been fired by me. No good reviews from anyone I have talked with about my pump and this loser doc.
I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

column38: Beverly Hunter|M. Tucker|Dan O|jessica simpson|Edward Moss|Jeff Harlan|Dl Garfield|mary Reardon
column40:
Dr. Bradford Noble is a VERY dedicated and knowledgeable about the care of his patients! He can tell where the patient has pain and can fix or extremely reduce and relieve the pain with cortisone shots and if necessary prescribe medication. I get my cortisone shots every 3-4 months in my tailbone area and it relieves the pain in my lower back for a couple of months until the next cortisone shot !!! Excellent Dr and staff is very professional and courteous!!!|Dr. Noble talked about everything from meditation, prayer, drinking water, hot/cold packs and physical therapy. I have major back, knee and ankle pain. Providing medicine to get through my day pain free, wasn't even an option. A total waste of my time and insurance co-pay. I'll never return or recommend.|Every time I go here me and my family member are kept waiting 3 hours or more past our appointment time and then it's another 30 to 45 minutes before Dr. Noble comes and sees us. They really need to fix that, it seems very mismanaged. The stories from other patients I've spoken to have the same stories or even worse than what I had. There's no need to be kept waiting that long.|Only went a few times because shots in my back don't work. But I've seen first hand how he doesn't follow his own plans he discussed with his patient, they follow his rules even after having major surgery and still denies the use of pain medicine versus all these injections that last maybe two days or 4 days max. Won't be back nor will I recommend this joke of a doctor.|All staff are responsible as well as respectful.
These people care about you as a person and not as a patient...all are knowledgeable about their fields of study as well as many other fields.If you're on a pathway to becoming healthier- lay your footprints here because the knowledge and charisma between staff and patient can be considered a highly effective method in medical science- it works!|Maybe it not all the doctors fault, but I was on pain medication long before I started see Dr Noble, I have went along with all his recommendations, injections spinal stimulator, which I would not ever have done if he didn't push it. He will only treat my back pain, but I've been on the pain meds for severe osteoarthritis long before he came along. I've been fighting this arthritis since I was a teenager, I've had 14 surgeries just trying to keep working, I've had both hips replaced, currently both knees are bone on bone, both shoulders are bone on bone, I'm trying to maintain a job, but I did as Dr Noble told me to take no more pain meds than needed, some days are worse than others, I was prescribed a max of 6 pill a day,but many days only needed 4, so now as my pain has gotten to the point of out of control, he shorted me 60 pill this month when I told him my pain has gotten worse, so I called the office,  needing more meds to get through the month, and was told they couldn't help me because I didn't take 6 a day and only refilled my meds once in a month and a half, so they can't give me 180 like I always got,absolutely no compassion for someone who needs help it's his orders of not taking 6 a day when not needed that got me in this situation and now I'm just screwed,how are you supposed to keep your meds coming when you do as the doctor tell you and now because of his orders he won't give me the meds I've been using for years! I do not recommend this clinic, never once has he been on time for your appointment, always very late,like no one else matters but the doctor as far as time wasted sitting waiting to be seen 2 hours late when you are there on time but he's too busy to keep a schedule, and now this ordeal!|ONE STAR....HORRENDOUS I have been a patient of Noble's for many years, he knows how bad my back is. In addition to my back pain, I now have a very screwed up leg; I need a knee replacement plus I have a huge painful lump on my leg. The pain in my leg is joining the pain in my back. MY PAIN LEVEL IS AT OH MY GOD STAGE. On my last visit, (he had cut down on my meds) I asked if I could go back to where I was before, just until I can get my leg operated on. HE HAD HIS EYES CLOSED THE ENTIRE TIME OF MY VISIT. HE SAID BY GOING TO AN ORTHOPEDIC SURGEON & GETTING A SMALL SCRIPT OF TRAMADOL, I VIOLATED MY CONTRACT. HE MADE A NURSE WATCH ME PEE FOR THE DRUG TEST, AND WOULD NOT ORDER A STEROID SHOT FOR MY BACK WHICH WAS DUE. (I HAVE PERMANENT SCIATICA, PINCHED NERVE IN MY LOWER BACK) He said i needed to make another appointment. He has been getting weirder with every visit. He overbooks & the wait is usually 4 hours. His behavior has become bizarre, very dismissive, especially to female patients. He refuses to explain anything ( like MRI results) or listen to your concerns. The last steroid shot he gave me hurt really bad. Frankly he acts  like he is prescribing to himself. All he cares about is filling out the 5 page questionare the "correct" way. I will never go back to him, he treated me like I was pill shopping despite the fact I have sciatica, advanced scoliosis, bulging disks, a torn up-very swollen knee, a bowed out leg that gets so stiff & painful I can barely put weight on it. Not to mention he has lost so much weight & has had so much plastic surgery, he barely resembles what he looked liked 5 years ago.|Dr. Noble, and his staff, are professional, personable, and kind. They listen and do everything they can to help.  I highly recommend them.

column2: Padda Institute Center for Interventional Pain Management
column3:
At the Padda Institute Center for Interventional Pain Management, we are a nationally recognized center of excellence for treating complex chronic pain conditions in St. Louis.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

Our approach focuses on eliminating the root cause of pain, not just masking symptoms. We provide specialized treatments for:

  • Chronic pain management

  • Low back pain relief

  • Diabetic neuropathy treatment

  • Foot pain therapy

  • Severe head and neck pain interventions

  • Physical therapy programs

Beyond physical pain, we also address mental health conditions that often accompany chronic pain, including anxiety, depression, and post-traumatic stress disorder. Our integrated approach ensures patients receive complete care at our specialized pain management clinic. Located at 5203 Chippewa St #301, St. Louis, MO 63109, we invite you to contact us at +1 314-481-5000 to discover how we can help you regain control of your life through effective pain management.

The pain management clinic located in St. Louis specializes in chronic pain treatment. We are a nationally recognized center of excellence for treating complex chronic pain.
We provide physical therapy, diabetic neuropathy, chronic pain, low back pain, foot pain, severe head, and neck pain treatment. We also treat anxiety, depression, and post-traumatic stress disorder. We believe in eliminating the root cause of the pain and not just treating the pain.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

column40:
I'm so happy Dr Seo was very considerate and listened to my fears and never pushed opioids on me. My back injections was yes very scary for me but the staff and the compassion of Dr. Seo was very calming and reassuring it was all normal. They where right the next day I had 95% relief of my pain that I have had for the past 6 months. Can't say enough about this staff and Dr.|If you are hurting like I was going see Dr SEO. He cares, he listens to you. He plans a course of action that will get you going again. We need more Drs. like him. All the office staff are courteous and listen to you.i would recommend him and have to anyone!|This place is a joke. Dr Bult had given me injections in my back, without anything to make me groggy or anything, then hit a nerve in my back with the needle, and I was down in bed for 5 days because of this. I couldn't walk, and I couldn't crawl. I literally was dragging my body by my hands, after having to roll off my bed onto the floor just to get to the restroom, and then having to drag my body back to my bed and lift my body by my hands because he hit a nerve in my back. Yes I have feet, but couldn't use them because he had hit a nerve with the injection I had screamed and cried when he hit that nerve, and he left me in more pain than what I had come in there with. He is very unsympathetic, bedside manners were horrible.
Needless to say, I have not and will not go back to this dr. I highly suggest that you don't either.|Pretty sore from injections in my back today... But he did a great job making me feel safe!
I was really impressed today.  About an hour and a half after I got home my phone rang... It was my pain management Dr who had just done my injections...he called to check on me and see how I was feeling.  Wow way to go Dr Bult! Now that's what I call a good Dr who knows how to  make a person feel like a person and not a number! Thank you!|Literally the biggest waste of a month and a half of my life.  Only things he wants to consider are physical therapy (which my insurance denied) and spinal injections for my back (which is only a small portion of my pain.) He does not believe in giving young adults pain medication, oral or otherwise. This is what he told me as a mother to a young legal adult myself . The rest of the staff I have met were incredibly helpful and sweet and have looked at him like he has bumped his dang head.|My  guy has chronic nerve pain in his face.  This pain clinic was recommended by his primary care Doc.  The gal who answered the phone was unbelievably rude. When asked if she had received the referral and being told that he was in lots of pain.  The gal responded by telling him that she had not received a referral and the doctor will not write pain prescriptions. All of this without having a clue as to the clinical nature of his need.  She did not even ask his name!!  So how the hell would she know if the referral arrived?  This place could care less about patients. Unbelievable.  We will seek care elsewhere.  Beware!|I'm in chronic pain all of the time everywhere, I have an illness combined with several diagnoses to numerous to mention. I have been to over 36 exceptional Specialist and none of them have been able to help me. Their comment is that I am over their scope of knowledge. Dr. Bult and Kelly are true professionals. They give me extraordinary care each and every time. The shots I receive in my hips, knees, shoulder, mid back, and lower back has increased my quality of life. It relieves non-stop pain for 1-4 weeks.  I do not live on pain pills. This is the best I can do since other Drs. Haven't been able to help me .
The personal care from this facility is of the highest rating I could give. Thanks for taking care of me when others didn't have a clue or even listen.|I am a a 60 man. Served my country for 33 years.  Dr. Bult and his Staff were very polite and professional during my office visit. After injections were given in my lower lumbar spine. I had pain relief in my back and legs. Going back today for further evaluation.  Yes he gave me pain relief. Yes he gave a referral for a dietician. And yes your weight has much to do with pain. Carrying arround too much weight effects your health and issues with pain of the human skeleton. Thank you Dr. Bult and Staff.

column40:
Dr Doss and his nurses ignored me begging them to stop as the local pain medication didn't work so I felt every needle in my spine. I did call and complain after but nothing seems to have been said to the staff. They called me today to set up my next appointment. Do don't trust Dr Doss and his staff they won't stop even if you scream.
I wish I had looked the reviews before going.|I have been a patient of Dr. Liz for a year, and I can't express how much I am going to miss her. Dr. Liz is an exceptional doctor who genuinely cares about her patients. She listens with compassion, offers thoughtful advice, and always goes above and beyond to ensure the best care. Her dedication and kindness made a world of difference in my pain management journey. Dr. Liz is more than just a doctor; she's a wonderful person who truly makes you feel heard and supported. She will be deeply missed, and I wish her nothing but the best in her next chapter. Having to find a new dr is going to be a rough time.|I was a patient of Liz Elwell's for about a year and a half . She  was the first doctor I found when I moved from Colorado. . She was the most amazing pain management doctor I've had! I've had 8 spine surgeries and most likely need another cervical asap. Now I cannot find a doctor to help with the pain management because I was told to go to my primary care but, I utilize cannabis as well I'm on my second that won't prescribe to 10 mg oxycodones a day! Which wouldn't do much but, it's the principle! They work together so well but, one or the other does't do the trick! I've had so many injections with no relief, several nerve blocks, physical therapy, and tens etc. none of those worked so I depended on both and Liz had no problem with cannabis!! It's medically legal! I have no idea why it's ok to just cut legitimate chronic pain patients off for no reason! She followed the DEA guidelines to a T. I tried to email the marketing manager whom had backed the clinic a few years ago with no response! Now my 3 inner fingers on my right hand are numb and I've been waiting on a MRI for over 7 weeks! I've already had nerve damage from the issue being ignored! I wish someone would of at least had the decency to explain to her patients why this decision was made!!|Liz was a good doctor but the pain clinic was by no means helpful with helping me find new medical care that I sorely need.  They don't give a damn about people or what they are going through as long as it doesn't burden the higher ups in charge.  So besides Liz Elwell this pain center is crap.  I don't blame her for finding a new place to work.|I saw the arthritis doctor who came down to Warrensburg on certain days from St.Lukes. When I arrived , the receptionist told me that I did not have an appointment. Earlier in the month, someone from her office called and changed my appointment. She ( the doctor refused) I will never go back there again.|I had an appointment with APRN named Liz, I think, I have never seen this physician before.

This is already after I had done all pre check ins and everything was ok.

Unprofessional, and not a nice thing to do to a disabled person.|This place sucks. I went there almost 2 months ago. They were supposed to set me up for treatment. I have never heard a word back from them. And the doctor does not speak English|Would not recommend Doss.

column2: St. Louis Spine and Joint Pain Specialists
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Fenton, MO

At St. Louis Spine and Joint Pain Specialists, we specialize in personalized pain management treatments that address the root causes of your discomfort. Our dedicated team, led by Dr. Shomstein and Dr. Mekler, brings cutting-edge techniques and compassionate care to every patient interaction. We offer a wide range of services including:

  • Targeted spinal injections and interventional procedures

  • Customized treatment plans for chronic and acute pain

  • Non-surgical approaches to pain management

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

  • In-office procedures for patient convenience

Unlike traditional pain clinics, we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop individualized solutions that restore quality of life. Many of our patients have regained mobility, returned to work, and significantly reduced their dependence on pain medications. Located at 520 Center St #101, Fenton, MO 63026, we're committed to helping you live pain-free. Visit www.yourpainmatters.com or call us at (314) 516-3289 to schedule your consultation today.

column38: Kelly Hill|Kristin N.|Gail Merisotes|Amanda Stansbury|Birdie Wing|Jen Houston|Becca Green|Bob Bishop
column40:
I have been going to St. Louis & Joint Specialists since they opened and WOW are Dr. Shomstein and Dr. Mekler amazing. I have never met more compassionate doctors in my life. They listen and they never rush you. And they are on the cutting edge with technology and research. Please go if you are living with pain. Your quality of life will change for the better and possibly permanently!!!
This is my story. When I first met with them I was having horrible hip pain and was in tears. I had been to specialists for hips in the St. Louis area and did not need a replacement so they didn't offer other solutions. Dr. Shomstein injected both of hips suspecting bursitis. I immediately felt relief and had a number of injections and have never had to return for my hip pain. I have been pain free for 4 years. They actually listen to you and you are never rushed because they are perfectionists and get to the root cause of the problem . I have recommended them to a lot of my friends and they have all been thrilled with the results. I have not seen Dr. Shomstein in years and had a shoulder replacement two years ago and have been suffering with horrible neck pain. The chiropractor wasn't helping so I immediately called them. They got me in quickly and sent me for an MRI and determined that I had arthritis in my C1 and C2. Dr. Shomstein is so intelligent and did a thorough check of my neck. He was 99 percent confident that my  surrounding muscles  were causing the pain. Instead of putting injections into my spine, which can be really scary and is more invasive, he put injections into all of the muscles that he suspected were  the issue. He took the less invasive procedure first. Within 3 days I realized he solved the problem. I started sleeping through the night. Hadn't in 2 years! I returned today, a month later for my follow up and told him that I was 95 % better. I hugged him and almost started crying. Living with pain becomes debilitating and I thought I had to live with this. Being the perfectionist that he is, he put a couple of injections  into the areas that were still causing slight issues. I will return in 3 weeks and I know I will report that I am 100% better. I have a very stressful job and carry my stress in my neck like most of I do! And I'm 57. So if you are sick of living with pain, go see them. Do not live in pain!!!!!!|Dr. Mekler and Rimma are phenomenal. So caring, helpful, and help my pain SO much when no one else would listen. I'm so grateful for them and would highly recommend them. They do shared decision making and want to get to the root of the issue to help!|I had left the care of Dr. Mekler and Dr. Adam. I'm so glad I'm back. Dr. Mekler goes out of her way to make you feel comfortable during the entire process. I only get a glimpse of Dr. Adam from time to time but every time he's smiling. Rimma is so helpful and friendly.
I drive from St. Louis Lambert Airport area to Fenton. Definitely worth the drive. Thank you Dr. Mekler!|Where do I begin with Dr. Mekler and Dr. Shomstein?  I can live my life again because of the compassionate care and brilliance that are these two wonderful human beings!  I've been receiving care under these two now going on 7 years and to say they are amazing is an understatement!  First, I was able to get off almost all of the medications I was taking due my multiple chronic illnesses, secondly,  I was able to go back to work after 5 years, and lastly they provided me with hope for my future again.  I can't begin to thank these two enough for helping me regain my life back and for always being in my corner...THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!  YOU ARE BOTH ANGELS WALKING ON THIS EARTH!!!|Every visit delivers the highest of patient care. Always providing the time to listen,understand and address each individual(s) concerns & needs. Honestly I don't believe... I've ever...(I mean EVER) experienced this level of kindness, and caring for their patients elsewhere. Because of this, my healing journey began here, and all of the blessings have followed. I'm forever changed, and thankful beyond words. Thank you, thank you,thank you for everything you do for me!|Dr. Shomstein and Dr. Mekler are a phenomenal team. Truly a personalized approach, they do not approach pain with a "one size fits all" mentality. They are thorough and take the time to make sure the patient understands the plan of care. They do their procedures in the office which is very convenient! They are super kind and knowledgeable, you can tell that they are truly committed to making you feel better. So glad I found them!|Wonderful office staff and amazing doctors! Rimma is so kind and communicative! And Dr. Shomstein is thorough and informative - he spends a lot of time with his patients to correctly diagnose the problem and discusses treatment options in depth allowing patients to make an informed decision about their care. Dr Mekler has assisted in several of my procedures and is really empathetic and wonderful, as well! Best pain management experience I've ever had... the entire staff is truly committed to helping patients overcome the obstacles acute or chronic pain can cause and they really care about their patients' quality of life!|A lifetime of working in the construction industry, resulted in 3 back surgeries, a neck surgery, arthritis and a host of day in and day out pain scenarios; (many of which would immobilize me). These Doctors specifically have gotten me through not only pain management to be able to function, but have actually gotten me to a point where I am off all pain meds, restored mobility and strength, and minimized my need for followup visits to very little at all. These are not your typical Doctors. They actually are what Doctors should be, not what the industry standard spews out. They are the most engaged, most competent health care professionals and are consistent over and over applying those characteristics. If you are overwhelmed with your pain, feeling that you have no hope of ever reclaiming life without pain, tired of being an insurance claim and forced into standard industry molds, you need these Doctors. Both are excellent and invest into your health with genuine concern and application for relief.

Welcome to St. Louis Pain Center, your trusted partner in neuropathy treatment in St. Louis, MO.

Specialized Neuropathy Care

We specialize in treating peripheral neuropathy, a condition that affects sensory and motor nerves, often manifesting first in the extremities. Our comprehensive approach addresses the tingling, burning sensations, muscle weakness, and coordination problems that accompany nerve damage and dysesthesia. We understand how debilitating these symptoms can be, which is why we've developed effective treatment protocols to help patients regain comfort and mobility.

Our Services Include:

  • Advanced neuropathy treatments

  • Knee pain management with gel injections

  • Personalized pain control therapies

  • Professional chiropractic care

At our Telegraph Road location, we provide individualized care in a comfortable, welcoming environment. Our team is dedicated to helping you find relief when traditional medical approaches have fallen short. If you're struggling with neuropathy or chronic pain, visit our website or call us at +1 314-846-2100 to discover how we can help you reclaim a pain-free life.
column11:
Welcome to St. Louis Pain Center. If you suffer from Neuropathy in St. Louis MO, call our team today and find out how we can help.

Neuropathy is also known as peripheral neuropathy because of its effect on the body's sensory and motor nerves. It is very common for patients to experience the first symptoms in their extremities (hands, arms, legs, and feet). It is also common for patients to develop muscle weakness and coordination problems. Peripheral neuropathy can occur when there is nerve damage and develop into dysesthesia, which affects a patient's touch sensation. This often leads to a tingling and/or burning sensation.

column40:
I had to give a review after meeting Dr. Oliver today because I read that other review that just now seems absurd!
Going through anything that requires pain management is a frustrating process. Dr. Oliver was extremely kind and attentive. He explained everything to me in great detail. He listened to everything I had to say and addressed every concern I introduced.
This is a journey and not expected to be fixed with one visit.
That being said. I highly recommend that you disregard the blatantly negative remarks made by the lady who clearly only had 1 visit. Go and meet him for yourself! You will not be disappointed!|I was very disappointed by dr oliver's condescending manner and basically dismissing the amount of pain I'm in. I ended up going to the hospital in excruciating agony and have been here for 5 days now. Why? Because they actually listened and are arranging for surgery on not only my back which the dr opted to barely listen to the problem but my hip, which the dr completely ignored when I tried to discuss it with him. His hopefully this will work attitude towards his treatment plan left me very uncomfortable trusting him with my health.|I have Complex Regional Pain Syndrome and have been treated by a few different doctors over the past 20 years including some of the world-renown pioneers in Pain Management. Although my specific condition details are unique, I have found success with a particular regimen of medications and the use of a spinal cord stimulator.

My situation is unique and complex enough to not allow most pain doctors to work with me because of Governmental limitations and restrictions. Most doctors have refused to even see me when they hear what is wrong with me and how I am currently being treated.

Dr. Oliver (and others at the Interventional Pain Institute) have been nothing but professional and compassionate with me. I have resigned myself to the idea that I will likely live my (hopefully) many-remaining years in moderate-to-severe pain. They have helped give me hope again that more relief... maybe even significantly more relief is a possibility and they are willing to work with me to try.

Pain management is a difficult industry to work in. As I have witnessed for myself, a third to half of the people sitting in the waiting rooms of a pain clinic are just looking to get high on opioids and most of them don't actually want rehab. That makes it much harder on those of us in actual pain and in need of those doctors and the devices and medications they use. IPI does a great job sifting through the drug seekers so they can concentrate on those who have actual needs, and THAT is as much a service to those of us being served as it is to the doctors themselves.|All staff is very friendly and so far my appointments have been on time with little to no wait! Dr. Oliver is great! He wasn't quick to judge me or label me as a drug seeker as some other pain management doctors have in the past. He took the time to really listen to what is going on. He is very detailed in what the MRI showed and used a model that was very helpful to understand where my pain is coming from and how we can treat it. During my injection procedure I was able to talk to him and get to know him a little more, was very comfortable with him and staff, and he has very nice bedside manner. I highly recommend Dr. Oliver and his staff!!!|2023. I Had three expensive procedures but  received no relief. I am being charged additionally although I paid $222. For each co`pay.  I feel used as income source not as patient.... The last appointment I was called in am & told not to come.  Didn't get message. Charged anyway.  I paid over over $1000 in co-pays. Current charge over $300. No explanation as to what charge i is fr.  Supposedly covered by insurance.  Feel scammed. Not told of cost beforehand . Got zero Relief. Do not waste  your money|I loved Dr Oliver when he first came to St Louis.  He took over after my old doctor retired.  I'd been with his practice for 10 years.  These are pain management doctors.  They treat pain.  I have had a back surgery and still really suffered from a lot of pain.  When Dr Oliver started with me I told him my goals were to get off the medications and see if there was anything else we could try.  We tried different spinal shots, some even worked for a while.   Then it got a lot tougher.  We decided to do a spinal stimulator.  The trail went great and I was approved.  I was sent to a spine surgeon who wanted to do some more tests.  To Make a long story short, I needed 2 spine surgeries and then just hope it didn't get worse.  I had the surgery 5 weeks ago.  About 3 weeks in I get a letter from Dr Oliver letting me know he was changing offices and could no longer treat me.  No referrals no advice.  He said he may know one doctor and he would call me back.   He hasn't called.  I've called to follow up only to have an extremely rude woman who did not identify herself basically tell me to just go away.  No one there will help me.  I am 5 weeks out from a double spine surgery.  After 10 years with this same doctors office and zero problems, this is how I was treated.  I have even had drug tests that proved I was taking my meds as directed.  I understand that there is a lot of pressure on these doctors but there are ways to help people and treat people.  Dr Oliver promised to call me back and then turned his back on me.  I am so disappointed and scared.  I need help and don't know where to turn.  Don't put yourself in this position.  Stay away from Dr Oliver and Signature Orthopaedics.|Dr. Oliver is such a good Dr.! He is very interested in what you have to say and do whatever tests are necessary to find the problems you are having. He puts my mind at ease, after all he is going to be inserting needles in my back! I'm scared of needles but he makes sure I'm comfortable. I highly recommend Dr Oliver. He's an excellent Dr.|I had Dr. Oliver perform another cortisone injection procedure on my hip.  As before, it was a great experience.  It was not without some minor pain and discomfort but the outcome made it all worthwhile.  Dr. Oliver is very good at explaining the procedure (what he's going to do and what area will be affected) and making sure I'm comfortable with everything that's going on with my medical care.  I would highly recommend him to anyone looking for a competent, qualified orthopedic/pain management specialist.  I've been seen by several such doctors but he ranks at the top of my list.

On a side note, the only issue I have with Dr. Oliver is his support of the LSU Tigers (as I'm an Alabama Crimson Tide man)!  LOL  But in all seriousness, he is an outstanding doctor that provides great care to his patients!

I ready like Dr. Schmidt and his staff!  I have been going to this office for 3 months and Dr. Schmidt and his staff are very respectful and care about you. I made a call to the nurse today and the nurse called me back within a half hour. I was very impressed because my previous pain dr wouldn't call me back, sometimes for days. I'm very happy with everyone in Dr. office!!|If you want to wait...and wait....then have a doctor smugly brush your thoughts about your own care aside, then Dr. Schmidt is your guy. If you like to be talked down to and be judged for needing pain meds to function than he's absolutely perfect for you! I spent two and a half hours there today and ended up walking out before finishing up my appointment!|I had been a patient of dr. Brian Smith when he was in practice here prior to his retirement. I had been going to this office for many years and they used to take very good care of me and help with my chronic pain from multiple sclerosis. I had always been satisfied with services here prior to recently visiting. I had moved away for a couple years so I hadn't used this office.
I recently moved back into town and scheduled an appointment with the office thinking that I was going to get the help that I needed with my chronic long-term illness as they had always been so reliable in the past. However when I went to my appointment 2 months ago I first waited in the office for an hour and a half before they called me to the back then once I was back in the room they take my vitals then the nurse informs me that I now had to fill out a new patient packet because they have a new system since I had last been seen. now mine do I had already waited an hour and a half in the lobby and could have filled out the paperwork at that point so now I had to wait even longer to complete this paperwork before I could be seen by dr. Schmidt. I am about 10 to 15 minutes into filling out the paperwork then another nurse comes into the room and says, "I am sorry Ms. Augustus but we will not be able to help you today if you are expecting any kind of medication prescribed to you." I then asked why wouldn't you guys have told me that sooner after sitting here for two and a half hours and as I'm balling my eyes out because my pain is so severe at this point what am I supposed to do I'm here asking for help with my pain you guys are licensed pain specialist and now you're trying to tell me that you are unable to prescribe me some type of medication for my chronic pain! Then she goes to say well I'm sorry but dr. Schmidt no longer prescribe pain medication he only does injections. I know that is a lie because I seen him writing prescriptions for other patients who were waiting on them in the lobby so now I feel like the staff is lying to me and why would they not want to help me especially since I had been a patient here for many many years? I left the office in tears I'm feeling so hopeless with getting help for my pain. I have a serious chronic illness again multiple sclerosis so it's not like I'm coming in there with nothing wrong with me I'm just curious as to why they would be so quick to shut somebody down and turn them away when that is their job to help people with their pain I'm very dissatisfied and will never recommend this office to anyone.|Dr Smith's staff are fantastic they made you feel comfortable and we're very professional and knowledgeable and felt that you were an important patient to them.... with the procedure/injection on my back I was in and out in less than an hour and that was with anesthesia... Even though they told me it would take at least 2 days to have the effect of the injection I felt so much better in 2 hours it drop my pain level from a constant five to six to a level of two..... It is currently 20 hours since the injection and procedure and I am still at a level two constant.,. They said I might have some irritation or pain or the first 24 hours and to put ice on it and then heat but I have had no need for any kind of treatment to the injection area it's like never happened as far as that goes..,.... Now since it has been only 20 hours since the procedure only time will tell on the length of the effect but so far I am extremely pleased.,... I'm not sure if I can but I will try to give an update on the effects in a few weeks...... So far I highly recommend this company Dr Smith with his great staff it was a real pleasure|the doctor takes his time with you and answers all your questions the staff is nice there is a staff member at the washington mo office named Anna that was so very nice and listened to what i had to say and didnt rush me off the phone i would definetly recommend that office|DR. STEPHEN SCHMIDT IS THE BEST ATTENTIVE,COMPASSIONATE  DOCTOR I KNOW I'VE BEEN WITH HIM SINCE 2006 ABSOLUTELY NO COMPLAINTS|I saw Dr.Schmidt years  ago and I can tell from the recent review that he has not changed at all if you even want to call him a doctor he is argumentative with zero compassion he is definitely in the wrong profession he needs to step down and step away from medicine|Dr Brian Smith and his team are awesome! My back, leg and shoulder pain are totally managed.
