And when I pointed this out and let the staff know I was leaving they became rude and condescending.|You know the first couple yrs I really enjoyed Dr Mohd he had me almost pain free and then in one visit he yanked everything down to 1/4 of the he previously ordered and made me stop the klonipin that I had been in for 15 yrs. I tried standing up for myself but was quickly laughed at and told I wouldn't b seen anymore. So for a year and half I went through living hell seeing other pain mgmt that forced u to have 3-4 injections every other week. Finally I made an appt at a normal MD  with one look at my file he took me on with my pain meds and also gave me back the klonipin. Which tells me that Dr Mohd did not have to treat a 2 yr patient the way I was treated. I'm not saying he's a bad Dr but I don't feel he's a good Dr either. Thnx|Dr Modh is great. He actually cares about giving ppl relief. Long term patients need to understand he has to follow DEA regulations regarding opiates.  Currently, I highly recommend.|He is an amazing Doctor, with the best bedside manner, I am so glad I was sent to him, my pain level was beyond a 10, now my pain is bearable, it will never go completely away, but at least now I can do things I never could before, but if you are just looking for drugs and a high don't bother because you have to take a drug test every time you go and that is to ween out the addicts, which is fine with me. Keep up the good work Doc.|I was just glancing at the reviews on Dr Modh and staff.  I was shocked at some of the low ratings!  I have been seeing Dr Modh monthly for almost 7 years.  I am a retired Substance Abuse Counselor.  I am very much aware of the possibility of addiction with chronic pain as is Dr Modh.  I get shots most every time I see him.  And I can tell you this, I WOULD NOT TRUST ANY DOCTOR OTHER THAN HIM TO STICK NEEDLES IN MY BACK!!  I had a prior pain physician that used some type of stimulation using electricity without explaining anything.  I ended up going into shock, couldn't walk, mind totally messed up.  Finally had them call a friend who took off work and took me home and stayed until the next day.  Last time for that doctor!  If you want a GOOD PHYSICIAN, Dr Modh is for you!|Dr Modh is a very down to earth Dr. Explains everything completely. column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Since 1982

At Pain Management Services, we've been dedicated to alleviating suffering for over four decades. What began as a focused practice for back pain patients has evolved into a comprehensive pain management group serving those with chronic pain conditions throughout Missouri. As the only accredited pain management medical group in Missouri, we combine advanced techniques with compassionate care to help restore quality of life for our patients.

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Diagnostic and therapeutic facet joint injections

  • Epidural steroid injections and selective nerve root blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulator implantation

  • Intraspinal drug delivery systems

  • Various radiofrequency ablative procedures including pulsed RF

  • Discograms and intra-articular injections

  • Caudal approach for epidural lysis of adhesions

  • Trigger point injections

  • Chronic opioid management in indicated cases

Located in Des Peres, our team of physicians provides individualized treatment plans designed to address the root causes of pain. Visit our website to learn more about our approach to pain management or call us at (314) 821-8644 to schedule a consultation.

I have gone from being reliant on pain medication to managing my pain with Tylenol thanks to the care of Dr. Cajigal and his staff.  I have dealt with chronic pain in my neck for over 25  due to a cervical fusion in 2001.  I was skeptical that I could get through a day without the help of medication, yet here I am.

I am back working, driving and being like 'normal' people function now. I still have many things that are a challenge, but I am grateful for all the things that have been restored to my life.|Dr. Smith and the entire staff were amazing!  I had previously had a bad experience with back injections so I was quite nervous going in. That was all put to rest with the attentive staff and Dr. Smith!  No anesthesia required and painless!!!!  Just an overall amazing experience!  Thank you so much!|Extremely incompetent staff. Failed to contact my insurance provider in time twice for the same procedure. Now I have to schedule for the 3rd time. They blame my insurance company, but I called the insurance company, and the truth is this pain management office just dropped the ball, big time. As a result, I'm sitting here in extreme pain, waiting for my procedure, much longer that I should have. I also have to cancel my vacation plans. Thanks a lot.

Update for Summer 2022: Last year I finally got the injection after several cancellations, due to the incompetent staff here. Dr. Greg Smith did the injection and it went surprisingly well. It was painless. Now I need another injection one level up. I decided to try Greg Smith again because I know he knows what he's doing. Sadly his staff is worse than ever. Extremely rude and dragging their feet on getting the procedure approved through insurance. It's no big deal for them, but I'm in pain, and I also have to arrange someone to drive me to the procedure, so I can't be playing these games where it may or may not be approved on my injection date. Really sad that such a great doctor has such an abysmal staff.|The one doctor  that retire was truly the best. Doctor Johann was a doctor that performed several services for me as a client. Unfortunately  he his no longer there, great understanding, caring and a thoughtful kind hearted professional. Facility was clean and sharp  as it's professionals.|The addition of Nurse Practitioner, Julie Boschert is a credit to this practice.  NP Boschert is the kind of medical professional we all dream about and rarely exists.  She is compassionate and listens to every concern you have in order to assist your needs.  She will remember (through excellent note taking) every issue you described and if you are better or not - all the while trying to offer you the most effective treatment. Her goal is clear to make you comfortable and relieve your pain while receiving Highest quality treatments available. This one-of-a-kind person brings so much to the table - finally I feel confident that there someone who truly cares.  Her 25 plus years of experience in the medical field in high quality facilities shines through during your visit and her expertise is a true asset to this practice.|Following CDC guidelines for in office visits. The waiting area had noticeably fewer patients than on several prior appts. Felt more at ease while I was there, as the staff has always been friendly & helpful.|Dr.Cajigal is an amazing person first and then you recognize his excellence in pain management because of his experience in anesthesia.Great professional staff and also Dr.Cajigal listens to me for as long as I need.Dr.Cajigal is the best MD in pain management.|Lower back pain - visited with Dr. Cajigal - had two trial injections - both showed excellent results - had injection 4 weeks ago - results are excellent - 90% improvement in pain level - played golf yesterday and had no pain!!

column40:
Very  unprofessional  I made 2 follow up appointments for after work two weeks in a row  I was called the afternoon before both appointments and asked to come in before noon  because Lacey wanted to leave early both days. Must be nice to change people's plans for your convenience|Dr. Zhu has helped treat my pain for several years. I highly recommend seeing him.|I have suffered from severe pain most of my adult life and have been treated by multiple doctors, but Dr. Fan is by far the best one I have had the opportunity of meeting, and he is the most kind and caring of any doctor you could meet. So many times, I have suffered so severely that it has robbed me of any normalcy in life, and I found myself unable to function. With the help of Dr. Fan, I have finally started showing improvement and seeing a brighter future for myself.
So for those genuinely suffering from physical pain and who want to get help, please know that there is nothing anyone or any drug you can take that will ever take the pain away completely; it is just not possible. Still, with the help of Dr. Fan, you can finally manage it and even have a chance to return to everyday life. But please know, as I said, no miracle drug or Doctor works miracles that can take all the pain away.
I highly recommend Dr. Fan to all my family, friends, and anyone else who suffers, as I have over the years.|I have been a patient of Midwest Pain and Spine for several years now and Dr. Fan, his nurse practitioner Lacy, and the staff have always treated me kindly and respectively. Dr. Fan and Lacy are very easy to communicate treatment plans and procedures with so that you know you are getting the best care possible. I've received several injections and physical therapy within their office and I would highly recommend Midwest Pain and Spine  to friends and family members.|Dr Zhu gave me an epidural shot in my back May 25, 2023 and I was never told to bring a driver so while I was laying on the bed , the nurse as me if I had someone waiting and I said no but the Dr proceeded to give me the shot.  I  didn't feel right when I left there and I told the girl at the desk and she never told me to sit down for a while so I left and went to Walmart in Desloge and when I got out of my vehicle my legs were totally numb, I had to have someone come help me and ended up at Parkland Hospital ER!! I was there over 3 hours before the feeling came back!! It was awful!! I would never recommend him to anyone!! I had to have x-ray of my elbow and ankle from the fall!!|Dr Fann and Lacey Sullivan have been taking care of my pain for about 10 years now. They have provided me with the latest in all care and procedures available out there which keeps me about 85 to 90 percent pain free most of the time. I am very pleased with those results. The whole staff there is very friendly and helpful   I feel at ease and cared for by all of the staff  when I'm there. I would recommend the Midwest Pain and Spine center for your needs as far as pain.|The people that work at mid west are amazing. They are very helpful and informative. They have my new appointment set before I ever get up to the desk and they always greet you with a cheerful voice. My dr and nurses are top notch. I went to several pain therapy dr before I came here and since I have visited this office I have never nor  will I ever go anywhere else. The receptionist at the office are amazing as well.|Do not waste your time or money. They do not care about their patients. All they care about is giving injections and getting as many office visits as they possibly can. Each time my back hurts they want me to make an appointment just to tell them my back hurts and schedule an injection. Then you have to come back for injection then they want a follow up visit as well. Therefore when my back hurts they get three office visits for one occasion. When you run out of medicine they won't give you refills without making you come back over and over again. Even for patients who don't take or want narcotics like myself. I take an anti-inflammatory and a muscle relaxer, neither one is a narcotic. Have had an MRI that shows I have bulging discs in my back. Why do I need to keep coming back to be seen when they already know what's wrong with me and my prescriptions are non-narcotic. Every 3 months they just stop re-filling prescriptions if they decide they want to get you for an office visit. When you call to ask why your medication hasn't been refilled whoever it is that answers the phone is very defensive and quite frankly rude. It is always my fault or the pharmacy's fault on why I can't get a refill, NEVER their fault. One thing I can say is they do not discriminate.... Everyone gets treated like a drug addict, rather you take narcotics or not. Guess I should have read the reviews before I trusted my doctor's referral. Don't see a single good review and am not surprised. All I want is for my back to feel better. Been going here for over a year and they are awful. I have finally had enough and am going somewhere else. Seriously don't go here, you will regret it.

column40:
St. Peters office. Just as another stated. Absolutely unacceptable behavior. Rude and impossible to even get an appointment. 1st call, I was told I needed a consultation appointment first which sounded like they were going to get scheduled and I tried to make that and the call dropped. When I called back, I was told in a rude tone, they can't make any appointments till I have my doctor send over my MRI results and hung up rather quickly, as if I was wasting their time. When I did this, I called again and was told I needed something else from my referring doctor, which I suppose I needed to make a list and expected to have all of this other stuff sent over. When I told them to forget it and explained why I was going to use another office (being that other doctors contact the referring office to request exactly what they need) not making the patient the constant go between (they know what they need).  Anyway, at this, "Kathy", who I believe was the person I dealt with each time, told me she didn't need a lecture, to which I explained that I was trying to let her know why their office will not get my business (to improve their procedures), she hung up on me.
Don't even bother calling this place and wasting your time.
I called my referring doctor, told them the issues and was given another place to use. Called that place and made an appointment with zero issues, like the last 20 + years of making an appointment and going to a doctor.|Dr. Coleman is an amazing doctor with a great bedside manner . He does everything possible to help you reduce the pain. I trust him 100%.|The sheer incompetence of the office staff is astounding. I've had numerous procedures done here that were covered. I had a different procedure done and I specifically asked if they got it pre-approved through my insurance, long story short they did not and my insurance wont retroactively approve a procedure that's already been done. Their militant billing department insists I owe them money due to their incompetence. Every time I call the front office the phone rings and never gets answered. I would not only avoid this clinic, Id recommend avoiding the entire SSM group in its entirety you'll be avoiding a massive headache.|Custo.er service is really going diwnhill.  I have been hung up on 4 times this morning not appreciated.  We work over the road and need prescription refills when asked not at a normal convenience of when i can get to it.  Very unhappy with the customer service at this office.|I've seen Dr Coleman multiple times in the past 7 years, and am floored at how unprofessional his office staff can be.   Talking to them today was the ultimate in frustration.  Was told they don't have any records for me, even though they acknowledge I'd been seen in 2019.  Tried to understand since it didn't make sense, but was given the "I'm following policy".|Love Ann at the front desk, dr coleman is awesome and the nurses are great. HOWEVER dealing with the lady that makes the appointments is not fun. If you make an appointment and change your mind and want to schedule a different one, she acts like you committed a cardinal sin and doesn't hide the fact that you have put her out.  This has happened twice and I have been to that office several times. She is very demeaning and I'd rather continue in pain than deal with her. I've held my tongue because when I come out after a procedure, I am still doped up and don't want to get in a confrontation but she apologizes profusely to the person that comes to her area and has to wait until she finishes with me but she is very short and curt with me. If you make an appointment and don't change your mind, you are good to go! Just don't change your mind. She will let you know about it and will talk down to you. She needs an attitude adjustment.....|I have not met Dr. Coleman yet but am already impressed with him and his staff. They have spoken to me a number of times over the last couple of weeks in planning for a procedure my 93 year old mother will be having tomorrow to treat a compression fracture in her spine. Everyone has been very professional and answered all my questions. Today Dr. Coleman called me to introduce himself, describe the procedure, and ask detailed questions concerning my mother's present physical condition and special requirements she might have. We were on the phone for almost 25 minutes!  When was the last time you had a doctor spend that much time with you?|Dr. Coleman is the undoubtedly the best doctor I have ever had. I have been going to him for years and have always been treated with respect and and no questions have gone unanswered. He's never in a hurry to rush me through anything. His staff is top notch, caring, compassionate, and helpful through every procedure I have ever had there. They are the best. Wouldn't go anywhere else. Thank you to all of you.

column38: Stephanie Akers|Natalie Pollock|SkIpPs Adventure|Sweetwater Farm|Deanna Elkins|AMG|Tim Brinker|Dawn Bennett
column40:
Update! ID like to add that the ESI procedure that Dr Naylor did gave me my life back. Can't wait to feel the full potential of the procedure. I'm 6 days out.

Emily and the new girl were amazing and compassionate! Made a very dreaded visit unexpectedly pleasant and less anxiety inducing! Dr Baylor was awesome. Explained everything in lamen terms. Thank you for all you do!|My husband was not only in excruciating pain from a herniated disc in his neck, but also having a horrible time with the meds he was on. We were quickly losing hope as the wait to get into a pain management doctor was as long as the neurosurgeon. Dr. Naylor and his office were wonderful at working us in when they heard about our plight and Dr. Naylor himself was nothing short of amazing. He switched my husbands medications immediately and it helped his side effects tremendously. When we met Dr. Naylor we were very impressed. He took the time to show us the MRI with explanations, but most of all, answered all of our questions. We felt like we were finally getting somewhere and had a plan in place as we waited for our neurosurgeon appointment. In this office you will find a very helpful, caring and courteous staff. We would never hesitate to refer Dr. Naylor and his office to our friends and family. He has been an amazing find and is truly an asset to our community.|There was no compassion

I was new to pain management, I had an office visit where I was told what I needed insurance probably wouldn't cover. Got a call insurance covered it, the procedure was set. The wait time sucked but really what's new in a doctors office. The part where it takes a real bad turn is coming up. So I get called back they they take my vitals and give me the blue hat and leave me to wait. When I get called back they took me to a cold room where they had me lay on a table, legs on pillow stands the nurses disinfect my knees. When doctor Nayler came in he didn't really talk to me he asked to confirm my info that's it. I began to feel anxious as I'm strapped to a bed and no one is really letting me know what's going on. Dr. N tells the nurses that they have to take one of my legs down and will disinfect it again later. Without warning he stabs the needles into my knee and I jumped a little he got frustrated/annoyed and snapped at me not to move. I told him that if he tells me what he's doing it would help he just acted like a jerk. I was in pain because that does not feel like a sting or a pinch it feels like a needle going in my leg set the expectations right. So here I was alone extremely anxious, too scared to speak up anymore and in pain. That's how my first pain management procedure went.|Every person I worked with was so kind and understanding. Most of my pain management came from lifestyle changes. Replacing my old  bed, physical therapy, rest. Jessica was determined to help and she did. Several others, not in this clinic, did not bother. They aren't miracle workers but pretty darn close.|This specific review is merely just to give some serious props to the NP Jessica Latham. I can't even explain how relatable and genuine she is! I have felt heard with every appointment I've had with her. She really allows me to be heard. That is all a patient can ask for.|I've been at this place for the past few years and on my first visit the doctor that I seen was great but unfortunately he left and I always wondered why? Well I found out from my own experience that they will give you injections injections injections injections injections and after the 10th one and so manny different high priced prescriptions that don't do anything for pain at all not feeling any relief after every single one them they want you to make an appointment to talk about surgery/back stimulation. So I made the appointment was told that I would be covered for the stimulation by the office so I decided to get the appointments scheduled for the MRI they needed and another doctor that was $350 bucks just for him to tell me this may or may or work. Got all that done the day after all of these appointments they called me and said we are sorry but your not covered for the stimulation I asked well how much would it be out of pocket I was then told on the phone it would be anywhere between 10-30k so I laughed and said so there's no more options besides this. And you know they always say "unfortunately not" so I hung up then after that happens I get a letter stating that they will no longer  see me in that office making it sound like I've been kicked out of there or they are going to refuse me. I spoke to other doctors in the city since this. And I'm getting way better options that I have ever received from this office. As soon as they figured out I couldn't pay 10-30 thousand dollars for back stimulation that was it they was done with me throw me out next person in line let's see what got!. So please save your time and what little money you have left after paying for mass amounts useless injections and what water pills they prescribe you. Do yourself a huge favor go somewhere else and learn from my mistake !|Dr hahn insisted that after 2 months being off pain medication for the first time in over 10 years that I would be thanking him.  I like many others had been cutoff medication and left with no options feeling completely hopeless with no where to turn and no medication to help with pain, not fake pain actual pain.  Mine happened to stem from being hit by a car as a pedestrian and having 17 surgeries,  Within the first two months of being off of medication for the first time in my life had turned to illegal narcotics and when that didnt work i attempted suicide and spent 4 days on a respirator then put in the mental health care system...  My life at this point is the worst it has ever been.  i lost my children, my home, and pretty much my life.  The opoid crisis is a joke cutting patients off, not helping them with alternative pain management solutions has forced law abiding citizens in need to actually start using street drugs...What a system and a joke...  So to answer your question dr hahn, yeah i nor anyone with actual injuries will ever call you and thank you and tell you that their life is better for cutting them off with no form of replacement therapy and pain management solutions.   i have been homeless, resuscitated, lost my children and pretty much feel like id be better off|I never even saw the doctor I was supposed to see. I dont know if I know the font desk person or if I just rubbed her the wrong way but I felt like she was very condescending and offended by everything that came out of my mouth. I find the person at the front desk to be most important as they set the tone for a visit. By the time I went back to the room my stomach was so upset I just left. I was uncomfortable just being in the office.

Beware of billing when having services done at this office.  They call to schedule and tell you that this is the amount to have the shot done.  They make you sign something that doctor has ownership in the practice and then sends a separate bill for the doctor like you are in the hospital, but it is the doctor's office.  They need to learn to be upfront and clear.  I talked to billing department and supervisor tells me they get these complaints all the time.  She tells me she can't do anything because they are after the fact.  Very poor practice if you tell me.  Now we are trying to pay $1600 total for a shot that did not work when we were told $914.66 the day of the shot.|Dr. Ackerman and staff are wonderful!
John, Jenni, Tamara, Trena, Teresa, Candi, BarbC and Donna! Professional, attentive, friendly. Shows respect, concern, empathy. Yesterday was my 3rd visit it was perfect! A great experience!|Dr. Israel just did an injection in my neck yesterday.   I've had SO many lumbar injections from other places & I don't do well getting them.  I have a needle phobia & they've always been extremely painful & caused me a tremendous amount of anxiety getting them.  This was my first one with Dr. Israel & I was expecting the same level of pain, so my anxiety level was through the roof.  He joked around & was compassionate about my anxiety.   I kept waiting for the familiar pain that I've always had getting lumbar injections,  & he says, "ok all done".  I couldn't believe how easy this was.  I am SO happy with my experience with him & I'm certain my anxiety won't be a problem when I come back for shot #2.  I couldn't thank him & his staff enough.  Excellent job,  Dr. Israel!!!!|Extremely disappointed in service options trying to call asking questions about being overcharged for a procedure completed on 2/27/22.  My wife was charged three times what was submitted to insurance.  Tried to call and leave a message, but the system just drops your call.  Will be calling my insurance company to report this.|I have the highest faith and trust for Dr Akerman and his staff, very professional and caring. column3:
At our practice, Dr. Syed Abdul Khader brings exceptional expertise in pain medicine to patients throughout the Bridgeton area.

Board-Certified Pain Management Excellence

We are proud to offer comprehensive non-operative pain management solutions for back, spine, and neck conditions. Dr. Khader completed his medical education at Thanjavur Medical College Hospital in India and his residency at Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis, Missouri. As a diplomat with the American Board of Pain Medicine, he specializes in physical medicine and rehabilitation with a patient-centered approach. Our services include:

  • Specialized nerve blocks and injections

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Non-surgical pain management solutions

We welcome new patients at our convenient location at 12255 De Paul Dr Suite 120 in Bridgeton. Contact us at (314) 291-7900 or visit our website to schedule your consultation today.
column11: Dr. Khader is board-certified in pain medicine. He attended Thanjavur Medical College Hospital in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu, India. He completed his residency at Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis, Missouri. Dr. Khader is a diplomat with the American Board of Pain Medicine. His sub-specialty interest is in physical medicine and rehabilitation. He specializes in non-operative pain management of the back, spine and neck.
column38: Kathy Kufskie|Donna Gill|Janet Simms|Wanda Lane|Marilyn Baker|Mandy De Krey|leon hunton|Sandra Malan
column40: Dr Khader is extremely personable. I have seen him several times as a referral from my orthopedic doctor whom I trust tremendously. I had my first nerve block today. My experience with Dr. Khader was pleasant as well. He is very interested in helping to relieve your pain. What struck a cord with me the most was when I a concern  HE called me back. I made me feel valued by the doctor himself!|I waited an hour longer than my scheduled appointment. The office signs say the doctor see all patients according to their appointment.  The doctor had me stand up bend from side to side. He bent my legs and knees and feet. He was on my chart the majority of time. He had an assistant.I was not told why.Dr Khader ordered an MRI. column2: Gurpreet Singh Padda, MD: Pain Management, Accident & Injury Specialist
column3:
At the Padda Institute, we understand that pain is the final pathway—your body's signal that something has gone terribly wrong.

Comprehensive Pain Management Approach

We specialize in treating the complex intersection of the pain epidemic, opioid epidemic, and diabetes epidemic, recognizing these as interconnected manifestations of systemic Metainflammation. Our practice goes beyond simply managing symptoms; we address the root causes of your pain through a multidisciplinary approach that includes:

  • Advanced pain management interventions

  • Chiropractic care for spinal alignment

  • Physiotherapy treatments

  • Specialized accident and injury rehabilitation

  • Comprehensive health consultations

We're not the right fit if you're simply seeking pain medication. However, if you're committed to dramatically improving your overall health and addressing the underlying causes of your pain, you've found the right medical team. Visit our Padda Institute Pain Management website to learn more about our holistic approach or call us at 314-481-5000. Located at 5203 Chippewa St #301, St. Louis, MO 63109, we're ready to help you reclaim your quality of life.
column9: Chiropractor|Doctor|Health consultant|Medical clinic|Pain management physician|Personal injury attorney|Physiotherapy Center
column11:
Pain is the final pathway, the body screaming that something has gone terribly wrong. We treat at the intersection of the pain epidemic, opioid epidemic, and the diabetes epidemic. They are all inter-related pathologies, the clinical manifestations of systemic Metainflammation.
If you are simply looking for pain medication, we are not the place to treat.

My husband pad rotator cuff surgery and his doctor very clear that it was impaired at Mark have some kind of injection directly into a very particular spot of the shoulder. This place advertises as a physical therapy clinic, but they are not. This is a chiropractic office. column40: Everything was fine when I first started there. Dr. Brashiers was super nice & really seemed to listen. Then I got switched to Annie. The neurosurgeon said I wasn't a candidate for surgery or injections so meds were my only source of relief. I went to my last appointment & asked Annie to please keep me on my same meds until after my oral surgery at least. Not only did that not happen , but I received a letter of them dropping me . I went into my patient portal to see their reasoning behind this & almost fainted when I read what they had written. They said I had "Underlying Psychiatric Issues " SERIOUSLY?? Well , I contacted the people who read these reviews and comments hoping it would get me somewhere. I talked to a guy & he told me he'd look into it and get back with me the next day. We'll,  it's been way over a week with no response. I've left numerous messages but still nothing. Totally unprofessional.|I have had chronic pain for over 10 years, and the doctors at Boone Pain Management actually know what they are doing. column38: Doug Combs|Kentucky Girl|Kathy Burkhalter|Margi Thompson|Catina Ross|John Egbert|Roey Fowler|Don Mier
column40:
Dr. Walker and the entire staff are very professional, caring, very open to any concerns, and did the very best to answer any and all questions and concerns.  Everyone did everything possible to assure my comfort and most importantly that the procedure went as smoothly and correctly as possible.  Everyone went above and beyond to assure before I left that any and all questions were answered and that myself and my wife was as informed as we could be.
I personally thank everyone involved.  I have before and will again recommend this facility and the professionals to anyone.|Dr. Walker and his team are the best! He is extremely busy, but he always takes the time to answer questions. If you have a procedure that requires him to go into your spinal canal, which can be scary since there are so many risks, Dr. Walker will explain everything so you know what to expect. He will talk to you throughout the procedure and explain what he is doing, but he also throws in some small talk to help keep you relaxed. I've been a patient of Dr. Walker for almost 10 years and I can't think of a negative thing to say about him. Dr. Walker truly cares about his patients and embodies everything a doctor should be. His front office staff, Sandy, Jade and Rhonda, are also exceptional people. If you have questions between appointments, they don't make you feel like you are bothering them. If they are unable to answer your question or resolve your issue, they will transfer you to the appropriate nurse who can handle your problem. If you have to leave a message, the nurse will actually call you back! Dr. Walker and his team are truly a wonderful group of people.|I don't want any other Dr to do my injections. Dr. Walker had me laughing within minutes, and I was so so nervous. Top notch service! His whole team was awesome.|Dr Walker is a fun guy that does a fantastic job. He helped me through the procedure with kindness and professionalism. I would recommend him to anyone.|Dr Walker is phenomenal. I have never had a physician be as pleasant and informative as he is. He has treated me for trigeminal Neuralgia and back pain and has given me my life back. I cannot put into words the comfort and trust that I feel with him and his staff. He is respectful, he listens to your concerns, and he explains the entire procedure before and as he performs it. I would recommend Dr Walker to anyone experiencing chronic pain. I felt hopeless before my first injection but today I feel a sense of freedom! Freedom to live my life and enjoy my children pain free!|I've had two pain management appointments with Dr Andrew Walker and have been very impressed with his professionalism, his skill and  his patient rapport.  He talked me thru each procedure (spinal injections), step-by-step, telling me exactly what he was doing.  I felt no pain during either procedure. Following the procedure, he visited with me (waiting for his next patient) making sure I was OK.  Super guy and doctor!  I highly recommend him!|Dr. Walker is kind and gentle. He talks you through the procedure.  His gentle manner helps you get through it.|I have a rare chronic pain. I get the injections in my neck and lower back. When he inserts the needle there is 0 pain. He gets right to the nerves and just tell Dr Walker when he's got it in the spot. Best Dr I've been too.Vary nice man. He will talk to you and get you the treatment you need, "Thank You" Doc...

column38: Tami Fielding|Sheila Adair|Zach S|Deborah Mize|Samantha Gembola|Terry|Nina Sala-Gault|Nickie LeVan
column40:
The pain management nurse for Dr Chuck is absolutely horrible. Rude, condescending with no empathy. She should be moved to doesn't require patient contact.  As far as the clinic itself is concerned, front office staff are great. However, there are issues getting my mother's MRI approved by her insurance because the office didn't provide enough information for the insurance company to understand the necessity or importance of said MRI.  I've heard people say Mercy is not the appropriate name as there is no mercy shown. I don't agree completely with that but I will say, that I agree at least 75% with that statement which is so sad as the that was NOT Sister Catherine McAuley's vision. I believe she'd be ashamed today.|I don't like to leave negative reviews for anyone, but I feel like this needs to be brought to someone's attention. I went in yesterday to have a nerve block put in my back. The nurse came out to get me and took me to my room as I entered my room she asked me, what my pain level was as of that moment and I said not bad right now. And the other nurse named Shell walked into the ro and said so you're not in pain today and I said not as much as usual but I am before I could finish my sentence. She responded if you're not in pain why are you here because this isn't gonna work.. (I understand her concern) And before I could explain that I was not experiencing as much pain as I normally do because I had not worked or done anything strenuous. She said we have a high patient volume and if you don't need to see us then why are you here. I work in customer service daily, but I have worked in healthcare in the past she has a horrible bedside manner and and an absolute horrible demeanor. The look on her face was a total disgust.  I wasn't there because I wanted to be. I was there because I needed to be. My pain management doctor from Rolla scheduled me in Springfield because I could get in so much sooner. I almost left and yes, I was probably was a little irritable from not feeling good for the past eight months, but that was totally uncalled for. The rest of the staff was fantastic. They were great, but maybe she needs to find a new profession. Definitely did not come off as a caring, nurturing, consoling nurse that she should be..  we all get stressed and I understand that. There's no need for you to talk to somebody like they are under educated or not on the same level.  Wasn't I was not there asking or seeking pain medication never once have I even asked for that. I sensed that the nurse that brought me back could tell that I was totally disgusted with Shell.  I wish I would've gotten her name because she was amazing. Maybe she just needs some pointers on patient care.|I don't like doing negative reviews. This is not about individual people. Individually, everyone is great. But when my doctor and my PA don't seem to be able to agree on my care, do multiple procedures without any marked success, and then say "we can refer you to an outside clinic". YOU ALL ARE THE OUTSIDE CLINIC! I'm a disabled veteran. I CHOSE you all over the VA because I trust you more than the VA. I may have been wrong about that. I've always believed the private sector could do a better job than the government, but Mercy makes the government look efficient and competent by comparison. Absolutely disgusted with the way Mercy operates these days.|Dr. Broadnex is inconsiderate and the rudest doctor I've ever met! I seen Dr. Everson for many years and he was GREAT! He left and that is how Dr. Broadnex came into my life. He refused to give me an mri so my mercy doctor did. When I took results to pain clinic I was told s ince I don't like his care I need to go else where.There is no other place that cares thou  . Now scared to come back. Refuse to see last Dr|My mother got a referral back in July, the first time, this place said they did not recieve it so she had the doctor resend it. 2 weeks later, she called to see if they got it, and they tell her they misplaced it. So the doctor had to send it a third time.  She had to drive 60 miles to get here just to make an appointment. A week later, a day before her appointment, they call her and cancel her appointment. They rescheduled her for 2 weeks out. So she drives another 60 miles, gets there, checks in upstairs, goes downstairs, waits in line for over 5 minutes. She gets to the counter and they refused to see her because she was 3 minutes late to her appointment. This is the most unprofessional, incompetent business I have ever seen in my life. They have no regard for their patients. If I could, I would rate this 0 stars.|This Mercy clinic has the worst insurance coordinators in the entire world. Inept person/persons should be terminated. No excuse for not doing your job.
In pain? No worries! They will keep you that way.|My husband has seen Dr. Benjamin Lampert for several years and is very happy with his treatment plan.  My only regret is that Dr. Lampert is not accepting new patients now that I need treatment.  Also, I need to comment that the many bad reviews posted here have me looking in other places for my pain management needs, since I can't see Dr. Lampert. It's been a hard year for all of us, I know, and pain makes it seem worse.  Maybe we should cut some of these health care providers a bit of slack.  Namaste.

EDIT:  Dr. Lampert has retired.  The doctor my husband saw was not as good as Dr. Lampert.  No relief was obtained from the injections.  This is not the reason my husband will not return to Mercy Pain management.  The reason is that he was not told until just before the injections that no anesthesia would be administered.  He stated it was painful.  Then, he was deposited in the dressing room and told to get dressed.  I was not given the option to be with him to assist him in any way.  The worst part was that the attendant did NOT offer him a wheel chair for discharge.  I saw him stumbling and holding on to the wall as he came out the door.  I held him up and got him to the car.  He said "just get me out of here."  That is totally NOT like him.  Because of this experience, we both are patients of the Citizen's Memorial Hospital system now.|I've never had issues with the staff at this clinic. The only issue I have is the hospital decision to no longer sedate for the injections it should be the patients decision. They are extremely painful and  when you experience daily pain you shouldn't have to experience more when it's not necessary. Other than that they've always helped

column3:
At Katalyst Pain Management and Restorative Treatment Center, we understand that chronic pain can dramatically impact your quality of life. Our mission is to help you reclaim your vitality and confidence through comprehensive, personalized care plans.

Integrative Pain Solutions

We proudly offer evidence-based treatment approaches that combine the best of traditional medicine with functional healing methods. Our specialized services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized pain management protocols

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Regenerative medicine options

  • Holistic wellness strategies

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our expert team, led by Dr. Boutwell, takes the time to listen and develop solutions tailored to your unique needs. When conventional treatments haven't provided relief, we're here to offer innovative alternatives at our Chesterfield location. Call us today at +1 314-230-7800 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11: When your body pain begins to affect your life, you know it's time to take charge. Regain your energy, vitality, and confidence with the help of Katalyst. We provide exceptional pain management care plans with evidence-based methods that integrate traditional and functional medicine.

column40:
I have been treated by Dr.Boutwell since October 2016 . In this timeframe I have not only come to know her as a very good doctor of mine, but  also a friend. She always take time to listen to you, your concerns your thoughts and how you feel. She always make sure that she's totally understanding what's being said . If she don't nail your pain issues down on your first visit, you can rest assured that she will work through it until you have a satisfiable treatment .  If you're interested Dr.Boutwell can help you with food alternatives for helping with inflammation and such. She has a great supportive staff also,Nicole her assistant is very good at what she does ,She is very friendly and have a great personality .|I love Katalyst. I was seeing another doctor prior to coming here and I'm so glad I switched. Everyone here is so nice, caring, helpful, and supportive and want to find a way to make your pain better. Julie, Jill, Dr. Boutwell, Jenn, Tamara to name a few are awesome. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who has chronic pain. I have a somewhat complex case and they had so many ideas of different things we can try. 10/10|Dr Boutwell is great. Her approach is inquisitive in nature and solution oriented. One of the best pain management doctors I have encountered. The staff is friendly and helpful, good people.

However, attempting to access documentation related to my care has been utterly laughable. The person handling that request has been absolutely no help whatsoever. A glaring bit of incompetence in an otherwise good clinic.|The staff at Katalyst are so professional and caring you feel as if you are with family. I was led to Katalyst by an attorney as a result of an injury, and I am so grateful. I feel as if God himself laid the path out before me that caused Dr. Boutwell and her staff's lives to intersect mine, because the level of care i have received for CRPS through Katalyst has been otherworldly! They have all been willing to sit down with me and my wife and have talks that other doctors will run from, such as holistic treatment and spiritual matters that can affect a person's recovery and healing. Katalyst pain management and restorative health has been a godsend to my life since my injury, and would assuredly tell anyone in the world if you have been stricken with a pain disorder that booking your first appointment and following up with the folks at Katalyst will change your life for the better as well. I know it to be true, as I am sharing my experience, strength and hopes with you, as I have received nothing but benefits of a healthier life as a result of their level of skill and wisdom in the affairs of restorative health medicine! God bless, and may you find the answers to better living and healing as I have because of Katalyst's employees committment to helping their clients have the best life possible, especially after being given something as horrible as crps as a result of an injury. Thank you Katalyst from the bottom of my heart!|This place rocks. Haven't even gotten my injection yet, and leaving a review. The staff and Doc are awesome... Very nice, personable, and super knowledgeable. Will leave another after my injection.

Injection complete. As suspected they were just as amazing during that part. Explained everything fully, and gave multiple chances for questions.

Would highly recommend if your broken like me to let them do the fixing. I don't even know if the fixed anything but they still get 10 stars.|I LOVE Dr. Boutwell!!  When you have Dr. B, you not only have an excellent and thorough doc, you also have a VERY caring person.  She has been working with my son who was hit by a car.  She found a tear in a disc no one else had noticed.  Her approach and her advice and her friendly nature are priceless!|What can I say other then what a blessing Dr.Boutwell has been on my life. She and her staff are very professional and treat you like family. I have a very complex and difficult neurological issue. I have had several doctors in the past and just hit brick walls. Dr Boutwell goes at it at a very professional and caring level. She truly and honestly does everything in her power to provide me with all the new technologies and advancement in medical field at her finger tips to try and put me in the best position to live as pain free life as I can. She doesn't hesitate to try and use cutting edge stuff and always keeps me informed on what kind of new possible technologies that could be coming down the pipeline. The world could use a few more Dr. Boutwell's. I would recommend anyone who struggles with pain and needs some high quality care to look them up at Katalyst pain management.|Dr. Kaylee Boutwell and her team at Katalyst Pain Management and Restorative Treatment Center have given me an eye opening experience. I shadowed with her team for one week and it was the best shadowing experience I have ever had. I was so intrigued by all the different types of restorative care that I have never heard about and it made me want to possibly pursue a speciality in pain management. The opportunity to shadow her office allowed me to include my experience into my personal statement for medical school. If time permits, I would love to come back and learn from Dr. Boutwell in the future, again.

column40:
SSM you should be ashamed of what you are putting patients through making them take the stairs while your elevator is out of service for four weeks. I sat in the waiting room of Suite 200 and saw numerous patients out of breath who have struggled to reach the suite is heartbreaking. And you don't even have anyone to help them up or down the stairs is showing little compassion in your part. This situation is nothing but accidents waiting to happen. These patients are struggling with pain to begin with and this is adding to their issues. Also your receptionist and her back up seem to lack compassion and organizational skills.  These patients are in pain, treat them nicely please.|Have tried numerous times to get a hold of someone at this office to schedule an appointment. I was told by the Dr. someone would call me within 2 days after my appointment to schedule, that was 2 weeks ago. There are no specific hours on the message lines, you'd think if doctors are referring they would at least have someone answering phones. Do not waste your time! Look elsewhere!!|So pisted they made an appointment with me I waited 3 weeks go in for my appointment and they couldn't find my appointment or my referral so I had to have my stuff faxed over again and they said doctor has to review it before I could be seen it takes 2 seconds to look at it but they said they couldn't see me until doctor looks at it then asks me if it's ok they do injections only after telling me over the phone the doctor does prescribe pain meds that they treated me like a drug addict and not a patient that has severe pain due to being beaten for years and several car accidents my MRI shows arthritis scoliosis and hernated disks. Oh and they told me the wrong building I went to at Francis building then I was told at Joseph's building so all the walking and elevators just put me in more pain plus your first appointment they say is just a consolation it's a waste of time and sounds like they want to milk my insurance I rather see Dr padda who I've been seeing because he takes my pain seriously and does injections chiropractic and psychiatrist oh and nerve burning treatments that help me but my parents wont let me see him and its frustrating because no other pain management takes my pain seriously im constantly rubbing ointment on my back and doing yoga stretches it helps a little but I need my medicine and nerve burning treatments every 6 months|I would have give a minus rating if all possible that is the total of worth of this office since I was referred.  The office staff is Cold, Clueless and  Very Rude.  The last appointment I had the APN was not up to date  with my case, although cordial the APN read my results of the prior appointment and did not see the MRI that I had taken the week before.  Being the type of person I am, I told her that there should be a MRI and results showing the problems that I'm having.  To no avail, she said that they would have to get authorization from my insurance company for a procedure.  Nothing else was discussed and that was the end of my visit.  I have been dealing with my back for the past 16 years as a result of two separate accidents and chronic pain.  I have been through Physical therapy, Massage therapy,  trigger point injections and spinal block without any relief.  I feel that I'm being jerked around and honestly I feel that no one cares. I left the office feeling mentally darined.  My question is would you feel safe having needles stuck into your spine after dealing with this experience? I certainly am not happy with this outcome.|I tried for months to get appointment with this office jumped through all the hoops, put up with delays getting calls returned, two weeks ago they told me that they needed insurance referral and could schedule an appointment. Now today am told docs have reviewed med record and will not see me at all
Wouldn't even give a reason. I cannot speak to quality of care, but the complete lack of customer service from this office is appalling. I possible I would have given a negative rating.|ONLY 5 STARS TO BE NOTICED !! 1 STAR !
After being referred by the primary to this trash. Paid the $50 copay. Was told we would receive a phone call for a MRI. haha 2 weeks later and still nothing ! PLEASE DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY !!|

Comprehensive Pain Management & Wellness Solutions

At St. Louis Back and Knee Center, our mission is to help you do the things you love in life. Whether you're seeking relief from chronic pain or focusing on overall wellness, our dedicated team creates personalized treatment plans to help you achieve your health goals. In either situation our team is committed to providing you the care that will help you reach those goals.

We are conveniently located in St Louis, MO, and it is easy to find us. We offer free parking and we are handicap accessible. Click on the directions button to find an easy route to St Louis Back and Knee Center. We really look forward to meeting you and helping with your health goals.
column38: Tyson Grohmann|Instrument Maker|Marissa M|Jeanmarie Market|Amanda Suraci|Gratefuldude 2012|Trudi Alexander|Patricia Smith
column40:
What a professional and personable team! I was in a lot of pain and they got me in right away - something I couldn't get with a lot of other clinics. After diagnosis, they created a customized plan that they explained in great detail and gave multiple finance options for. I'm very happy I found this team to help me get the treatment I need.|I came to St Louis Back and Knee Center with severe sciatica pain in my left leg.  Standing and walking for more than a few minutes was so painful that I avoided any physical activity. I had recently retired and did not want to spend the remainder my life not doing what I enjoyed. After completing the program, I can now go on long hikes and can stand for extended periods with little or no pain.  I can enjoy my retirement thanks to the experience and compassion of everyone at their office. Would highly recommend.|I'm surprised there aren't more negative reviews, as I found this place to be a high-volume, in & out clinic. They will push upfront payment plans that you will have to finance (very unethical & unecessary). I was left with just as much pain after my 3 month program, which I had to continue paying for 2 years. I had the option to continue with even MORE money (excuse me?).
To top it off, my program was supposed to include knee injections that they completely "forgot" to do. I noticed after going over my paperwork, so they offered to refund me that portion. Since nothing was itemized, I'm really not sure I got the correct refund.
The chiropractor was nice, but I always felt rushed, like I was moving through stations. The physical therapy was nothing more than printed off exercises I could have done myself.
Most of all- I specifically mentioned that my biggest source of pain was middle back. They seemed to only want to focus on lower back pain & never even X-rayed above my lower back (why???) I feel scammed!!!|You don't need surgery for a meniscus tear on your knee. Tore the right knee three years ago and had prp injections and  totally healed.  Now having left knee done. So happy no no surgery is  needed !!  Ty ty tyb|I'm so happy that I found this place, the staff is amazing. I felt very well cared for, they listen to everything that I had to say and are coming up with an action plan to help me get better. I would highly recommend coming here!!|Fantastic! I've had severe sciatica and scoliosis for quite some time and I'm finally getting the relief I've been searching for. Truly worth a try. Every one I see at my appointment are kind, compassionate, understanding, supportive and above all extremely knowledgeable. Dr's Dan, Josh, Kelsey, Cara and Vivian at the front desk are amazing. Decompression Therapy is my favorite treatment but there are multiple methods of treatment that are bringing me pain relief. The St. Louis Back and Knee Center is the real deal. And they take insurance. Highly recommended! Your back will thank you!|So impressed by my experience this morning! An absolute 5 score! Everything was perfect. They really have got the whole professionalism accompanied by kindness just right! Outstanding!|I have been going to St. Louis back and knee Center for a month and a half. I walked in, hurting so bad because of my knees, and when I walked out from my first visit,  I was amazed at how much of my pain was already gone. The staff is absolutely amazing. Dr. Dan put together an amazing team and will devise a plan for you just like they did for me.  They're so caring and informative, professional, and friendly. They truly are there to help. I would tell any of my family members who are in need of pain relief to go there.
Patricia Roellig

column3:

Stanley|I love going to this office. Everyone is awesome. I'm so thankful that I started going here. I love NP Rebecca Buchanan, then she sent me to Dr. Orr & he's amazing. column38: Melinda Kleine|Joanne Vollmer|Bryan Ussery|Lynn Phillips|Toni Meyerkord|Dyerwulf Fallon|Eric Schnelten|Bob P (Bassguy)
column40: Dr. Meek has taken care of my husband and father-in-law.  He helped them and both were relieved of their pain.  No words can express how grateful our family is for his talents and professionalism of explaining their back pain issues and resolving their pain issues to become pain free.  Thank you for doing such an awesome job!|Provides great care to my aging parent! Great bedside manner. Explains thing well, takes his time and is focused!|After being diagnosed with CRPS and undergoing 2 years of treatments and surgery Doctor meek felt it was more important to change my diagnosis to benefit workman's comp instead of actually helping or trying to help me He is rude argumentative And cares very little for what kind of pain you're in Even tried perscribing me zertec allergy medication to treat CRPS pain  And after a month when I told him it wasn't doing anything he wrote up that I simply refused to take it Definitely a scam artist working strictly for workman's comp benefit would not recommend trusting this man at all|If you have a real problem with your back I would highly recommend Dr Brian meek. He's an excellent pain management physician and if you have to have injections he is quick and painless in addition to being very kind personable caring physician!|It's so sad sometimes that great doctors are burdened with horrible and disrespectful staff. I appreciated the care and attention Dr. Meek gave and followed through on his recommendations. First, a receptionist left a voicemail saying that there was absolutely nothing wrong with my shoulder (she suddenly became doctor) and even said Dr. Meek said that there was nothing wrong with it even though he was aware of a traumatic history. After recommending I get an MRI on a shoulder bothering me, I attempted to reappoint with him to hear results and move forward. The woman that answered the phone told me that I was suddenly to see a NP, whom I had not ever seen before (I only saw Dr. Meek.) I told her I'd prefer to see the doctor and she told me that he was suddenly unavailable to see me on my days off, Mondays and Fridays. I told her I saw him twice before on Fridays and would like to be accommodated. She said he couldn't see me at the Saint Peters location, kept selecting a Wednesday date, and I asked to be scheduled at the other. She said, no. It was despicable to have to, in 2021, deal with this maltreatment. I took my business to Dr. Lyndon Gross at the Orthopedic Center of St. Louis in Chesterfield, who gladly saw me on a Monday, explained the details of my shoulder injury, recommended treatment, and completed it. No disrespect, no control issues from front desk personnel, just care; all I asked for. Dr. Meek, I believe, is excellent with patient care, but some of the front desk/appointment setters are horrible.|Dr Meek is a Professional, Kind  & truly Gentle & Caring. He has been treating both my Mom & Sister for the past 10 years. My Mom is 90 & fell when she was in her early 80's & broke several vertebrae in her lower back. Dr Meek injected a kind of plastic that took the place of where the bones were. She fell on the deck & broke her right wrist 2 years ago. It was bad. One of the other Dr's at this practice set it Perfectly. She's retired from Arm Wrestling, but is good as new. My Sister has had back problems since she was 18. She was riding & the horse she was riding decided he didn't want to take the jump with her. She's had Injections & other treatments done by Dr Meek over the past 10 years & has helped her improve the quality of her life & it's all worked out Beautifully. And, Dr Coleen Glissen is a VERY Gifted Hand surgeon. She did Carpal Tunnel surgery on both my Sister's wrists & she's OUTSTANDING! The scars are so very small they're unnoticeable. This is THE place to go to for Pain. They are an amazing group of Practitioners & we're fortunate to have them in our Community.|At first, Dr. Meek led me to believe he was there for me.  He even told me he would be the physician I would go to for the rest of my life.  After a few visits it became very obvious he did not have my best interest in mind.  If you are considering this physician for care, you should look elsewhere.|Dr. Meek has an awesome "chairside" manner.  I've been seeing and treated by him for lower back pain for almost a year now.  He carefully reviewed and discussed my MRI results with my wife and me.  His  approach to my treatment plan was taken in stages starting from the least aggressive possible. After several pain injections that resulted in good short term but not long term relief his professional ethics dictated that these injections were not beneficial in the long term.  He then suggested a more aggressive treatment called nerve ablation.  After he carefully explained this in office procedure along with its risks and benefits I decided to have him do it.  So now the lower right side of my back has the ablation completed and am now waiting for the next visit for the left. So far so wonderful.  I'm looking forward to much less back pain and the ability to enjoy my grandchildren and everyday life.  Thank you Dr. Meek and your wonderful caring staff!!

column40:
Just had back surgery here a couple months ago and was a nervous wreck but the nurses before made me feel more at ease. At the doctors office one of the nurses is a little rude.. that's why I only gave 4 stars but the doctor is straight to the point and tells you how it is which is what I appreciate. Will definitely trust him and have less anxiety with my other back surgery that I'll be having in the future.|I found that Dr. Lucille was very dismissive. Would come in the office with same concern and would say on three different visits what he was going to do but never followed through on any of it. He did not seem interested whatsoever and what was going on. I was extremely disappointed with his services and his caring of what is going on. He never tried to get to the bottom of what is going on. He did not even scratch the surface to try to understand. I had seen him in the past maybe three years ago Maybe four and when I seen him recently, he did not seem like the same doctor anymore. He seemed like he just did not care and when he would leave the room and you would only talk to him. Maybe five minutes you would sit there and wait thinking maybe somebody would come back in Either him or a nurse but nobody would show up so you would just get up and go. Extremely disappointed with Dr. Lucio and how much he has changed and how he cares for his patience, which seems like he does not care at all. I would definitely not recommend him to anyone and he is supposed to be on the board at Saint Mary's now so maybe that has something to do with it. I do not know but he just does not care about the patient's needs or even their symptoms. Did not help me at all and never followed through with what he said he was going to do on all three visits|Have been suffering from chronic pain for over 15years. I have been a pain management patient for 6 years and have been able to live a mostly pain-free or comfortable since then. I recently moved and was referred to SSM by my doctor in California.
SSM Pain doesn't care about you. They care about making money off you and your insurance company. Since I've already been through all the proceedures and shots they want to give you before they prescribe something to help your pain, they denied treating me. All I need is a prescription. They don't want to waste their time on me, not profitable enough I guess.
Horrible people.|I have been going to Dr Lucio for many years . He has always treated me with great respect and he is a very good Pain management  Dr. He also has the greatest Staff. So caring for the patients just like Dr Lucio he cares and is very concerned  with the patients .  I Recommend  Dr Lucio .|I waited for over an hour to see Dr. Lehman. Then I waited another thirty minutes in the office. The nurse checked my reflexes and asked about my back and neck. She said we are going to get an X-ray of your back and neck. Then left. They did the X-ray pretty fast which was nice. Then Dr Lehman came in another 30 minutes later said my back wasn't operable. He said this is what happens when you get old. Mind you I'm 41. I didn't know that 41 was old. Then he said your range of motion is fine, he didn't lay a hand on me at all!!! How does he know? All they did was a reflex test. I started to talk and he cut me off and said I don't need you to talk only answer my questions. Then he said I'm sending you to pain management and left the room. He was in there for 5 minutes.
After I spent two hours there, I saw the doctor for 5 minutes and the only thing he said was I was old. Then pain management never called. After two weeks of horrible pain, not being able to sleep! I can't sit or stand. I can't bend over, I can't stoop down, I can't sit over ten minutes but Dr Lehman wouldn't know that because he didn't even do an evaluation on me. He didn't even examine me.
After waiting two weeks and pain management never called, I finally went to Columbia Orthopedic Group and saw Dr. Jenkins. My experience was night and day different. Dr. Jenkins is wonderful! He knew by looking at my MRI AND X-RAY (same one that dr Lehman looked at) that I was in bad shape.
He asked me questions, he wanted to know all about my history. He wanted to know what doctor I had seen and who referred me. He wanted to know what medication I was taking. When he found out I have been sick since I was 11 years old he was deeply sympathetic with me! He really cared about me. He made sure I received care that day! He spent 20 to 30 minutes with me in the office. He did send me to pain management and I had an appointment that day. He gave me a diagnosis and explained what he saw in the mri and the X-rays. He also set up a treatment plan moving forward. By the way I only waited four days for an appointment.
When I saw Dr. Lehman there was no treatment plan and I wasn't allowed to talk and he didn't ask me any questions so not much was said. Like I said my diagnosis was, this is what happens when you get old. And that was it!
But I'm only 41 and not many 41 year olds have bulging disc, deterioration in a disc, sacroiliac joint dysfunction, bursitis in your back and hips which is what I was diagnosed by the other doctor and Dr. Newton the pain management doctor! I also was diagnosed with the same thing from my family doctor and my Chiropractor and yet Dr. Lehman's only response was this is what happens when you get old.|I've been suffering from chronic back pain for over a year.  In the last few months it had gotten to point where I could barely walk.  I had tried physical therapy and chiropractic and even had been to another pain management specialist.  Dr  Nathan Kenyon changed all that in the very first treatment.  I went from barely able to stand or walk one day to being almost pain free the day after the treatment.  I can't express my gratitude enough. Dr Kenyon truly cares about his patients.  His staff is also truly amazing. Very friendly and attentive to my needs.  They made me feel very comfortable.|I don't write many reviews but I feel both of the doctors I seen deserve all the credit they can get.
I'm 35 years old female and I was suffering from a pinched nerve it was going down my back and my left leg into my foot for 7 months. I was in constant pain everyday. I could hardly walk, sleep, sit, climb stairs or do anything. I kept thinking it would eventually go away on it's own but it kept getting worse. It was the worst pain I ever experienced. I went to a doctor in my small town and there wasn't much they could do but send me everywhere else. So I got a referral to go to SSM health to see Dr. Lehman he was a great Dr. he reviewed my MRI & told me what needed to be done.
I told him I would rather try the lumbar epidural steroid injection instead of surgery. He agreed we could try that and referred me to pain management to see Dr. Kenyon. I got my appointment set up and later went back to see Dr. Kenyon he went over everything with me and gave me the lumbar epidural steroid injection the same day. I feel great now! I can sleep and walk again. I'm no longer in pain at all so far. They are both really great Doctors and the staff is great too they was all very kind and caring. I will choose to go to them if this ever happens to me again. 5 stars for all of them! I highly recommended them!|I was a patient of Dr Rodgers for about 20 years.  He recommended Dr Lehman. My spine problems are organic, not from injuries.
So when I was injured in a car accident, I called Spine and Pain Management.  They got me in to see Dr Lehman the very next day.  Wonderful! Dr Lehman was polite and took great care to inspect my injuries by ordering a CT scan and MRI after reviewing the x-rays he'd ordered.  That was the last contact I had with Dr Lehman.  I think he is a good physician from what I've experienced.
However, when I was given results from my x-rays, MRI and CT scans I was given two totally different diagnoses.
Dr Lehman also told me that he would see if my injury was caused by the car accident I was in three days prior to my visit.
When his PA called he said I had a fractured  vertebrae and it could be surgically repaired. When I called for clarification if it was most likely from the car accident, the person who called me back told me there was no fracture, I didn't need surgery, it would heal on it's own.

I wasn't given Dr Lehman' s opinion on the likely cause of my injury until they said I could no longer be their patient.
Additionally, the PA saw I was wearing crocs and informed me they had latex in them.  So there was no way I had a latex allergy.  I also called to make sure my chart reflected my latex allergy.
My contacts with the office and this review is to insure no other patients are treated so poorly by the staff.

Specialized Pain Management Solutions in Springfield

At the Center for Advanced Pain Management, we provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Located at 1001 E Primrose St in Springfield, MO, our medical clinic is part of the respected CoxHealth network. column3:
At SSM Health Pain Care, we understand how chronic or acute pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our dedicated team of pain management specialists is committed to helping you regain control through safe, responsible treatment options.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Located at the SSM Health Outpatient Center off Kisker Road in St. Charles, Missouri, just minutes south of Highway 364 (Page Extension), we provide specialized care for various pain conditions including:

  • Chronic pain (ongoing pain that progresses over time)

  • Acute pain (sudden pain in response to specific injuries)

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

We recognize that effective pain management is an essential component of complete healthcare. Our goal is to develop personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs and improve your daily functioning. If pain is interfering with your ability to enjoy life, take the first step toward relief by contacting SSM Health Pain Care at (636) 498-5920. Our office is conveniently located at 1475 Kisker Rd #275, St Peters, MO 63304.
